text:
Not THE best Italian ever, but delish nonetheless.

The bread was warm and crunchy in just the right spots (insert sexual joke here).  My Cesar salad was mediocre, but my gnocchi was heavenly.  I feel like they kind of skimped on the portion size, considering how large the damn plate was.  My tartufo was AMAZING.  When you put chocolate AND ice cream together, I'm pretty much a total sucker (insert additional sexual joke here).

The tables are quite small, and I challenge you to eat dinner with 8 other family members, fit 2 bottles of wine, wine and water glasses, appetizer and entree plates without feeling ridiculously cramped.  The service was pretty wonderful- very on top of their shit.

It was really crowded on this Wednesday night between 730-830.  I'm unsure if it was because families were indulging on pre-Thanksgiving get-togethers like mine- or if it's like this on every Wednesday.  Either way, it would probably be a more a pleasant experience minus most of the people and the loud conversations.

+1 though for their BYOB rule.  And thank god my cousins from California know how to chose their wines....
If you're looking to break the same old routine, and want to have a good time, a few laughs, and a decent meal, give this place a try!

Always helpful and friendly. Love the free popcorn too! I'd rather shop here than at Walmart, there is a better assortment of items and much better help finding what we need. Love the miniature train that goes around the top of the store, really cute!

Always friendly, helpful and top notch.

I loved the experience.. until weeks after it was delivered.  I then received another bill (about 33% of the original shipping bill) for other services that were not needed. The customer "service" department has been fairly short and not willing to consider the situation or evidence they require for a dispute. 

If you are shipping for business- this company does a great job of eroding your profit and putting you in the red!

We went yesterday to see a special showing of Young Frankenstein with supposedly a live intro from Mel Brooks. Boy did the theater mess that up. Nothing about it seemed special. They started those movie, stopped the movie, turn on house lights, and then cut into the intro after it had already started. Then the stopped that turned back on the house lights and went back to the movie before the intro ended. I am hoping I can find the complete intro on YouTube eventually. That was the reason for paying for tickets to see a movie I already own on DVD. 
Last time I tried to come to this theater we parked in the garage expecting the validation from our ticket but with no warning the theater was closed so I saw no movie and had to pay for parking I didn't need.
This time the box office was closed so you had to go to the concession stand. Everything about this theater was poorly ran. This theater also is in desperate need of upgrading. To be the downtown movie showcase and for the condition to be so poor is a shame. That's why we usually avoid this theater

Some days this is worth four stars. Today it was worth three stars.
I used to eat at Black Bear Diner a lot more. I went in today and got the $7 New York Steak breakfast. 
The steak wasn't bad, but really you could tell it was part of a $7 New York steak breakfast special. And I think they cooked it in A-1 Sauced. The eggs and potatoes were standard eggs and potatoes. 
Service was good.

Custard review only.

Service really pushed this to a four star.  The woman working the inside counter was super friendly and when she heard we had a birthday in the group she made sure to hook us up with a free birthday sundae.

Custard was creamy with a dense flavor.  We will return!

This is a tough one; a 4 star but leaning towards a 5. Honestly, I recognize that the food and hospitality industry has taken a bad hit throughout the pandemic and that changes the ambiance and overall feel. 

Upon entering, the ambiance is subdued and very pleasant. The barkeep is also the hostess, and....ALSO the server. Without being nit picky that is what I was referring to in my first paragraph. This Jack or Jill of all trades implied that they determine how much help they'll need on any given night, they said that on this night they asked the additional help to not come in. So, this is not a case of not being able to find willing workers (big problem everywhere it seems). Frankly, I'd have been far more comfortable not having to watch this person bustle around doing everything...which they DID manage beautifully.

For whatever reason we were having an extremely difficult time deciding what we wanted, no fault of a limited menu, there was plenty to choose from- even for a pescatarian like myself. The server said they are known for their Mac and cheese with shaved brussel sprouts (app). It was indeed next level but was also a tad salty. Our 2 main courses, grilled eggplant parm and branzino, were served beautifully and tasted good as well. We did have one drink that was also good. 

For what it's worth, I also liked the art adorning the walls.

We used to love checkers. It seems like a dirty place now and I'm adding it to my list of places I will not go to. We waited at the drive thru speaker (passenger side one) for a long time and nobody ever came on. Several cars went through the other side. Eventually I had to back up and go to the other side. Maybe it was broken? But no cone or signage. We waited forever at the other one too. The food wasn't great when we got it either.

Customer service here is the worst. Had a $12,000 job lined up with them over the summer, paid 1/3 down, crew came out and could not perform the work because the water table was too high. I had called them previously telling them they need to send an engineer out before sending the crew because of the amount of water getting pumped out but they seemed to think I was wrong I guess. They asked me to let them know when the water table dropped so they could resume since thus far they just broke a hole in the basement floor. The water table is not dropped but the house is about to collapse and there is nothing I can do. Now, all I have been asking for is a simple letter stating that it is impossible for them to fix the house because of the high water table, which is what they told me, or get out there and fix it! The letter is needed for my insurance company to help with my claim. But today I was told management does not feel comfortable with that even though they kept almost $300 of my deposit for 'costs incurred' and I can't even get a breakdown of their costs that they incurred. I was told 'permits and other costs.' If you choose this company you better hope it's an easy fix that management doesn't have to get involved with.

This place will now be my go to spot. I love the ambiance, friendly staff and the tasty food. Cannot write enough things about this place; the food was perfect and the place is kid friendly. The garlic fries are ridiculously good. Had that with the blta, wife got the wiseguy sandwich everything was great including my OJ which was freshly squeezed.

I order the one pound Ham Steak and Eggs and it was amazing!  The best ham and eggs in all of Reno.  I have been to Hobeys a few times and each time the food has been really good.  Never been there at dinner just breakfast and lunch and every meal has been worth going back!

I brought my Sacramento family here 2 days ago and we loved it.  The house fried rice, chow mein, fried noodles were really good. My daughter in law said, "Good choice. I'm glad you brought us here!"  I come here every now and then since it's really close to me!
Zero Covid precautions. No sanitizers anywhere, no distancing of tables. Servers do not wear masks. No staff members anywhere where masks. Totally outrageous. Will never go back.

Great experience here! Our waitress was attentive and we go seated quick for outside seating on a busy beautiful Saturday evening which was pretty surprising. I went with my aunt and we both split a large house salad with a crab cake. The restaurant very kindly split it in to two for us without asking. I got the shrimp taco special with aioli on the side( I believe it was a chipotle lime) I taste tested it and was not a fan but I'm not huge lime fan so to anyone else u would probably love it. We also split cheesesteak egg rolls and they were phenomenal! Will definitely be back great place!

I thought this place was okay until the time I found a long hair in my burrito... disgusting. That turned me off enough to the point where I'll probably never go back. When I did go here, I usually ordered burritos and added vegetables as an extra. Unfortunately, the veggies always tasted somewhat mushy in my burrito, and I think having zucchini and broccoli as part of the vegetable mix is just not the right choice for Mexican food. Also, the horchata was disappointing and the service wasn't that friendly.

 I would rather walk 2 hours to the one Chipotle in town for a cheaper and tastier burrito.

Finally!  A great quality sub and cheese steak shop that uses fresh, local ingredients,  fresh sliced meats,  and rolls baked in house!  American Subject with ham, provolone and red vinegar and oil was superb!  My chicken cheese steaks with onions on fresh whole wheat roll was the best I've ever had.   A keeper!
100% Satisfied. The carpet looks and smells great. The job was fast and drying time was fast as well. I will use them again.

Great beers. I like sours and there was a fabulous one on tap Jeff goldplum, absolutely incredible and only  $5. Sours are usually very expensive. My husband likes the ipa beers--two thumbs up on the Thai basil ipa. Long drive for us but we'll worth it. Would recommend this to fellow beer geeks.

Good sushi.  Small "diner" feel.  Really enjoyed the Lucas Oil Roll. Friendly wait staff.  Had lunch around 12:30 and I was one of 5 people in the whole place.  Would have expected it to be busier.  I have been here several times before and it has always been packed in the evenings.

These guys are fantastic. Called for an estimate and Derek came out the same day. They were able to get my install squeezed in the same week. My fence looks great !  They beat every quote I had from competitors. And I had just about every fence company I could find come out. The installers were quick and professional. Definitely my go to fence guys.

Omgggggg, how am I so late to the party on discovering this place?!?!

It's amazing! It's old school tasty, Is that a thing? Well it is now, it tastes like every Italian movie you've ever watched where they make deals and order hits and u wonder what they are eating. Well they are eating this!!

Everyone was so friendly, Mitch at the bar was absolutely killing it. The host was incredibly friendly. U really did feel like family. And I haven't even gotten to the food.

The sausage Joe was our starter and it was spicy and savory and perfect. Next came the skirt steak, cooked perfectly and full of flavor and juicy. For a side we did the pasta, Don't sleep on their pappardelle, amazing. While writing this I'm already thinking about what I'll try next.

It's pricy but worth it. I'm happy to drop $100 for a meal you can tell was actually cooked. And I mean COOKED. By a real chef, not a corporate recipe.

Well we all know how this place is. Walk in get ticket wait to be called. Go up get taken sit back down and wait for 30 min to get your picture taken. With not so intelligent people working in this place. So as much as I hate it I try get in and get out.

My wife and I went here for dessert on our Anniversary this past year, and I couldn't have been happier.  I had the Strawberry Sensation and my wife had the Mango Yogurt.  The staff was very kind and the dessert was great!  If I lived closer I'd go there more often, wish I didn't live about an hour from the restaurant.

Fried rice smelled and tasted like B.O.
Wonton soup tasted like chicken bouillon and sadness. Would've preferred a 99 cent cup of noodle.

Very fun to go an enjoy happy hour or dinner on the water. They always have a live band, and we always seek to get a great waitress or waiter. The downside is that it is very busy, so you may have to wait for a good table. But if you have some time to sit back and enjoy the music, you can order a drink while you wait and still have a wonderful time. The food is also tasty, there is a nice variety for everybody, not just one type of food.

Went here for Easter brunch and was extremely disappointed.  This was a glorified breakfast buffet, definitely not a brunch.  The only non-breakfast item offered was pasta.  The food was nothing special, it looked processed and the presentation was underwhelming.  The worst part of this was the price- $32.95 per person PLUS 20% gratuity for a party of 3!  Our waitress wasn't good and it was infuriating to have the tip built into a bill for such a small group.  I definitely have no interest in returning.
great breakfast!  friendly staff!  huge helpings with homemade taste!  mimosas are very good too!

This place seems sketchy and the atmosphere isn't that great, BUT the food is awesome and the prices are hard to beat.  Their pan fried dumplings and fried salt+pepper chicken wings are amazing.  Well really just about everything on the menu is tasty so if you don't mind a dingy looking restaurant you should definitely give this place a try.  It's one of my favs.

Very welcoming. Greeted us as soon as we came in the door. The wait wasn't very long. Fantastic service. Kim was amazing. I got a deluxe pedi, and I couldn't be happier.  Worth the price of service. I highly recommend this establishment.
Been here several times and always have a good meal. it's a small place but very homey. the pasta is homemade and it's a BYOB in the borough, can't ask for much more. Service is usually really good.
I've eaten at Bonnet Lane several times & it's always good! The staff is friendly, service is good, food is good. Their menu is pretty much basic American food, the prices are great.
Great hand crafted cocktails, craft beer selection, and domestic deals.  You can always find a seat to watch the game and there's always a talkative crowd.

Took the short trek out to NO LIB for a nice relaxing Sunday brunch after some pretty epic Friday & Saturday nights.  I was scared of the infamous 'hour long wait' quoted several times below.  Came with my girlfriend (two people for those not skilled in maths), and fortunately we only had to wait 15 minutes.  Wooo!

I ordered the chicken frieddd steak and gf got the pancakes.  Pancakes weren't my cup of tea, but they never are, so I won't critique them.  The chicken fried steak, however, was absolutely delicious.  Crunchy and not an ounce soggy, a small spicy kick, and a very nice accompanying white gravy.  It was, dare I say, very TASTY.  I use that word a lot, but this dish was 100% tasty.  The home fries were also excellent.  Service was pretty good; a little slow towards the end of the meal, but our server had a good number of tables, so I'll let that slide.  I'm definitely going to be a repeat customer; so many more items on the menu to try!

P.S. - if I did have one complaint, albeit a 'tiny' one, it would be the table real estate.  Our table was tiny to begin with, but then there's this like HOT SAUCE bonanza going on right next to you.  Mexican hot sauce, asian hot sauce, american hot sauce, and spanish hot sauce.  Do we really need that many variations?  @_@
Amazing service from our waiter David and even better food. My friends and I had no complaints and would definitely go back for brunch again!
We LOVE flowing tide!!! It has become our weekly staple up here in the northwest. By far, best variety in beer and way better food than any other restaurant nearby. Definitely will keep coming back!

We made the trip from Tampa to Canterbury Farm in Hudson to purchase plants to go around our patio and pool.  They had a great selection of healthy plants at reasonable prices.  The staff was quite helpful, Anika drove us around the property to make our selections.  They also offer a military discount.  Well worth the drive!

Port of New Orleans (Cruise Terminal)

I have traveled through the Port of New Orleans (Cruise Terminal) four times in two years.  I have to tell you it is, without a doubt, my favorite cruise terminal in North America.

I have found the ground staff organized, friendly, informative and ready to assist.  The facility is clean and modern, and without a lot of unnecessary steps for the passengers.

I really like spending the night before at the New Orleans Downtown Marriott at the Convention Center.  You wake refreshed, cross the street, and Port of New Orleans Staff meets you half way down Julia Street, and checks in your bags. Then you stroll into the Cruise Terminal and on to your ship.

It just doesn't get any easier. Five Stars.

My fiancé and I decided to check out Toyota because we needed to trade in our car for a new one. We worked with Arthur C from start to finish and it was honestly a great experience. He was so helpful with walking us through all the different styles and models and prices. We ended up leasing a 2019 Toyota Camry and traded in our 2011 Chevy Cruze. They were really great about getting the price down the best the could too (which was our main concern). Arthur even got us lunch so we didn't have to leave while we were filling out paperwork. Happy we have a new set of wheels!

Stopped in on a Saturday evening around 7 pm for dessert. Place was pretty quiet. Service was terrible. Was told we couldn't order decaf coffee and had to get decaf Americano. Okay... You bill yourself as a coffeehouse, but whatever.. Waited about 20 minutes for the waiter to bring the dessert. Now mind you, this was a chocolate pie. All they needed to do was cut it and put it on a plate. My husband had ordered a glass of port when we first got there. We had to ask about it twice before the waiter eventually brought it over and blamed it on the owner having to get it from the basement? Then we were ignored while waiting for our check. Put our credit card on the table to indicate hey, we're ready to go dude! He sees the card and says he'll be right back with the check and then we waited another 10 minutes for him to get back. Did I say the place was pretty quiet? No excuse for the bad service. The dessert was good, the Americano was good, but the poor service will prevent us from returning.

best s r ever! meat is good and deli stupendous! the hifchen needs to tone down on the garlic when proparing food. even the chinese is good!
the produce departmen is neat,clean and always fresh...
friendly staff and workers. sometimes too crowqdwd.

mike m 
voorhees

My wife and I finally went for our first time today.  The inside is a surprise considering the outside of the building.  Very nice design and feel.  The menu was a nice size in the number of options - not too many and not too few - and all of the menu items worked well together.  The food we had was incredible and the prices were extremely reasonable!  We will definitely be back.  I only took of a star because their hours make it very difficult for us to go.  I never get home from work before 5 and we typically don't eat out on the weekends. I'm sure they have their reasons for closing just before dinner but, for us at least, it's an impossible option most of the time.  I'd definitely recommend if you can go for breakfast or lunch!

Intro: My family and I were looking for a good restaurant on an average Wednesday night.

Food: I had the Caesar salad without chicken and a strawberry smoothie. The lettuce was wilted and the dressing wasn't great. My sister had it with chicken, and her salad was the same. Her chicken was weird and spongy. However the smoothie was AMAZING! 

Atmosphere: The atmosphere fit the food they served well, though I am not a fan of such decor.

Employees: We talked to the manager about our chicken and he was patient about it, but he creeped me out real bad.

And on that note -

Worth the Visit: No
Everybody is very friendly and makes sure that you're well taken care of. They teach about products, help customers make educated decisions, and make every customer feel like a world class athlete!
Hands down, these are the best donuts in the city! They are worth getting up early and standing in line for hot, fresh donuts!

I tried Panera as a lunch item for the first time on Friday.  Not bad; except the lines are long and they only had 2 people on for lunch hour.   I ordered a ceasar salad with chicken.  Pretty good so I went back today.  Again during lunch time only 1 person on, some people were getting sort of irritated in line.  I ordered the same thing  ceaser salad with the bread.  

Now the point of the salad is the dressing.  I ordered 1/2 salad each time and got a decent sized "vat" of dressing.   This time I only received a small container which I dont think it had a TEASPOON of dressing for this sized salad.  COME ON.  my lunch is ruined..... i have a good size salad with 2 pieces of wet lettuce.  i know its salad but wow.,...Won't go there again.
Great hoagies, paid about 34$ for 3 hoagies with drink and chips. I was more than satisfied with only half of a "regular"size hoagie.

Supposedly, this location used to be where the pirate Lafitte had his shop and supposedly.... He's still there. Haunting the ladies room. To each their own afterlife, I suppose. The tavern is very dark, and on the weekends patrons overflow into the street. There is also limited outdoor seating on the side of the bar. Their signature drink is the Voodoo Daiquiri, and if you don't drink regularly it's a lot of alcohol.  It is cool and refreshing to sip down Bourbon Street or back to your hotel though.

Military friendly. lots of food. got shrimp, fried mushrooms and bake potatoes. Made fresh. came in with 8 and thought we would have to wIt forever...not the case. fried mushroom are amazing. very yummy and cooked right. if I'm in the area again, will be back.

My husband talked me into eating their sushi buffet here one weekend based on the recommendations of a friend of his. I try to stay away from sushi buffets, and I should have stayed away from this one. The food was only the beginning of our problems. 1) There is no way that food is kept at the appropriate temperature. 2) The service was atrocious. My husband had to refill our water glasses himself, and we had to hunt someone down to try to pay. 3) The atmosphere leaves a lot to be desired. I will not be returning EVER.

Okay, so who knew this place has the ambience, the full bar, the sportscasts that COULD make Anthony's a total package BUT it failed. Because my salad, which took fo-Eva  was ffffrozen with the egg yolk bouncing off my ffffork, the chickpeas bbbbouncing better than Kobe and the manager, Sal Romano,making excuses rather than apologies. Shame on Sal!  shouldn't have been a hard sell, but hard sal made to it so. Pizza should be the call for your menu choice, but it is Well Done aka fairly burnt. Great location, great that they have FULL bar yes! Not so great that sal was not so great yo Sal yowhere'd ya go! Will try again soon sal so watch for me! No bouncing egg yolks  and don't blame others for your lack of supervision.  Service slow cas a comatose turtle  too.   Ugh.

The best Indian food in the area. A great example of  tasty Punjabi cuisine.  Just enough spice and a great deal of flavor. The only drawback is the seating or the spot would deserve 5 stars across the board.

Bearcat Cafe! We make a point of eating there every time we visit NOLA! Every bite has been tasty and the staff is friendly and works hard to serve an often packed house. We sat at the counter today. Amazing to watch the preparers work their magic. Everyone should give it a try.

I love Dali. I am only giving this museum 4 stars because I love him and his work so much. However, I am not a huge fan of this museum. I visited the old Dali museum in St Pete probably 7 or 8 years ago. I was blown away! After admiring  his works in books for years, it was so surreal (pun intended) to see them in person. Then in 2004, I decided to go visit his 3 museums (teatro-museo, Gala's castle and the Port Lligat home) in Spain. If you are a true admirer of Dali, nothing can compare to seeing the landscapes that inspired his works and the home environments that he created! 

When I heard all the buzz around the new Dali opening in St Pete, I decided I needed to make another trip from Indy down to Florida with the main purpose being to visit the museum. There seemed to be a lot of hype around the building itself and so I was excited to see it's architecture and explore this new home created to house this impressive collection. I think my expectations were too high. Yes, the exterior side of the museum with the glass is really cool and unique, both inside and out. And the spiral staircase inside seems very Dali-esque. 

Other than the glass wall & staircase, the interior of the museum feels so stark, sterile and not like it was inspired by Dali in anyway. This is very disappointing to me. I would give the plain white walls and overall boring interior 1 star. Maybe the creators wanted it to be a simple backdrop that wouldn't compete with Dali's works for visitors' attention, but to me... it was a huge letdown. Perhaps I had anticipated that this building, designed with Dali and his paintings in mind, was going to somehow echo the theater museum that he had created in Figueres... one giant surrealist creation designed as a home for many more of his works. This was not the case. 

The sterile environment does not do Dali proud, in my opinion. While I would encourage admirers of Dali or even someone unfamiliar with him who happens to be in the area to visit the museum, I am personally not in any hurry to return. I will just save up my money for a plane ticket to Barcelona and make my way north, next time the Dali bug bites me! :)
They did not show up as scheduled and then cancelled. I am grateful though that they did not show up, my car started back up. Praise God!

Well we decided to try this place out instead of taco smell. What a mistake! The guys don't speak any English and it was hard to give them my order. Then I went over to get cucumber and guacamole sauce and the tongs where  in a container on the side in dirty water.. Then I got some cucumbers and there was a hair in the mix.. The guacamole sauce was brown and had a sour taste to it. I threw it way.. Then came the lengua (Tongue)tacos where not fully cook and cold inside. The shrimp taco was very good that's where the 2 stars comes from. The shrimp tostada had a funny taste like something from Christmas food.. Not sure what but it was weird flavor. The cabeza (head) taco was good also.. My wife had tripa taco and she said nothing special. My daughter had steak tacos and the meat had a funny taste. So next time I would just make the first right into Taco Bell and don't drive straight to this place.

I needed a part for an older gas log insert that I could not locate on the Internet.  I reached out to them and Frank got back to me right away stating that he would try to source the part for me.  I then heard back from Cyndy that they found the part unavailable on the net, for me.  Great customer service, communication and follow through!!

Food is best when it's prepared simply.  Pastaria nails it.  Everything was amazing.  Pasta was cooked perfectly (al dente), the seasonal squash / pumpkin seed pizza was brilliant.  The braised beef with polenta was prepared perfectly and huge!  The risotto balls transported me to Valhalla.  Buy five orders for yourself.

Worst type of customer service that exists.. ask for an extra dipping sauce after leaving a more than generous tip and the bartender says it'll have to be rung up and I'll need to pay for that. Really? I just left 25% on $50, you could easily do something.. I've gotten more sauce at a McDonald's drive up window. Should have tipped zero

Yum! This place is great! Was out shopping and stumbled upon this when looking for some lunch. Loved it! I was sat immediately, staff was polite, and food came out quickly, nice and hot!

Hand sanitizer is available and the restaurant is clean. I ordered the Hakata Tonkotsu Black Ramen, and it was great! Would recommend trying that one if you're not sure what to get.

Good location, definitely getting busier .
All I know is that I am hungry and I want some carnitas . Been here for 15 minutes , only like 10 people in front of me and watched the burrito maker mess up 3 in a row, this isn't baseball.
Still love this place and can't wait for my carnitas on a salad.
What a tremendous value for $7.65

This restaurant name like we need to eat like a cat and left the fish with bone and head. Fortunately, the chef is kind enough to fillet for all the customers. Personally, I like whole fish to eat and left only the bone. With that said, their brand is to have good seafood. I always have good respect for this restaurant. 

We start with corn chowder with lump crabmeat. The chowder is great. However I would suggest sautéed the crab meat which will make this soup more superior. 

Our entrée are the grilled red fish. This very good dish. It is not in the regular menu. Redfish is bit harder to catch. The meat definitely is nice and good. It is accompanied the string green bean and crawfish etouffee. This is very excellent dish. 

Our next entrée is sirloin and crab cake. I like the crab cake but the sirloin is average. It come with two side and I have crab fried rice. Again, the crab meat need to include in the fried rice while they stir fry. Not added with broil lumb crab meat. 

The service is great. It has seamless coordination.

I just love a fast food location that has it's act together, makes it easier to be picked when we are in a pinch and needing some delicious fast food. The fact that DQ has Blizzards just makes this an even better choice.

This location so far has only impressed me, fast & friendly staff and well made food. Both inside and drive thru, yaaay! So rare in fast food these days. As a note, DQs new sandwiches are quite good, I really enjoy the Turkey BLT! 

Well made Blizzards here too, so far none of that "all topping on top, just ice cream on bottom" shenanigans. 

Pretty easy to get in and out of this location as it is one big loop. The drive thru window is up pretty high which is kinda funny but not a huge problem. 

I am glad this location is close to me! Definitely a good choice when you're craving DQ!

I'm from the northeast and these are definitely  the best bagels in town. Definitely great fresh ingredients. So glad they are here for when I have that craving for an amazing bagel.

Definitely overpriced for what it is. For that reason, Breuggers, which is good, will be my regular go-to bagel shop. 

Maybe the price will adjust if and when there is legitimate competition in town.

One of my favorite vegan spots in Tampa! Their chili dogs with a side of Mac n cheese is to die for! I recommend ordering the original Mac n cheese (the garlic one tastes too much like garlic powder) without the veggies on top (because tomatoes just don't belong on mac). I have also had the jackfruit bbq, although it was not the best version of the dish that I have tried. You can't go wrong with the chili dogs, and they're worth the mess!

This place was awful!

It actually started out ok - even though the outside of the building majorly needs a makeover and their sign to be lowered about 20 feet.  

When you first walk in it's somewhat appealing to the eye, I was quite surprised.  Maybe because the walls were covered with wall mirrors to enhance the size. There was no one at the counter, but my date and I decided to sit at a table.  I normally don't like tables at AYCE sushi because I feel the chef skips on ingredients in the roll or makes a completely different roll than what I ordered.

We started out with seaweed salad (like always), edamame and crab rangoon.  These were very good and well made, so I thought the sushi would be the same and I was excited...my first roll was the Orange Blossom - it looked nothing like the picture displayed and the scallops were uncooked and slimy and loaded on top - yuck.  Other places like the Atlantis and Hiroba cook the scallops and put it on the roll, but these were slimy and smelly, I didn't want to finish.  The quality of the fish seemed very cheap, especially on my next roll which was pictured as the Kietzke roll - when she put it on the table, I said "is this the Kietzke, it looks nothing like the picture"?  And she told me the pictures always vary.  There was no sauce on it and the color of the seared salmon looked a little gray.  There was also supposed to be cilantro in this roll and there was none what-so-ever.  I decided to order one more roll to see if they can even come close to making a good one, I ordered the Big Hill or Hill Big roll and my date ordered the Mountain roll.  When they brought the two together, they were identical twins.  I guess a big hill is basically a mountain, but my goodness we couldn't find one difference except I ordered mine with tobiko.  In other words, the sushi chef made two rolls exactly the same, threw tobiko on one and called it gross. we ended up putting plates on top because we couldn't bring ourselves to finish.  Not to mention, I found a piece of plastic (probably from the wrapping of the fish - no big) in one of my bites.  And one more thing that was bothersome, there were flies everywhere.  I noticed one landing on the edamame, then my roll, then my dessert.  They only had one mochi strawberry left, so I was stuck with mango.  No one could pay me to go back there, I hate paying $21 + tip for crappy sushi when I could have gone somewhere much better for $25.  I'm glad I tried it to add to my Reno sushi adventures, however this place gets 2 out of 5 stars from me.  Sorry Kitzmo.

I have been going to Famoso ever since it started in this location. It has been consistently good until recently. I went back just few days ago and all I can say is they have reduced the portions of their servings. I know how big their pizzettas and tiramisu servings were and now they are much smaller. When I asked the server why, he said they still use the same amount of dough in the pizzetta but probably it was made thicker so it's smaller. Well, if that is the case, it is still smaller because they use less toppings when the circumference is smaller. When the tiramisu came out, again I was surprised to see how much smaller it is. When I asked again, they said it's still the same size, just cut differently. Seriously, they are bluffing. It would have been better if they wanted to make more money to charge more but keep the serving size the same. As a loyal customer, I come here all the time expecting whatever I ordered before to be the same, but now, I don't know what else they "downsized." And oh yes, the Tartufo Funghi used to have more Tartufo flavor to it. Now, it's a red pizza and they might as well just have called it Funghi (mushroom) pizza as there is hardly tartufo smell and flavor to it! It used to be a lot better. Probably will no longer go back. Too bad as it used to be my and my family's  "default" place to be.

Um... kinda scratching my head here? I know it's the airport and that's an experience in itself. But the service was great the lady that took my order was so kind and friendly. Couldn't say the same for the cheese steak sandwiches though. 

**Let's start with the good. 
-piping hot
-seemed made to order
-meat was tender

**The bad. 
-Bread was cold and dry
-Meat was dry and had no taste
-seasoning need? 
-cheese was at its minimal 
-more bread than meat 

All in all I need to try the one that's original. Hope this helped.

Never really thought much of this mall until recently when I met someone who lives near here and started shopping here more regularly.  Not the biggest mall by far but there is a good range of stores here!  For me the best part is the PJ's Pets, Winners, and Mr. Sub all in one place!!  They also have most of the clothing stores I like.  I don't think I have ever been here when it's been super busy (even Boxing Day morning was very reasonable).  Seems clean and there is lots of parking.  Maybe not my first choice but definitely a good choice I would say!

I'm a bit disappointed by the selection compared to online, who ever manages the stock could do a better job of bringing in better selection but most of the time I find an item worth buying.  I buy most of my sportswear here, besides shoes.  I've found some immaculate sportswear at this Nike store.  Despite the fact it's staffed by teenagers and being a busy store, I've never had to wait for a change room or wait inline for more than 5 minutes.  The staff are positive and are easy to find if you need help but will never bother or pressure a sale.  There is always a sale going on and not just on the ugly stuff they can't get rid of, I've found some good stuff on sale on a regular basis.

Well organized, well staffed, descent price, descent selection, always has been a positive experience.

The grouper fingers were NOT fresh. They tasted like fish sticks out of a box. The wine glasses were filthy. The fish tacos were very bland. The service horrible except for our waiter, he was very polite but pushed to his limit. Save your money. Overpriced boxed seafood.

The ultimate nerd store. 

Very competitive pricing on all your electronics/computer needs. More than willing to match NCIX, Tigerdirect & Newegg.

I love these stores as I do my research ahead of time and know exactly what to get. Their website is fantastic as well with options of in store pickup. 

Blackfriday & boxing day deals are really great as well. There is always some kind of sale going on.

I had the honor of having my senior prom here. 
I'm not sure if I would call it "honor". The place seems very snobby to me. Before we even hit the front door, one of the staff reprimanded my friend because she was too loud. Notice, this was before we even step inside the building.
The building itself was gorgeous and very formal. Our prom was great even though they were some confusion due to them hosting two prom on the same day.
The food was okay. Salad that I feed to my boyfriend. Very fatty chicken. And cheesecake. 

The best thing I like about this place was the bathroom. They are nice and very stocked. They have lotion, hairspray and basketful of tampons. Very nice.

Good selection of great quality donuts.

You may experience sticker shock, this is not Dunkins.  It is so much better!

The big sunny patio will be a perfect place to enjoy your treat once the weather warms up.

Awful awful awful.  Walked around this store for an hour looking for a specific category.  Didn't have an exact title or author.  This place has nothing in any kind of order.  I asked two different employees for help and I was asked "do you know the author?"  They have no computers set up to search for anything and all the employees hung out at the front desk chit chatting.  I guess I will join the rest of the world and search for the book I want on Amazon and stop giving the brick and mortar businesses  a chance.  Come on!  Organize your store and make it easy for the customer.
Best mexican cuisine in the area. I've tried many different dishes but the tacos are definitely my favorite.

European gem in the middle of Downtown Tampa! As a family-owned restaurant, it truly felt like we were dining at their home, from the inviting ambiance to the warm hospitality to the delicious food (highly recommend the grilled eggplant spread and homemade bread)! We had a wonderful experience overall and definitely will be returning again soon!

I took a friends young son to the Bounce U at Cherry Hill. The experience was disappointing and I will not recommend this location to any parents in the future. Here is a breakdown of the issues encountered. We had a voucher slip purchased at Groupon which allowed for five visits. The day we visited, was on the MLK holiday. As soon as we entered the facility and presented our voucher, we were told they did not honor coupons on holidays. This is actually on their site, but is hidden in the calendar to the point where you have to click on the actual time and date your planning your visit to see the disclaimer (this is a bad sign when you hide your policy). This was also not on their door or their answering machine. I guess they had so many angry questions about this that they scribbled a make shift sign and taped it to their door, I saw it as I left the place.

No problem, I paid for the current visit and also redeemed my voucher for future use.  The injury disclaimer I had signed was never verified against any identification, I could have put any name down and nothing was checked (another bad sign when issues of legality are glossed over). Upon entering the facility I was surprised to see that they were very crowded and had only three high school age attendants monitoring the inflatable bounce slides. One young attendant was sitting inside the ride with a dazed look while children pushed and shoved each other, while I was there this attendant never once intervened. The second pair of attendants was standing together in another ride. These two were more engrossed in their teeny bopper conversation than what was going on around them.  The facility is actually smaller then what you would expect for a place like this and it was really crowded. In the corners of the facility were disassembled slides and some of the air generators. Instead of being stored away or roped off from the kids, they were on the floor as potential tripping hazards. 

Some of the slides had a cushioned pillow to absorb the impact, others did not. The overcrowded bouncing palace was also not monitored despite the sign that stated kids should not enter unless supervised. One of the younger kids left the bouncing palace crying because she was getting hit in the face by an older boy, yet the attendants kept gabbing away. This pandemonium occurred with younger visitors being bullied, blocked, and pushed by older ones. This could have been easily remedied if the attendants split up and did their jobs more effectively, or just did their jobs. Eventually, and after the child we were with got shoved and pushed by older kids, I decided we would not stay the full time we paid for. As we left I returned the unused vouchers and asked for my Groupon receipt back. I would rather get my money back from Groupon (and risk not getting a refund) then visit this poor location again.

I tried this nail salon because it was conveniently located and the yelp reviews were really great. I thought I'd treat myself after working outside and gardening all day. However, when I walked in the young guy at the desk was not friendly and looked annoyed. The instruments they used didn't look clean, saw her put a few things back she didn't clean after use. They also don't soak your nails at this nail salon, nor do they clean under your nails or trim cuticles?!?! I left with dirt under my nail and some gel polish slapped over it. Would not recommend this nail salon. There are far better ones in the area. Don't waste your money.

Hands down the absolute BEST DETAILING JOB EVER! I have Landon to thank for making my car look simply AMAZING!  The entire staff is so friendly and professional but Landon is the person who performed the detailing work on my car - ultimate exterior + claybar. Worth every penny and I can't recommend these gentlemen enough. If you need to show your car some TLC, this is the place!

I went to Hinata with my fiancé for Valentine's Day. We were missing Japan after having to cancel our trip over Fall 2020.
There isn't a single thing we had that we didn't enjoy. Everything was beautifully presented and amazingly well prepared.
I will absolutely be going back and can't wait to share the experience with my friends when we start to go out together again.

This store is great.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Fresh produce,  good selection of meat and cheeses.  I love stopping here,  it is on the way home and cashiers keep the lines moving fast!  Also they have all the items that a natural sistah needs for her hair! Yeahy!

We have ordered here a bunch a times and always enjoyed the pizza and Stromboli's! This time we ordered pizza steaks and a buffalo chicken wrap. The wrap and chicken were all delicious! The food was ready for pickup in 15 mins and service was friendly. Will definitely return!

In town for work, my crew and I saw this place across from our hotel. I looked them up on here and it misleadingly says they close @ 3. Lucky for us they don't close til 9! When we arrived we were greeted and told to sit wherever we wanted, having 5 guys we decided to sit at the counter. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. You can tell by talking to her that she takes pride in where she works. I ordered the Farmer Boy Burger which is a bacon cheese burger with pepper jack and an Anaheim chili. It was delicious, warm, juicy, and full of flavor. My only complaint, thinking back, is that the menu said the bun was toasted but it wasn't.  We also tried the buffalo wings. Honestly, they were the best I've ever had. Very crunchy, warm, and delicious. I would highly recommend. I will be back for sure!!!

A good German Doner Kebab is one of my very favorite foods. I've chased that specific taste in numerous countries over the years, but for me, nowhere comes close to the German style. This place really hit the spot!

The beef/lamb Kebab was outstanding. The meat was lean and tasty. Some places use ground meat, but I much prefer this style which is actual thin slices. The bread was also perfect, pressed nice and thin with just the right amount of crispness. I'm so happy to have found a great German Doner outside of Germany! I will definitely stop back at this place on future trips through Santa Barbara. Thanks for bringing German style Doners to Southern California!!

PS: the reviewer(s) claiming this is some kind of wrongful "cultural appropriation" are ridiculous. Everyone knows kebabs originate from the Middle East. Kebabs are now available in most of the world now though, and are often influenced by the local cuisine. A German Doner is a very specific thing and should definitely be advertised as such. I certainly would have never even tried eating here if they didn't advertise that it's German. Check Wikipedia for more info. Their Doner Kebab article has a huge subsection on "Regional Variations," with several paragraphs specifically dedicated to Germany. Here are a couple interesting highlights:

Even orders placed in the Turkish language in Berlin will ask for the hot sauce using the German word "scharf", flagging the hybrid nature of the Berlin style of döner kebap. This variation served with pita bread has influenced the style of döner kebap in Germany and in other nations. A 2007 survey showed that many people consider the döner kebab to be the most characteristic food of Berlin.

Annual sales of döner kebabs in Germany amounted to €2.5 billion in 2010... Tarkan Taşyumruk, president of the Association of Turkish Döner Producers in Europe (ATDID), provided information in 2010 that, every day, more than 400 tonnes of döner kebab meat is produced in Germany by around 350 firms.
One of my favs! Best salads and stir fry in the city! Love the farm to table food and ordering is a cinch!

Regardless of many raving reviews on Yelp, I was extremely disappointed at Joe Mama's food.  We went there around lunch time and the restaurant was extremely busy, perhaps border line chaotic.  

Joe mama's is not exactly a nice sit down place, but closer to a fast food breakfast/brunch place.  Without judging, I did not hesitate to place my order of southwest eggs benedict with home fries, which I was told it was one of their famous dishes.  My mom, on the other hand, ordered pulled pork sandwich.   After placing our order at the cashier, we looked for un-occupied table but all the tables were either taken or hadn't been cleaned yet.  However, soon after we set our stuff on a bench right next to a table, one of their waitresses came by to clear the table for us.

As time passed by, we were still sipping away on our water.  Our stomachs were demanding food as we both did not have anything for breakfast.  Finally after more than half an hour, the food finally came.  I took my first bite and I wonder how long my food had been sitting and waiting to be served.  My eggs benedict was cold and disgusting.  The cornbread was soggy - not eatable, and don't get me started on the home fries.  For a moment, I thought I could taste the nastiness from freezer burn.  All the sudden, my appetite was gone and I was done with my meal after waiting for my food for nearly 40 minutes.

I did try my mom's pulled pork sandwich and it was alright.  The bbq sauce tasted like it was straight from a bottle.  There was absolutely nothing special about that dish but it sure seemed to be popular since I see them on almost every single table across the restaurant.

As I was waiting for my mom to finish her meal, a waitress came by and asked if we got their complimentary hot cakes because they had messed up on the order their pulled pork sandwiches had come out.  After waiting for another five minutes, the hot cakes never came and I had given up.

From my first and my last visit, I would give Joe mama's a one-star rating.  There is nothing special about their food; in fact I find their food less than OK.  There are definitely other places out there that serve better and eatable breakfast and perhaps even cheaper.  So save your time to fight through the crowds for something that is maybe an upgrade from mcd.

What a jewel of a restaurant! Delicious food, beautifully presented and ambiance is excellent.
Started with Lettuce Cups, crispy chilled lettuce and yummy chicken filling. My sister had the Beef Teriyaki served over perfect al dente vegetables. I enjoyed amazingly fresh Sashimi displayed on a bed of ice with a lighted ice cube for a whimsical touch. Dinner was topped off with fresh mango over purple rice in sweet coconut milk. Staff friendly and service extraordinary. I'm visiting from out of town and delighted to find this newly opened restaurant.

This lovely consignment shop has been the ultimate "find" during  my stay here in NOLA. Miss Nellie and Miss Nell (yes, they essentially have the same name, and they are marvelous, each in her own way) took EXCEPTIONAL care of me (and my honey) during my two visits to the shop. 

Im addition to their genuine warmth and professionalism, the clothing, shoes, and accessories here have clearly been selected with a discerning eye (Miss Nell was a professional buyer, and it shows!). The pieces are all fashionable; most are of level of quality that makes them timeless. 

If you are looking for a special occasion (i.e. wedding, reception, etc.) outfit, an affordable designer item, or simply to add some pizzazz to your existing wardrobe, I highly recommend this inviting shop. 

The aptly naned Prima Donna allows the "prima donna" in any woman to blossom, at prices well within reach. Pay them a visit if you happen to be in town and are in need of  a wardrobe update (and a warm welcome!). You'll be glad you did. 

Thank you Miss Nellie and Miss Nell. I'll be back!

A great place to visit for the lumbar-challenged.  RTB has a bewildering array of chairs, seat cushions, desks, beds...even inversion tables.  Pretty much every orthotic you can think of to ease back pain, especially while sitting.

I picked up a nifty office chair in which your weight is moved primarily to your knees...wow.  Also got an inversion table and can hang like Teeter.

If you suffer from lower back pain and don't want to go the meds/surgery route, you should check this place out and sample their wares.

The 10 day return policy gives you an opportunity to try out your item and see if it really helps.  There is a "restocking fee" which you should negotiate out when you make your purchase.
I ordered the turkey panini and lemonade. Delicious! Fresh ingredients and quick service. I'd recommend Healthy N Fresh Cafe! The prayer box is a nice touch :)

Kelly is absolutely wonderful.  The best colorist and stylist to ever work on my hair (my being 47 years old and having colored by hair since 20 - that says a lot)  She's also a great font of information on all things/places/events in St. Louis.  If I have to move again, she better be willing to travel!

Outstanding food and service. Stopped in on a very busy Saturday night and scored a sidewalk table. The service was outstanding even though we sat outside. Cheese plate was amazing, and bucatini was phenomenal. Definitely will return.
Excellent food! Mussels app is over the top! Great food and service! Go back all the time!
I have enjoyed a number of good meals here.I would rate this diner slightlybelow Vincentown ,but certainly better than most

Wegmans is a first class grocery store with excellent fresh produce beautifully displayed, and a bakery which is second to none featuring fresh made breads, cakes, pies, donuts, cookies, and various ethnic type pastries. The prepared food section is one of the best I have seen in any grocery store, the quality is truly outstanding and the various food bars are well stocked and meticulously maintained. There is a separate section for bulk food item purchases, like disposal paper goods, can goods etc. with pricing that is very competitive. In my opinion Wegmans is light years ahead of Whole Foods in every single category, I only wish we had one in my area.

Ordered this last night and the food was horrible. Everything was overly greasy, wings had no flavor... the CINNAMON ROLLS were TERRIBLE! They are literally rolls drenched in butter with cinnamon sprinkled on them. Worst $40 I've spent.
Been coming here for decades. Love this place so much. The owner is such a nice person, extremely friendly staff, and the food is always awesome.

We had a great experience on the tour. Very informative and lots of good info. Get a shady seat if it's sunny and up on top deck of bus. There are some great stops. Stop 12 is Lafayette cemetery number 1. Free self tour. A couple blocks down from bus stop. Busses every 30 mins. Good way to get around the city. Runs all day.

This place is owned by a disgusting, racist, hateful bigot. While I was getting my hair done, I heard her refer to black people as "disgusting monkeys" and tell one of her employees that they could never do something as horrible as "date a black boy!" I was completely appalled and sick to my stomach, hearing any human speak like this, especially while running their own business. the owner is a terrible person and I wouldn't recommend anyone giving a single dollar of their business to this sick woman. I would give -5 stars to this business if possible.

If I could give 0 stars,  I would. We went to General RV Ocala location to look at RV'S.  Cheyenne Wagner was our sales rep.  We explained to her that we don't have any credit, because we have always paid cash, house, vehicles, everything.  However,  we wanted to try to finance an RV, so we wouldn't have to pull the cash from our savings.  We found a toy hauler we loved,  we went and spoke with the finance guy, John.  He told us he would know something in 24-48 hours.  We made an appointment for ten days the following Wednesday.  This was on Monday.   Neither John nor Cheyenne had the decency to call us back.  We called everyday, sometimes several times a day, left voice-mails everyday for Cheyenne to please call us back.  The one time I actually got a hold of Cheyenne, she was annoyed that I had gotten her on the line and promised me a return call in 15 minutes.  Needless to say, she never did. We had cash in hand to purchase the RV, however, due to the exceptionally poor customer service, we will be taking our business to another dealership.

This lovely little cafe is hidden inside the Pavilion office building, so it can be easy to miss. I really like this place though. The staff is super friendly, it's really peaceful, even though there are TVs so you can watch the news and whatever else is on. There are comfy couches as well. What I like most about this place is that it's relatively calm inside, so it's an awesome place to chill, read, or do some work.  Plus, it's never super crowded.

I haven't had the prepared food yet, but the pastries and drinks are pretty good. My only complaint....well, a wish really, is that the hours extend a little bit later into the evening. :)

Restaurant was almost completely empty when I walked in at 5:45. I asked for 1. Was told I could not be accommodated until 8pm. I asked if I could sit at the bar and was told no even though there were plenty of seats. I asked the guy if he was serious and he said he was. Called him on his bullshit and said if they didn't want my money I would go somewhere else. He got all angry and defensive. The place was EMPTY! Will not come here again.

After I finishing eating somewhere else I walked back by. The restaurant still had many empty tables.

I finally found a dentist I can feel comfortable going to. Still being recently new to the area I have had a hard time finding a good fit for me out of all the dentists in the area. A New Smile Dentistry really impressed me. The location is easy to get to off of Smith Valley Road. The building is and interior is new. The staff is upbeat and friendly. The wait time was next to none. The staff explained everything to me very clearly and made me feel good about my smile and taking care of it. I was very impressed with a new laser tool they used that scanned your tooth to verify whether you had a cavity or merely a stain. I felt like I was in good hands.
I was very  disappointed. Tasteless  lacking  seasoning  if you doing  Cuban  do.   It   is known  you  have  to cater to  the  American  pallet  but your are cuban

Very beautiful, professional spa that wasn't too overwhelming for a spa newbie like myself. I got a great swedish massage with Beth! The massage bed was heated, the locker room was clean, and they had a nice sauna to sit in, too.

If you want a family oriented restaurant with great service and even better food this the place. Like an up north diner where the staff knows your name. Also every Christmas Eve the owners have free buffet breakfast and lunch for all customers. Very thoughtful people!
Perfetto! Amazing food and knowledgeable staff. Always busy, but well worth the wait. A little bit of NY in Tampa with the sophistication of Frank Sinatra.

I'm highly impressed with this place. I got the buffalo and the Sriracha wings. Both were great. The Sriracha were really unique!
My bartender Haley was knowledgeable, kind, and adorable. Decor was really modern and comfortable. The men's room was immaculate. 
It must be a new place because it wasn't that busy, which added to its appeal. I'll definitely be back for Sunday football.
Food was very enjoyable, price was a little pricey for the portion size but i would definitley go back.

Although Peruzzi is supposedly set-up for electric cars like the Mitsubishi MiEV, they seem to have no experience with it. They start out asking about oil changes (for an all electric vehicle), then they sell 4 new tires for a car with only 17,000 miles (I knew the front 2 tires had some wear and tear and not ready for the colder weather).  And after the service, we didn't get a report on the state of the battery that we got from a previous, wonderful Mitsubishi dealer in GA. 

During the replacement of the tires, they estimated 90 minutes, so I went away for 3 1/2 hours and asked for them to charge the car after they were done. I don't know if they waited until the last minute to start or whatever, but the car was just done after the 3 1/2 hours and the car when I got in was at a 6 mile range, so I couldn't even drive it home.  They needed to drive the car after installing the tires and check alignment, which is normal, but the heat was on high, AC on and fan on full -- not a great combo for saving any battery range. 

So I'm back here waiting another hour to have enough range to get home and probably never come back.

So... remember after my first visit, I said that a re-visit was debatable? Well, the debate is over. R2L is not worth a revisit. Unless, you're newly single and looking to impress a new date. And another new date. And another new date.

Food. Another Restaurant Week, a new menu. Same dessert. My favorite part was the dessert last time, so I'm glad they kept that the same! The fried risotto balls were OK. It was like a grown-up version of fried cheese balls you can get at a dive bar, but with risotto. The poached and fried chicken, which looked almost exactly like the Chicken Picnic, were both just OK. The portions were extremely small. The chicken was cooked well, but lacked seasoning. Celery didn't add much to the dish, but to me, actually took away from the dish. It didn't have a place on the plate. It added a separate texture that didn't connect with the dish. The lobster mac and cheese was wack. The bechamel, although very creamy, was not flavorful. For the different types of cheeses used in the bechamel, it lacked saltiness.

Drinks. For a lounge that boasts some of the best views in Philly, you would think the drinks should be up to par, especially for the hefty price tags. Apparently, you're just paying for the view, not for the quality of drinks. I would think R2L would have some legitimate mixologists, especially with the fancy cocktails they have on the menu. But every drink either had too much liquor or not enough. You were either taking alcohol to the face in the form of a cocktail or you were sipping on soda with a splash of liquor. A meager splash.

Service. For a place so well-staffed, man... service was hecka slow. Dinner took 2.5 hours, so plan accordingly. This doesn't include our appetizer order while waiting at the bar. Include that, then the dinner from beginning to end was closer to 3 hours. Our dishes were not laid in front of the right people at our table, not a big deal. A beer was delivered to our table that was not ordered. Our appetizer was incorrect. And at least two glasses, at different times, were broken during dinner. But... at least our server was friendly.

But please, visit here once. Enjoy the city lights. And then dine elsewhere.

Let me start off by saying I absolutely HATED it here. From management to falling door knobs to noisy neighbors. The manager Amy Detwiler is a racist, she would cater to white residents and ignored the complaints of minority residents. As a  pregnant woman with chronic headaches, I made MULTIPLE noise complaints and nothing was resolved instead I was told to go and speak to the neighbor myself. The walls are super thin and you can hear everything from your neighbor but also the people walking by in the hall way. The yoga room computer screen was broken for about 4 months, two machines in the gym were non operational, the printer they provide residents NEVER worked while I was there and there was not enough shopping carts for the residents to bring in groceries. The trash room door handle was broken for weeks and when they came to fix it all they did was put tape over it. They sell you this apartment to be luxury but it is really just a front, the appliances are cheap and there is an ant infestation. The washer/dryer all in one takes 7 hours and ruins ALL your clothes, it's a disaster I had to begin going to a laundry mat to say the rest of my clothes. Multiple times when I made complaints to Amy she would ignore my emails. The only person that I can say was a huge help was Courtney. Their communication SUCKS, not once was it mentioned to me that I would be charged additional outside of my deposit for cleaning fees. They charge you for EVERYTHING even after you clean and ridiculous fees that don't even make sense. I moved out of the apartment and was never informed of these additional charges, they had my phone number and email address never received ANY kind of invoice. It was not until I applied for a new apartment who reviewed my rental history and reached out to them, as many do, where they informed THEM I had an outstanding balance still remaining at their management company. Avoid this place if you can, it is not worth staying here!!

I'm not even sure how to describe Beyond the Edge.  I typically stop in when there is a game I want to watch.  I've been in for soccer, football and baseball.  Every time I have been able to see what I came for.  This is key in a sports bar.  They even label the TV's during football, another key for when I am posting up for the day.  The crowd is super diverse and I've never had bad service.  The food is standard sports bar fare.  The queso, bomb!  Also if you like the Bears this is where you should be during football season.  Overall it does what I need it to.  My only qualm, which is standard to most Nashville bars, is that it's too smokey.  When is Nashville going to hop on the no-smoking wagon????

We decided to have Sunday brunch here on our last day in NOLA. We made reservations well in advance and requested courtyard seating. We arrived and were seated promptly. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was beautiful. Our problem was the food and where/how it was presented. I felt like I was collecting my food from a cafeteria. The food area was very industrial looking, unlike the elegant decor and architecture. The food itself did not live up the their reputation. I just read another review and they described it as "Cajun Golden Corral" and I have to agree. Definitely not worth the $102. (buffet and one drink) per couple.

Went there this afternoon 5:20pm
Service was horrible my fajita was sizziling the rice and beans were cold, would've sent them back but our server never came back until I was done with my fajita! The same with my wife's order her rice and beans were cold too. Don't recommend it!

Outdoor bar, local brews, food and games.  This beer garden does it right.  Just across the street from both the bell and independence hall, this place was packed.  The scene was good, a lot of people drinking and having a good time.  Only gripe is that the beer was on the expensive side.
Still an awesome place and I highly recommend it.

I usually don't expect a lot out of a hotel restaurant, but The Landing, located in the Crowne Plaza Airport Hotel was actually pretty good. Well, "pretty" good, but as two stars goes, I've experienced better.

The menu was simple, yet had a nice, varied selection of foods. I just went the Chopped Wedge Salad and it was quite good. It hit the spot that I was going for this time. It was Iceberg lettuce, Egg, Tomatoes, Blue Cheese Crumbles, Bacon Bits, and Blue Cheese dressing.

Although a bit pricy at $11, it was well prepared and fresh. For that kind of price, I'd expect about double the portion and at least use a good quality lettuce, not iceberg lettuce, which is the cheapest one around. 

So, for next time I think I'll skip the $11 'side salad' and maybe try one of the local dishes.
Great food and amazing service!!! My boyfriend and I will be returning in the near future for sure!!! Highly recommend steak house for an anniversary dinner or just looking for a fantastic meal!
Great store...cheeses, cold cuts, hogies, hone made soups and great selection of hit sauces.  Friendly staff...

The Sephora's stores are my place of happiness.
All of the stores are small and packed full of excellent products.

You are always greeted with happy friendly hello how may I help you.

My experience has always been excellent.

The managers and staffs are knowledgeable and happy.

Most of the Sephora store have estheticians to help you with what you need for your skincare and makeup.

This chained store has the same operating system as the  other 300 stand alone stores and 475 inside of J.C.Penny stores since they were founded in 1999.

I love that they have eco- friendly products to remove your makeup with just water. I love all these choices on skincare and makeup.
The reward program is very nice too.
Thank you for excellent customer service and products for all. I will return.

Gloria~

North continues to impress! I've always been a fan of North, but especially after the remodel and new menu concept launched last year. They have clearly stepped up their game. I love the casual Italian farmhouse feel and can't say enough about the quality of every dish I've tried. My friends and i have been impressed on every visit. And I love that it has stayed consistent. We can't get enough of that bruschetta! Be sure to check out the Ferrari of meat slicers on display by the kitchen. And they make some of the best homemade pasta I've ever had. Also love the chef's board (thank you Chris Carter on the crescenza cheese in depth education!) the calamari, any of the pizzas, the scottish salmon, the meatballs,  beet salad, etc. and those Italian donuts will be the end of me! I had to take those to go last time because I was so stuffed and they were almost just as good heated up for breakfast. Thanks Chris. And thanks for the great service!

This is a favorite place-- Fieri has never steered me wrong!

The Cuban will change your life: crunchy (but not hard) toasted pressed bread, pork and ham that melt in your mouth, and perfect punchy pickles.

The Guy Fieri Burger: a burger so amazing they couldn't serve or whole. It's quartered and served in its own box. So. Worth. It. 

A wonderful stop: no muss, no fuss. Dang good food.

We were very disappointed. Driven by many times and normally don't stop because there is always a line. Decided to give it a try tonight even though it was fairly busy. Husband and I both ordered the brownie hot fudge sundae. We should have known it would not be great when we got our sundaes "AFTER" the 3 people who were in line behind us got their orders before us. The sundaes had to have been sitting for a while because there was absolutely no ice cream in them. It was only hot fudge, a brownie and a liquid. The ice cream was completely melted and we "drank" the ice cream portion of our sundaes. Done. Won't be back.

I vote this best lunch place in all of Tampa and St Pete.  $10 big lunch and 12 cognac and sit outside under nice shade.  Afraid to go anywhere else after this awesome lunch deal. No! I don't work here and I actually give a lot of bad reviews.
I am back for some Monkey Breathe. This time i am taking some to go. What amazing beer.
Had my hair colored today at level salon spa. Had a wonderful experience from start to finish. Loving my blonde highlights by Callie. The perfect blonde.

WOW!!! Cheap and YUMMY Oysters! In San Francisco it would cost $28 for a dozen oysters but in New Orleans its $13.50!!! ANd you HAVE TO EAT IT the New Orleans Way or else it just isn't the same....

Place it on a slice of saltine cracker which they always provide free on all the table, then place their WASABI sauce on there, an squeeze a lemon and there you have it....You put the whole thing in your mouth like sushi and wash it down with a chilled beer, wine, etc.

MMMM, MMMM , MMMM!!! 

Don't go for anything else...just their oysters and drinks :) 

You can bet I had more than a two dozen...and I WENT THERE THREE TIMES during my trip to NOLA! THREE TIMES

Let me calculate now that I'm back in the City...I just saved myself $200 worth of oysters! Oh plus maybe $10 worth of saltime crackers :)

ACME I miss you!

Wow what a terribly disappointing experience. We dined here tonight for my mom's & my birthdays and absolutely one of the worst dinners we've ever had. Regulars of the Franklin location, we decided on Hendersonville since we were going to be in the area but what a mistake. 

To start, we arrived at 4:00 pm when they were due to open. 10 minutes of standing in the cold, with another family past 4:00pm and circling the building, peeking into windows, we were finally let in. Another 5 minutes in the lobby waiting to be seated, music wasn't on, bar was still being stocked, salt and pepper was missing from all tables, bathrooms were empty of toilet paper and paper towels, table candles weren't on (because they are battery led not real flame, by the way Franklin has real candles, then another 10 MINUTES, no joke, for a mojito, bottled beer, and glass of wine. Let's not talk about the fact that they were completely empty on a Friday night. No wonder. There were two other tables in here the entire time we dined. 

Sadly, we weren't the only ones with an issue, the table next to us got up several times for similar complaints. 

Next our server, Sydney, was nearly absent our entire visit, is unfortunately quite clumsy, spilled our chips all over our table and laps after we waited a good 5-10 minutes for them to be replenished since he brought our queso but not chips. Hard to enjoy queso while it's hot without chips. 

All 4 of our entrees arrived cold, we requested salt & pepper and hot sauce at meal drop off, that didn't arrive until we were 2/3s of the way through our meal.

Next to our table, there was a trip hazard, some sort of runner rug that no less than 3 people tripped over. We even overheard the manager tell the table next to us that the carpet was stained and that's why it was there. Are you kidding me? Absolutely Disgusting! 

After my dad waited 10 minutes for second beer, he finally got up and got it from the bar himself. Again, 3 tables in the place, 10 minutes a drink is unacceptable. 

Finally the most disappointing part, the sopapillas :( this is typically my favorite part of the meal - airy, hot, and delicious. Well not this time. Warm at best and like a brick. What?!?! How is this is even possible?!

We called over the manager to alert her of our concerns. When I mentioned the brick-like sopapillas, she continuously retorted that the dough came from the Franklin location. First of all, don't argue with a customer, and secondly your chef doesn't know how to cook them properly then. She was overall apologetic and discounted our meal but did in fact say they were under a change in management and one can only assume they will be closed soon.

Sad sad sad. What a terrible blemish on the outstanding reputation of Sopapillas, where we bring all of our out of town guests and celebrate. 

Needless to say we won't be returning to this location but Franklin will continue to keep my business.

Pack o jacks came out and provided a quote. Stated they would start on Monday. Monday morning we reached out since they didn't show and they stated they were backed up on a job and would be there Tuesday. Tuesday comes and they don't show again and have not responded to our texts or calls.

Good spot on the water with friendly service..being on top of the water, wish they would reduce their use of plastics and provide smokers with an astray instead of them throwing their butts into the water
A cheap dry cleaners that does a good job.  The people could be a little friendlier.

Good selection of lingerie, and fun accessories.  However, the staff should be more excited about the merchandise.  I had a question about a piece and how it fit, and I felt instead of being helpful, or honest they were sort of rude, and avoiding the question, and extremely uninterested in helping me.  So great merchandise, usually great help, but this recent time really lowered  my opinion.  I'm sorry!  Give it a try though!

I brought my Chevrolet Volt here for repairs after an accident. Mike and the others were very friendly and professional and worked quickly with the other party's insurance to get my car fixed in only a week. They matched my car's 3-stage pearl paint perfectly and the bodywork was perfect; you'd never be able to tell my car was ever hit! When I picked it up, they had even given it a full detail inside and out. It looked like a brand-new car! I couldn't be happier and would recommend Classic Coachwork for any car repairs!

Staff is professional, very accommodating in an effort to make you as comfortable and happy as possible during your stay. Nurses are delightful and personable. The Dr I saw was great. Great attitude and friendly. I'll be back in about about a year and am looking forward to it.

If you like really great Thai food - I mean GREAT! - then definitely visit Pad Thai in Lamplighter square.  While it's small - about 12 tables - the dining experience is wonderful!  Food prepared to exact specifications for spice, flavor and presentation.  I've gone there many times for lunch and have never had a bad meal.  I do a lot of lunch and dinner entertaining and I highly recommend Pad Thai!

I'm surprised to see the other reviews... maybe I'm actually reviewing the wrong place? Or maybe I just got lucky? Who knows.

Anyway, the big menu by the entrance said they had carbonara with asparagus. Yum! So we went in. Disappointingly, the carbonara wasn't listed on the menus we had at the table.

I asked the waitress, who said it isn't offered anymore. I might've gotten a little snarky at that point (don't get between me and my carbonara!). I mean, why not at least cross it off the big menu if they stopped serving it? Apparently they don't have asparagus anymore, but they haven't removed it from the main menu because they might bring it back. The waitress said she would ask the chef to make the carbonara as long as I was ok with it not having asparagus.

The food took a while to arrive, but when it did, it was awesome! The chef had apparently found asparagus somewhere (yay!). If the carbonara had been somewhat less salty, it would honestly have been some of the best I've ever had. I expected that boring spaghetti-in-runny-bland-alfredo-sauce that a lot of places call "carbonara," but this seemed like the real deal.

Like I said, maybe I just got lucky. But I was impressed with both the food and the service.

Staff was super friendly and kind... problem was I had made an appt the day before for 4 pedicures. Assuring me they had the time and space. They were extra fast! Like didn't even have time to enjoy. But the real kicker is when they moved 3 of the 4 of my party to regular waiting room chairs to finish our pedicures while they moved more customers into our pedi/massage chairs. Like what?!?! I had an appt... not happy at all. I can tell money means everything. Move in as many as you can. Won't be going back. Was pretty pricey for that kind of treatment.

I live up the street from this quaint little Establishment. I remember seeing the  "Avenue Scoops coming soon" on the store front when they where in process of building so it was nice to finally sit down and enjoy some "Scoops" on the "Avenue". The ice cream was delicious. Creamy, rich and satisfying. I actually went for the waffle sundae. I almost felt like I was down the shore. They have outdoor and indoor seating and it is quite spacious. I hear their coffee is amazing but I have yet to try it. All in all, this place is very cute, affordable and hits the ice cream spot! PS: The guy who was preparing my sundae was very friendly and nothing beats friendly service.

UPDATE!!!!  We have had consistent great food and service at this really fun and chill place for the last several times that we have been here this summer.  Last night, we sat outside and had some of the best chicken tenders (with honey mustard dip), sweet potato fries, salad and skillet chocolate chip cookie.
