Our server was really nice and did an excellent job.  It was hot outside, but they have nice overhead fans.  Great time.  We love coming here!

I'm on vacation in NOLA and what am I doing? I'm standing on a street corner in the hot sun waiting in line for fried chicken. But not just any fried chicken, supposedly the BEST fried chicken in the US at James Beard award winner Willie Mae's Scotch House. I saw a video of Anthony Bourdain eating here and licking his fingers the whole time. Anthony has never let me down before!

After a 30 minute wait, we were finally seated inside at a table. In order to expedite the process, we were ready with our complete order the moment the waiter arrived. The America's Best Fried Chicken Platter for everyone! Sides included mashed potatoes, fried okra, butter beans, and red beans. We also got some corn bread and dinner rolls.  The chicken platter comes with three pieces and a side. If you specifically want white meat, it will cost you $3 more. I prefer white meat over dark, but not wanting to pay the extra cost, I figured mathematically one of us would end up with a breast and I was right. 

The chicken arrived hot, crispy and juicy. They use a wet batter at Willie Mae's and fry it up to perfection. The cornbread was better than the rolls. The sides were all delicious, but the beans were a bit on the salty side. We ate every morsel of that chicken and it was definitely finger licking good!

I am a BIG fan of Southwest Airlines and usually take trips out of San Diego. I appreciate their affordable pricing, the two free bags, the complimentary in-flight snacks and drinks, the adult beverage vouchers, the humorous and friendly staff. However.... on the evening of 03/27/2017, I had a upsetting experience with Flight Attendant 'Suzi.' I was on Flight 1247 from PHL (Philadelphia) to Denver. Maybe she was having a rough/bad day, but her demeanor effected my travel. While in flight, as she was passing out snacks, she reach across me to offer the window seat passenger snacks. Her body and arm were blocking my access and I assumed she would offer me the snacks after the other passenger. She did not. Suzi immediately retracted the snacks, turned her back on me, and offered the other row snacks. I tapped her on her waist and advised that I would want a snack. She made a smart comment, allowed me to take two snacks, and continued on her way. Later in the flight, she took my drink order; I asked for a vodka tonic. She later returned with the drink.... only she decided to mix it herself. Now, flight attendants are not bartenders and she did not ask me how I would like to take my drink. The items should be given to the passenger so they can decide how strong or weak they would like their drink. After all, these are not free drinks and they are not made to order. Suzi poured the entire bottle of vodka in the cup and topped it off with a little tonic water; way too strong. I informed Suzi that I was not at all pleased with the drink. Her response was that I should have indicated that I wanted the entire can and bottle to make it myself. She made the drink because it was easier for her to carry, versus the carrying the small bottle, can of tonic, cup of ice, and accessories. I informed her, that of all the times I have ordered my alcoholic beverages onboard, I have always been given the can and the alcohol to mix myself, which makes sense because everyone enjoys their drinks differently. Suzi returned to my seat and slammed the open can of vodka on my tray and told me to mix additional tonic in as I drank it to weaken it and walked off. I sat in my seat for a few minutes.... shocked at her frustrating, disrespect, and her disregard. After so long, I got up out of my seat, went to the rear of the plane, place my beverage on the attendant's counter and explained that I was unsatisfied with my beverage and wished for a new one, after all, I am paying for my beverage. This was not a complementary soda. Suzi returned and again disrespectfully slammed the beverages on my tray. 

However minor as this incident may seem, it really had a negative effect on my travel. It put me in a bad mood and made me defensive when having to deal with Suzi. The interaction was unprovoked and unwarranted and at that point, made my drink unenjoyable. This one experience does not deter me from traveling with Southwest, nor will it prevent me from recommending Southwest to my family and or friends. But be reminded that as a flight attendant, they have a duty to respect others and treat everyone with dignity.

So let me start by saying that I made a complete error by booking two kayaking tours for my husband and I on the same day. Santa Barbara Adventure Company was completely willing to work with us, which they did not have to do. We ended up doing two kayak tours both at 1 o'clock with Chantal and Tyler.  They were both completely different tours, very unique and we had a beautiful time on the water in gorgeous Santa Barbara for two hours. What else could you ask for. We even got to see a pod of bottled nose dolphins while kayaking out to the green buoy we saw a lot of natural wildlife including sea lions, harbor seals, went directly through a group of 60 or more pelicans resting in the water... (What a blast) and had a great time hearing about all the different yachts, boats and harbor stories from the local area.
Guides were on time, and very professional.  They made sure that everybody had the skills they needed before we hit the water.  I would recommend this to any level of kayaker, even beginners. An extra shout out to Chantal... She made the tour very personal and delightful. Make sure you give it a try. We got our tickets through GROUPON too!  THANK YOU, All!!

I too agree this UPS is one of the worst I have ever been to.  I still use them from time to time to be a smiling face to some of the employees because the men who work there (manager/owner??) are some of the rudest, most abusive, vile, and sexist people I have ever encountered.  At least most people try to hide their pain or prejudice, here it is blatant and encouraged.  I actually asked the young woman if it was always like this and she said yes.  I told her I was so sorry she was the target of such obvious sexism and abuse and that she had a right to call Human Resources.  The men literally laughed in my face as well as call me names and try to dominate me.  How come UPS does nothing about this? I understand he may own the store, but the license should be taken away or the store bought back.  It gives the company a terrible name- what country do we live in? Absolutely unacceptable! Not to mention he has lied to my face about charges and I began to call him out and now they charge me less because they know I know their tricks. Guys- what do we need to do to change this?

I seriously don't want to write a bad review about this place. But the more I think about it, the more up set I get. We came across this place from recommendation of many sites. I was very excited to dine here on our labour day weekend trip to New Orleans. We booked our table for labour day. We were seated right away when we arrived. It took 10 minutes for our server to greet us. He apologized for the delay and gave us the menu 5 minutes later. Took another 15 minutes before he took our order. The food was ok, we had better somewhere else. The whole dining experience was not comfortable at all for us. We want to leave as soon as we finished the dessert. We asked for the cheque. Gave our credit card and it took another 15 minutes to get our card back. We even had to remain the server that we were waiting to sign our card. I really felt that we were the forgotten table. I did not expect an extremely good treatment, I know that it was labour day and the restaurant might short on waiter. But we didn't deserve this treatment too. We dine all around the world, to be honest this might be one of the worse experience that leave me feel really sad.

Boyfriend and I came here for our last meal in NOLA, and I liked that it had a communal table and coffee-bar feel. The menu seemed a little overly fancy (duck confit crepes, etc), especially given that there doesn't appear to be a kitchen and everything is prepared behind the counter, so most of the ingredients are premade (at least they were in my salad).

I ordered the gulf shrimp salad (it had a cute name but I forgot it), which has avocado and arugula in it. While the salad tasted really good, the presentation was kind of strange. They just scooped out two avocado halves, put them on top of the arugula (which still had stems?) on a rectangular plate, and then dumped the shrimp in the avocado halves. Would it have killed them to cut up the avocado? It wasn't busy, and it just seemed like lazy food prep and presentation to me, plus the avocado was really bland because it wasn't mixed with any of the dressing on the arugula. If you're going to be high and mighty with your menu, have presentation that matches. 

My boyfriend ordered the prosciutto sandwich, but got speck instead because they were out of prosciutto. It seems like the speck was pretty tough, since he was having a hard time getting a solid bite and the sandwich just fell apart. They also put whole little tomatoes (cherry? grape? I'm not sure), in the sandwich instead of slicing them up, so when he bit in a tomato exploded all over both of us (including my white shirt...). It seemed like the whole tomatoes were a cute theory, but not a practical when it comes to the execution of sandwich-eating, since you can't really pop a whole one in your mouth the way you do with a salad.

I did really like my chai, which is made there, so that was a plus. And it wasn't like the flavors of the food were terrible, and the food wasn't overpriced, either. It just seems like they were trying to create a higher level of the food/coffee bar concept but didn't fall through in putting their meals together in a practical way.

Not good. Not good at all. First of all, this place is suffering from a major identity crisis. There's nothing Cajun about it, apart from the name. The interior is a hodge podge of different decors thrown together resulting in a very confusing dining experience. 

I asked the server (who may also possibly be the owner) what he recommended and he just said "It's all good." I went with the Cajun burger which was supposed to be a hamburger stuffed with cheese. What I got was a frozen hamburger patty that was tough and tasteless and had no discernible cheese in it. It came on an odd bun, which looked like a cinnamon bun without the sugar and cinnamon. My hubby ordered the Catfish sandwich, which was also previously frozen and tasteless. It came on a tough, chewy roll. 

I'm giving this restaurant two stars, though, because the server/owner was very nice and provided good customer service for the most part.

Best girl drink on Bourbon street that I had no shame carrying around in public. The bright green cup you're forced to carry around basically screams "hey yall, I'm phucking hammered!!". The music they had was the basic Bourbon street trash but still was entertaining when you're drunk, so I was all smiles! I believe the drinks are $14 for the Grenade and $13 for the refill. AND Yes, I got a refill...TWICE!!

The Jug is our favorite bar in SJ! We love everything from the music, the bartenders (S.O. Tina, we miss you!!), the strong drinks and the delicious bar food. It's awesome that this bar offers different beer specials every day of the week and live music on Wednesdays. I cannot wait for the live music and outdoor area at The Jug to be open soon after MDW- neat little hangout area with full bar, snacks, and cornhole games. Since the pandemic, their takeout service has been nothing short of amazing!! TIP: 1. If you ask for a bottle, it'll be the coldest in NJ. 2. Carolina bbq sauce is to die for. Order it on wings, tenders, chicken cheesesteak, on the side with your fries- you won't be disappointed!!! 3. Make sure to leave your name on the ceiling downstairs.

We were pleased with Percy Street, especially for the restaurant week price! Two of us ate for $35, including appetizers and desserts. It's authentically Texas-style. Having grown up on the Great Plains, I prefer a bit more northern, sweet-and-sour style of BBQ, like you find in Kansas City, but I'd wager it's the best barbecue in Philly. 

The roll of paper towels on the table was perfect. Bring your own takeout container, though. The portions are ample and they pack it in lots of styrofoam.

My rating is based on the food.  The service and decor are obviously lacking.  Go for lunch or late evening.  The tasting menu is your best bet.  I've gone three times.  They'll send extras, more of something you liked and you'll get to sample items you wouldn't normally order.

Fantastic meal. Was a little unsure as it is in a hotel (the Intercontinental) happy I came in- 
Best Filet ever- cut with a fork. 
I travel weekly eating every meal out consequently might be hard to please. 
I am coming in late December and will bring friends

Beer good not much variety. Most of the employees were nice except the jerk maning the milkshake bar was a total jerk been there three times  asked for to go no problem we ate a full meal but if you didn't get a to go shake this time because we didn't order food at his station. Won't be going back.
This is flat-out the worst place in town. Bland food, awful salsa, bad service and arrogant management. This place is just for tourists.

Went to Bertucci's on Concord Pike for my aunt's birthday.  Everything was excellent.  Food was wonderful.  John provided us with excellent, friendly service.  We all left full and happy. My aunt had an awesome birthday! Highly recommended!

I feel very fortunate that I had Monica for acquiring a commercial property. I did not have that much knowledge or experience in buying a property but Monica was very patient and caring through out the whole process. She took the time to explain the steps involved and always there to answer any questions. She is always considerate of what you are looking for. I would not hesitate to use her again for future purchases. I know that this experience would have been a disaster if I had used anyone else.

Overpriced. Small portion. Chicken parm was $18 and was a small portion. Bow tie pasta side was overcooked  and under sauced. 

Only good thing was toasted ravioli!!!

Wow!  Super great Cajun food, very busy place but the staff seemed happy and definitely knew their business.  My questions about some of the selections were quickly answered and I definitely took the servers' recommendations to heart!  So glad I spent 2 hours of my evening in NewOrleans at Emeril's !!!!!!
Anna did a great job with my gel mani.. I would recommend Ruby or Anna. Everyone is always so nice and welcoming.

I've been going here since I was a kid and can honestly say that the food hasn't changed in almost 20 years - it's always been really good.  And they've obviously been doing something right if they've been in business this long, even after having to close for several months due to a fire a number of years ago.  Normally I just get takeout pizza, but the eggplant parm and chicken parm, and pastas are good too.  When I visit my family I insist on getting pizza from there because it's my favorite in the area.  Slices are huge though, so asking to double-slice is a good idea.

Celebrated a Birthday, restaurant offers at a charge a candle in dessert. Candle looked nice but a bit pricey given the cost of dinner. The food was tasty and wait staff was good this time. We ordered several of the specials and they were on point. We will return and try this restaurant again.

We hit the new Jalapenos spot in Oaklyn all the time.

The food is as close to authentic as you can get around here but the chicken tacos and taquitos are fantastic.

The drinks are good, try a Habanero Margarita hot spicy and delicious.

My first time in St Louis. My husband was very excited about this restaurant and the great history behind it. Well, I was so disappointed with the service. Our waiter seemed very annoyed by trying to explain one of the dishes in the menu. We ordered some wine, baked ravioli ( a must in st Louis) and I  had a question about the cheese. Big mistake ! I could not even eat and my husband meal went the wrong way ( brought half of his salmon  to the hotel).  BTW the restaurant only had 2 tables occupied , a very interesting game on tv for the waiter and a couple of other people there too. 
Food was average and service was the worse I have had since New York 4 years ago, never again. Do not recommend.

I'm not sure why there aren't more reviews for Brand Jewelers in the Deptford Mall? Five stars - why? 

1 -
The way the owners treat the employees and how they both treat the customer - that's the first reason. Incredible. Incredibly great.

2 - 
The owner personally selects the diamonds in their custom-made jewelry - I was shocked to learn that my black diamond ear-rings were crafted by the business! This is very meaningful to me.

3 -
The fashionable taste and recommendations, selection, and product offerings are classy and very personal. I'm a guy - a gift for my mother was recommended based on description alone, and it was perhaps the most meaningful gift she's had throughout her lifetime.

4 -  
No pressure sales. While I am loyal to this business, they supported my shopping the competition for a matching piece of jewelry - and they prefer doing good business versus closing a sale. Very honest and genuine individuals.

5 -
I'm pointing out 5 details because I only have 5 stars to work with, however, this jeweler is simply amazing. They've restored my grandfather's ring from the 1960s to incredible condition - for a more than reasonable cost. They personally care about every instance with every customer, and they make you feel like family when shopping. 

What else could be asked for? As for price range - they have a wide selection of merchandise - some custom made, others custom ordered. I personally support and advocate this business because of the way they have treated me as a guest and more importantly, their attention to my grandfather's ring - my most valued family heirloom -they presented me a gift - not a service sold.
Great, unpretentious storefront that serves up what it promises: delicious soup dumplings. Reasonably priced and quick service. Stop by for lunch or an early dinner.

Went to DiBella with a group of friends this past weekend and we all had such a wonderful experience. We travel to many vineyards and wineries all over PA and NJ, and DiBella was by far one of our absolute favorites. We arrived there about 10 minutes before they opened and as soon as one of the owners saw our car pulled in, she flipped the sign to open the store just for us. We were greeted with a warm smile and the decor was welcoming-it was quaint, with beautiful woodwork and had that feeling of Home. You can tell the owners take great pride in giving their guests a personal and pleasant experience. We went for a wine tasting and Julie took care of us. She was very knowledgeable about all the subtleties that make each wine special, and answered any questions we had about the wines. The price of the tasting was one if not the least expensive we've experienced and the samples were more than ample. If we really enjoyed a certain wine, she generously offered us a second tasting--I've never had that happened in any other vineyard. We all enjoyed each of the wines we tried and the prices of the bottles were very reasonable (compared to many wineries) considering the excellent quality of the wine. We want to 4 other wineries that day and not one of them came close to the warmth and hospitality that we received there. I highly recommend visiting DiBella whether you're local or not and I would absolutely go back again for the events they host which you can learn about on their Facebook page. I generally tend to write reviews when I have unpleasant experiences, in but I felt compelled to share because Julie and her families winery was just so enjoyable, knowledgeable, wonderful, and of course tasty. Definitely check this place out! I will definitely be making a trip back in the future.

Nice people, attention to detail, clean fun atmosphere, fair prices!
What more can you ask for?

Their chips and salsa are outstanding/some of the best soups from scratch, and seafood that clean and fresh!

And don't forget my favorite dish the roasted Green Chili Asada! $12.00

In house made Auga Fresca


Service has always been prompt and friendly, not sure why these other reviewers are so disgruntled?

Great comfort food, good and quick service.
Recommended joint.
The Shepherds pie was quite authentic...
Elle, our server was great too! Attentive and pleasant.

They did an absolutely amazing job on my 2012 VW Beetle. I reached out on Wednesday via their chat feature on their site. Super responsive. Had an appointment for Friday at 9am. They immediately took my car back when I arrived. Finished by about 10:30am and let it dry in the sun for 15 minutes to ensure it was good to go. 

The back window of beetles are really hard to do and these guys had it done in no time. The tint looks great. I have already referred other people to Leo's. I will take all vehicles in the future here. No fuss. No runaround. Just quick and efficient service. They even placed "don't open windows" stickers on my window controls. I've had at least 3 other vehicles tinted in the past and no other place ever went the extra mile to do this. And it has lifetime warranty for bubbles and peeling. YOU CANT BEAT THAT!!!

Came in for the home brew contest.  Sampled their beers liked most of what I had (IPA's). My fiancé had the sours.  He liked them all.  Me, I like my gummy worms sour not my bear. They were serving brunch.  The French toast was amazing.  The chicken biscuit sandwich was even more amazing.  We definitely will be back.
Great place! Speedy service and affordable prices. Delicious ramen for beginners! Would recommend coming back for sure !

I would love to write a favorable review of Metropolitan at Rittenhouse Square.  Who wouldn't enjoy an upscale bakery a few blocks from home and just at the edge of one of the city's nicest public spaces?  The wall of breads and the warm atmosphere; heck, they even have dog biscuits for all the neighborhood canines.

Unfortunately, I can't.  I am a regular consumer of croissants and Metropolitan almost never fails to disappoint.  Sometimes there's a bit too much egg glaze, but most often the problem is just too much butter (or that it's too unevenly rolled).  Some people might think that's a nice sign of artisanal or hand production.  I don't.  Nothing spoils a croissant like biting into a pool of butter.  The texture is bad, the taste is bad, and it makes you think the decadent treat wasn't worth it.  This has happened several times with croissants from Metropolitan.  More than is reasonable, in fact, for me to keep returning.  The first time I thought, well anyone could make a bad croissant out of thousands.  The second and third times I thought, well that's not right, but it was so close and convenient and the store seemed so well put-together I went again because I thought it had to be me -- it couldn't be this great upscale bakery's problem, could it?  (Their breads are very good and much more consistent.)  But again.  And again.  Until now I can't recommend them anymore.  Sorry.

I was convinced by the low price of their twice a year "ac check up" for my businesses rooftop units. When it came time for the first inspection, all of a sudden my unit needed a number of repairs that totaled a few hundred dollars. One of which being a coil cleaning that happens to not be the coil that is covered in the contract. 

it hadn't been work on in a few years, so i figured it was possible. Cut to less than a month later, AC stops working, call them up, they come out promptly, find more "Issues" that now total another few hundred. Including somehow blowing the breaker it was on. 

Cut to about a month later, AC Down again, turns out now my motor is busted, $895 later, and a few hours of work later. Still No ac. Turns out the circuit board "must have been friend by the old motor." 

Three weeks of phone calls and emails to them about the cost of this "simple fix."

Their sales rep Johnie Long, after telling me the part was coming in three times, finally calls me with a quote he can't say in the office because he "could get in trouble." 

He can do what typically costs $550, for the low low price of $448, because "I'm such a good customer. "

So all total, I've spent already close to $1400, to have a non working AC unit, and I am expected to pay an additional $448, for them to come out only for, I will assume, the AC to break down a month later requiring more repairs. 

DO NO USE THEM.  My AC gave me NO PROBLEMS, before them touched it. Then it fell to pieces.
Absolutely great entertainment! Drinks were cold and the bartender kept them coming! Pizzas were great to soak it up a bit. We had a blast!
Hot pastrami with Swiss on rye. Limited places in this area to get one, and this is the best I've found!

The sandwich is seemingly so simple. However I continued to be shocked at both how good, and how bad a sandwich can be. And every time I have one of those great sandwich experiences it seems to be a total shock somehow. Really, how good could pastrami, cheese, onions, some sauce and lettuce and tomato really be? 

The answer is it could be as good as it is a Country Catering. I walked into this place yesterday for the first time ever. I had read a couple good reviews and assumed it would good. But again, how good can a simple sandwich place be? I walked in as they seemed to be closing up. I was the only customer in the shop, and suspected quickly I'd be hearing, "Sorry! Closed up for the day". Instead, I was asked if they could get me a sandwich. I asked for pastrami with swiss cheese on a wheat roll, and suggested they surprise me with the rest. I waited and chatted with the staff about what I was doing in town, how I found the place, and finally what kind of side I would be having. I ordered macaroni salad hoping that it might in some way remind me of the macaroni salad in Hawaii (which all you mainlanders should know is way better than anything I've had stateside. And in all seriousness I still can't figure out why). But anyway. The sandwich comes out and in a funny way I wish it had taken longer. The staff was so incredibly kind and amiable, I found myself truly happy to be there. I found myself thinking that living in Goleta would be wonderful. 

But now, the only thing that really matters to a review reader; THE FOOD. There can be no understatement regarding how good this sandwich was. It was everything a sandwich should be and more. The pastrami was juicy, salty, sweet and plentiful. There was no excess of condiments, and if the sandwich was "too wet" it was due to the copious meat drippings that were shooting down my wrists. I demolished the entire thing in no time at all. The cheese was melted, and the lettuce and tomato was crisp and fresh. But then I noticed that I still had the macaroni salad. At this point I was stuffed full of delicious sandwich and would usually have passed. But given how good the sandwich was I dove in, and Yes, I finished the entire thing. It might be some of the best macaroni salad I've had. It screamed California with olives and crunch from the celery. All ther really is to say is that is was delicious and in no way having too much mayonnaise.

To end this epic, I will tell you I returned there today for lunch, decided to try the Tri-Tip, and simply told the girl at the counter my life was in her hands and aside from the meat the rest of the decisions were up to her. Needless to say, the sandwich was, again, transcendent. 

SO
in short, go to this place and spend your hard earned dollar. It couldn't go to nicer people, and you will, for your $8 or $9 get a sandwich that will shoot you over the moon and back. 

Just go. If you don't know where to get a bite in Santa Barbara for lunch, GO HERE.
This ice cream is addictive. I bought three pints before I left Nashville. LOL! The great thing about Covid is no long wait because they always have a line.

ust had the worst experience ever. The Waiter was beyond rude-- after he brought the wrong dish to the table, he literally says to us, he is Japanese and he knows his noodles; Not being polite nor thoughtful to say may I offer ,.,.,. Did not return to serve water, but when asked for the bill and we informed the SOB that we were paying in cash and to reduce the bill by 5% He was very nasty; after we were ready to pay the bill and gave cash and told him to bring change back he literally slammed the money down on the table,and told us we had to wait because he was busy. We then got up in search for a manager to pay our bill and inform him (Manager Kim) of our experience. Kim tells us that the waiter is crazy and this is his last day instead of firing him on the spot, Manager Kim pushes him away from us as we were speaking to Kim, That Waiter passes by as we were about to leave and says to us as he is walking violently toward us in an angry manner to fight while yelling "Fuck You" repeatedly and loudly. Needless to say we should have called law enforcement but decided to get them where it counts,  in their pockets $$$. What is the purpose for advertising, All You Can Eat, then charge again for leftovers, .50 per thin deplorable slice of Sushi. I often patronize this establishment but NEVER AGAIN!!
Love their pizza. Reminds me of Lorenzo's in the city. Super friendly family owned business.

Great customer service and competitive prices; however, horrible cancellation policy, product availability and shipping methods. Appliance arrived two months after backorder and then was a nightmare with the shipping company. Would not recommend Goedeker's at all.

Stopped for coffee at an outrageously early time of day, walked into a store smelling of sweet warm cinnamon and fresh brewed coffee. The lady working the counter couldn't have been sweeter. Restrooms were shiny clean. Everything else was fairly standard as far as Maverick's go.

Ok - BBQ is one of my all time favorites, with that said, I was a bit skeptical when a friend of mine picked up lunch from "an old truck on the side of the road." But being the glutton I am - I fell to, once I saw the sandwiches he brought ( at this point I thought forget the consequences- I'm starving). 
     What my friend failed to mention was that it was Whaley's, not just any truck selling meat. This place is awesome. Good BBQ for a price you cannot beat. The meat is usually very lean too. I have enjoyed both pork and beef. I am partial to the pulled pork. 
     If you are looking for fine dining at a BBQ restaurant, sorry- maybe a Whaley's will gloriously open some day. For now the truck is parked at different locations at different times during the week. Perfect on a colder Florida day.

This is definitely a staple of American culture and what St. Louis is known for. This is a big gateway arch that goes over the city and you go up really high and look over at the stadium and the river and just a bunch of downtown things. It's really fun it's really once-in-a-lifetime experience that if you're in St. Louis you have to do do

Delish! The huevos rancheros was amazing. It does does take a little while to get your food, but good food takes time. As to the overpriced review- where is that person eating? The most expensive thing on the menu is all of 8.50. If you drink water, 2 people can eat breakfast for 20 bucks- and that includes the tip.

This will be my second year living here and to date everything has been fantastic. Everyone at the leasing office has been very nice to work with and answered any (and I had a lot!) of questions. A shoutout to Benji, who I worked with the most on the leasing side, although Luis, Jesus and everyone else have also been fantastic and helpful. On the maintenance side, Louie and Ben have been fantastic! They respond to any maintenance requests very swiftly and in a friendly manner as well.

We ordered the curry goat and fried plantains. We also got the dumpling with one of them. Over the food was food, authentic, but did not knock our socks off. The staff was friendly and the store appeared very clean when we picked up our food.
Mushroom Ravioli was out of this world! Chicken Marsala was delicious! Chef  Ivano very talented. Wait? Umm if I had to wait for my food, what I ate that night would be worth it.

I loved this restaurant! The staff was pleasant and helpful, and the blood Mary was delicious! We loved every plate of food we ordered. The community table was a new experience, and I enjoyed sitting and talking with new people! Will definitely be back
Love this place. A Tampa institution. Been eating here since 1998 and food is great and cafe con leche. Is the best.

Held a bridal shower there yesterday and can't say enough about how great the food and service was.   Everyone commented on how good (and plenty) the food was which included Vienamese Spring Rolls, Chinese Egg Rolls, Wonton Soup, and Sesame chicken just to name a few items.  The server did an excellent job of keeping things moving and was very pleasant and attentive to our needs.  A very nice job, Oriental Pearl and thank you!

There are two things I look for in a barber: first, I want an inexpensive haircut. Second, I want my hair cut. No slightly longer hairs around my ears, nothing left on my neckline, and no random longer hairs on my head.

I go to the Shop because I get a great haircut here for $20. I don't know of a cheaper place in downtown Wilmington, and I don't know anywhere that will give you a cut with as much attention to detail.

The Shop has a very cool interior. There is always a movie playing. The last two times I went in Bad Boys 2 and Ali were playing. There are flat screen TVs within view no matter where you are. The volume is low, but audible if you want to watch. The shop seems brand new, and is immaculately clean. Other than that, it is a typical barber shop.

My family has leased/purchased 3 cars over the years from Dave Pulliam at Runnemede Toyota. Each time Dave has helped us find exactly the right car for our needs while staying within budget. No pressure. Dave follows up too making sure you are happy with your purchase.

A return visit to Magpie found some yummy treats. We tried the butterscotch bourbon pie which was clearly a winner. I also tried two thirds of the seasonal trio of mini pies including the bourbon vanilla caramel cream and vanilla custard crumb pies.  The former was very good and the latter was decent. I would probably get the vanilla cream pie again but maybe not the custard crumb one. I do think it's really cool how they have special rotating pies in addition to their usual ones becaue the selection is a bit limited.

The place was really packed on a Saturday afternoon but the service was great.

I'm just going to re-post my review from their old location. It's a five-star place, that has earned a sixth star for its new location. Fantastic!

"This is an out-of-the way place that deserves a trip. I've only ever eaten a few things here but have been many times. The things I usually order are so good I don't want to stray. Chicken shawarma platter is my go-to, then it's a toss up between the buffalo chicken or the donair pita. And the price is right too. Definitely check this place out."

Have come before & it was ok. Received a coupon book with offers for this location in it, so I figured I would try again. Was told by attendant that greeted me that they have a new cashiering system & don't have a way to do the coupons & don't even offer the specific wash service mentioned on it. So that was my first disappointment. Then, there are no wash service menus ANYWHERE!! Just empty boxed frames with light bulbs in them. So I had to ask what WAS offered. Wow.  I have 4 coupons for here, but will most likely let them go to waste. Quite sad for a business to think these circumstances & service is acceptable.  Ridiculous.

Nice atmosphere not really Irish setting and our server Alexa did a good job. The chicken sambo was ok , the curry cauliflower was hot but not  lit if taste and the beef stew was a little better than ok. Not a bad place just not a place we are likely to return to

Great food ! We had to pick it up because they don't do curbside delivery. Noticed tables were awfully close , no social distancing. Staff wearing masks but no one else while waiting to get their food. Will order again if they start curbside delivery

parmesan crusted sole!! I don't usually eat fish, but this dish is outstanding-
I've never had a meal I didn't enjoy.

This is one of our go-to pizza restaurants, especially when we are at Imax. We make our own custom pesto pizza and it's to die for! The cannoli are my favorite in this area. I prefer to go during non date night, busy hours, because on a Friday night at 6.....long wait!

This end of Doylestown has needed a place like this for a long time and now we have it. Beautiful shop with ordering kiosks, several tables and a good selection of bagels,La Columbe coffee,muffins and sandwiches...the service was great and the  people working there were very friendly and helped us with ordering.My wife and I stopped in on Saturday morning, she ordered bacon egg and American cheese on an everything bagel, I had the sausage egg and cheese on a plain bagel... incredibly fresh and tasty, we loved it. We also picked up a half dozen bagels and a half pound of their cream cheese to go. 
Check em out.

The best Chinese food I have had in a while, and definitely the top Chinese food in the area. Fresh, authentic, fast. The Dan Dan noodles, Cumin Lamb, and Snow Pea Leaf are our favorites. A spot our family enjoys!

I battle 76 and parking everyday for one of DiNic's signature masterpieces. Nothing and I mean nothing comes close to the perfection that these people achieve day in day out, possibly the worlds best sandwich. Do a brother a service and do not ever stop providing these goods to the Philly community. We would all go through withdrawal, get sad then angry. KEEP EM COMING. Thanks for all the hard work keep it up

We had such a great time at the Spanish Garden Inn. The atmosphere of this hotel was everything I wanted while staying in Santa Barbara for my courthouse wedding. We stayed in one of the suites and upon arrival had chocolate covered strawberries and champagne waiting for us in the room! I was so surprised and so happy. They even allowed us to bring back my 10 family members to the courtyard for coffee and cupcakes. To top it off the breakfast selection was more then just a typical continental breakfast, the breakfast burritos were a game changer. Thank you for an amazing stay!

Came here during COVID, but luckily they were open for dine in! I got the Loco Moco and it was really good! The gravy was super tasty!!!! Service was A1! And they were really nice always checking in on us, really loved that! Great service and great food! Would definitely come back!!
Definitely the best yogurt in Westshore Mall. Better flavors, cheaper price, and a fun business model of creating your own treat. They are one the cutting edge of fro-yo technology!

Delicious food for a really reasonable price. Have been here several times and their falafel sandwich is delicious and the chicken breast kebab platter is spot on with large portions that leave you satisfied. The Turkish coffee and baklava are a great way to end a meal as well.

Well, not bad.  I had hoped for more after watching bizarre foods.  My sister and I visited Philly for our birthday.  We stopped in and maybe the first major failing was the two lines for different sandwiches.  
I went into one line to order the roast pork sandwich and my sis went to the other for the cheese steak.  I got my sandwich right off but my sister's took forever so by the time she came out the roast pork sandwich was all soggy.  (I didn't want to just start eating without her!)
Also the cheese steak was bland and needed tons of ketchup.....just like a cheese steak I could have gotten anywhere else.  I mean I could have made it at home and it would have tasted the same.  
In the end it was just such a pain to find that the end results didn't justify the aggravation.
It was ok, but not stellar.

We had to move from our condo to this hotel because we weren't able to rent it for another 3 days only.  Check in is at 3:00pm, we arrived at 4:00.  We had rented 2 rooms, one with a queen bed and the other with 2 double beds.  The manager showed us to our rooms and they both had 1 queen bed.  We told her that we had booked 1 queen room and 1 room with 2 double beds.  She argued with us and said she had called and talked to me and told me on the phone we would get 2 rooms with queen beds.  She never called and talked to anyone.  She needed up giving us a room with 2 double beds for 2 nights of our 3 night stay and then we would have to move to a room with a queen bed.  
The rooms are small but have full size refrigerators which is nice.  They are clean but outdated.  They have cable and wifi.  Parking is right up front which is very convenient.  The pool is not a pool... it is tiny, basically an oversized hot tub.  It seems overpriced for what it is as it is still a good 2 blocks from the beach.

If you're near Clearwater, FL and you want to do some diving then Tanks-a-Lot should be your go to.  Start to finish one of the best experiences I've had diving.  Captain Ryan and company provided a level of service and professionalism you just don't see a lot of anymore, and were still able to create a very chill laid back atmosphere. From my first email contact till we settled the bill back on shore I always felt well taken care of.  

Great dive sites.  Great boat.  New and high quality equipment rentals.  Most of all really superior people.  Highly recommended for novice divers or ones who haven't dove in a while.

We just relocated from Kansas City MO to Clearwater. We lived in downtown KC and had 5 microbreweries within walking distance including Boulevard Brewing. Love local craft beers - definitely did not care for Sea Dog. I did a flight and was not impressed with any of them. And the website states they have food - they do not. They give you menus from Codys next door. Food was very bland and mediocre. If you a truly looking for a local place there are plenty of other choices that I recommend exploring.

So this is my first time coming to Woofies. I've heard of this place a long time ago. But of course it slips your mind until you see it! First and foremost they are open and the have a drive through! If you love a good hotdog I was told that this was the place to go. Due to COVID, the inside was closed but that doesn't stop the friendly person on the outside that takes your order. I ordered a bratwurst with cheese and small fries. It was good! I love hotdogs! So I definitely recommend you try this if you're ever in St. Louis. It's the last one there is! Go help this business out! Especially if you love hotdogs. I'm stopping at woofies every time I'm in the area!!

Super Cuca's is fast and cheap and generally pretty good. My main complaint stems from being a vegetarian. My boyfriend and I have gotten burritos and quesadillas there four or five times and almost every time one of us has found a chunk of meat or gristle in with our food. We probably should have known better, but we do now.

The food is average at best. I had the tortilla soup and turkey club. It's just Soup and sandwich but the lettuce and avocado were not in good shape. You hope for more from wolf gang puck concept. That's actually not this place's biggest issue. They may have the worst service in the entire airport. I've been here twice and always see a manager sitting at the counter rolling silverware on a half empty restaurant and not attending to food sitting there waiting to go to tables and checking on the horrible service. Two different servers and both are rude and short and kind of give you a half smile when they give you the check. I gave it two chances but I'm never spending my money for not great food and rude service.

I came in to order a Schmagel and coffee this afternoon at about 1:55pm. When I came in, the barista, Isabelle, was extremely kind. I ordered and went to pay and noticed she had to open her drawer back up, which was confusing at first because online it said their hours were until 3:30pm. After I ordered and paid, I walked around and noticed the food had been wrapped up too. I was a little confused still so I walked to the front and saw on the window the hours were only until 2pm.
I felt awful immediately, to come in about 4 minutes until they were closed and order food and a coffee. I apologized immediately and saw she was already making the coffee.
I'm leaving a 5 star review because of how incredibly kind she handled all of it. I work in the industry as well and I doubt I would've been so patient or have not mentioned that we close in 5 minutes. But she was smiling and friendly and going above and beyond. I told her about the hours online and she said that was the other stores hours and it must've been a mistake on Apple Maps.
The food and drink were great and I still am so impressed with how well they handled what's usually a very annoying situation. Thank you, Isabelle, and the staff in the back making food. I apologize for the misunderstanding on hours but I really appreciate how kind all of you were.

If I could give 0 stars, I would've. Although my business with this establishment had nothing to do with heating or cooling or whatever else they claim to be. They posted an amazing 31ft trailer on an app for 1550. It said the trailer needed some work. I left the seller, we'll call her R, a message on said app. She then reached back with her phone number. I responded and said I will get back to you around noon. Time got away from me, but I heard my phone message alert and it was an OfferUp message. After opening the message it said the price dropped to 1100. I called immediately! R and I made tentative plans to bring money. R also stated she will sell said trailer for 800. Well that got me on my horse and I was on my way to this business. She called and broke my heart and said another guy got there first. But if something happens, I'll be the first person she would call. 2 hours later R calls again letting me know the trailer was mine. The guy couldn't pick it up until the next day. I immediately used the U-haul App for obvious reasons. After renting the truck, I reached out via text to seller to ask for zip code and another text for hitch size on trailer. Just to make sure all i's were dotted and all t's crossed. I was on my way to Wilmington from south Jersey,  about an hour away. I was so excited to finally have something to repurpose. After arriving  at this meeting place, I called seller, no answer. I texted, no response. Waited, then realized there was another trailer on the property. I looked at the trailer but wasn't the one I was coming to get. I turned around and seen the trailer from the app being towed to this property. I thought he was bringing it down to me. A man drove up to me with a very curt tone and told me to move that thing out the way. Meaning the brand new GMC I had rented. He gets out of his truck and says "my wife didn't call you?" I say "hello, how are you?" I talked to her about an hour ago. He says, well it's gone. The guy came back with 1000. Now... I'm not upset that the trailer was sold to the highest bidder, I'm upset that R knew I was travelling a distance and wasted money on a rental for nothing. What is interesting is that the husband asked how much I had to try to sell me another trailer. I told that poor excuse of a business owner  " sir, I would never do business with you." That explains the piss poor reviews about how they conduct business. I'm so sorry I didn't read the reviews as I do with any business I visit. But I felt inclined because people need to be aware of shady characters. I've been in business as a stylist for about 20 years. It's no way I can let anyone leave my chair disappointed.

this place is great! drunken noodles are the best, I've the spice level of 2 and 3, and both were too spicy for me. ill go down to 1 the next time. i also had their combination rice, it was very good als and plenty of meat. they give you enough to last for two days.

Came in to spend a bit of time before walking the beach. Service was great, our server David was amazing, free drinks when we signed up to the WiFi. Try the shrimp burger!!! It's like a crab cake on a bun with Siracha aioli sauce. The fries are really good too. 

We come down to St. Pete every summer and will be coming back this next summer!

Place has potential- it really does.  But it's clearly catering to the 21 and under crowd and making those of us who are over 21 pay extra for simply wanting to drink while we enjoy a performance.  

Went for some concert (I can't even remember the headliner honestly cause the whole experience was so bad) on a Saturday night and was expecting to pay $25 for the ticket.  Get to the front and was told if I wanted to go to the 21 and over section, it would be $55.  Oh, did I mention it's BYOB?  And that extra 30 dollars means 30 dollars for you to store your ALREADY BOUGHT alcohol on a shelf at an empty no-liquor-license bar?  I didn't even have alcohol in my hand but a friend in front of me had a case of beer with him.  I guess assuming people are going to drink cause their friends are is grounds for charging me an extra 30 fucking dollars.  I could have just said "Oh, I'll go to the 21 and under section, then" but security made it clear that I'd be stuck over there in that section:  I literally would not be allowed to visit my friends in the 21-over section to escape for a bit, regardless of my ID that says I'm over 21.  I paid the stupid $55 cover for a wristband and went to the 21 and over section, now in a sour mood.

When I first got there, it was so dark and I couldn't figure out where the hell I was going, but soon made sense of everything.  There was actually a really nice bottle service section (how much do they charge for that if you bring your own bottle, I wonder?)  but if I paid for it, I'd be pissed cause it was not exclusive at all.  Anyone and everyone could just saunder on through and block your already-shitty view of the DJ booth.

Friend had to give his beer to some "bartenders" behind the "bar" so they could store it and put his name on it so whenever he wanted a beer, he'd say his name.  Not a terrible idea, except if I didn't have alcohol and paid the $55 and wanted alcohol, I could just go up to them and make up a pretty common name and get booze in return.  In addition to this, you also feel obligated to tip these "bartenders" because they need to make a living, too, right?  But honestly, dishing out any more cash on this place will just piss you off even more.

To the concert itself:  I couldn't even see the opening DJs because there were a million pillars in my way and though I could hear, it was really muffled.  I did get a nice view of the EDM high school dance below me, though.  When the headliner came on, we wanted to get closer, so we had to finish our beers, walk down the steps past the bouncers, then shuffle through the 15 year olds to the front to get a decent view of the stage.  Luckily, this particular show wasn't crowded so it wasn't hard to do but I can't imagine how difficult it would be to get a glimpse of someone famous, like Diplo.

You'd honestly be better off going somewhere far better, like Union Transfer.  Or hell, YouTube it and you'd get a better view of your favorite artist than SoundGarden has to offer.

Came here to try the Audubomb but unfortunately it was sold out! :( my friend and I bought five macarons, and two puddings. 

Salted caramel pudding: PERFECTION. 
Carrot cake Cyrene brûlée: very sweet but still oh so good! 

I can't remember which macarons I fell in love with, but the oolong and lavender one was not good. The rest were fantastic! 

Service was great! Kelly, the server, was very informative and helpful in recommending which ones were best and I thank her for that! 

The place is small but very cute. Walls are chalkboard and have community/neighborhood-items on it. They post pictures of people and quotes. The music, however, is incredibly loud. 

Nonetheless, I would come here frequently if it was on my way.

I love Scout's.  It is a throwback to an old-school style barber shop.  The atmosphere is great and the music selection is always on point, though often unpredictable.  The staff is courteous and professional.

Mandy is absolutely fantastic.  She's been my go-to for my hair and beard needs for more than a year.  She's extremely friendly and professional and always does a great job.  She has given me several styles of haircuts and beard trims and they have always been awesome (though a couple have been a little bit out of my comfort zone, I've always received compliments!!!).  

If you want to try a new barbershop, or if you're looking for a place to get a haircut, give Scout's a shot, and see Mandy if you can!
Great food and depending when you go you might not have to wait and sometimes you might have to wait an hour to sit
One of my favorite places to perform at!!! The vibe, the staff, the people and the band is always on point!!! I enjoyed gracing the stage earlier with some the tightest musician in Indy!!!

Went for late breakfast with my boyfriend with high hopes. We arrived at around 11:35 on a Sunday morning with maybe 3 other tables already seated and eating. We tried ordering several items but each time, the waiter needed to go back to check and we were ultimately informed that the items were unavailable. After about 10 minutes, we were finally able to order eggs benedict, a spinach mushroom omelet, and banana french toast. We ended up having to wait until 12:35-ish to receive our food which caused us to almost miss our train at 1 pm. The food was reasonably priced and tasted good, but the wait certainly was not worth it. If I had 3 hours to spare, I might come back, but otherwise, I would find another place to get some breakfast food.

I would tend to agree with J M.  Now I feel like I should have written my review when I had my experience..... (and I wish this thing would allow NO start to be clicked)

I moved to New Orleans in April of this year and, ONLY because I have a very good friend who is from here and knows all of the best places to go, I listened to him when he raved about getting three of the best pairs of glasses he has ever owned and he got them from this business.  He insisted that the young lady that assists patients with glasses was very thorough, very knowledgeable, and honest in her opinion.  He told me that even if I picked up the most expensive pair of frames in the place, if they were not a good fit for me, she would NOT let me get them without explaining WHY a different frame would be the best choice.

Because I already had my prescription from my eye doctor in North Carolina and just needed to get it filled, I didn't need an appointment.  Because I had just started working at my new job when I moved here, I had to wait until I could comfortably take some time off to go do this.  In September, my friend called Eye Works and asked for the young woman who had impressed HIM so much.  He was told that she was "out of the office" but that she would "be back" later that day. 

What a JOKE that was.  THAT particular young woman LEFT this location earlier this year and after dealing with the rest of the staff and having one lady (who I later found out was the DOCTOR and owner of the place) snidely tell me that she did not care if I had a prescription, it was more than six months old and I needed a new exam if I "expected" to buy glasses from them.  Yes, you read that correctly. 

#1 - my prescription, at the time, was just at FIVE months old.  I had an exam done in the beginning of April of THIS year and moved HERE in the MIDDLE of the month.  I went into this location in September....so, five months.

#2 - IF I EXPECTED TO BUY GLASSES FROM THEM?  No, I expected to be treated with respect being as I was CHOOSING to purchase something from them and had $ to burn on this above what my insurance would have covered.

Needless to say, I stormed out, my friend was very upset that he had been lied to about the person he wanted to help me still being there, and I found somewhere else to go for my services.  And the upside is that when I brought the business cards to my friend, he was ecstatic because the lady that helped me with my glasses at the new place was the VERY person he was trying to get me to see to begin with.  I found EVERYBODY at Eye Works un-professional,  rude and snide.  Sorry J M that I didn't post before - I may have been able to save you the trouble.

This store is so fun! Educational and QUALITY toys for all ages! Also, they have the BEST selection of candy that you can't seem to find many other places! Nicest staff, free gift wrap. Just the cutest little store! Oh, and if you sign up for email, they are very generous with coupons and special events in the store. Love love love!

Absolutely love the food!! I'm a vegan, so burger joints are NOT my thing, but when I heard about this place from a friend, I knew I had to check it out -- and I'm so glad I did!
Their vegan burger was SO delicious! It's really hard to find decent vegan options at restaurants, but Elevation Burger far exceeded my expectations.
My husband (who's a full-on carnivore) loved their trademark Elevation Burger with 2 meat patties, and couldn't get enough of their caramelized onions! It was so great finding a place that catered to us both.
It's even better knowing all of the food is organic and healthy!
Not a bad place to eat out when trying to keep those new year's resolutions ;) definitely going to come back here for another round!
Had an awesome dinner here.  Food was outstanding and service was as well.  New owners made us feel at home.  Mike and Sheila rock.

I stopped by Havertown Pep Boys to make an appointment for an oil change.  Unfortunately they were fully booked for the next two days, but the manager told me to bring in the car in about 30 minutes and he would squeeze me in.  I returned 30 minutes later and got right in.  The staff was polite and efficient and the car was done in about 45 minutes.  Good service and friendly, accommodating staff.

Love this tasting room. You walk in and there is a long bar area which plenty of seating (including a high top by the window). My husband is the whiskey drinker in the relationship but I still love me some distilleries! 

The couple of times we have gone, there was something we both could enjoy (with our vastly different tastes). I love the creativity in their craft cocktails. I don't remember what I ordered on my last visit but remembered trying a pb&j cocktail my husband ordered. Admittedly I wrinkled my nose at the thought but holy cow it was yummy! 

Really cool place to enjoy some cocktails.
Usual Ihop, not busy on Monday morning,  good omelette,  wonderful raspberry pancakes, friendly staff

This is hands down the best and hardest workout I've ever done.  I started because I wanted an effective way to get stronger in less time.  In the beginning, the progress is subtle but you can feel it.  After my second workout, I literally felt stronger.  I'm about to go into my 5th week of 1 x week workouts.  Last night I bowled a 188, my personal best score.  I can't say 100% that it was related to my training but I can say I don't see myself stopping any time soon.  

Also of note is the impressive supplement selection.  The owner Josh is incredibly knowledgeable.  If nutrition interests you at all, this is THE place in town to go!

This is an experience I had months ago and didn't share because I like to support black businesses but some things must be addressed in order to improve. I called and asked what time was closing. The girl replied 10 but said I must come in to place orders after 9. Annoying but no problem, I asked her what tike would the door close and orders stop since I live 20 mins away she replies 9:45. I get there and if you have been here its not in the nicest area so as a female It can be uncomfortable. I get to the door and I am unable to open it. I see a female worker at the desk staring at me as I stand outside with a two creepy men harassing me for my number. She finally proceeds to the door after watching me for a minute (keep in mind it is 9:39 so I still have time) she opens the door but blocks it so I cant come in and says with attitude "were closed" . I say that cant be true I spoke with you on the phone not too long ago and made you aware I was coming and I drove 20 mins to get here , she opens the door all the way reluctantly with attitude. I place my oder and added a cake. My order is finally done but I am so turned off by her attitude and audacity to put the tip jar back out from its hiding place after all of the grief she gave me that I hurry and pay for my food and leave. I get back to my car only to see she never gave me my cake I paid for. I double park and run back in and by the look on the male workers face and hers I saw they were livid and he yells you didn't even lock the dam door back to her. To MY AMAZEMENT IN JUST 2 mins he comes out WRAPPING FOOD FOR TOMORROW ALL WHILE SMOKING A CIGARETTE he is smoking over the FOOD !!!!!!! He is blowing smoke everywhere and disappears once he see I see him. I was APALLLLLLLED. That was the end of my dining here. Ps... Food was very salty and yams almost sent me into a diabetic crisis and Im not even diabetic.

This place gets no stars. When I came in they were rude. No hello..or welcome...just" pick your polish And wait" then one of the ladies doing nails talked on speakerphone for at least 20 minutes while doing a mani. Not only is that really unprofessional but she was so loud. I went there to relax not to hear ppl yack on the phone and be ignored. I ended up leaving after waiting for 20 minutes to even be helped (and they weren't busy).

This is a pretty cool, albeit confusing, venue for Nashville.  My first time there, I almost missed the musician I came to see because I didn't realize the stage area was through an unmarked interior door, and was hanging out in the upper bar area wondering when the damn band was going to go on.  I'm not sure if that is a common mistake or not, but it was a little frustrating.  

12th and Porter to me seems to have a split personality.  When you first walk in there's a large bar with a TV and a lot of open space that I'm assuming is for dancing and socializing.  It's decorated in a trendy club kind of fashion, i.e. clean and minimalistic and contemporary, and they show a lot of cool music videos on the TV, but isn't typically the atmosphere I came there for.  To your left as you come in is an interior door that is usually manned by a scruffy yet friendly doorman.  Once you walk through the door, it is like a totally different place.  

This main room is dark, crowded and loud like you'd expect a rock venue to be.  There's an upper balcony which is really cool, I'm a big fan of interior balconies at venue's, especially ones where you have a good view no matter where you stand.  There's a good sized bar to the right of the stage that serves a good variety of beer and liquor that's a tad bit on the overpriced side, but I think everyone is used to overpriced drinks at clubs by now.  The stage is one of the most put-together ones that I've seen in Nashville.  Their lighting set-up is fantastic, and there are two video screens on either side of the stage that can be utilized by the performer.  I think my favorite show there so far was one of the local band The Protomen.  For those of you unfamiliar, they are an extremely visual band and their performance fit in very well with the venue.

The location of 12th and Porter is its biggest turn off.  It's randomly located down a side street off of 12th Avenue on the corner of Porter (hence the name).  The area is very run down and is pretty sketchy at night.  Parking is a pain, there is a lot right by the venue, but it's small and full of huge pot holes and generally hard to maneuver through.  The last time I went there a random homeless person was directing cars where to park down a slightly scary side street.  I thought it was pretty hilarious, but some people might not find that to be as funny as I.  He seemed to know what he was doing, as the car was still there when we left, scratch and break in free.

I wish more touring bands came here as I'd pick 12th and Porter over Exit/In any day.  Their calendar can be hit or miss (check it out on their Myspace page) with a lot of their acts being unknowns.  They do have writer's nights which are cool, but I still think the End is your best bet for the best shows by bands you've never heard of.

Frusco's is definitely the best part of drinking on Frankford Ave. Many, many times have we left the bars early just because somebody mentioned Frusco's. The dining room is small, sparse and can be pretty filthy, but the steaks and fries are great. Meat is top quality, sliced, not chopped. The cheese sauce is the perfect consistency and the rolls are just right. They're crusty on the outside, soft on the inside. Supposedly, they sell Sarcone's, but every time I thought to ask for one, they didn't have any. Lots of great memories eating here, probably just as many great times when I was too drunk to remember.

Decent spot. Definitely not the best in Nashville as many of the reviewers think. 

It's filled with old men discussing Reaganomics. I can discuss politics and economics with the best of them, but I like to relax when smoking a stick, and the tone of conversation there is never relaxing. 

They have a good beer selection and the staff is  cool. 

They are, however, extremely overpriced. anywhere from $1.50-$5 a stick. 

If I am stuck in the area, I will go to Havana's first. I still prefer Uptowns over all of them.

Food is OK, its not great. Menu is HUGE. Portions are HUGE. Service is absolutely  HORRIBLE!!! The only reason we go is because 2 or 3 times a month they have 50% off your entire check. I mean you can't beat dinner for $10.00 or less.

Over President's weekend, my poor innocent parked car was hit. So sad! I called my insurance company to file a claim (thankfully there was a police report left under my windshield telling me who was responsible!) and they recommended Sterling. 

They came and picked up my car free of charge and towed it, then called a day or two later with the estimate. The damage was much more extensive than I thought! Then, they subsequently called me with regular updates about the status of my vehicle- excellent customer service!

The work was excellent. They even cleaned out the inside of my car (which had not been damaged at all by the accident). My car is good as new!

I wish I could give a 4 1/2 star review- but had to downgrade because the repairs took a few days longer than expected- I was told it would be ready on a Friday the whole time, and then suddenly it was delayed until a Tuesday. If I had needed to rent a car, this would have been a bit of a hardship.

I recommend Sterling without hesitation- they do great work!

Their staff is giving the chicken sandwich place a run for their money in politeness and engaging with customers and the food is fantastic.  Kena said the BLT was perfect and the Bruchi Burger excellent

Stay away from this place , owner can't seem to get people who can do simple things such as add sugar to a coffee , or refund an item charged incorrectly on the bill .they always get my orders wrong and when I ask them to correct it they give you attitude and are very rude . If you use the app for ordering be careful because the store will accept your order and take your money and when you show up they are closed and it's a pain to try to get refunds . This place is gross . Save your self the frustration and go to the one on levick, They have their act together there .

Absolutely beautiful! If you're a fan of architecture and of mosaics, this place is definitely worth seeing!! The entire ceiling is completely covered hundreds of thousands os small tiles that make up ornate designs and beautiful pictures. My husband and I attended a mass there this past Sunday. We had no problem finding parking on the street, which is amazing! The mass was pretty full and we sat near the back and off to the side. I couldn't believe the beautiful art that completely surrounded us on all sides!
Great pizza. Keep in mind if you're trying this place for the first time that they do not have a dining room-carryout or delivery only. I also recommend the fried mushrooms, Italian beef, and wings.

Manos Bakery is fantasic! Their meat pies are delicious. Today I arrived to late they were sold out of the meat pies so I go the spinach and cheese. It was amazing. It will be to hard too choose between them so I will just get one of each from now on, The best is their Bougatsa - Custard Pie. Every bite is a piece of heaven. They have samples you can try first but trust me get the Bougatsa, you will not be disappointed.

This place is pretty well reviewed but I really didn't see it on my one and only visit thus far.  I dined with a group of fellow Yelpers and certainly enjoyed their company even though I didn't love the restaurant.  This place has a lot of reviews so I will keep it brief...3 ups and 3 downs:

+ Great location - there is just so much going on around there all the time.
+ Server was very friendly.
+ Half of the burnt ends ranked among the best I've ever had.

- The other half of the burnt ends were among the worst I've ever had.  So dry that they bordered on beef jerky.
- Really loud, very breezy near the door plus no reservations just doesn't seem like a place I will go out of my way to dine.
- Ribs and chicken wings were both so thoroughly coated in rub that you I couldn't taste the meat.  Very, very salty also.

There are a bunch of bbq places I want to try before I make it back here to see if I have a different experience.  I may give them another shot but it will be awhile.
There are pictures to what I came out too after only being there for 4 hours . I will never go back and I'm telling everyone that I know not to go to nugget Casino Resort in Reno/sparks

Solid Mexican food in West Philly where food options are fairly mediocre.  While this isn't the most authentic, this is a Garces restaurant so you can expect quality... at a price.  The room has a cool layout and it has a younger crowd which is always fun.  Being on the fringe of the university, parking can be a little tough at peak times, but if you're adventurous you shouldn't have an issue a few blocks west or north.

This experience was great! It was my first time having Thai food, and I'm upset that I've waited this long. To start, the venue is super cute. I went during lunch time.  It wasn't very busy so I dined in. The lunch menu was short and sweet. You chose a dish, your choice of chicken, pork, beef, or shrimp, then whether you want mild, medium, or spicy sauce. 

I picked the garlic and pepper option with chicken which included rice and sautéed veggies in my choice of medium sauce. Every lunch choice comes with a broth soup, salad, and pork egg roll. I brought my appetite so I also tried the dumplings. Everything was delicious! The presentation was beautiful. 

If you have a peanut allergy you want to stay away because peanuts were sprinkled in everything. But I've read other reviews that said they have peanut free options. So thats a win! Can't wait to tell my friends about this place.

The establishment has decor befitting for the location and name Mity Nice. Indeed it was nice and clean. The service we received was professional, good and attentive. The serve acknowledged us however also advised us their were ppl in front of us. I had the CAS chicken applewood sausage, egg and cheese sandwich. The sandwich presentation wise was good. The sandwich itself was good but could have been better, had it had more chicken sausage pieces. I had six little pieces spread between two pieces of white bread, eggs w/cheese and some mushrooms. I was so hungry I ate the sandwich before the post. My friend had the Broadway, and he advised it was good. He would have it again. All in all, I will come again and checkout other items on the menu.
Bob molluro and staff have played a huge part in rehabbing me through several surgeries. The professionalism and knowledge in this one office is above par. I wouldnt recommend any other facility.

After delay, after delay, after delay we are now waifing on staff to assist in departure?? I travel frequently for business and this airport is the worst.  Always late and always delayed.  At least they have good shops and restaurants. Better than most.  But American Airlines is the worst. And since they merged with US Airways, they are even worse!!! If you can fly another airline....DO IT!!

I love the delicious possibilities!  Today I got the Matcha Green Tea Blast.  It was creamy and wonderful.  They guy that works mornings is always nice, but not overly so.  Considering I just had oral surgery I probably be back a lot in the coming days.
Excellent food, friendly and attentive service. Large outdoor dining area with plenty of heaters. Can't wait to return.

This is home style cooking at its best, the lamb and garlic is awesome... I recommend to every one who visits
Reno to eat here.  You can't leave with out trying this. Oh yeh, very affordable.

A Bridge Over Troubled Water

"Yes, I'd like to request a late checkout please."
"Absolutely, sir. How much more time did you need?"
"Oh about 50 years."

A breath of fresh hair amidst a smeared canvas of insanity, the Ritz is the place to park your butt if you want a safe, secure, and luxurious buffer zone between you and Bourbon Street, while leaving it completely accessible right down the sidewalk. The room service food is quite good, especially the fried chicken and biscuits. I got a clean, comfortable, well-decorated room with a great view that quickly became home. The club lounge had great service, but they wouldn't bust out some cheese for me in between their timed layouts. It took 3 elevator rides to get to my room due to the complex layout of the hotel, but this can be avoided if you go in the rear entrance.

My boyfriend and I absolutely love Little Nonna's. We recently moved to Philadelphia and this restaurant has easily become one of our favorite places. If you want delicious, quality Italian food in a beautifully intimate restaurant, you should absolutely go here.

Wish I had read the reviews first before taking in my dress.  It's now a faded color of coral instead of the bright coral it was and looks worse then when I dropped it off.  My boyfriend's suit still has the stains on it that were there when we brought it in. DO NOT GO THERE. the cheap cost is not worth them ruining your clothes.

I needed a quick patch for my tire so I decided to try goodyear despite the reviews. When I politely declined to give my address and asked if there was a decline choice I was told that I could go somewhere else and denied service. It is clear to me now why tire kingdom, which was 2 minutes down the street, had a three hour wait and the Goodyear parking lot was empty.

I have been coming here for a while to do my laundry. It is clean, the woman that works there is really kind, and I loooove that they have an affordable wash and fold. I would definitely recommend bringing your laundry here!

Only word i have for this place.. WOW. First off the decor is beautiful, the hostess are friendly, the service is unbelievable and the food came out exceptionally fast. Everything was hot, tasty, and you can tell they care about the food they prepare. Also a tip: order the deep dish cookie for dessert, it's so good. If your in Philadelphia this place is worth eating at. We can't wait to come back

I've only been to a couple Anytime Fitness locations and this one is never too busy, is neat and clean and has updated machines that are easy to navigate and use, no matter what level of fitness you are. They also offer free boot camp twice a week.

Almond Tart
Bread pudding

Not sugary and great taste. We had buy one get the other 50% off as wednesday offer 7 am - 6pm.

The owner and host was very helpful.

This place saved our Saturday night. My mom, wife, and I, went to a Korean restaurant before going here and that restaurant had the worst customer service ever! We left that restaurant,  then we went looking for another restaurant and when we found this place, the customer service was outstanding, the food was amazing, and I have to say this is one of the best Thai places I have ever visited. Thank you Sawasedee for giving my family a great experience, it made up for the horrible experience we had earlier in the night.

We stopped here after work the other day for a little pick-me-up! This was the first time I've been to Step Brother's but my husband had been a few times in years past. 

This place definitely has a divey vibe going on. They have a fair amount of seating available, although most of it is on high bar stools which I am not really a fan of. There is a large couch near the front window, so we ordered our drinks at the bar and then headed to the couch to relax for a bit. 

The bartender was very attentive, and asked us what we would like to order as soon as we sat down at the bar. I ordered a double vodka and redbull, while my husband ordered a pitcher of Stella, so no complaints as far as service or drink options available. They have several TV's playing, with various shows on ranging from sports to news. They didn't have any music going, but it was still early and the folks who were there were chatting amongst themselves. 

What wasn't so great was the serious gnat/fruit fly situation going on. I don't like swatting bugs that are flying around me while I am using the ladies room, or squishing bugs flying around my drink while I am trying to relax at the bar, so I found that aspect of my experience to be quite unpleasant. 

While I'm all about divey/hole-in-the-wall joints, this place wasn't really for me and I don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon.

We drive by The Getaway all the time and it always looks packed! We finally visited last night and loved it. What a great bar - really felt like we were on a tropical vacation. Check it out on my food blog: http://www.floridafoodlover.com/2014/08/fourth-street-shrimp-store-getaway.html

I am writing this review based on three separate visits, with friends suggesting this place for dinner. The atmosphere is lively, great for drinks and chat with friends. The food is okay. Have had better sushi at other places in town (da Joint and Hiroba)...don't expect anything thrilling....the biggest disappointment however is the staff (yes, all three times). They don't offer refills, forget one thing or another...you name it. I understand, they're busy, but as a paying customer, one who is willing to tip 20%+ for great service, this place just doesn't cut it.
