If you're searching for good atmosphere, mediocre food and service, then this is your place.

Too crowded at lunch but great food.  Parking is horrible.  Too many businesses attempting to use one parking lot.  Meridian P&Z you should be ashamed, this area has too many businesses for the allowable parking.

I did not eat much, but what I had was plan old ordinary. Started with the chilled cucumber soup. Bland, watery and boring. Next had the assorted dips with pita and raw veggies (zuchini and red peppers). Hummus and tzitiki were ok, other dip with feta was a bit too rich. Grilled pita slices had good portion but average bread. Wait service nice but not overly working it.  Much prefer Dmitri's, Kanella and Zahav.

Not Up To The Hype

We found that the cheesesteak was overpriced.  The perceived quality of the meat was just not the best, and the portion did not match the roll, or the price.
We did however think that the roll itself, was excellent.

Of all the places in Philly, this place didn't really do it for me. 

We tried two types of Mussels, The provence (eh) and the Red Light (good).  This place was dark, dingy, and our service was mediocre but the beer menu was impressive.  I  went for the Flemish Sour and it was tasty.

Maybe it's a gem in Philly but i've had better food, better service with comparable beer menus at better places.

We love shopping here! You can find just about anything--including individual screws and bolts in every size, and not have to buy a whole pack when you just need one. Staff is friendly. Great hardware store!

This is a must-stop for me every time I come to New Orleans (and I often order from them online when I'm back at home).  It doesn't matter what I am looking for -- some touristy souvenir of being in New Orleans, a sweet treat, or an amazing new toy, they have it all!

The bakery and treat section always leaves me staring because I can never decide what my dogs might like the most. There are so many choices and it doesn't matter if it's Canine King Cakes or peanut butter cup look-a-likes, my dogs always go wild.  

There are all kinds of NOLA inspired goodies -- dog clothes, leashes and collars, stuffed crawfish or gators, bandanas, whatever!  Their Connor the Crawfish (small or large sized) is my dogs' favorite and I have to bring one home every time I stop by.

The staff is always helpful, and if they don't have something you're looking for in the Quarter location, they can check over at Riverwalk to see if there's something there they can put on hold for you.

Great overall experience and I'm always excited to stop there in when I'm in town!

I really like Embassy Suites. The rooms are big and you have both a living room and a separate bedroom. They also have a bar and a separate restaurant downstairs which is very convenient.

The room was perfect and satisfied our needs. We went downstairs and had dinner in the restaurant, everything was very good.

This one is very convenient to the airport and there is a 24 hour shuttle. 

Check-in was very easy and the employee helping us at the front desk was very efficient. I wish I could remember her name.

Our server Nick in the restaurant was very helpful and took very good care of us anticipating our every need.

Overall this was a very good stay.
Love this place! Has been super close to my hotel the past two times I've come to NOLA and super thankful to have a great 24/7 place to pick up another six pack or some French fries.

I bought my "family car" because I was due to have a baby and I wanted something safe to transport him in. Well, thanks to Wholesale Auto I'm scared every time I buckle him in his carseat. The light for the transmission came on the day after I bought it (which means the code had been cleared). So, i took it back down there and after sitting in the waiting room for half an hour a mechanic came back and told me "Well we cleared the code so we'll see if it comes back on." I was blown away. They treated me like I was so stupid that I would think that turning the light off would fix the problem. I decided to take matters into my own hands and took the car in to get a transmission flush...$180 dollars later the light was still on and the shop told me the fluid was BLACK. I felt hopeless but I was so busy HAVING A BABY that I didn't get back to the dealership. They called me 6 months later and I missed the call so I called them back not even 10 minutes later and told them that I needed to talk to them and no response. Finally, I messaged them on Facebook and they called me and had me come down. They looked at it and handed me a quote to get my transmission replaced. I said that I wasn't going to pay it so they told me they could cover the cost of labor and that was it. Like if you think Wholesale Auto should replace the faulty transmission they sold to a pregnant woman. Feel free to share so no one you love gets screwed like I did
UPDATE: They are replacing my transmission with no cost to me !!! The owner called me this morning and told me he's taking care of the problem and he talked to a friend of mine who helped him understand?! Thank you to everyone who supported me to bring attention to this issue and an extra special thank you to whoever Richard talked to last night  Y'all are amazing

Went here for my birthday and dropped serious coin.  The food is great.  This place is over the top expensive, and hyped beyond belief. Your eyes won't roll to the back of your head, but you'll have a terrific, terrific meal and be able to brag to your friends you ate @ Vetri.  Once in a blue moon kind of place to eat.

I had lunch here and enjoyed it. I had #55 chicken curry w jasmine rice. It was good but after seeing the broth bowls I wish I had gotten my usual pho order. This place is packed- they do a great business. Great location near university

Delicious little spot! Lunch time place only so their open hours are very limited. But the food is to die for! Their prices are great for the amount of food you get. Very limited seating so big groups aren't very accommodated.

Had such a good meal - the avgolemono was wonderful, best pastichio we've had in ages, the dolmas are huge and hand made and dee-lish, and just lovely, warm service.  I'm sorry it has taken us so many years to find this place.

In town on business and came across this place right by my hotel. If you want a welcome dive bar with amazing food this is the place. Great atmosphere and the locals were welcoming. Highly recommend and the food was amazing!
I absolutely adore Olivia. The food and drinks are absolutely fantastic. The staff is top notch. They are so attentive no matter how busy the restaurant may seem. Will always be a staple for me!

I'm a regular at this Wendy's.  I always order the crispy chicken sandwich with lettuce, mayonnaise, tomato, onion, & mustard.  I've found that by specifying all my toppings I'm not shorted.  This beats, "add tomato, onion, & mustard" & ensures getting all five.  I also get the $.89 Junior Chocolate Frosted for free, i.e. I bought the '18 KeyTag.

What a great bargain ($1.39); it's consistently tasty, right temperatures, freshly prepared, & the staff never seems to tire of me ordering off of the budget menu (they make a little profit I'd hope with my frequent visits).  One of my few benchmark fast food eateries.

AMAZING! this was a much needed addition to Dunedin. Great acai bowls and recommend anyone in the area to stop by! The lovely ladies behind the counter were so friendly and have mastered the art of smoothie bowls.

Dr. G is the best Urologist I've ever had.  I've had kidney issues since early childhood and Dr. Gruenenfelder is the only Doctor who took the time to figure out all my issues.  She cares deeply and even took the time to assist with my hysterectomy recently because I was nervous about my uterus being fused to my bladder!!  I've been a patient of Dr. G's for 14 years and told her that if she ever moves, that I will have to move with her.  She is worthy of 10 stars!!!!

This place was AMAZING.  The waiter, Mike, was excellent and truly made it an awesome experience.  He answered questions honestly to help me order and based on my taste made a recommendation on the type of steak I would like.  I ordered the bone in ribeye prime and my husband had the dry aged ribeye.  My steak was perfect.  I like my steak well done and this one was done, but still juicy & tender.  My husband doesn't generally like to order steak when we go out, as he likes to cook his own, however he stated that was the best steak he has ever had.  He's still raving about it today which says a lot.

Mike made a Caesar salad table side and it was the best salad I have ever had.  After the salad, Mike brought a sherbet in champagne to cleanse our palate before dinner.  That, too, was pretty amazing.  I simply cannot say how excellent Mike was.  He checked on us often and made conversation with us.  Top notch customer service.  
We actually wanted to go back for dinner tonight (and we may) just to have Mike wait on us again.  Too bad it's his day off today.  If you are lucky enough to get him as a waiter, you're in for a real treat.

Bimini steakhouse is wonderful food, classy atmosphere, and top notch service.

I always come back here for the service! It can't be beat. Alice is amazing. Her attention to detail is crazy. I always feel like they go above and beyond, handing you a water, pulling out your chairs for you, putting on your slippers, giving you a little extra massage at the drying station, and really making sure your nails are dry before helping you with your shoes. Besides all that, the place is spotless and they always use sterilized clippers. Couldn't recommend it enough.  Also if you go before lunch time you almost never have to wait.

Glad to see that she's good at hair based on the other reviews because she gave me the worst mani/pedi I've ever had. She completely cut off my nails and toes down to the skin (no shaping at all - just filing) and there's polish all over my toes around the nails. I would never recommend her for this or go back. She is not a manicurist at all. I was the only person in the salon for over an hr and 1/2 and that didn't include dry time because I left. The equipment is very old and not very clean. There are no employees just the owner. I did have a Groupon which because of how unsatisfied I was, she did not use but she should not be advertising that she does nails.

I was on the work trip alone looking for some local flavor to enjoy while being safe and the ladies behind the bar were off the chain great. The music was awesome, the games I wanted to watch were on and the drinks were cold. I live in a tourist town myself so I get what's going on. Thank you for giving me a wonderful experience.

Saturday, Feb 8th. This isn't my first visit to K&Co Jewelers, and I am overwhelmed at their level of service and kindness.  I went in today (I think my 3rd time now) for some watch batteries and watchband replacement. They are so wonderful and no matter if its a simple fix, they are professional and offer solutions to make their customers happy !!!  I also met their son, Andrew, what a fine young man, very professional, very happy and genuinely sincere. His positive attitude and his knowledge is certainly a great learning from his parents, Richard and Katrina (of course).  About a year ago, purchased an awesome necklace for my husband, and Katrina went out of her way to get us the right one, I'm hoping he wears it more this year !!!  Great selection of anything you need and their prices are very reasonable, give them a try, you'll love the relaxing environment and their genuine interest in whatever you need to purchase, and their service timeline is incredible !!!

Since I've moved to Florida I've been trying to understand the love of the Cuban sandwich ... Today I found out. This sandwich was so delicious! I really wanted to eat the whole thing! But it's huge. Share if you can. I also had the frosted brownie. Also scrumdelicious! The frosting tasted like I made it in my kitchen from scratch. Yum. I can't wait to try more stuff from there. We needed something this good in Ruskin!!

Everything is so good! Thai ribs, red beans and rice, the chicken. The cucumber jalapeño marg, the old fashions!! Sorry no pictures, we are it too quick but everything was good. 

Steak cooked perfectly, crab cakes on point, but best thing is the Thai ribs!!

Macadamia Nut Crusted Chicken.....The BEST ever...wish they would bring this 'trial dish' back SOON!!!  Even though Grillsmith has great food...this tops the list and is NOT a regular item...It would benefit them to put this on the menu permanently!!!  To the CHEF'S and POWERS THAT BE....Please listen!  Thank you!!! :-)

This place is gorgeous, the interior is beautiful. The coffee is great, I just tried the latte with oatmeal milk and it was pretty good. You can come here and study upstairs or just grab a cup of coffee before work. The berry jam cookies are really good.
Woo! Awesome food and fun atmosphere! Sooo glad we tried this place. Everything we had was great (be sure to try their Bloody Mary)

I went here for a quick studying session and to try the highly recommended scones. It was a cute, friendly environment. Not too loud, but it was pretty crowded in the middle of the day. It's not the best place to study. There's limited parking space, which is very hit or miss. I happened to go when there were a few spots open, but soon after I got there they were all full. 

I had a blueberry scone and it was amazing!! Very moist and delicious. Next time I'll definitely try one of their drinks too. Overall I was pleased.

My husband Tony  and I moved to New Orleans 3 weeks ago and had not found an auto shop yet.  The one in California we were loyal to for 25 years!  Anyway, Friday our Toyota Corolla had a problem with the starter motor, and the AAA tow truck driver recommended Pit Stop.  We called and Charmaine was very nice on the phone, but informed us the shop closed at 5PM, so we told her we would see them on Monday....Tony brought the car in Monday at 7:30 AM when Pit Stop opened and Ed met him at the door and said...."Hi, just made coffee....have some."   My husband said that Ed reminded him of our shop guys in California.....friendly, efficient and professional.   The best part of Pit Stop is they give you options, not just a diagnosis.  That's important because it lets the customer have an input before the work is done. On top of doing the work in a timely manner, for the quoted price, a very nice young man by the name of Louis, drove my husband home and picked him up when the car was ready and drove him back to the shop from our home....now THAT is called service.   Our first impression of Pit Stop is that they know that each customer is a potential return customer, or a reference to the next customer so they treat you in a way that will bring you back...Tony said that while he was there a lady came in for some work and said two of her friends had recommended Pit Stop.  So, as far as we are concerned, we have found a auto shop in in New Orleans that we will be happy to be loyal to.
Good service, and tasty food. Menu is small, could use more of a variety but food was good. Live music on Friday evening. Beautiful Patio.

The only thing this company is good for is providing funny stories to my friends on how much this company sucks.  My tracking information said the package was delayed due to external factors, which I was told was because the hub where the package was located was facing weather problems.  I laughed so hard when the operator told me that because I live an hour  from Bristol and the weather was 70 and sunny where I lived, so I called my cousin up in NE Philly, only about 30 minutes from Bristol, and asked if they got 12 feet of snow and I just didn't know.  

What a disaster company.
Sarah. Was extremely sweet and knowledgeable. Welcomed me as I walked in and took care of me right away. Highly recommend them.

Do not stay here. The pictures online do not match the reality of the cleanliness or state of the rooms. I am traveling for work and quickly booked a place close to the office I am visiting. Regret not planning better. 

Cons:
Dust everywhere, moldy ceilings, peeling/bubbling wallpaper, filthy chair, shower drain clogs, some sort of...liquid spilled on the doors - see pics. The AC is full of dust. 

I cancelled the rest of my stay and booked at the Courtyard Marriot, suggest you do the same. 

Pros: pretty lobby, friendly front desk staff.

Next time I go to Reno, I'm definitely going back to The Peppermill, and staying in the jacuzzi suite. It was totally worth the extra money. I enjoyed the amenities at the Peppermill and found the staff to be helpful and friendly. I remember the old Peppermill restaurants (one was in Santa Clara, the other in Cupertino) and was adamant about staying there since I enjoyed the neon at the restaurants when I was a kid. It's a few blocks away from the main vein but I find that better...Atlantis is close by and all the other casinos on the strip suck anyway.

I was thrilled with a recent experience at this brewery and restaurant! We had a large group of ~15 veterans meeting up and selected this location. It was busy, and due to the high ceilings and lots of light, it never felt too crowded. 

You stand in line to order your drinks and then they pour them and hand them over to you. I had no idea they had food here and that was a pleasant surprise. You can order it via the same line as the drinks and they bring the food out to where you are sitting. The pizza was amazing! 

Steven and the rest of the team were extremely nice and we will definitely be back!

Tip: get there early for parking if you are trying to hit happy hour! They had overflow parking onto the side of Virginia St.

Brunch is my favorite meal of the week. I often wish it was acceptable to step out of the office at 11 on a weekday and sit down to a big plate of french toast.  And if it was acceptable, Cafe Lift is where I would go and the cannoli stuffed french toast is what I would eat.

The boyfriend and I only live a few blocks from here, which could have (subconciously) been a big draw to the apartment for me.  We still photograph our meals when we go and look back at those photos reminiscing throughout the remainder of the week.  

Overall, I say you should have already been here.  If not, go, ASAP.
I love these games. Love! I have done a few of them now and I always think they will get old and be predictable but they never are! I can't wait to see what new games they come out with.

I used to love this restaurant, but it went downhill.  I recently ate at the Clearwater location and it was really good, so I thought I would give this another shot.  What a mistake.  I ordered the southwestern bowl with chicken and a brown rice base.  I ate maybe a third of my meal, only because I was ravenous.  It tasted like dirt, and I mean literally. Yuk!  The wait was so long that I went inside to inquire about my food and the cashier handed it to me.  Now I regret tipping!  Don't waste your money!  There are much better options in the area!

Please, DO NOT take your car to this shop!  Just because they are BBB accredited does not mean they are a good business!  They've had 15 complaints since May 2010; 14 of them regarding products and services, 1 of them about the warranties.  There will be a 16th complaint soon, as my husband and I plan to file one ourselves.  A lot of reviews on other sites will tell you a similar tale, except for the ones the company writes posing as customers (you can tell which ones they are because they all sound the same).  They charge a best-quality amount for bare-minimum service.  If I could give them negative stars, I would not hesitate to do so.

In a year and a half, they have:
- Replaced the transmission 3 times, messing up the alignment each time.
- Told us to come get the car and left it behind the gate.
- Threatened to make us pay for services, even though the car has been under warranty.
- Gave our car a flat tire and refused to take ownership of that mistake.
- Had our car for a total of about 6 months since we bought it in 2011.
- Ordered the wrong part.
- Made sexist comments toward me.

Don't go here unless you want to pay more for repairs than your car is worth!

Since I still had that melt from Checker's, I just stopped in on my way home from work to grab a cup of lobster bisque and side of crabmeat salad to complete a quiet dinner in.  The bisque was creamy and savory, and just thick enough so that it would be fantastic as a dip for fresh bread from Corropolese or People's.  I only had toasted Butter Bread courtesy of Sara Lee but it was still delicious.  Seriously, try it.  Heat the soup for a few min while you toast a roll and then enjoy!  It's more savory, healthier, and more flavorful than EVOO or Irish butter.  I didn't actually intend on finishing the entire bowl but it was that good.  The lump crabmeat salad was  creamy and full of actual pieces of crab, not "krab" aka surimi.  I can imagine that it would be fantastic on a toasted, buttered roll.  Alas, father dearest tried a bite and ate the entire container before I even got a second taste.  Next time, I'll remember to get more (and hide some for myself in the fridge).  Service was very friendly and helpful.  I'll have to stop in for lunch since their entrees (and just about everything else) are very nicely priced (less than $10 for fish, starch, and veggie).  And the leftover late-lunch melt?  Only ate about half due to the unintended bisque overindulgence. It just paled in comparison to the soup.

We are over at the Greek festival and decided to find a Greek restaurant to go have dinner at.
It was about 8PM when we arrived and they close at 10 p.m.
I ordered the pastisio and my husband ordered the Gyros, chicken and sausage combination plate.
The portion was huge so we decided to both share his plate. And I would take my pastisio home.
The gyros meat was dry and brittle and it had obviously been carved from the outside that have been probably exposed to heat way too long. Same with the sausages... they were cut and where each piece was cut it was black. And the sausage also very dry. The only thing that wasn't burnt or overheated was the chicken which was very tender juicy and tasty.
I understand it was probably late in the evening but what they should have done was cut the outer meat of the Gyros off dispose of that and cut into the more tender and not overheated parts. 
And as far as the sausage goes, it would been probably better just to fix some new sausage. Instead they chose to use the sausage that have probably been sitting under a heat lamp for hours.
So we filled up on the chicken in the rice and the accompanying vegetables and our salads.
I posted a photo and you can see the black meat strips and sausage and pieces.

I really appreciate the service and honesty from these guys. They are a family iwned business and its an old school type of shop. No frills but they do good work and you can rely in their work. They tell you exactly what you need and don't do the whole "upsell ". They replace and fix what needs tonand that's it. I have a new vehicle now with a service package, but when it expires I will continue to be a client.

Amazing food, solid beer and wine selection, and top notch customer service. These folks are doing everything right. My hubby and I have been here a few times. We've tried about five different menu items and they were all delicious!  We'll definitely keep coming back.
Great place to sell your scrap gold. Best prices of all gold buyers that I have researched. Peter.
Best sushi place in Nash metro thus far! Much more consistent than Peter's, not as pretentious as Virago.  Prices are on the low end, and the nigiri melts in your mouth!

Don't shop here. I counted three associates standing around doing nothing and I needed to check out. They pointed me to the self checkout. I'm sorry I don't shop to self checkout that's what you pay your staff to do. Never shopping here again!!

How you gonna have a sign that says "fitness center" wit a picture of free weights when your gym doesn't have any dern free weights.  I signed up for this place specifically for the boujie lifestyle and the gym was a HUGE part of this. I thought I was going to be thin and BUILT from liftin all them dern free weights. I'm talkin SWOL. But lil ol me goes down to da gym in my LuLu joggers n my athleta crop top n my cute ol pony tail juz ready to lift and what Happens?? They got three cardio machines, a stoopit bike and this dern pully weight dohickey that ain't none of them instagram models showin any quick tips or tutorials on.

DERES A PICTURE OF FREE WEGHTS ON UR SIGN AND NO FREE WEIGHTS IN UR GYM

Also, there's a stoopit pot hole when you pull in the driveway that I hit everyday and da girl below me has 6 cats and doesn't pay a pet fee. Her name is Monica.

Also, I always wannna kick it wit my ladies in da club house n shotgun beers but there's like desks and offices so its weird, and it closes too early

Also, the laundry room has these lil vents on the floor that I cut my feet on, and there's a dryer with out a door with rusty nails hanging out of it. 

The lady wid da packages in da office is nice tho.

Ima give this 2 stars because deres a Dunkin donuts next to it. But I wish dere was an Arby's.

#hope4residencesatglenviewreserve

Finger weg! 

Schimmel im Zimmer! 
Hotelzimmer riechen sehr unangenehm! 
Defekte Klimaanlage die Wasser im Hotelzimmer verliert! (Teppich war den kompletten Aufenthalt klitschnass) 
Unfreundliches und freches Personal!

I just want to say CarSense is the best car dealership ever. I just got my new car yesterday and absolutely love it! Low mileage, clean inside and out. I love my new car. In addition, the customer service is awesome. No pressure by the salesperson to buy a car or any additional services. .. just one smooth transaction.
Specializes in cat care.  Bit on the pricey side of vet services, but stellar staff, and always does well with the crankiest of cats.

I really wanted to like this place since we have such a shortage of good restaurants in the Delco area, but, here is my experience.
The atmosphere was fine, large bar, friendly people, ample dining space.
But the food was a miss.
The crab soup did not have much crab..
The crab stuffed mushrooms and crab cake had shell all throughout - unacceptable!
The peel & eat shrimp was tough. Food was disappointing.
Service was just o.k.
They had a large crowd here, so they are getting the traffic, just hope they can improve on the food.

First, nice things. Happy hour margaritas cannot be beat. Cheap, and they do the trick plus the service has never been anything but awesome. Now my issue is with the food. It stinks, it's too expensive, and it's made myself and countless of my friend sick. 

I guess if you like hanging out on a crowded sidewalk so people can see you while you eat, this place is for you. If you like good mexican food, just go across the street to El Zarape. That place is BANGIN.

I'm in town for a conference for 6 days. Hard a hard time finding decent priced hotel closed to the convention center so this is where I ended up. 

I would really like to give this hotel a better chance but I'm now in my 5th night and they have failed miserably. 

First off I want to recognize the front staff who was very helpful in accommodating our request to put us in a 2 bedroom but could only give us smoking. 

The room: the stench was horrid. I can't fathom why people would smoke inside a room! At any rate the moment I opened the door the whiff of the cigarette smell slapped me on the face! Since I despise the smell of cigarette whether from inside a room and worse...second hand smoke, I went to Target, got some Lysol spray and room deodorizer. I was desperate to mask the horrible smell. 

Housekeeping: I give their housekeeping
staff a whopping 1/2 star. First day, granted I didn't get out of my room til noon...I saw one of the housekeepers as I was leaving and said to her that the room is now empty. I came back late that night and the room was the way I left it. Second day they made the beds but didn't empty the trash and refilled the TP. Third day I finally called the front desk to remind them to plz empty the trash. 4th day I noticed the sink was quite grimy and didn't appear it was cleaned. I wanted to see if they will clean it today. The HK staff failed so miserably. I am quite disgusted to be honest. 

I am a paying customer to a cheap hotel but I have been to some hotels in the same category as this one and got better service.

Definitely not a 3star like Priceline or Expedia describes.

Giving it two stars for the food because it could definitely use improvement.  The corn tacos completely fell apart when I picked them up maybe they need to buy a better brand. I also like that they have vegetarian options since I'm recently pescetarian.  I do like the atmosphere cause the music was really good. Also good location at a gas station since people are stopping there anyways.

Called, needed someone quick and reasonably priced since the home was vacant and just needed a quick clean. I went through yelp app and it automatically connected me with a few cleaning company options. I provided the details of the job and they advised a decent rate. I decided to hire them and they came out within the week. Was done in a few hours and when I checked on the work. They did a great job. Will keep this number for future cleans

If you're looking for fresh fish on your sushi/sashimi, this is the spot! Great service and not commercialized. I am avoiding gluten and Sushi Chef Danno created something for me, how awesome is that?! My husband loves sushi and is very picky where he eats, he said the fish is so fresh.

A few friends and I places an online order for pick up. We got a notification that our order was done at 9:45...it is now 10:15 and we are still sitting waiting for our pickup to be handed to us. While we were waiting for our order, we witnessed the workers smoking Njoys together. None of them were wearing gloves and were touching their phones, smoking devices and biting their nails and then making pizzas, without washing their hands. They also had ear buds in so they couldn't hear us talking to them. Would speak to a manager if one was around.
Since the restaurant was sold, the food has gone down hill. Service is slow. So many good restaurants  on the beach. I would pass on this one.

First time here and all I can say is WOW. All the staff were super helpful, attentive and went above and beyond. Food was awesome, drinks were delish and reasonable.  The place is small but filled with personality. I'll be a happy regular here in the future. Great job!!!

We stopped by about 4:30 on a Saturday as we came by last night and the line outside detoured us. We were seated quickly and ordered a Dunkel Gold and Original Sin Black Widow ( blackberry cider). They were both very good and would order again. I was feeling adventurous and tried the PB and J Burger, it was surprisingly very good. The peanut butter and jelly are stuffed inside the burger and the cheese and bacon are on top. The salty sweet combination was strangely good. We also had Korean short ribs which were ok but not great. 
The PUB sign above the door outside makes it a bit hard to find but once inside you have a true pub feel. The staff is very friendly and attentive. We will be back for another early dinner.

Jeanne sold me a flight over the counter and was not overly friendly.  She was a bit impatient even though there was no one in line behind me.   
This is not what I was told SW was like.  Hopefully this message will  reach a supervisor and they will give her a little bit of training.

My one sentence take: It's not the most delicious food you've ever had, but it may be the most interesting.

The only real options are a $45 four-course meal or a $65 chef tasting meal. While the four-course meal may not seem like much and the portions look small, the dishes are really rich. I have a big appetite and was actually pretty full at the end of everything. I would also say that the desserts are the only more traditional part of the menu, and they were excellent.

Sbraga serves some really interesting combinations of flavors, many of which I'd never even comprehended. Oysters with apple, jalepeno, and caviar; lamb chop with lamb belly and oatmeal; quail with sweetbreads; scallop and pork belly with watermelon and jalepeno; etc. There were no bad dishes that we tried, and I won't really recommend favorites (check that, the miso black cod was our semi-unanimous choice for best dish). What you order should mostly depend on your tastes and how adventurous you're feeling that night.

One disappointment was that the Singapore Sling was taken off the menu. I was really looking forward to trying it. Oh well.

What a hidden gem! Brū offers an array of unique and refreshing brews on tap, including hard cider and seltzer. 

I had visited just once, last year, for a trivia event featuring the Office. It was packed!! During my recent visit on a random Wednesday evening, my group of four had the place to ourselves. 

Ashley hosted our [unofficial] private event with grace and style. She went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed, and kept the bar lit. 

Just as I remembered, there is no food served at this bar but that's what the neighboring G Peppers is for. With their powers combined, Brū and Peppers makes for a great evening in this otherwise sleepy plaza. 

Overall a chill spot to thoroughly enjoy cold brews or grab growlers to go. There is a small porch for outdoor seating but if Ashley's at the bar, you're better off inside.

LATE LUNCH SO WE GOT THE BAR MENU..SAT ON the patio and it was like we were removed from Tucson but we were Here, and it was so amazing. Beautiful one month old hotel I would stay in,  In a second. Do note the Main Fire Dept faces the SW Corner and there could be some big city noise. We had beer, drinks and tacos. They were outstanding and not way out on the prices. Chips & Salsa  were maybe of the best I have had in Tucson in 20 years. We will be back. fun little very cool New place to go in Tucson.Staff was also VERY VERY Nice with excellent service.

I love Dewey's! I can walk to Dewey's from my apartment and while I wait I have a Shock Top and sit around feeling good about the night.  When I go to Dewey's I usually order the exact same thing every time and it never fails to please my pizza cravings. I get a salad to start to get my appetite worked up and then I get an extra cheese pizza.  I love their crust, I love their sauce, I love their cheese.  Really, everything is great about Dewey's.  

I do sometimes get confused when I have one waitress and then another and then another, but I guess that is what makes Dewey's tick.  Sometimes I place a take out order and again...never fails to satisfy!

Very unprofessional and rude. But what more can you expect from a clarion? I'm sure the people who work here realize how crappy this hotel is and that's why they treat people the way they do. Will not be returning and id advise others to do the same. Unbelievable.

I have tried Match.com, Tinder, JDate, Black People Meet...nothing worked. I was resigned to the fact that I would never meet true love...until now. Sometimes you just have to do it the old fashioned way. Go out there, pick out a hot chick, get a drink, and get to know them. Really devour all they have to offer.  

We got here around 8:30pm and the line was way out the door.  It's pretty rare to see a long line at a restaurant at that time of night.  That was a good sign the food was going to be special.  Or Burt Reynolds was signing autographs inside.  

I ordered the large white meal(two breasts, two wings, two sides). I only got the medium heat level since we were heading out to the bars right afterwards and I didn't want an active volcano in my stomach. 
The medium offered a little tingle and a lot of flavor.  Overall it was splendiferous.  Hattie B's fried chicken is my spirit animal. I'm certain it came straight out of Yahweh's kitchen.  

For sides I got fries and pimento mac and cheese.  The mac attack was tremendous.  The fries were well seasoned.

We sat facing the line of people. I could see their eyes fill with terror as they watched me eat like a pig at a trough. I didn't care. I go into a zone when eating great food and it gets wild. 

I'm just going to say that if you don't like this place then I hate you.  Simple as that.

Now if you'll excuse me I'm going to hop in the car and drive back to Nashville.  My bride-to-be is waiting for me.

It's was our favorite restaurant in Boise! You can imagine how it broke our hart to not see kitchen staff with masks covering their mouth and nose.
When we asked if they could wear it, the lady repeated our request but the corresponding answer was "why?"... we said: because else we will leave. That got shrugged off.... heartbreaking but we won't be back there.

Hands down the best taco, tequila/mezcal joint in town!  Pricing is reasonable and service is prompt.  Aiesha served me every time I visited and she's the best!  Well deserving of a promotion and raise. Her attention to detail was notable for the fact that it was busy and she didn't mess my order up and remembered my preferences in subsequent orders.  The one negative is that you should have public WiFi available.  I mean you already are broadcasting the signal. Sharing is
Limited menu I get but the limited quality I don't. Many folks here but we couldn't buy wine by the glass? Food was limited and just ok.

I keep trying to like this place because breakfast all day is usually a really good thing, but I am more disappointed every time. The eggs Benedict aren't even poached, the hollandaise sauce is sour and bland, the avocados were brown, and the hash browns were undercooked. Coffee was not great. Overall I paid way too much for a very disappointing breakfast. Service was ok, waitress was not very friendly but the coffee girl was very attentive.

It's local, it's friendly, and the beer selection is the best in the area.  You get the hang of what to, or not to, order off the pretty versatile menu.  Always safe with the cheesy pasta dishes, nightly specials or asking your server what the big crowd pleasers are.  I'm a fan!

This is the worst apartment.We rent here about 4months.Too loudly and noisy upper stair，Play music and sing around 11pm to 4am，we can not sleep until they stop playing.we have to work，choose this  apartment because rent is cheaper，but terrible for us，can not sleep well .
Great service! My pool tile looks much better than expected.  I won't wait as long to call next time.

This is a late post. We were in Florida for vacation. We went to Clearwater for the day and stopped at Shells on the way back to Orlando. We had a party of 12. We thought it we would have to wait long because it was about 7 pm on Christmas Eve but the friendly wait staff was able to seat us within 15 minutes. The food was delicious and very reasonably priced. The best part of the experience was the wait staff. They were all friendly, courteous, and attentive. My drink glass was never empty and our head server, Roseann, had wonderful customer service skills. She asked us where we were from, she made the kids laugh, and she took the time to make sure we were all taken care of. Would definitely recommend this restaurant!!
I love this place! Smoothies are amazing and the women who work here are so friendly! Also gotta recommend the chicken curry crepe it is fantastic! Definitely somewhere I have to come again!

We really wanted to give a five star review. The food and atmosphere are very good to excellent. Unfortunately, our service left much to be desired. 

Setting: We were a group of 8 adults with some young children who didn't require anything except food from the menu. Our beverage order was about average - half coffees, the rest water (which is self serve from filled containers on the table) with a couple other beverages (fresh pressed juice, etc.) 

Atmosphere: Beautiful setting that is modern and eclectic. Everything was clean. 

Service: We has a group reservation at 10:30 on a Saturday morning. We weren't seated til almost 11:15 due to another party being at the table we were supposed to have. I understand it isn't always possible to honor your reservation times, but 45 minutes late is a bit much. Finally, we scouted out the area and proposed a solution to the host, which was quickly accommodated. Our waitress was not particularly friendly with her greeting nor well equipped to offer suggestions from the menu. When our food was brought to the table, the runner asked whose dish he had, but had put multiple side dishes together, which no one ordered. His response wasn't to split them up and see who had them, rather "Well I'll sit them in the middle of the table and you all can figure it out ourselves," which was not in a very friendly tone. I know working Saturday morning brunch isn't the best, but showing a little enthusiasm and hospitality to your patrons goes a long way for us. As soon as we had paid our bill, our waitress was refilling the flatware buckets and then sat them in front of us (not placed back to the middle of the table), which felt like a not-so-subtle hint for us to leave. 

Food: Very good. Portions are appropriate - not too small, not too large. Well seasoned and fresh ingredients that complemented each other well. Good variety of menu options without being overwhelming. 

Overall: 3/5
Always good and service is consistent.  We always come and leave Happy! Price is fair, excellent fries.  What else can you ask for?
Just walked out after sitting at the bar and being blatantly ignored for 15 min. Wasn't busy. Won't be back.

We had friends in town that were staying overnight downtown. Quick! What's a good place for good drinks & food within walking distance? This was the first place that came to mind. 

The guys ordered Manhattans. The girls ordered wine & my favorite: the French 75. They always get this right. 

We introduced them to the shrimp cocktail, of course. Anything we can do to help fight off winter sinus irritation. It was the right about of horseradish & sauce. I wonder why they only give you four shrimp?? 

Steaks were done to perfection & the mashed potatoes were so good that the rightful owner didn't wanna share. I went with the prime rib sandwich which was big enough to have some leftover for lunch. I'm glad they lived up to the top 25 ranking for our friends.

This is not good steak. 
Service isn't where it should be either.

Food doesn't seem to be appetizing here anymore.
Very mediocre.

6/28/19
I've been trying to come to Knead every couple weeks because I absolutely love this place and its people. Their staff are top-notch and genuinely friendly. Yesterday's meal was on-point! I got to try a salad I hadn't gotten a chance to try before (I get stuck on my favorites here sometimes!) and it was incredible! The Wedge Salad was so light yet flavorful with an oil dressing, and the cured tea egg was perfect! Such a flavorful cooked egg white, and the yolk was cooked to perfection with the perfect golden jell texture. I was in heaven sitting at the table savoring each bite and probably looking like a lunatic with my facial expressions of pure bliss. The sourdough that came with my Carrot Dill Soup was still steaming as I tore it apart to dip in the savory orange soup. It was just another perfect meal! Thanks so much to Knead and their team! You all do such excellent work!

Purchased a membership at my wife's urging. A friend has a membership and took her shopping once, just enough to get her hooked.

Good prices on bulk items. Quality foods but you get what you pay for. Seems like their baked good prices are high. We like their ground beef burger patties, Members Mark chicken breast packs, and their huge containers of potato salad. 

They have lots of employees dishing out free samples. 

They have gas pumps outside for members, a few cents cheaper than anywhere else, but I believe it's debit only, they don't take cash or credit.

They also have extended hours (earlier) for enhanced club members. Yes you pay more for it.

Their website does not accurately show store stock. What you see in the store isn't always on the website and vice versa.

Their sister store in the same parking lot, Wal Mart, has similar or better pricing on some items. 

Will try it for a year and see if it is worth renewing.

I ordered and had to get it delivered but when I wrote instructions to go to my back door they didn't do it they came to my front door anyway!!! I live in a highly monitored apartment complex and wanted some privacy to get my delivery I guess that was too much to ask or too hard to understand?? Idk? Lol

I'm so glad we decided to stop in, the restaurant was very busy, but, service was phenomenal and prompt. We end up sitting at the bar, having Italian margaritas which were to die for and the seared yellowfin tuna appetizer was out of this world delicious! Will be back!

Just finished my 70 mile move with Centurion movers. Probably the best experience with movers I have had hands down. They were quick, easy to communicate with, accommodated having to make a stop at our storage unit. Price was very reasonable and fair. Only issue was that the truck was very large and wasn't easy to maneuver around the tiny south Philly streets but that is not the fault of the movers. If you are located in center city just make sure to move as many cars from your block as possible.

We braved Bourbon on a Friday night to return to a favorite of my partner's, Galatoire's.  I hadn't been there in years, myself.  I donned a jacket and sat down...  regarding ambience and comfort, we had excellent service overall (but had to request bread plates), but the background noise was deafening... we had to shout to each other to be heard.  

My sweetie wanted Crab Yvonne (her namesake)...  we were told that crab was "out of season" and unavailable, so we would have to substitute crawfish or shrimp. (We knew better from other area restaurants, but didn't argue.)  She went with an etouffee, it was competent but dull, not bright in its flavors or presentation. My gratinee seemed too grittily panko-ed on top. 

Her salad was likewise OK but seemed like it had been sitting for awhile.  My duck gumbo was spiced tastily but it was a small cup.  And the overwhelming noise in the first-floor main dining room impaired our enjoyment significantly.  

For the pricing and its reputation, it was an overall disappointment.  And if I ever return I will be sure to refuse a first-floor seating, only the second floor.

Westshore plaza is such a good mall. I like it better . They have pf Chang's, Mitchell fish market, maggiano's etc. Those are some of my favorite places to eat.

Westshore Plaza is a nice, clean Mall but is smaller then some of the other's in the county. The layout is a circle which makes it an easy mall to walk. You don't have to turn around and walk back!

Because it is far from where I live, I honestly only come here for the great (AWESOME) dinning options that you won't find elsewhere in Tampa. 

When I do come, I always enjoy being here.

Parking spot is little difficult to find. Also, they have lot of shopping options if you are not looking for high end brands.

Came by to grab some food at the drive through- I'm from out of town- and this person is a rude @ss racist worker!!! Telling me she don't understand what I'm saying! Freaken racist! She obviously don't wanna work! Horrible service!

The restaurant is great, but the wine cellar in the basement is even better. We love the unique tapas menu and the vibe. The servers Wesley and Henry are always on point, making sure our experience is what it should be. If you're looking for wine and amazing tapas, check out the wine cellar!

Having recently moved to Tampa, I've been looking for a traditional Japanese restaurant and I think I have found it.  The food and service are excellent.  The ambiance is great, with Japanese pop music playing and nicely decorated with traditional lanterns, anime comic book pages and traditional art.  There are happy specials even on the weekends, which makes it very popular on a Saturday evening. Will definitely be returning soon!

OK, so this is not about Starbucks coffee or lattes. This is about service...quality or lack thereof.  I am a past Starbucks employee so I do have higher standards, but I do believe that if I spend $700/year in Starbucks and a significant portion of it at this store, I want more for my money. This store inevitably gets my drink wrong once a month (at least). They are slow through the drive through and they do not offer the "experience" or "third place" that Starbucks boasts. They generally aren't very friendly and are ALWAYS (no matter what time of day it is) behind in orders, where it seems they only make drinks off one machine.  I wish that they would take note of these issues and correct them. I know it's a smaller store, but that doesn't mean that there are less customers.

As far as parking, forget it.  It's near impossible to find and getting in and out is somewhat difficult since the redesign of the roundabout at Keystone Parkway.

I love me some Starbucks but I only stop here if I "HAVE" to.

Yes, I know - 1st world problems.

I went several times to get my hair trimmed here and this place is very clean with a comfortable atmosphere. Thu was very friendly and personally trimmed my hair according to my face structure. I LOVED THE RESULT!! I definitely recommend her salon and I don't mind traveling from Kenner at all, I'd come back.

Best gelato I've ever had in the States. The flavors don't stop. I'll have to admit, I've skipped over one of their locations just to visit another to get some different flavors. On the most recent visit I had sea salt and pistachio. I loved eating right along the border of the two flavors to get a little salted nut goodness. Delicious!!!!!

I wish I could give a zero star.  Worst customer service with Katie at the main office. I was forced to use this company because of my home warranty plan, American Home Shield.  I had stoppage in the bathroom sink, Joe came out, ran the water, and said their was nothing he could do because there wasn't a complete stoppage.  He suggested that there may be built up in the main sewer line and said he had to come back another time pending approval from the warranty company. This first visit took a total of 5 minutes and he did nothing!!!
During the follow up appointment, the draining was still slow. He decided to actually do some work and remove the drain trap. He removed some hair and the sink started draining well.  
After Joe left my house, Third Generation Plumbing, Katie calls me and said she has to charge me another service fee.  This is outrageous, Joe did nothing the first visit and now they want to charge another fee!!!! He should have checked the drain during the first visit.  He did nothing the first visit! Wasted my time with a second appointment!!! and Now wants me to pay a second fee!!! Stay away from these people!!!

Such an adorable society hill coffee shop! The cappuccinos are delicious and the barista was very fun. I stumbled on here by chance while doing some bike couriering and I definitely plan on coming back here with my laptop to work.

Extremely slow service. Friendly staff but overall a poor experience... I'm sad to say I wasted over 2 hours of my night here.

I'm really not a fan of the food here, so I can't say it was worth the wait either. If we didn't have a gift card to use, we would have jetted out after waiting 30 minutes for the unimpressive cocktails.

I've lived close to this place for years but tried for first time today - ordered delivery. I was extremely disappointed and will never order from here again. Ordered Moo Shu. The quantity was less than 1/2 what I've had in restaurants. Would have made 2 roll-ups. The pancakes were so tough, I couldn't eat through one. (So much for my dream of chowing down on these. I ate one.) We also ordered Chicken Lo Mein. It is the worst I have ever eaten - old tasting. spaghetti noodles (not rice or linguini-type), veggies overcooked and gray (although the delivery was fast). Also, the crab rangoon were not good - the wraps were overcooked, dark and chewy.  I paid extra for sweet and sour sauce that had a hit of ketchup or bbq sauce - something recognizable to those things. Again, very little quantity. My meals plus delivery cost me over $40 bucks. If I would have ordered from a couple of spots closer to my home - for the amount of these dishes, I would have paid $22 - $25 bucks. Save your dough and order elsewhere.

In spite of the reviews here, I decided to stop in there one weekday with the kids.  It was hot outside and the park just wasn't an option. I decided to purchase 2 $10 cards which gave us access for the buffet.  It was lunch time and the kids needed to get fed anyway.  The food wasn't horrible for what it was. The kids loved it.  It reminded us of Circus Circus in Las Vegas (which is where we're from). There was a carousel, bumper cars, go carts, video games, etc.... Basically, a kid's dream. The only downside was that everything was pretty run down.  There were a bunch of games that were out of order.  There were some sections that were closed and the entire place was pretty filthy. I think it they put a little more care into the place and maintained all their machines, that they'd probably do much better and get more business. Overall, it works for me and the kids. Just remember to bring some hand sanitizer and you'll be ok.

For years, I belonged to X-Treme gym on S. Howard, but I eventually got fed up with its $50-plus per month fee, and it changed management that was not as good, as well. So, I needed a new gym. This basic chain offers $10 mo for everything I need, which is free weights, some machines and the occasional cardio. I do not need, or want to pay for, classes, boxing, cycling, tanning and a fancy locker-room. This place has anything a true fitness fiend really needs.
I like the green and purple decor. It's always clean, and the music soundtrack is fine. If you need a lot of bells and whistles, look elsewhere. I usually go in late afternoons, and it's never too busy. Now, if you go on Monday nights, you might face a little crowd since that's when all the once-a-week workout people seem to show up to try to work off their weekends. The location, in a sketchy strip-mall with few other tenants, leaves a little to be desired, but that's not too important. I don't bother with the Lime card for $20 mo, which gets you into other locations. Don't need it, though they are always trying to push it.
My only complaint is it sometimes takes them weeks, if not months, to repair broken equipment. That should be done a lot faster.

I mostly appreciate the zucchini and cauliflower noodle options for any and all dishes. I have a gluten intolerance and generally try to stay away from grains. I only tried this place because I needed food delivered because I was confined to my apartment after surgery. The doordash method is not the speediest but it got the job done. 

1. Be careful when ordering meals with meat in them.. i chose 'no meat' bc i thought it came with the meal. but after choosing that, i got a spag (cauliflower penne) & meatballs with no meatballs :( 
2. The 2nd night in a row we ordered it was a TOTAL disaster because of doordash. Once we got in touch with Noodles & Company instead, they apologized up and down, made it right, and comped our next meals. Unfortunately for them we were HANGRY by the 3rd attempt of delivery. Our first driver got a flat tire + doordash claimed to place the order again but never did. We went back after this because of how noodles & co handled it. And we will continue to go back. 
3. *most importantly* i have not found anywhere in Boise that has this kind of variety/substitution + is fast and decent. I love it for a quick, easy, + guiltless option.

*ordered from here via grubhub*

Would give 0/5 just for terrible service. Don't even know how the food tasted because I recieved it cold, and had already started to cook my own food. Was working on a resolution with grubhub when the restaurant called and told me to "NOT MAKE A BIG DEAL OUT OF IT"??? What kind of service is this?? Blatantly disrespectful

Seriously fun. The owner & creator, Matt, is such a fun person to be around and his business shines in New Orleans. If you get a chance, book a trip on the brew bus or join him during a Tailgate party for LSU & Saints season!

As a native New Yorker but New Orleans transplant, I can say that this is some of the best pizza that I have had since leaving New York. It is simple, fresh, and totally delicious. I had the white pizza, being a vegetarian, while my boyfriend had one with pork on it, I believe. My pizza was fabulous and big enough to take home left overs. My boyfriend ate his in its entirety! The wine and beer selection was great and the happy hour deal is something that you can't ignore. I just booked our second reservation for later this week because we enjoyed it so much. While the normal menu selections look rather delicious, they are a bit pricey but, I am sure they are just as wonderful as their pizza. Happy Hour here is a must!

Based on the decent reviews we decided to give this place a try. We needed a hotel to stay at for our weekend at six flags. One of my biggest pet peeves with hotels is cleanliness and this one wasn't too clean, at least in our room. There were different types of hairs on the bathroom floor, bathroom counter, in the bed, and the ice container . The shower just didn't look like you wanted to stay in there too long. There were stains on the ceiling. I talked to the guy at the front and they didn't even offer to clean the room and they were fully booked. He did give us a full refund and we left that same night. We won't be back.

While it was a very festive looking place, with a large outdoor patio, once we were seated (which was fairly quickly) we were roundly ignored.

I had to finally wave over a waitress to take our order, which she did though she said she wasn't ours,   We were then further ignored as we watched other people being given bread and olive oil.

The bruschetta was generous but not inspired.  Lots of fresh tomatoes in olive oil with some marinated artichoke hearts and a pair of green olives... yet it was lacking something, more spices or garlic...

Our dinners were mixed.  The lasagna was quite good and the angel hair pomedoro was a huge hit with our daughter, but the calzone (which looked like a monstrous ravioli!) was met with a major lack of enthusiasm.  Particularly the sauce, which was very little removed from plain, unseasoned tomato sauce and was described as "the sum of its parts" by my wife.

Service continued to be a problem, and when desert was brought, I was never offered a refill on coffee.

While it was not a bad  meal, we wouldn't return as we have had far better Italian meals elsewhere.

Ah well...

We were lured in by the clever name and the fact that they were open till 3 AM for cookie delivery. The cookies were the normal size of a bakery type cookie. The night we went in, the flavors available were chocolate chunk, double chocolate chunk, mint chip, peanut butter chip, snickerdoodle, sugar, white chocolate macadamia, and oatmeal raisin. The specialty cookies were even larger but for more money. There were only three kinds which were another larger chocolate chunk, S'mores, and peanut butter cup. Husband and I picked up three regular to split just to try them. We got the chocolate chunk, the double chocolate chunk, and the peanut butter chip. They were good cookies. There really wasn't anything gourmet about them but if you have a craving for cookies and don't feel like making them yourself they're perfect for just that. They also sell small bottles of milk, if that is your thing, to have cookies with milk. The staff member running the register was nice.
Good but not great. The food was good but not awesome. I had the scallop appetizer and pumpkin soup which were good but my husband had a steak special that was 40 dollars but not worth the price tag.

This is always a must do for me when I am in town. I sit at the bar, enjoy the view with a beer or wine and feast on the freshest seafood around. I like the casual bar atmosphere coupled with quality food n drink at the end of the pier. The walk is always beautiful getting here anytime of day or at sunset.

This is by far the cleanest international grocery that I have visited. They appeared to be renovating/expanding during my visit. Each shelf was immaculate. 

I was on a quest for rice noodles, which they did not carry. They specialize in ingredients for middle eastern and Indian foods (but not Asian). I was excited to find semolina flour for making pasta at a great price. 

They also have a vast selection of beans, rice and flours.  I picked up some fava beans. There is a large meat counter at the back of the store with fresh meat. They also carry an assortment of fresh breads. 

Tons of fresh dates greet you at the check out. The staff is super friendly and efficient. 

The store is located on the south side of 38th Street in an older strip mall. There is plenty of parking. 

I'll be back.

Cool place! Intimate but with a cool vibe!

Waiter was very knowledge about their menu and very helpful overall. Cocktails were tasty even if a little on the sweet side. They were busy but the wait was not too long.
I would definitely go back for more!

I appreciate Jamba Juice for their nutritious alternatives to quick service restaurants, especially when zipping through the airport. I wish they had more organic options here, although they definitely have a healthy selection of delicious ingredients. It's definitely an expensive but worthwhile treat.
We ordered a cheesesteak. It was passable as edible - but it was a sloppy greasy mess. Take some time and try to actually care when you are cooking something please.

Very hard workers. I've done the exterior car wash and it gets my car looking sparkly and clean every time. They have a $9 or $12 option. The reason I gave 4 stars is because there have been a few times when I come out of the wash and no one was there to put my antenna back on or take the tape off the rear window wiper. Besides that excellent service!

Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.... we LOVE this place. We walked in on a whim as we were waiting for friends before our dinner. There is outdoor seating which people tended to gather at. It was a nice night but we wanted to check out the inside. 

It is dark and clean, 2 nice tv's above the bar. Lots of seating at the bar. Semi comfortable stools. Bartender greeted us quickly and poured our beer. She was friendly and delivered our drinks quickly. 

As we sipped our beer we looked around. An eclectic bunch of decor, it is not sure what it is trying to be, but this place has more character than the 'irish' place down the way. Well done Skips, without trying even! 

The one downer was no bag hooks under the bar. I don't like setting my bag on the floor and I don't like setting it on another chair in case a patron comes in and wants to have a seat. Minor negative and a quick fix. 

They have a jukebox which has an old school list of songs. Cheap (25 cents per song). Unfortunately our friends arrived early and they were 'starving' so we had to leave to eat. We would have rather of had another beer and enjoyed our music for a bit. They asked us 'why are you sitting inside. It is nice out, we would rather be out there." Ok, well, fair enough but this place has character and all of the rif raf is out there. There were minimal seats open and there were several dogs sitting in the way of getting to those empty seats. 

Obviously, dog friendly. LOVE the dogs but sometimes the owners of said dogs make it impossible to enjoy outdoor seating. Not the bars fault. 

They have t-shirts for sale, $15 and $20 for a long sleeve. Full bar. Clean. Easy in and out.

Good quality and fair prices for hardwoods. I found some wonderful birds eye maple with lots of figuring. Perfect for a box I have in mind. My only wish is that they sold some boards that have not been faced all around.

Sandwiches there are always good. Can't go wrong by eating here.  It gets pretty busy at lunch time so plan on 15 minutes or so to get your sandwich.  Sandwiches are reasonably priced, drinks and sides are a little high otherwise I'd give them 5 stars.
This is a great car wash. They do an excellent job and really work to make sure the car is clean and just don't go through the motions.

My boyfriend and I came here for a delicious meal on a Thursday night. We ordered shrimp cocktail and crab cake to start and we each had a petite filet for dinner. The seafood was excellent and the steak was cooked perfectly to order. I especially enjoyed the peppercorn sauce. Everything was great! The service was prompt and everyone was extremely friendly. I would definitely return here and I would recommend this place to anyone.

I love honey grow, especially the one in KOP. This honeygrow I keep having issues with. Not only once but twice have they given my order to someone else (They did not have the same name as me). Lastly, I ordered a door dash from Honey grow and they gave me undercooked noodles..it was disgusting and they were all stuck together. We called and they blamed doordash. Again, I love honey grow but this place isn't getting my best review.
OMG Where do I begin?  The filet was sublime. Never have I loved a brussels sprout so much. The Chardonnay... like butta. And the bread pudding??  OMG. This is a must!!

This is one of the first places I bookmarked when I first moved here a few years ago. Yet I waited till recently to visit and now I'm kicking myself for that. 
This place was awesome!

I tend to avoid going downtown as parking can be difficult. However, we were able to find parking in the parking garage just down the street (4 min walk away). Plus it helped later for walking off the food we would soon enjoy. 

We started with the 'Glory Curds' and Shrimp. The curds were amazing. Crunchy and crispy on the outside, gooey and cheesy goodness on the inside. Large curds, small curds, all delicious. The shrimp was also very flavorful. Crispy and went really well with the spicy dipping sauce they came with (the curds also went well with the spicy shrimp sauce just FYI). 

For dinner we enjoyed a couple of Hub burgers and my wife got the NY strip. The burgers and steak were perfectly cooked to our liking. Nothing over done and everything juicy. The burgers had pastrami, Swiss and coleslaw. All the flavors paired very well together. Criticism about the burger: the coleslaw was a bit too juicy and made the bottom bun way too soggy. Almost falling apart. I really did enjoy the slaw but maybe less juices? Something to combat the soggy bun would help. Otherwise it was delicious. The tater tots and fries were very good too. Pretty big portions all around!

We ended the meal with their ice cream. I went with a scoop of blackberry and a scoop of the lavender & honey. Both were refreshing and creamy. The blackberry could have used a bit more blackberry flavor in my opinion. The lavender and honey was unique and worth a try! My wife went with the oatmeal cookie batter (I believe) and that was very very tasty. 

The staff were very friendly and considerate. Everything was clean and tidy and the dining area was well decorated. The staff didn't wear masks, maybe due to some restrictions relaxing but worth a mention for those wondering. 

Overall a great experience and we will be back for more. Enjoy!

We took our 3 year old to the car racing/bouncy house part. She had so much fun!  It's an indoor little race track I think they do ages 2-6 for the card. $10 for one kid and $15 for two. Not sure on time limit but they let us go as long as we wanted. The best part about this place is that it is CLEAN. Not nasty like chuck y cheese! I had no idea this little gem was hidden here. We will be back for sure!

The food was delicious! its absolutely worth the visit .  I honestly googled best brunch place in Philly , this was one of the location that popped up .
I came  to this restaurant on a  Saturday for brunch . straight from the airport around 11:20am It was a 20 min wait to be seated so around that time we was looking for parking , founding parking isn't that difficult or easy but you can found it .  I eventually parked on Spring garden a  block away from broad street , paid a meter with quarters and you may can found free street parking if you drive around.
Now let's begin with my visit .
The atmosphere is a lil twist of New York feel like Brooklyn vibe  , its not small but it do free coldest a  tight space ,and extremely loud with a lot of people talking sounded like a cafeteria in high school if you can imagine the scene . So intimate conversation with your guest is somewhat impossible. That's my only con about the location founding parking, the size of the place, also only one bathroom (unisex male & female share ) The service was awesome 5 stars for sure .

The food was so delicious . I ordered the Lemon pancakes , Turkey bacon well-done and eggs Toast bread and  potatoes , for my drink peppermint tea . My Partner order blueberry almond French toast which looked good so mouth watering , my opinion food critic dream dish . 
My pancakes didn't need any syrup it was just delicious to eat the way they were . 
I will be back soon;)

Great place to order Food, hubby loved their chicken Wings, we also loved their food, stuff are always very nice to us. Pizzas are always very fresh and good. We love their new Remodel is lovely and cozy

First time being here. Nice atmosphere and the waiter was really nice and attentive. Came here with my sister ordered black and gold roll (because of the reviews I saw) and miso soup. The miso soup was great, loved the tofu. My sister got a complimentary clear soup with her order and also ordered smoked salmon and St Charles roll. All rolls were good. Presentation was excellent but kinda pricey. 8 pieces for $12.00.Will come again!

I literally created a Yelp account to say how terrible this place is.  Worst service I have ever had in my life.  30 minutes just to get bread and 50 to bring out 2 salads and a soup.  We ordered a Bloomin Onion for an app and it never came out then when our food finally came the server said they were out, but he waited until the food was out to tell us?  Not to mention he said our onion would be out in "just a second" when we got our bread.  I don't care that they're out those things happen but he obviously didn't put in our order otherwise he would've known that earlier.  Didn't fill up my lemonade once and we only saw this waiter three times in an hour and 10 minutes. Please save yourself some time and don't go here. They made me rate this place 1 Star to leave the review but it's truly not worth going.  Guy gave us a free desert ticket for all the trouble when there was no way I should've paid for that meal.  When I went to pay he put the mashed potatoes on the check but never brought them out with our meals.  Truly insane people please this is a public service announcement don't go there!  Shut this place down and give me back an hour and a half of my life for literally 2 salads and a soup.  I'll never do another food review again but I had to let someone know because felt so disrespected by this establishment and it changed my mood solely by my experience. Thanks for reading this all the way through if you did and have a good day anywhere but in that restaurant.

Super cute place located on Machester that I have been waiting to try! We got two waffles to share- one sweet and one savoury and they were both delicious. We got the Goat in the Grove (goat cheese, avocado, eggs) and the Nutella and Strawberry and they were both great choices. The service was fine but we checked in on Yelp and got a 20% off but they did not honor this for us because they said it was meant to be for the week before (only on 08/24/2019). I feel like they should have honoured this discount or just take it down but this wasn't worth fighting over.

Black Rabbit Meads is the newest addition to the Reno Brewery District on 4th and has been our new go-to place in Reno. We've been 3x since it opened last month and I've been shouting from the roof tops about how much I love this place because it's so so yummy. It also happens to be Nevada's first ever meadery. Pretty cool. 

Mead is a honey-wine and tends to taste like a mix of beer, wine, and cider all in one. The meads at Black Rabbit are cider-style and are made with honey sourced from the Sierra Nevadas. They're currently serving four meads: Church of Roger, Hawaiian Ember, Song of Rasputin, and 3 Headed Rabbit. A tasting of four (any combo) is $10 and is well worth it. So far my favorites are the Church of Roger and the Hawaiian Ember; I typically get two of each of these in my tasting because I enjoy them that much. And while it would make more sense for me to order a glass of my favorite, I still prefer the opportunity to enjoy several different flavors in smaller tasting sizes. Really looking forward to visiting often and trying out new meads as they're released!

The service was great.
The food was phenomenal.
The atmosphere was cheery except for the ostentatiously large, angry drunk man who screamed, "I'm going to punch you in the face."
Gyros are a must. 
5/5 stars. Highly recommended.

No idea why this place is only rated 3 stars. I stopped in for lunch one day, and it was extremely busy. However, the service was great, and you get served green tea before you meal (which tasted amazing on a cold snowy day). I had the chicken and broccoli, and it was the best. Hands down my favorite Chinese restaurant in Philly, or possibly anywhere else.

Great little joint. Had the duck waffle with mashed sweet potatoes -it was as good as it sounds. Also had the best Pimm's Cup ever at the bar while we waited. A bit of a drive, but you get to experience the real NOLA. Highly recommended.

Excellent coffee house with sandwiches and salads from Joe Fassi's Sausage Factory and wonderful desserts, coffee selection and smoothies. Prices are cheaper for most things than on the pass around laminated menu 

Venue is intimate and features a lot of local musicians. According to a sign, they serve beer and wine

This is an okay poke place if you're looking for Asian style poke rather than Hawaiian style. The "ponzu sauce" on my fish was basically sushi rice seasoning and the fish was not marinated with the sauce then put on the rice like authentic places. The service was okay as well and the serving size is less than I'm used to from poke places with the same price. The fish and ingredients were fresh but I probably won't be back again.

TLDR - If you're looking for hot wings this is not your place.  If you're looking for various sweet sauces then this place might just be what you're looking for.

I was visiting the area for business when I decided to stop in here based on the reviews of other yelpers.  After asking the waitress about the nuclear wings I decided to give them a go.  The wings themselves were nice and plump and cooked very well.  The sauce, however, was not what I expected.  A sauce described as franks xhot with added hot sauce concentrate sounded just like what I wanted.  The sauce I got was sweet.  So sweet that it barely had a kick at all.  Nuclear, I think not.  I ended up swabbing the sauce off the wings because it was so sweet.

This is my favorite Flowers Shop. I use there service almost 20 years. Always fresh and gorgeuse flowers arengements . Good location and open hours. They do delivery on time even if I ordered same day.

Loved the food, loved the company I was with, loved the drinks, loved the staff.   I had never heard of JCS before and COULD NOT BELIEVE it was a chain!  The hot, spicy and plentiful Steampots are to die for.

to. DIE.  for.    



Twice.



These are some crabs you don't ever want to get rid of...  (ummm..not that I know from experience... I'm just saying...")
   
The restaurant decor is cute, super kitschy & fun. Great for families, laid back/down-to-earth dates, and groups.  

I highly recommend getting crabs from Joe.  He's a good guy.  Don't judge.

This place has pretty good food, I got the Juicy Lucy burger and it was tender and filled with cheese! The waffle fries are pretty good and we also had the cheese curds which were AMAZING! I'm a ranch lover and the ranch was a little vinegary for my liking but still ok. The service was pretty lousy, I wasn't impressed with the friendliness of ANY of their servers. Our server took forever to bring out extra ranch after he made sure that we knew there was a charge for it. One from our group ordered a cheesecake and it took almost 10 minutes to come out to our table. Overall it wasn't a bad experience but it also didn't stand out in my opinion. I made sure they knew to split the check as we all needed to pay separately and it kinda seemed like it was an inconvenience for the server. The cheesecake wasn't bad but it was pretty frozen in the middle and just didn't taste fresh. One good thing was the music that was playing while we were there. It was nice to try something new but I probably will not be back. I'm sure the servers name was fake but the receipt said Sabrino. All in all the food was average and the service wasn't good.
Best restaurant in our visit to New Orleans. Every meal was so tasty and paired well with your drink of choice. I had a whiskey flight which went well with my Cochon (pork) dinner.

Nashville has to have one of the worst Driver Services Centers I have ever been to. For a big city they have only two centers that will do full services if you are a new resident and need to transfer your out of state license. If you don't get to either of them early plan on waiting in line only to get told that they are not taking anymore people in line. I first went to the one on Centennial only to stand in line for 10 minutes and then get told that if those of us standing in line weren't up on the board that they weren't taking any more people. 

So, then I drove to this location on Hart Lane. First, nothing is marked clearly. There were a about 5 of us that walked in together and had no idea what to do. Finally, a couple of people that were standing around told us that that we needed to get in the long line just to get a number. I stood in line for about 15 minutes. Get up to the counter for someone to look over all the paperwork I brought, give me a vision test and to give me a number. I took the number and sat down and waited for about an hour to an hour and a half. The number tells you how many other people are waiting in the same category. There were only four of us...why did it take so long to get my number called then? 

I get to the counter and hand the girl my stack of paperwork and she tells me the papers I had wouldn't work for proof of residency. The girl that gave me the number told me that I had everything I needed! So disorganized! I told the girl that I had more papers to choose from so she went through my stack and found other papers she could use.
