She wasn't the friendliest but I just wanted to get in and get out by that point. Finally, got my picture taken, signed the digital pad and got my paper license. Real license should get delivered in about 2 weeks or so! I'm finally officially a Tennessee resident!

But seriously, Davidson County...get your Driver Services Centers better!

Larry- he scammed us. He told us that's we HAD to get a sales inspection done on my car before any lease buyout could happen even if we went through a different institute to buy our car. He charged us $300 for that. We got a price breakdown only because we got an oil change. It showed that price at $160. We were there for three hours waiting for my car to get an oil change and for the inspection to be done. They could have notified us of this during the time we were there but they didn't of the price difference. The payment was handled separately and of this transaction and the oil change. The receipt we got for the $300 inspection just said we spent $300. We called the next day after noticing the price difference and we're told we'd have to come in to get a refund. So once again we're we not going to be refunded or told of this. 

We also were told by him that Mazda doesn't do any business with Suncoast Federal Bank and they could not write a check for the buyout to send to Chase. We went to the bank and they took care of everything for us. So the inspection was not needed either. So again another lie and scam.

I called this afternoon to complain and ask for a refund and the manager Shawn said he'd call me back in a couple of hours and never heard from anyone.

The wife and I went for dinner the food was good but the service was terrible so slow. We'd order the same thing I'd get mine and four or five minutes later she'd get hers. we were constantly reminding our waiter about our food. This went on the whole time we were there. There were two orders we didn't get but by that time we were ready to go. The waiter told us that they were short staffed in the kitchen.  that's why I'm giving them three stars I'll give him the benefit of the doubt would also like to add the place was so  dark I needed to use my phone flash light to see the menu

I don't give 5 stars often but this place deserves it!!! First off, the place was immaculate!!! There were no water spots in the glassware or plate ware. There was a mature presentation to every course and the chef out the "art" in culinary art. The menu was clear and easy to read. I actually told the server the cocktails were under-priced. I'm very happy with what this restaurant is doing!!

My wife and I go here every time we come to Indy and always have an amazing experience. Our latest visit goes well beyond expectations. We planned a weekend getaway to Indy for our 10 year anniversary and made reservations at Harry & Izzy's for dinner on our Saturday night. Plans were severely changed as we were in a car accident on our trip down on Friday night with my wife getting pretty banged up (thankfully no serious injuries) and our car being totaled. After a long Friday night and much needed rest for my wife all day Saturday, she still wanted to have dinner at Harry & Izzy's and get out of the hotel. As always the food was amazing (of course the shrimp cocktail is a one of a kind) but our waitress Paige was even more amazing. She provided exceptional service but more importantly, she was so sincere and comforting once she had heard of our accident to start out our weekend. Towards the end of dinner my wife was feeling uncomfortable and Paige made sure to get our anniversary dessert made to go. She also had her manager come over to make sure we enjoyed our experience and that it had made our weekend better after the accident. Paige then stopped by and had informed us that they had taken care of bill and they hoped that that made our special weekend a little better. This was an unexpected and welcomed surprise which was also not necessary.  However, it is so nice to know that there are people out there that truly care about their guests as more than just customers and go well out of their way to ensure that they have a great experience. We already make sure to visit Harry & Izzy's when in Indy, but this experience just reassured that this restaurant is some thing special.

I have been here at least a dozen times in the last year and their food and service is consistently good!  They feed you well and serve you quickly.  They also make good Micheladas!  They have a large menu of the all Mexican Restaurant staples and fabulous salsa!  The tables and chairs are brightly colored and close together.  The space is always buzzing with conversation.

I typically order the chicken fajitas and they are always cooked to perfection and come out steaming hot!  Big Quesadilla Hacienda with chicken (this is basically chicken fajitas cooked inside a large flour tortilla with cheese)!  My one deviance away from anything chicken fajita related is their Chicken Soup!  It comes with rice, avocado, and pico de gallo.  It is a big steaming bowl of happiness.  It has a fabulous flavor and big chunks of chicken and avocado!

You should give this place a try if your in the area!

I've been to this amphitheater several times the past few years and each time I go it only gets worse and worse. First, I'd like to start with the fact that the service fees to go to this venue are ridiculous. Just this year, I bought a 64 dollar pit ticket and it ended up costing me 90 dollars after all the fees. That's insane! Secondly, the security here are so rude. When saying that, I immediately think of Uproar Festival last year. A clear line was forming in front of the gate to get into the general admission floor. Many people (about 20+ people cut in front of me and I was the third person in line originally) cut right in front and the security did absolutely nothing about it. When someone right behind me started to complain about, by simply saying "hey, are you going to do something about the people cutting in front of us? I've been waiting hours and they're just cutting in front," the security threatened to throw him out for cutting line, when he obviously did not. Seriously?! To top it all of, when the gate open to go into GA Floor, the security let 15 people in (including those who cut) and then stopped everyone else. What is that?! I'm continually more and more disappointed with this venue. I'm going there again Friday and am desperately hopping for it to better. If I could avoid it, I would, but festivals and artists keep playing there, and as long as they do that, I'll be seeing them there.

Got the sectional I really wanted and the floor team were all very helpful. Transparent about price, nothing hidden and worked on getting the best deal. Even if it meant waiting a few weeks to assure we knew about upcoming sales.

I went here for breakfast on a weekday with a college friend. The place was pretty empty, I got metered street parking right in front of the restaurant. I ordered tofu scramble with mixed vegetables, a side of potatoes, tempeh bacon, wheat toast and vegan butter. The tofu scramble was not good at all, it was basically chopped up small square tofu pieces tossed with vegetables and vegan cheese sprinkled on top. It did not have much taste, it really lacked flavor. I would not call this a scramble. The potatoes, however were good! The tempeh bacon wasn't crispy and it could use a little more flavor also. My friend ordered an omelette and she enjoyed it. My vegan meal wasn't great, but I wouldn't rule out this place completely for others. Their other breakfast options look decent and they have a decent cup of coffee. Also price wise it's good. This place unfortunately just isn't a great option for vegans.
Love it! The razorback pizza is DELICIOUS, and I'm not usually a meaty pizza type of person! They have excellent calzones as well!

They showed up at our complex the other night from 5-8. Ordering online was easy. They have a very user friendly platform. Pick your time, pay online, walk down to the truck to get it, and enjoy. A very smooth process.

I had a Rick's White and I have to say it offered some of the best bites of pizza I've ever had. When you get a bite where the cheeses are thick, the blend with their tasty Italian Sausage and garlic lights up your taste buds. I'm usually a ground sausage guy but these old style sausage cuts were fine. Don't plan on kissing anybody for awhile. It's heavy on the garlic and it will take overnight to kill the bad breath. :). 

My wife had a plain old Margarita, and they do it the way she likes it. Simple, no red sauce base. Cooked perfectly, she gave it a 5.

Their basic location is over on Starkey near the tag office. It's about a 20 minute ride for me. It's worth it.

Woohoo, really as good as it gets. My girlfriend and I stayed here for a weekend, and we were consistently blown away by the sincere kindness and enthusiasm for making our stay memorable, so much so that each of the employees we interacted with deserve a call out. Darrin at the front door was extremely helpful with recommendations and directions, Sean (one of the bellhops) took a personal interest in giving us his best recommendations for cool neighborhoods and nightlife, and went out of his way to follow up with us throughout our weekend, and Kayla was cheerful and wonderful to talk to at the complimentary wine receptions. 

We took a spur-of-the-moment trip to the 25th floor ballroom, where we scared the bejeezus out of Jason, one of the banquet staff members. Rather than toss us out, he stayed to talk and made sure we saw the city from the best viewpoint! Not only that, but on the way back down it our room, we shared an elevator with Chef George, who later hand-delivered a bowl of truffle oil popcorn when my girlfriend jokingly said she missed the popcorn at that night's wine reception. Above and beyond, literally every step of the way. 

The Queen View room (1711) was fantastic and luxurious, and the free fixie road bike rentals were an incredibly creative addition to our stay. Incredible location. We can't wait to come back.

So my group and I visited Mother's today for dinner.  We were told that the food here was to die for.  Judging by the line outside you had to believe it.  We hangout at the Harrahs casino and visited the restaurant around 7pm we waited for the line to die down.  I ordered  the half fried chicken and my wife ordered the combination platter.  One of our friends ordered the baked ham and the other another half fried chicken.  Well the chicken  was fried very nicely it lacked flavor and the red beans and rice tasted pretty bland. The baked ham my friend ordered was pretty good.  That's about it. Don't expect top notch customer service.  Our waiter was pretty bad. He did not make us feel welcomed and lacked some basic waiter interaction, he sure did advise us that even though there were posted signs stating that do not to tip the staff he advised us that tips are accepted.  I am sure glad I did not stand in the sun in line to get in and be disappointed.

This is by far one of the best Grocery Outlets I have ever been to. Always clean and organized and they have the real freezers that have doors instead of the freezer bins. Also, it's in a better part of town and most of the people you see in there don't look like they are on drugs, and the cashiers are competent. The carts actually say Grocery Outlet on them and aren't reject carts from KMart or Smiths.

A jewel - piano near the door - honky tonk & Mozart, great small plates - surprises & tiddies
Don't miss it - in Frenchman's Quarter a fabulous residential neighborhood from the 1800s
Don't miss it

Good food and drinks! Love the environment too! I've been three times so far and each time there was a live band and a dance floor. So much fun! First time I went was for Fat Tuesday and the band was amazing and they gave away Mardi Gras beads. Very festive. I love the hush puppies, porkchops, and greens. Funny time and good food!!

I definitely wanted to get a new pair of leggings, and I ended up leaving with a couple of beautiful pairs.  Unfortunately for me, I ended up exchanging quite a few pairs before I found a few leggings that I really liked.
 
I really wanted to like the Fast and Free and Invigorate because the concept of having side pockets for cell phones, keys, etc sounded great.  Both pairs of pants just fit too tightly, too snug in my waist and felt uncomfortable.  

I did fall in love with the Wundertrain!  They're smooth, soft, breathable and I got them in a beautiful purple / blue, a color which I personally love.  I absolutely love those leggings.  I just wish that they had pockets.  

So, I went back to Lulu and got a pair of Align leggings, with pockets!  My absolute favorite thus far!  They're incredibly smooth and soft.  They're very comfortable and I love the side pockets!  The store staff did caution me that these pants may pill and they're not exchangeable if they do.  I hope that they don't!  

I do a lot of walking and I got Lulu leggings because I was hoping that by paying the steeper price tag, the pants would be better quality than the competition.  Not entirely sure there.  I do take excellent care of my leggings, I hand wash them and air, drip dry them.  

I really enjoy this store, it's a beautiful store, although it definitely is expensive.  Very friendly employees.  I enjoy checking out their sales racks.  I'm glad that they carry larger sizes.  Nice store!
You can't walk by this store and not go in to look around. The items are contemporary, yet have a nice, rustic feel to it. This store, in particular, was clean and things were laid out very nicely.

The wife and I recently had lunch at Local Harvest compliments of a Groupon I score a few months back.  The first thing I noticed is the limited seating capacity - unless of course you consider the patio area - weather permitting.  We chose to dine on the patio because there were no avail. spots indoors.  

I had the delightful Mediterranean sandwich, which was messy but delicious.  It was hard selecting one thing from the list of sandwiches and dishes on the menu because they all sounded amazing.  At any rate, I believe the wife ordered the turkey sandwich.  The bread (and sandwich in its entirety) were amazing as well....yes, I snagged a couple bites. The ingredients are locally produced and fresh, which is a huge plus.

The prices are a little steep if paying full price.  However, our lunch was maybe a few bucks after the Groupon.  I wish I would've purchased more than one!  At any rate, we attempted to come back for lunch another day - a Sunday if memory serves, and it was jam packed with a long line out the door.  Unfortunately, we had to venture elsewhere.

Overall - love this place but wish it was a big larger in size.  The indoor seating seems rather crowded and close.  However, the patio is great as long as the weather is cooperating.  I'm sure we will return again soon and hopefully get to stay and dine next time around..
This place suddenly closed for some reason, but I must say they had one of the best pizzas I've ever had anywhere. I will certainly miss it. What a tragedy.

The wait in a line that snaked the building was worth it. I ordered the Ga peach pancakes which were served crepe style with warm peaches and powdered sugar. They were so good and had a true southern charm. I was unable to finish due to being stuffed. My fiancé had the Strawberry Shortcake pancakes and was very satisfied.

Cinder House is Gerald Craft's new restaurant at the Four Seasons.  Craft won the Beard Best Midwest Chef award.

Started with Grilled Watermelon with aged ham and Coxhina.  My server says they have one staffer making Coxhina, cheese balls deep fried.

Next, Dia's Cheese Bread and my entree: Piri Chicken.  The bread takes 20 minutes to bake.  So decadent!  The chicken is cooked in a massive wood fired grill and packs some heat.

The Rice Pudding was insanely amazing, especially with the toppings.  

The Piri Chicken was my #1 dining pick, followed by the Rice Pudding.

This is Craft's best restaurant yet.  The South American comfort food inspired menu was superb.  I can't wait to return!

We have been here countless times by now and the food here is always consistently good.  One of our top 5 restaurants in Tampa Bay.  If you like mole sauce, you won't find much better than theirs, even compared to places I've been in Mexico.  It's really, really good... but you have to really like mole.  Drinks here are excellent, tableside guacamole is also stellar.  Service has been great each time and, even though we moved away, we always come back whenever we are in town.

Disclaimer: I'm a Texan living in Nashville. I've eaten my fair share of tacos. And Taco Mamacita's tacos (and the sides) disappointed this new Nashvillian. 

I had the fish taco with a side of slaw and a side of Mexican street corn. The fish taco contained a piece of fish so thin that I could barely taste it - I actually looked to make sure they hadn't just given me a piece of fried batter (that's all I could taste). The Mexican street corn was just bad. I love Mexican street corn - but this corn didn't resemble any Mexican street corn I've ever had (and it had an unpleasant texture from something sprinkled on the corn - cornbread-y?). The slaw was fine. But it was slaw. 

The margs were a hit. The ambiance is very Tex-Mex-y - I felt at home. And the service was stellar. 

But would I wait 40 minutes for these tacos? Nope.

The food is awesome. I always get the Chicken Souvlaki dinner which comes with salad, rice and pita but I eat gluten free so I skip the pita. The chicken is nicely marinated and tender. The rice is just so perfectly cooked and seasoned. I love their tzatziki, it is definitely homemade and well balanced. The salad to start is perfect, I love the light oil and vinegar dressing on it, not too heavy, just right. The portions are huge. It is a small, family owned business and I personally think it's better than any of the Tarpon places. Oh and they have a fabulous dry red Greek wine there that I cannot find any place else.

First time in PK and didn't disappoint! Bourbon and berries is a wonderful go to drink. The food was spectacular with great presentation and flavor. The ambiance of the place was warm, inviting and comfortable. Shaun made great drink recommendations and Savvy followed through with the flavor. They are both great assets of PK.

Vegan Mac n Cheese was the creamiest I've ever had. I wish I could talk about other menu items but it's so good I just keep coming back to that. Staff is friendly, and the place is full of personality.

The place is never clean...it feels like there is a layer of nasty all over the place.  The manager Bradley W couldn't care less when you bring a problem up to him.  Employees are rude and and act like they couldn't care less to serve you.  This is all coming from someone that has run restaurants at a high corporate level.  When I called to let Bradley know his employees were basically telling guest they can't eat in house because they were closing in 10 min...all he really had to tell me is well they were mad at me because I made them work on fathers day and tried to brush it under the rug and acted like he did not really want to deal with it.  Very poor job Bradley....YOU are the reason why your employees act the way they do.....You need to take a look at yourself and how you run Salsarita's.

After traveling for several hours, I just wanted to grab my rental car and get on my way. I have to say, Enterprise really made the process oh-so-simple. The shuttle to get to the rental center didn't take long at all - both in terms of how long I had to wait for a shuttle to arrive, and for how long it takes to get to the rental center. There were several customer service reps waiting for me upon arrival. They offered me a bottle of water (that was a nice touch!), had my car inspected and off I went.

Overall, I had a great experience with Enterprise. It was great service at a great price. I'd use Enterprise again if/when I come back to Philly.

I just purchased a new bike and I loved the the sales
Person who was very helpful, the price and the care and consideration the store showed me.I would highly recommend!! Love my new Bike.  Thanks!!!

Mike is absolutely Amazing, he definitely goes above and beyond normal customer service standards. My husband and I shopped around with different lenders, trying to find the best rate. Mike was able to offer us a higher purchase price at a WAY better rate than any other lender out there.  Continuing on with his team for our transaction was a no brainier. During the process, Mike was easily reachable the entire time and was always sincere and friendly, even when we may have been rushing things or acted pushy to close, he still maintained complete professionalism and impressed us with how hard he was working. You know those rare moments where you run into someone who is just absolutely incredible at what they do and you get the sense that they were made to be in that profession? Thats Mike, theres literally nothing that he cannot do or help you with. Id have to say my favorite and most appreciated thing about working with Mike is the fact that he will give you his personal number and allow you to call him at any time, for any reason. (Yes, even after business hours). Buying a home, especially for the first time, can be a very nerve wrecking and stressful situation, thats why It is so important to get with a lender who makes you feel safe, understood and cared for. This man truly values his customers as well as what he does, you will not be disappointed to trust your home needs with Bay Equity Loans. I will forever be thankful for working with this team.

Over priced drinks; at one point in the evening, I was charged 2 different prices for the same drink.  Later we had bottle service; the bottle arrived already opened and not to mention was very watered down.  Parking sucks, valet and lot parking all came with pricey tags in addition to the admission charge.

After seeing a gentleman cleaning my next door neighbors gutters, he gave me the phone number to call to hire them to clean mine.  Once I got the bid, they include two cleanings in the contract without option to have just one, making it pretty expensive.  Then, when my bill arrived I called about the referral credit.  They advertise, "$20 off for everyone you refer to Aerotech you each get $20 credit on account referred customer must sign up for either a min2x cleaning or min $295 repair".  I believe my account, or at minimum my neighbor, should have recieved the credit.  When I asked to talk to the tech that gave me the bid about why he didn't write down anything about a referral, the women on the phone said I could not.
Aerotech is not worth the money.

IF I could give this POS insurance company -10 stars I would!!  NBC Universal Comcast switched to this awful horrendous garbage company from a fantastic health insurance company and that just makes it easier for employees to leave the company and find employment elsewhere.  The coverage raised their premiums, deductibles and this insurance company doesn't cover anything anymore. You can't speak to anyone and Accolade has declined exceptionally so you lose your mind trying to get assistance. It's infuriating how awful this company is.

Allison, I don't feel comfortable sending you my data because, from experience, I'm pretty sure we will get targeted, not helped. What do you think you can do to resolve the issue that ibx refuses to pay for blood tests my Dr (at the time but no longer) ordered without us knowing it is "sometimes" not covered and is costing us $600 out of pocket?!

Note: This review has been formed by opinion after several visits. After moving to the Indianapolis area, I heard my friends absolutely rave about Bakersfield on Mass Ave. "The tacos are so good! And they have the best margaritas!" I thought, okay.. well, if it's so good I may as well try it. My first experience was with my boyfriend. The atmosphere was crowded, noisy and I could barely hear him talk. While sitting at the bar stool- Keg tables, I kept getting ran into by waitresses and other customers. Not a very comfortable way to try and enjoy your lunch. We ordered an appetizer of the guacamole, chips and queso. The guac is incredible. absolutely perfect- the queso on the other hand tastes like they emptied a freezer burnt bag of shredded cheese into a pan in melted it. When the tacos came out, my boyfriend exclaimed, "these are tiny!" lol. good thing we ordered the appetizer. Not only were the tacos tiny, but also were incredibly lacking in flavor. Disappointing. The staff treated us as though they were trying to move us out quickly and had no time for us. The other trip I would like to elaborate on was my last visit. My best friend arrived just a few minutes before I did, was first in line and was ignored 4 times while they seated her. There was no, "miss, would you mind waiting for a seat, because these people have the whole party here." No. she was straight up ignored. I got there, Kaylee got a beer and I opted to try one of the "fantastic" margaritas. My margarita was definitely anything but fantastic. I could make a better margarita out of a bottle mix in my blender at home for cheaper. The waitress brought us out our guac and queso (kaylee wanted the queso. gross!) and the guac was of course, amazing. Then we waited..and waited..and waited some more. Finally, a whopping 43 minutes later the waitress came back to check on us and took our order. I'm usually a lenient and patient person, but the kicker is THEY WEREN'T BUSY! We ordered the food, this time better than the last.. and then we found ourselves waiting another 40 minutes for our checks after we had finished. I appreciate the "fun" atmosphere they're trying to develop here.. 83 minutes of waiting during dinner just isn't fun. I am disappointed and don't really recommend it. The only thing they have going for them is their guacamole.

DO NOT USE EMPIRE!! I wish we had looked at these reviews prior to using them - they are unfortunately one of the worse vendors I have encountered. In the past we have always used Avalon or Lowes and never been disappointed - but our realtor recommended Empire so we followed her guidance (wrong move!!).  The rep was initially friendly, then things changed and I became quite uncomfortable.  He was EXTREMELY pushy, overstayed his welcome - and I felt like I was haggling with a car dealer!! (come to find out he use to sell cars!)  we had two vendors measure the room, both came up with 270 total square feet.  Empire measured the room and quoted me of 380 square feet (For the SAME room)  - how does THAT happen!!    Lowes quoted us a number - Empire (for the same carpet grade) quoted us 3x that price!!... and actually said "wow, that's a great price!"  Net-Net after I pushed back SEVERALLY... and said I wasn't interested (at least 4 times) and told him thanks and he had to leave. He refused - I told him to give me his number and I would think about it - he refused, said the 'deal' was only good for today and that there was no way to contact him.  But then SOMEHOW. he and his 'boss'.. were then able to match the price.  So - carpet is suppose to arrive/be installed the next day.... they give you a window... 10 min prior the the expiration of the window I CALL THEM... and they tell me that they are running late - don't know when they will get here... and that it could take 3 hours to install the carpet (the room is TINY)... AND because I requested furniture removal (which I didnt - but was told NOT getting it wasn't an option) it could add more time..... REALLY!!!!   I took time off of work (unpaid) to meet them here - they don't show up, their dispatch can't find them - and then when they do they are running 'very' behind schedule.... they couldnt call!!!!
Lowes was in/out in 2 hours for my den - a room 2x the size!  Lesson learned - go with what you know!!  DO NOT USE EMPIRE - Go to Lowes or Avalon carpet!!  We are in the process of closing on a new house - and were going to put all new floors in - I can assure you that we will NOT be giving our business to Empire nor will be recommending them to ANYONE!!

Me and my girlfriends go here all the time for girls night out great staff always on the ball they make the best margaritas mango is my favorite I always get the  fiesta nachos but all of their food is delicious.

Well, to be honest, I was under-impressed. I loved Fosters Freeze when I was little. My mom would take me to the old Santa Barbara Mesa location and I would always order a caramel shake. I went to this location in Carpenteria and it was a disappointment. The service was bad and when I finally got to order, they got the order wrong. It was so hot out I didn't call them on there mistake of giving me a vanilla shake when I ordered a caramel. I am truly disappointed. I still might have to return in the future for that caramel shake.

Dioji is such a wonderful place for my puppy to burn some energy and socialize with other dogs. We bring him to the Goleta location once a week and he is always exhausted at the end of the day. The staff is fantastic; they are friendly, responsible, and very professional. Sometimes they email me pictures of my little guy playing, which is super cute.The transportation service that they offer was a HUGE help to us one day when our travel plans were delayed and none of our roommates could drive him to day care. I would absolutely recommend Dioji to any dog parents out there!

This is my 1st time here.  I was so excited to check this place out because every time I drove by the smell was just calling me.  We went for lunch.  I had beef and pork, mac and cheese, and collard greens.  The mac and cheese has croutons which was different and it was cheesy.  I really can't say I liked it but it wasn't bad.  The meat was good.  The 1 thing I didn't like was either of the only 2 BBQ sauces they make.  I wish there was more of a selection.  The collard greens were out of the world!  I also thought it was odd to not have mashed potatoes.  This are just things I wasn't pleased with.  However, this place is constantly busy so you should definitely try it to form your own opinion.  Every one of the staff was extremely nice and my family members that weren't happy with their sides had them replaced free of charge.

To start I never leave bad reviews, but this is ridiculous. Our first move was great minus the fact that they broke our rototiller, right in front of us. They were told how to correctly move the item but did not heed our instruction. Due to our $250 deductible they will not correct the issue as the fix is 200. On the second move (for items that remained at our home for staging) there was zero communication and the mover arrived with no help!! My husband had to actually help the mover so that the items (sofa sleeper etc) made it safely inside. I have emailed the VP with zero response.  The salesman and secretary both have also ignored my emails.  Good customer service until you pay, then don't hold your breath if you need something.

Nashville meets Beverly Hills when it comes to the Hutton Hotel.  The Hutton Hotel is a very classy hotel, located right in the heart of everything downtown Nashville.  My wife and I spent a romantic weekend at the Hutton and were not disappointed.  You are walking distance to Broadway and the very nice Frist Museum.   The hotel restaurant is an awesome place to eat, but there are numerous other restaurants walking distance to the hotel like the Midtown Café, which was listed as one of the top 50 restaurants in the south.  I highly recommend staying at the Hutton for any occasion.  This hotel gets 5 stars from me, but I would give it 10 stars if I could!
These didnt post when  I updated my review . Wanted to make sure y'all seen why I've had a change of Heart ! It was the bad customer service for me

my car was my life, and that was stripped from me by a careless teen who ran 3 consecutive lights in a row before slamming into my car and causing me to break my arm and my leg. I am lucky I survived...

I was in so much pain that I didn't want to even handle any of the work, so I hired 911 Legal Team to step in a take care of everything. They dominated the insurance work, referred me to get check ups, and ended everything off with a fat check to reimburse me. I am now driving around in a way nicer car, which is also my life!

My attorney was great and i highly recommend hiring 911 legal team as your personal injury attorney. You won't regret it promise me

My dad's car was stolen from here yesterday because they allowed an addict from the street hop in and out of cars. They did not call the police on this lady even though her behavior was very suspicious. She stole another customer's keys.  My dad had not been in Florida 24 hours before this negligent car wash let his car be stolen. Then they didnt want to give him his money back for the car wash. The manager had the nerve to say "well you did get your car washed"!!!!! Furthermore did not compensate with a rental while he waits to see if the police can find his car. Manager once again stated something foolish " technically is not our fault"  I cannot believe a company would act this way after a customer's car was stolen because of their negligence.  This was my favorite car wash and I will not use again even if my life depended on it.

Update: boca is still as great as always!!! Came here for a friend because we were given vouchers for our birthday. We came right in time for happy hour too. Our server was super sweet and attentive to us even though it was a busy Friday night. We loved the zucchini fries and our favorite house sangria!! Thanks for a great birthday, Boca :)

Worst place ever to go shop for a car and, or get one fixed! Had to get a new engine in my  6 month old car (that they broke in the first place and took them 2 months to actually fix) and come to find out 3 months later that my head gasket was leaking oil as well as many other locations and needed to be fixed. After taking over a week to fix it a month later I come to find out that now my oil pressure switch is leaking as well as a few other locations AGAIN/ STILL. Worst part about it is now I have to go BACK to this horrible place to "fix" it again! I HATE this dealer!!! Find a better place to go. A junk yard dealer would be better then this place and DO NOT DEAL WITH CORY IN SERVICE!!

Still would rate this place a zero. 
Susan of 10 years - customer service I only asked to switch money out into larger bills. 
Horrible fucking attitude and after she was done counting it all she said was "here you go."
Like your guys' employees fucking suck with "customer service." The way she looked at me and the way she handled it was just fucking rude. 
You guys won't do shit about it either right? Fuck you walmart on your shorty responses on customer complaints. 
And I still shop here! How sad.

Customer service is friendly and labor is reliable.  I've had bodywork done at Spirit over the years for my Toyota Camry.  This is where Seegar Toyota sends all their customers because they do not have a body shop at the dealer.

It can be hard to find; located on the back road off Manchester.

I was traveling from out of town and found this gem of a place! I went on a Thursday which was even better with open mic night. Very friendly, neat atmosphere. People were hanging out and the baristas knew all of the customers. Very friendly. Food was good. Desserts were amazing. I didn't have coffee, but everyone raved about it. Prices were very reasonable too. This is a must try!

I tried to lease a 2017 Honda Civic that Honda was running a leasing promotion on. Apparently my salesperson John C is not aware of something called the internet. I knew the price range I should be able to lease the vehicle for by using Edmunds and KBB to understand what a fair price would be for the car. John C was proposing I pay list for the car, when I already knew the average price paid was 1500 under MSRP. He didn't seem to understand that by discounting the car 1500 it would lower my down payment or monthly lease cost. How a car sales person could not understand that concept was beyond belief. After 2 days of this nonsense I called and asked to speak with his sales manager directly. The sales manager was unavailable, so I had to leave him voice mail. I never received a return call from the sales manager, however I did get a call from John C on his day off. So obviously the sales manager didn't want to deal with me directly.  After getting jerked around for 3 days I went to Piazza Honda of Reading, where I was able to get a fair price within minutes. When I let Roberts Honda and John C know I was looking elsewhere, they were now able to now get a sales manager Greg on the phone, and he got me the price I was looking for. Unfortunately it took them 3 days to get there, not to mention the aggravation of dealing with an incompetent sales rep. I don't do business that way, and when I told John C I would be purchasing from the other dealer, he sent me 10 text messages questioning my decision. Really hard to believe this guy can make a living selling cars. Since I did purchase my Honda from another dealership, I can't comment on Roberts service department, however their sales rep may have been the worst I have ever come across.

Pros:
This is probably the Green Line location with the most space and seating.

Cons:
The wifi is rather unreliable.
The employee on the evening shift plays really aggressive rock music at an aggressively loud volume. It's rather stressing and anxiety-inducing at 9 PM to have to listen to hard core rock at loud volumes as well as this employee's enthusiastic singing along to the music while trying to do work. I wish there would some consistency/centralization to the playlist choice so it's not just at the whim of whichever individual employee is on shift at the time.

Considering how coffee shops are usually used by people trying to get work done or have casual meetings, both the unreliable wifi and loud, obnoxious music choice seem antithetical to that purpose.

Also, I wish they had some alternative mechanism to heat the food other than a panini press. It really squishes the bread (ciabatta, buns) that come with their sandwiches.

I gave this place a second chance and honestly great improvement! Gucamole was delicious, margaritas great and service excellent! Love the atmosphere and patio is the best. Try it out you wont be disappointed.

Outstanding quick weekend trip, stellar service!
The Doorman offer outstanding dining advise, the room was perfectly cleaned and ready on time.  The cocktails in the lounge are not cheap but they are delicious!

Unassuming hole in the wall traditional donut shop. Cash only. Super cheap donuts. There's a decent selection, but I wish there was more chocolate frosting on the chocolate old fashioned and other similar chocolate-type donuts. 

The woman who checked us out was curt and aloof, but I think it's part of the charm with these types of places. She was yukking it up with the fellow ahead of us, likely because he's a regular. This was our first time there. We'll wear her down, watch!

This place is in Britton Plaza and is a drive up. I appreciate this service because they do a great job. I have been going there since I moved to South Tampa 4 years ago. I actually did try other places as well and keep coming back to this location. Why? Well, it is nice to find someone who can fix shoes that you can count on for a long time. I seem to be replacing the heel lifts often since I am in Business Development and on my feet all day. Thank you, Rick Gentile for your excellent customer service. I do wish you would consider joining the South Tampa Chamber of Commerce where your word would also reach many others in our community. Respectfully, Marilyn Varee Westropp

Great tasting, freshly shucked oysters. Friendly staff, clean & welcoming ambiance. We sat at the bar to eat & drink. It was an all around excellent experience: plus no lines! The wedge salad is the best I've ever had. Looking forward to trying some of the other great looking selections offered on their menu. Been to New Orleans many times, but for some unknown reason had never been in Mr. Ed's Oyster Bar. Will definitely go back!

One of the best ice cream parlors around. You'll want to come hungry. Indoor seating is plentiful but the little street it's on is great for walking. Too bad you usually can't bring food and drink inside the other stores!

It's your standard fare. Nothing over the top. It's just super loud and you feel like you have to scream at the person next to you. Did enjoy the garlic Parmesan wings. I'd be back but not dying to go back.

I stayed here for two nights during a conference. Bed was really comfortable and my room was spotless. 
Nice atrium / bar / lounge area. I'd stay here again without hesitation.

I've stayed here a few times. They had on a week night what was called a Manager's reception where you got to meet the GM and light food was served. The rate is reasonable compared to the other hotels in downtown St. Louis. Nice hotel behind the convention center.

I went to this place on Olive St. Since, it was my first visit to the city..I wanted to try local Indian food. I ordered mutton biryani, which was nothing more than a glorified rice with gravy and few pieces of lamb. The taste wasn't even there. Since, this was a take out, i didn't realize that they didn't even putany plastic spoon in it. Food is overly expensive, which I don't mind if it was good. I know one place to avoid in the future. If you are looking for some good Indian place, this is not it.
My favorite movie theatre in the city!  It's a little drive from uptown, but totally worth it!

This hotel is okay. It's right across the street from the airport, but there is also a Hyatt place nearby, so I'm not sure why anyone would stay here. The room rate does not include breakfast, and while their restaurant produces fine standard breakfast fare, at $8-12, it's a tad overpriced for being a restaurant inside a best western. My room was fine. Non-smoking as requested, and clean enough. The furniture was pretty outdated, as were the bedspreads and carpet. The room was pretty dark, but the heating/cooling worked, as did the TV. There were accessible outlets and a powerstrip between the bed and the bedside table so I could plug things in easily. 

I haven't stayed at any of the other hotels in the area, but if you just need a clean, airport adjacent room with no breakfast for $90-160, then this place would do. They do have a free shuttle that will pick you up and take you to the airport (call for pickup), and you can also pay $5 to have the shuttle take you to (and pick you up from) a nearby casino if you don't want to drive or don't have a car at the hotel.

Wifi was easy to get on, and the person at check in gave me all the info I needed to get online once in my room.
This pet store is my one stop shop for everything I need for my dogs at reasonable prices.  The dog food brands and treats they sell are high quality and my dogs love to go with me and shop too!

Very nice local Thai restaurant. We have been coming here for years when we want a special treat. They serve authentic homemade thai tea that tastes very good!

Last night we ordered curry puffs, sushi rolls, tempura, and green curry with squid.

The food was great as always and my curry portion was so generous I had enough for tasty leftovers the next day!

The restaurant setting is very intimate and great for going on a date! The staff are always very nice.

I'm by no means a bbq snob, but this place was close to the worst I've ever had. Chopped pork sandwich was bland, the sauce was watery, the mac n cheese had an odd sweetness, and the beans tasted like they just dumped them out of a can in the back. Points for the friendly service and ok hush puppies, but that's about it. I'm astonished by the other raving reviews!

Disappointment, much? :(

1) They don't even have a cooking license, so they only "heat" pre-made items. No cooking allowed, period. Everything's just refrigerated 

2) Wake n bacon : not worth the price. Yummy, but not worth it.  

3) Crabmelt : Super fishy tasting, def not quality ingredients.  


Especially after learning that they don't cook any of their items in-house, it was a huge turn off.  Tasted very un-fresh and wasn't pleasant.

I came here for bottomless brunch with friends. I might come back, but definitely not for bottomless brunch. 

The food itself was great. I had the kung pao cauliflower and the pork belly, both of which were delicious and affordable.

The drinks and the service, on the other hand, left something to be desired. The service was so slow, and it took over 10 mins just to refill a drink. On that vein, the drinks were also mediocre. Maybe it was just for bottomless brunch, but the mimosas tasted just like orange juice, and the rose tasted watered down.

I might come back to try some of their wines or eat dinner, but I can't recommend bottomless brunch in city winery.

We have now used these guys twice.. In a 2 year span. Again, they were GREAT to deal with ! On time , professional and VERY reasonably priced. I can't figure out why they have a few reviews that complain. It must be one of those Yelp things that have some businesses complaining. Interestingly, for some reason Miracle Movers doesn't even come up in search real easily.
Use these guys.

Love, love, love this tattoo shop. 

So far I've had work done by Jason, but all the artists have strong portfolios. The shop is comfortable, clean, and inviting. Pricing is reasonable for the area and the quality of work is outstanding, Parking can be a little crowded, but it's East Nashville. And no cooler-than-thou vibe either - even though it's East Nashville.

I'm gluten-free and vegan and my husband isn't and this place is great for both of us! The Impossible Burger with a gluten-free bun is amazing and the sweet potato fries were great! I have a hard time finding "real" sweet tea here but they have it! Dana was my waitress today and she was so sweet, understood my picky eating and kept sweet tea on the table! Great lunch today and a great dinner here last week!

There's something to be said about a neighborhood burger joint hugging the Santa Barbara Coast. The Double Cheeseburger and Curly Fries were just what the doctor ordered against, after a surf session and brew session with the dogs at Island Brewery. The patties were fresh, and the fries were golden brown, crispity, and delicious. I got the curly fries by the way, in place of standard. If you've ever seen the sign for The Big Yellow House from the 101 while passing through SB, this place is like a block away from that. I'll be back here some day because the place had soul. Three employees and some locals sporting Jean jackets with a Creepshow patch. The burger was delicious, and I am ready for a nap on the beach.

The girls at the coffee counter were too busy arguing about their tips to make my coffee. When I finally asked for it, they had completely forgotten about me. When I finally got my coffee had to remind her that I ordered a pastry as well. Their organic coffee and great philosophy brought me in but the bad service will keep me away from now on. Too many coffee shops to settle for poor service!

Grouper nuggets were nice and fresh, not overly breaded. Jumbo lobster tail was huge and pricey but cooked perfectly. Grilled shrimp was fantastic but the grilled Mahi Mahi was bland and could use some good blackening seasoning. Great atmosphere and wonderful view.

The menu is great. Lots to chose from. I only had breakfast here and it was pretty decent. Coffee was nice and hot. 
Only issue was the service. It took forever to get a server and the restaurant was not busy at all.
Best vegan burgers in Indy! If you are vegetarian or vegan I recommend the sweet potato burger. It was amazing . Shoutout to my guy Dwight for the great service!!!

This is a large airport. It has a lot going on.
While there is not much before you hit the tsa line, once you're past it, you'll see so many good options and shops. They have everything from sbarro to pei wei. 
They offer lots of comfy seats and tons of outlets to charge your devices at while you wait.
Everything here was smooth sailing for me, and I don't mind having to come to this airport at all.

The folks at Fantasia are wonderful. They clearly love the animals they care for. I only use them a few times a year when I travel, but they always remember my dog and are excited to see her. I love to board at the North location which has lots of space, but living on the south side makes the drive a bit much. The shuttle service between the two locations eliminates that problem.

So delicious! The menu is small and simple, but it's perfect. This was my first time trying it there. I had their huevos rancheros and they were delicious! I went with a friend, but now I know I need to take my husband there ASAP. My girls had he giant pancake with a side of eggs and bacon. Everything was perfect. Will be going back to try everything else! Prices were also reasonable.

Beautiful resort, very friendly staff, wonderful casitas and great food.  Loved being able to choose to eat in the library, the patio, by the fireplaces....yes, it is a Ritz so expect to pay for a Ritz, but well worth it in my opinion.

Their wings are soooo good and I've never tasted a plain donut so good. So moist and flavorful. If you're getting the wings get the sweet chili and coconut curry. *chefs kiss* never expected good wings for a donut spot

I love Russell's! Their brunch is amazing, their dinner is amazing and their baked goods are to die for.

If you haven't tried the pecan ribs, you must! There is nothing like it. 
After you eat make sure to head to the front counter to pick out a baked good to take home.

Great running/ outdoor path around the lake. It's a about a 6 Mike loop with some inclines and declines- but mostly flat. My only negative comment is that part of the trail is the road along the nature center. I didn't realize that at first and did some off- roading. Once I figured it out, I had a great run. There is plenty of wildlife to take in, but beware the geese, they will chase you if you get too close. Would be a great picnic spot on a sunny day!

Always clean, great selection, quality items. Although I don't have kids I love that they have the farm stand with the 1 free item for kids. All of the workers have always been pleasant. I enjoy buying things from this location.

This place is delicious!!! Never had something vegan AND gluten free that tastes sooo good and has a completely normal texture! The place is Very light and open. The staff went above and beyond, very attentive even though it is mostly self serve. Can not wait to back! :)
My absolute favorite sushi place. I say try the country ko ko. The staff is also dope and they remember from the countless times I've come in.
Excellent breakfast and freshly squeezed juices!!! very busy and tight space but the staff does a great job moving around and tending to the customers.

Terrible, terrible, TERRIBLE! We should have known when we walked in and there was still popcorn on the ceiling that the underlying facilities were circa 1970. But the paper thin walls confirmed our suspicions.  The non-smoking room which reeked of cigarettes was furnished with a lumpy bed, the pillows that were flat, and in the morning, the shower (which was surrounded by mold)didn't drain. Then, to top it off, when I called guest services to complain about the shower, the answer I got was akin to, "We will get to it when we can." Also, when we stopped by the cafe after our evening's events and wanted to get some dessert to take back to the room, the hostesses were rude and acted as though we were a nuisance for making such an outlandish request. The only upside was the dessert we settled on from the pastry shop; there we had our only pleasant interaction and picked up some yummy treats. When I voiced my complaints to the front desk at check out, the best they could do was comp half of my $36 room service charge. There is a hotel that we usually stay at when we stay in Reno amd it is always fantastic! Next time they're full, instead of trying somewhere else, I'll stay at home.

Washoe Public House is a must when in Reno!! It's about a 10 minute walk from the casino, but a 30 second walk from our hotel. We went Thursday night for dinner after driving up from the Bay Area and it was AMAZING!!! 

*Service: Great! We were greeted and seated right when we walked in by the hostess and had Brett has our server. He was great! Was very detailed about the menu when we asked questions and we got to know him personally as well. 

*Food: DELICIOUS!!! Tasty, rich, flavorful and so much more! We started off with an 

*appetizer to share: Rock Candy Short Rib Poutine~ soooo tasty that I might need to go again tonight for dinner. The sauce was so good and the fries were soaked, the short rib fell apart easily and was so flavorful. 

*Wild Boar Schnitzel (featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives)~ which my boyfriend had. He said the flavor with the mushrooms and gravy was perfectly matched with the boar. 

*House Made Pasta~ I had the house made pasta which was crazy good. Tasted like chicken piccata but a pasta version. 

*Dessert: I had the Strawberry Creme Brûlée with strawberries and shortbread cookie on top. 
The best dessert was the "It's It?" S'mores Edition: it was EPIC!!!! Highly highly recommend this and sharing it with the table because it's pretty big but oh my soooo tasty! 

We went back for lunch today and have nothing g but good things to say about the staff, location, and cleanliness of the restaurant. Everyone smiles, says hello and is very friendly. When I Reno we definitely recommend checking this hidden gem out!

I've been to Mazzah (on State Street) many times over the past few years and while the food is always delicious, there is always a mistake with my order. I typically get the falafel platter, with tzatziki as my sauce and fries (with fry sauce) and hummus as my two sides. The falafel is always delicious, although sometimes I feel it is overcooked. Like, if I threw it at a window, the glass would shatter dryness. But despite that I still enjoy the food. 

Typically when they mess up, they give me the wrong sauce with my platter! It is such a simple thing that I don't understand why it keeps happening. I've had them repeat my order many times to prevent an issue, they say the correct sauce, I get my order and go home, and find the sauce is wrong. At this point I've decided I just need to check before I leave, because believe me, tahini tastes NOTHING like tzatziki and the falafel is awfully dry with nothing to put on it. I also feel they could add some more vegetables to the platter for the price (c'mon, three pieces of soggy lettuce and two pieces of turnip doesn't cut it...add some more lettuce, and tomatoes would be nice...). -1 star for constantly making mistakes, -1 star for lack of veggies.

Thank you Catherine for once again going beyond the call of duty to listen to my request and create two beautiful arrangements to send my daughter and her newborn twins yesterday.
Rebel Hill Florist is my to go place anytime I need to order a flower arrangement that will put a huge smile on the face of the friend or family member that I want to honor. 
Professional, courteous service, beautiful flowers prompt delivery. The best in Nashville!

Our waiter Cimmeron was amazing. Very upbeat, polite, and informative. I ordered the lemon roasted chicken meal which was spectacular, probably the best chicken I've ever had. My boyfriend ordered the 4 cheese pasta which he agreed was good as well. For dessert I got the toasted smores cheesecake which although a bit too rich was still very good especially with the toasted marshmallow and graham cracker.

I Eat here all the time.  Well,  I used to.   Just parked in the back and the guy that's usually nice to me was yelling at me saying  he was going to tow my truck!  Wth??.  You can take your Chile relleno and stuff it another way!  Small town with tons of Mexican restaurants.  Adios,  jerks!

LOVELOVELOVE Reading Terminal Market (which is apparently pronounced like "Redding"? according to my philly friends). So many choices that we couldn't decide on just one. I shared Keven Parker Soul Food Cafe (leg and thigh w/ one side - mac&cheese), Sang Kee Peking Duck (peking duck roll), Kamal's Middle Eastern Specialties (lemonana - mint, rosewater, and lemon juice/smoothie), and Beiler's Donuts (coconut custard). Everything was amazing and I wish I had more room in my stomach for everything (and maybe money). It was slightly crowded but it was lunch time and a very popular tourist location. There were numerous seating areas in the middle of market and other seating at certain merchants. I would definitely come again and try different places!
Dont try to use the app system they will just take your money and not start the machine. And the attendant has no idea how to deal with it, it eats your money with no compensation.
The steak was ok not all that. It was extremely oily and I didn't notice the truffle cheese. I'll skip this place if I want a good cheesesteak. The fries was good.

Good vegan food.  Service is good as well.  Overall pleasant experience!  The appetizers were my favorite part while the vegan pad thai left a lot to be desired.  It was hardly more than a mixed vegetable salad with what seamed like thousand island on it.  There are better options I am sure.

I remember when this used to be a Chi-Chi's and when it was an International Buffet for a while. So glad it became a Mexican restaurant again. 

Every time I have been here the food has been excellent no matter what I get. Some of the portions can be pretty large depending on what you're getting so be prepared to need a box. The other thing I love about this place is that you get so much food and it's relatively inexpensive. 

The decor is very bright and festive and it's a great place to grab dinner with a small group. 

Not sure what to get? I'd recommend a wet burrito with red sauce. It's steak, chicken, shrimp and rice packed into a burrito with peppers. Normally it's topped with cheese sauce.

This place is huge ! Indoor eating area, outdoor eating/play area. Play area has ping pong and bean bag games to play. Eclectic decor but nice and comfy. Menu has alot of options. I like that they have a separate anti pasti menu with many selections of meats, cheeses, nuts, olives etc to make up your own snack tray. Alot of tap beers, many local. Wine and mixed drinks. We did order a small anti pasti with 4 items. All were delicious and nicely plated. I ordered the grilled steak tacos and Mom ordered the Prime rib sandwich. My 3 tacos were filled with meat, pico and sprinkled with cojita. Searved with a fresh corn, jicima, avocado side. Fresh flavors. Prime rib sandwich was tender and flavorful but lacking in quantity of meat. The side salad that she got was large and seasoned well. Overall, we enjoyed our lunch and would like to come back again to try new selections.

We spent 5 days here for our honeymoon and it was worth it. We loved the service and hospitality. We were pleased with our stay and loved how attentive the servers on the beach were. We feel that this resort was 100% worth the hype and were thrilled with our selection for our honeymoon! The only downfall we had was the daily parking fee, seeing that you pay a $38 resort fee each day. Each worker was so kind and attentive to our needs. Truly loved our experience!

HURRICANES! That's all you need here. We took an Uber from our downtown hotel here on our first night and it was a great introduction to the city. Sit in the courtyard as close to the flaming fountain as possible and order a round of the famous Nola drink, the Hurricane. They are very generous with the alcohol here and even offer you the souvenir glass your drink comes in. If you don't want the glass be sure to walk it up to the bar to get $3 back.

The service here is a bit hit or miss but overall the experience is worth it. Don't let the name mislead you into thinking this is your average sports bar, it's so much more and a must do when visiting New Orleans.

A GREAT EXAMPLE OF CORPORATE INCOMPETENCY AND GREED.
I called chase card services @ 2 am in the morning to get 1 simple question answered: how much is 1 Amazon Rewards point worth?
It took 1 hour 10 minutes+ , 3 phone calls, 7 people: 2 CSR's (useless), 2 Account Supervisors: Jen & Jen (?) (not much better), 1 Manager: Devon (not any better either) And 2 people in Account Security/Fraud: Ann (useless) & Doris to answer that simple question. 
It is hard to tell what their real names are as everybody had an accent and except for Doris, nobody was able to comprehend my question, leave alone offer an answer.
 Doris in Account Security was the only person competent and actually caring enough to get the issue resolved and my question answered.
Even contacting Thomas Horne, VP Card Services, US Operations at Chase did not bring any results worth mentioning. THIS COMPANY DOES NOT CARE ONE BIT ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS. IT IS ALL ABOUT MAKING MAXIMUM PROFIT AND who cares about the aftermath of NO CUSTOMER SERVICE.
As they really don't appreciate my business, I am going to cut up all my Chase Credit cards. Goodbye.

The readers are very good, kind, and respectful. The managers listen. The supplies are very good and impressive. So, you may wonder, why only three stars? The receptionists, or should I say, cashiers are nice to your face, but talk about you behind your back. Once when I called about something the receptionist started laughing at me. I thought, "Why am I being treated like this. I deserve to be treated with dignity and respect.") I told management on a mean receptionist years ago, and she was kind and empathetic. By the time I told, the abusive receptionist left. That's why management couldn't figure out who it was. But they tried to be helpful and had empathy. Now I heard bad stuff about me again as I was leaving. Today. It was about a situation that was hurtful enough as it was without that cruel comment. So what do I do now? go to management again? They would probably respond in a kind, helpful way like they did last time. But one shouldn't have to go to management  to be treated with dignity and respect. Newsflash to receptionists everywhere.: Pretend you work in a doctors office where one is not allowed to talk bad about clients. Some, clients like me, have unusually good hearing.When I said to my mom, that she should have waited till I left before badmouthing me, she said that I shouldn't have been badmouthed at all, that these are not doctors offices, so they are less likely to act professional. I won't go to management again, though they'd be kind and helpful. I will stay away from the place for a few years. As I was asked by phone whether I want to reschedule the reading I was canceling, I said because i heard gossip about me I won't be back for a few years. and that's a promise I intend to keep. I'd still recommend that other people go to New Age People because the management, the readers, and the  the staff is nice. (at least to your face.,) Management and readers are always nice, Staff members are nice to your face.

EXCELLENT FOOD, EXCELLENT SERVICE!  Everything was hot, fresh and tasty!  I really don't like refried beans, but these were the best I've ever had, I at them all!  Had the shrimp in garlic sauce, it was outstanding!  The red and green salsa were both delicious!  I will definitely be back next time I am in the area!  Service was very attentive and friendly as well!

I walk past Salt on a daily baises, and haven't tried it until a late Friday evening with a group to celebrate a friend's birthday. Not going to lie ... I had my reservations and preconceived notions about this resto. However, Salt did manage to exceed my expectation.

For drinks I ordered the Nik Nak to begin with and a pinot noir to go with my meal, and I enjoyed both. The table did order the skillet bread with honey butter. The honey butter was solid and I liked the black salt (I think?) added to it for texture and flavor. For my entree I ordered the chef's special, which included a slightly blacken fish (I forget what kind, but it was slightly meatier) with the tomato lime sauce and lobster risotto. Every aspect of the dish complimented each other and it took everything in me not to grab some leftover bread and lap up my leftover sauce.

I would definitely recommend requesting Jey as your server ! He definitely knew the menu well to give recommendations and knew which wines to go with your entrée (I would haven't thought of a pinot noir for fish) ! He made sure our table was happy and to made our table's birthday girl feel special.

I would come back to Salt for special occasions or if in the mood for some well-prepared seafood.

I have been to IBG 3 times.  1st visit 5 stars caliber! I sat at the bar 2 bartenders and service was great. Bartenders returned in time for me to never go dry!  2nd time we came on a Friday and there was a party with a DJ that was decent, however we could not sit at the bar.  We were at a high top and waited 20 minutes before having to get up and work our way to the bar for a wait to be served.  Not even sure if they had a server on the floor. We stayed for 1 drink and left after going dry.  1 star service for that visit! 
3rd time back at the bar and great service! 

I gave 3 stars only because the floor service and I have not eaten there.  I will return because the Bartenders are awesome at the bar! I would leave if they are busy and you can't sit at the bar.  You will wait for a drink!  Hope this helps.

l love this place. Everyone is extremely helpful and so fast, they take all of the stress out of your typical post office experience. I never go to the post office anymore. I especially wanted to thank the woman who helped me yesterday with some advice on shipping and returning shoes that I'm ordering for our upcoming wedding from London. She helped me save a lot of money with her knowledge and experience and I can't thank her enough! I hope the vibe and morale of the place never changes - someone is doing something right over there and I for one really appreciate it. Cheers!

I asked for a beer. Orange Blossom Beer 2. They didn't carry it. They kind of passively took my phone number and said "yeah I'll ask if I can get it for you." Sometime later I got a call letting me know my beer came in! Wow! Thanks guys! They really make you feel welcome and truly have the best prices in town. This isn't a yucky hole in the wall liquor store. They are knowledgeable, friendly and it's really a treat to shop there. PROTIP: Don't forget to walk up an almost hidden staircase. There's a beautiful selection of wines (and some great deals on nice champagnes if you need a fancy gift at a good price fast!) Keep it up! Oh, and the beer cooler is at about 33 degrees. It's gotta cost them a fortune to run it but it's the coldest beer in town. (I can barely stand to be in there)

So, everything that I read is true. It sadly appears that there was a change of ownership since my last visit. Maybe it was a staff change. All I know is the people that I remember are no longer there. I hope they are doing well.

The service was still good. The young lady at the counter was very nice and I didn't have to wait too long for my takeout order. There was only one other person picking up a takeout order in the restaurant at around 5:30 on a Saturday. 

I ordered the sweet & sour shrimp for my mother and the pho with veggies for myself. I've had their pho before, but it was different this time. Before I had the brisket, meatball, and chicken. I remember it being a light colored broth that was very tasty. This time it was a dark brown color. The flavor of this one had more of a cinnamon taste to it. It was also saltier than what I've had before at this restaurant. The rest of the flavors were there, but I didn't have the same comforting feeling that I usually get with pho. There was a generous portion of veggies and I liked the inclusion of scallions, carrots, broccoli, cauliflower, cabbage, and those little baby corn things. I was a little disappointed that the Thai basil leaves weren't as fresh as what I had recently at another restaurant in the area.  Everything else was very fresh. Mom thought the sweet & sour shrimp was good, but not quite as good as it was before. I don't know what happened. I can say that it's still very affordable. That hasn't changed. I'll still go back every now & then to try other menu items. They may have different specialties so I just have to find out what it is that they do best. I'll update my review if anything else changes. As of now, it's A-OK.

Gainesville, Jacksonville, Orlando, Davie... and now FINALLY St. Petersburg!

Bento Cafe has finally landed in the Tampa/DTSP area.  Located on Third  Street South, Bento serves cooked foods and sushi in a fast casual setting.  You order your food with the cashier, get a number, grab your seat, and a server brings your food right to your table.  You can place an order to-go if you're on the move.  You can also call ahead and place an order for pickup.

I've been eating Bento since my college days in UF.  It's nice to see them taking over Florida and never losing their quality taste or quick service.

I ordered my usual build-your-own poke bowl.  They have 3 sizes: mini, regular, and large.  The regular has 2 proteins + 1 base (white rice, brown rice, or greens) + 4 mix-ins + 2 toppings.  For $11, you get a good sized portion of ingredients made to your specific liking.

I also ordered a boba milk tea, which is just average in my opinion.  It is now one of the few places in DTSP where you can order boba tea quickly to-go.

There is indoor and outdoor seating.  Although it was just a soft open, the servers were quick to clean vacated tables so new customers could sit right away.  I imagine that during peak hours, it will get crowded quickly.

If you are craving some good pan-Asian cuisine, definitely check out Bento Cafe.
This place is great for getting a grain/green bowl. Lots of great options that are mostly Mediterranean style. I got the falafel and it was good. A great place for lunch.
Reasonable prices, the ability to order easily ala carte and convenient location. Only complaint was the coffee: weak. I had the biscuits and gravy and the bicuits were really light and fluffy.

They are always very helpful and knowledgable. 
I have never been to a more knowledgable  staffed nutrition shop in my life.
They are always very friendly and help you in a non-pushy way. 
And how they manage to have really nice, muscled, knowledgeable guys here every single time I come here, a different guy each time, amazes me.
Obviously I have been going to the wrong place!

TLDR: Very nice, knowledgeable, nad helpful staff with vitamins and supplements. A nice surprise.

This place has a very themed atmosphere and decor. That's not really my thing but also not the reason for my 3 star review. I'll go over the good first.

I ordered the Steak Frites with my steak medium rare. The meal comes with fries and a side salad. My steak was cooked medium rare and tasted great. The fries were good and on par for this type of restaurant.

Two things swayed my review to 3 stars. The first was the side salad. The pretzel croutons could have been amazing but they weren't. Infact I wasn't sure if they were even suppose to be croutons or if they were going for the chewy stale pretzel slices angle. The salad was also served on a plate so small it made it extremely difficult to eat without making a huge mess. On the bright side I liked the blue cheese dressing.

The second issue was the bathroom. The trash was about to overflow and the toilet was absolutely disgusting. Seriously someone needs to scrub the toilet there. It was something I would expect to find at a highway truck stop not a small restaurant in Safety Harbor. I'm a firm believer that a clean front of house reflects a clean back of house. I was not impressed.

Would I return? I'm really not sure.

The only thing worth the stop here is the ice cream on a hot day, or the wonderful fudge that they have. I don't particularly care for their chocolates because they are not freshly made there, but in a factory in South Bend. It takes a while before these chocolates go from being made to being displayed and eaten. Their chocolate covered nuts are lickable, oops, I mean, likeable... and I guess their lickable too! 

Note that only this downtown location has ice cream, and the only reason they have it is because this used to be a Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory location.

I don't know what is going on with the Wendy's company culture but across the board they have seriously and continually dropped their standards over the years. I have visited this Wendy's 3 times over the last month since I live close to it. All 3 times they have messed up my order. That is twice in the drive-thru and once inside. The latest mistake they missed ringing in some of my order then every Sauce that I explicitly ordered (and present on reciept) was left out of the order. I know that this may seem petty but not getting dipping sauce that is ordered for 4 sets of chicken nuggets is a big deal to me or not getting some of your order rang in meaning when you get home you dont have enough for everyone does sound like a big deal to me. Then when you go inside the employees and Management dont really care what your issue is. It's sad all the way around. Top this off by getting home and one of your Burgers has a nice Black hair cooked in between the cheese & patty (Note: I am Mr. Clean bald and my family have Blonde hair). I will NEVER patronage this Wendy's again. Even my kids would rather eat at Tiajuana Flats next door than deal with Wendy's and they don't like Mexican food, that's sad. I highly suggest everyone avoid this location at all costs. KFC is down the road, Chick-Fil-A & Tijuana Flats are in the same parking lot, even Walmart pre-made sandwiches are a better option.
Great beer selections!  Love their ovals and weekly bar specials.  Only drawback is sometimes its hard to get a seat at the bar, but I guess that's not a bad thing.  Will be back soon.
Great little stop for tacos after a visit to the zoo. Really liked the pastor tacos. Fresh ingredients. $6 for four tacos and some grilled onions.  For Nashville prices, that is ready cheap.

Only got a chance to do appetizers here but wished I reserved a spot for dinner. I got the lobster dumplings which were the BEST dumblings I've ever had. Their biscuits are homemade everyday, and THEEEEE best biscuits you will EVER have. They have a full bar and the menu just looked amazing. Upscale place and will definitely come back for dinner the next time I'm in Nola.

I love stopping in here for lunch when I want something quick and filling that won't make me hate myself afterwards haha.

You walk in to a bright, clean and modern fast-casual restaurant.  The menu has a lot of choices.  My go-tos are usually the kabobs or pita sandwich.  Both are a lot of food.  The chicken is so fresh, when you compare it to a place like Panera, you shudder at eating their chicken ever again!  Lots of choices for sides, I think the Greek Salad is delicious.  The produce is top quality and you get feta, olives, peppers, tomatoes, onion, and pepperocini.  The housemate dressing has a ton of flavor.  The pasta salad is also very good, love that they use orecchiette.

Lastly, the staff are so friendly!  They really do make a big difference.  They've been great overtime I've gone in.
The restaurant itself is very clean and decorated tastefully,  the staff is very polite, and the food is AMAZING. Probably the best Chinese food I've had.

I have always liked this car wash as the tools are much easier to use than other places. However under the new ownership this place is awful and I would suggest no one waste their money at this business. The current owners are money grubbing lazy crooks. When they went to a pay per stall operation I was not comfortable but I did get used to it. But I found the lighting has even become worse with the new owners and I can hardly see my car to see if I have cleaned it. And I'm pretty sure that is deliberate of the new owners.

Second very upsetting development was their wax. I spend an extra 2 mins washing over my car with wax to get the streaks of water off. But since the new owners have taken over there has been no wax at this place. But they continue to list is as a services and charge you for it even though they know they don't have it. I have gone to them to complain many times. The owner comes to look at my car and claims it is working. I show him that it should bead off my windows and he sits there dumbfounded. He goes back to his utility room to check his wax and comes back to claim it is fully loaded. But he is completely lying. I  assumed that maybe it was just a one time bad occurrence but I had returned and used different stalls and again the same thing. Always speaking to the owner and he love to lie and claim it works. I was so frustrated I drove across the street to the shell where their hand wand wax works perfectly. Spent another two minutes there to properly wax my car. 

Then the other day I was rushing into town and wanted to wash my car quickly with their brushless automatic system, and on a car that is not too dirty this system has always worked perfectly. However my first time using it under the new ownership has proved to me that they have also taken the wax out of the automatic system as well. Even though they clearly state on their signs that they offer it and I paid for it. They are complete crooks. You are better off finding a new location as the current owners are only interested in taking your money without proving you the promised services.

I can't really figure out how this place stays in business. Tiny portions of food that you have to cook yourself. Why?!?! People were nice enough and we had no wait, but I'd much rather stay home and spend a few bucks on pancake mix. It was stupid hot with very poor ventilation.  Also, I would never bring my children here. It would be a disaster with toddlers and a hot griddle.

Was excited to try this place. I love Mexican food and heard this place was fantastic. I enjoyed the ambiance, but honestly don't understand why there is so much star wars stuff. The food is good not great and so found the food and drinks to be pricey.  My biggest complaint is that you have to pay for chips and salsa. Never been to a Mexican restaurant that makes you do that. Overall good but not the first restaurant I would choose on restaurant row.

Traveled the Country last year eating BBQ in Texas, Oklahoma and New Mexico on my way to the Grand Canyon love BBQ. Today had some of the best BBQ in New Orleans burnt beef end, Pitt beans, spoon bread and house made pickle all on point great job Central City BBQ
One of my favorite dining experiences ever. The staff was beyond helpful and friendly and the food was fresh and delicious. Highly recommend.
