Dr. Levine is fine. The office staff were terrible. Franky, especially. She has no courtesy at all. Everytime you talk to her it's like you owe her some money. Her attitude makes you disgusting!

This place is trash
Ordered from this place over the weekend 5 of us who ate the food puked 24 hours after eating violent puking was terrible 

My wife ate the food the next day today she spent the day puking as well

I cLled the restaurant and informed them a little bitch answered the phone and laughed in my face that my family got sick 

Called board of health and will be going down there personally when I feel better wanna laugh at me because your food made us sick you got something coming my friends 


DONT EAT HERE UNLESS YOU WANNA LOSE 15 LBS TRASH

Love this place; great atmosphere! My hair cuts are usually pretty simple, but I have Italian blood, and can be super picky about my hair. They really take care of you here, complimentary hair washing leaves you feeling fresh, and not like you have to go home and shower to get rid of the excess hair. Have never felt so comfortable while getting a hair cut. 
Up until a couple years ago I tried out several places around Sparks and Reno and just couldn't find the right one. This was my last stop an have been coming back here ever since. I'd recommend calling ahead to make an appointment, they do accept walk ins but can get pretty busy at times.
Amazing food & drink!  Service is excellent as well. Brand new. But awesome!  Sit at the bar at the kitchen.

Wow! Since the upgrade has been done it's great. Reclining seats and reserved seating makes for a stress free theater experience. The staff is nice. The place is kept clean. I like how they check bags yet not everyone is checked. They seem to focus on younger adults which is a stereotype. If you're going to check purses check everyone's. I'm all about keeping everyone safe!

My wife and I have been searching for a neighborhood bar since we've moved into our south city neighborhood. Many of the bars within walking distance aren't worth yelping about. When we stumbled upon the Purple Martin Saturday afternoon, we knew we had to stop in. After dropping our dog off, we went up for a drink before our dinner reservations and had a great experience! With neighborhood bars, I believe the things that matter most are a solid cocktail list and friendly bartenders - this place had both! The bartender took the time to find out what my wife likes and dislikes to be sure he suggested the best cocktail. She was impressed, as was I. We didn't try the food but will be sure to do so next time. We'll def be back!

We were so fortunate to have Dr. Jones as our vet for the past year.  One of our cats, Herman, had a bad bite infection on his rear, which she treated very well and led us through every step she was doing, making sure the environment was as stress and worry free as possible.  She is very kind, and very knowledgeable, flexible with her hours, and understanding.  You can tell she loves all animals by how gentle she treats them.  This instance was a house call, which we did a 2nd time for vaccinations; she came very well prepared for both times.  Highly recommended.

There is no place better for glasses. I just bought my 4th pair now in two years, not because they are not durable but because I love them that much. The staff is incredible. The prices are so cheap, I dont want to post in case other opticians see it and force regents prices up. This place is a gem. I cannot stress enough how good it is. The unique selection of glasses and the quantity they have can take you all day. They have an onsite optometrist that took me in within 20 minutes. THIS IS NOT A LIE, THIS IS EDMONTONS GREATEST OPTICAL STORE.

The 1905 salad isn't as good as it used to be, it's still pretty big though so make sure to get the dressing on the side so you can take it home. The Gambas al Ajillo and the red Sangria are still amazing though! And the bread is always nice and warm. My dad likes to take people here for business lunches and it's always packed. Make sure to make a reservation no matter what time you go, just to be safe!

This was one of the best dining experiences I've had in Reno! We took my out of town friend visiting from PA here as the basque dining experience is so unique to this area. We first sat at the bar to order a picon. The bartender (I forget his name but he had been there for 30 some years) was awesome. He made an terrific picon and provided a suggestion how how to drink it which was much appreciated as those buggers are strong! He also shared a good deal of knowledge about the basque community here and its history. 

Once we were ready to move from the bar, we took seats at one of the long family style tables. I let my friend know that he needed to prepare his stomach (I had been to another basque restaurant in town and know how much food you get) but what soon came even I was surprised by! 

You start with the softest yummiest bread and butter (I could literally eat the basket myself). You're served a large carafe of table wine and also out comes the soup. Split pea soup was the soup the night we went and it was enjoyed by all. Then comes a chicken dish which reminded me of chicken cacciatore. Wait, not done yet... then out comes salad... and a bean dish... THEN all three of us ordered the lamb as our entree and out comes a massive pile of perfectly cooked lamb chops. It was awesome. Somehow we managed to clean up. 

Great place to come and enjoy fantastic home style food. The quality and quantity you get for the price is unbelievable. If you come with a small group like we did, be prepare to sit with strangers but don't be shy. It's a great place to meet new people. We had a blast.
Decent pizza, but they got my order wrong 3 times in a row and constantly try to haggle with me on any kind of refund. I wouldn't recommend, unfortunately.

If in New Orleans this is a fun tour but they drop you by some local bars and ask you to buy.  Depending on who you are with this could be good. The historical tour is very good depending on if you actually believe what they say.
I never thought I would try duck but I'm glad I did I was blown away on how good the flavor was and the banana foster here was on point as well if your in town try both they were great.
Not big on sandwiches in general BUT I crave the sandwiches from here.  It is a bit pricey but it will not matter after you have a bite.  It is really good.  Will definitely be back!

I finally ate Zoe's Kitchen after many friends had recommended it and boy am I glad that I did! It hit the spot for lunch. I got the grilled chicken pita and pasta salad; both of which came out fresh and hot ( at least the pita did) and was the perfect amount of food. I'm very excited to come back, and plan on adding Zoe's to my list of regular lunch spots. Extra points for being healthy!

If you need an auto glass replacement, this is the place to go. I got quotes from pretty much everywhere in town for my '09 Chevy Colorado. Safelite wanted around $200 just to come out and replace the front windshield.

I went to the cheapest place in town, Tony's Auto Glass who quoted me $130 for parts in labor. I thought it was a great deal, but they do not take appointments (first come first serve) and they don't do mobile installations.

Dwight's not only matched, but beat Tony's price. I paid $125 and they were happy to install the windshield at the time and location of my choice. They also offer pretty good prices on tinting. Job was done in under 30 minutes. 


Summary: They can match or beat any price in town if you get a quote. Highly recommended.

Yeah, I'm not really a fan of Chuy's.

I came here once about a year and a half ago and ended up feeling kind of sick that night. I chalked it up to a weird dairy reaction, but didn't care about going back. Today, though, the office was excited about the spring-like weather and wanted to walk somewhere closeby. Cue Chuy's.

Cue meh-ness.

Chuy's offered a special "rapido" lunch menu where you could get one of about 8 entrees (with beans and rice) along with a drink and dessert for $9.99. The rapido menu also promised that they'd bring your food out within 15 minutes within certain hours. Before I could carefully look at the rapido menu, the server took our drink orders. I uncharacteristically ordered a Sierra Mist with no ice, since it was going to be included in the menu deal.

All of that sounded good, except once I actually got to read the menu, I didn't see a vegetarian option. I sighed and ordered chiles rellenos from the regular menu, and the menu said it came with black beans and white rice. I asked to substitute Mexican rice instead of white and was told this would be fine.

Despite not being on the rapido menu, my entree came out at the same time as the others. Unfortunately, my soda had ice in it and my rice was white. I didn't want to make a fuss, so I just started eating. My pepper had some veggies in it - spinach, maybe some squash or zuchini - and was topped with red sauce and cheese, but it was all very bland. There was no spice, and I couldn't tell the veggies apart. Likewise, my rice had no taste, and the black beans weren't very good.

It came time to order dessert, and we had our choice of sheet cake or sopapilla. I chose sopapilla, though I haven't eaten it yet as I had it immediately boxed to go.

There was a bit of an issue with the bills. About 8 of us dined, but Chuy's insisted on putting us all on one check. Some paid with cash, but quite a few of us had to use cards. That's all fine, but our server ended up splitting the checks evenly. For many people, this was ok - a lot of folks had the $9.99 special. However, some people ordered extra sour cream and guac (for an extra cost), and my entree was supposed to be $1 less than the others. Again, we shrugged and paid it, but we weren't happy.

I likely won't be back again.

Love this little hotel!  When my wife and I want a weekend staycation in New Orleans, this is one of our go to hotels!  Location is perfect, staff is very friendly, rooms are great.  Sometimes you might have some street noise early in the morning.

I hired Chef Christian to teach a class for my boyfriend and me as a birthday present.  I am not a fan of cooing and he thinks he's a chef in a past life.  It was the perfect gift!  Chef Christian was completely amazing - some great recipes and techniques.  He answered all of our questions from the most basic (how do you pick a good knife) to more complicated ones.  He had advice on proper cutting techniques, flavor ideas, etc.  It was a great night and he made me look like a fantastic girlfriend!  I am actually trying to figure out the next "holiday" to get him back in my kitchen!

Little hole in the wall 7-11 right down the road from another bigger (and better) 7-11. Weird. Tiny cramped aisles, high gas prices, and a bad spot (at a busy intersection of 7th and McCarran) where its very difficult to get in or out of this place. Meh sums it up!

I placed an online order 20 minutes before arriving to the restaurant. Upon arrival, i waited 10 mins before I called 4 times as instructed for a Togo order. The line rang and was not answered. I then went inside and was told that my order would take an additional 10 minutes.

We sat and waited until he car another 30 minutes before having to go back inside to ask for a status. I even tried to call again and the line just rang. 

When I went inside the statement was that there were a lot of online orders at once. I am happy that business is booming, however, don't have customers waiting on Togo orders for over 40 mins then say you had other orders to handle. We are already there.....waiting. 

I had high expectations and was severely let down that my business wasn't appreciated.
Amazing service, and a great time was had by all! Serena was on top of everything, and took great care of all of us! This is by far my favorite Flowing Tide.

Service was very subpar.  2 servers per 6-8 tables total that were in there and they couldn't even handle that.  Don't plan on ordering the $12 Sampler platter either; you get 1/2 of one piece of flatbread and if you ask for more, it's an additional $3.  When I went to tab out I gave the server cash and she didn't even bring me change, expecting after all of the above, she would get a 30% tip, which is the amount of change I would have received.  I laughed about it with my friends and didn't even mention it to her, because it probably would have taken her 10+ minutes to get back to me with my correct change and my ride was waiting.  Stay classy, Athens... Food was good though, I will say that!

I'm currently enjoying my bridal appointment at the nail salon next door. That's how baaaaad the service is....
They might have a large selection of dresses.... But the sales personnel is just...... let's go with extremely unprofessional. Manager/owner get decent sales staff,  "Bridal consultant" you.... oh well.... I got nothing for you.  I'll take my business elsewhere.  Extremely disappointed. I spend there less than ten minutes.

My wife and I stopped in for an early dinner, sat at the bar, and were cheerfully greeted as we sat down. Wife ordered a craft beer from their menu. I had iced tea. Server came back to inform my wife they were out of that brand. Switched, and were ok. Wife ordered a salad as an appetizer and wings. I picked fish and chips, cole slaw instead of fries. After a nominal time, the main courses came out, but the salad never showed up. Two minutes later, it was served. My wife enjoyed her meal, tasty and fresh.
My fish was a pre-frozen and lightly coated three piece serving of cod. No flavor and dry, freezer burned flesh, a statement more of the restaurant's purveyor than the kitchen. Tartar sauce was mostly mayo, also bland. Cole Slaw was limp, very lightly dressed and had a long refrigerator stay evident. I gave my food one star. Abe's has 21 TVs. We ask our served three times to change the one in front of us to a different channel. Never happened.
One and done with Abe's.

Good, strong margaritas. Not great. Waitress brought the wrong one. I ordered a mango. She brought lime. Didn't matter. Couldn't taste mango at all. Taco Tuesday and happy hour. Ordered queso and chips. Queso was thin and flavorless. You have to pay for chips and salsa? Tacos were good. Not great. Overall disappointed

Off the Cuff used to be my go-to place for all of my dry cleaning needs.  No longer.  Though their prices were not too bad for simply dry cleaning occasional dress shirts, the proprietor's attitude towards her customers is shocking.  

After several episodes of being verbally abused, the final straw was an altercation where she demanded that I know exactly when I planned to pick up a "to be dry cleaned" shirt.  I had previously told her that I would pick it up in "a few days," apparently on the incorrect assumption that this would not be a problem.  She began screaming at me and so I simply took my shirt and told her I would take my business someplace else.  She responded "fine."  I'm no psychiatrist, but I'm pretty sure this lady either (a) is bipolar (as I've had several disarmingly ingratiating encounters with her as well), or (b) has barely supressed anger issues.

Fair warning: only go here if you don't mind being creeped out and/or yelled at.

Stopped by for lunch during the Strawberry Festival and the restaurant seemed pretty busy.  We had a group of six and they actually had a party of six cancel which worked out perfectly.  We got sat right away and our drinks came out quickly.  For it being lunchtime however, the service was extremely slow.  Having a 13 month old with us, we were expecting the food to come out much quicker especially during lunch.  The baby got his food first and he actually basically finished his meal before we even got our soups and salads.  By the time our meals came out, he was ready to go.  

The food is sub-par for the price you are paying.  3 of the 4 adults got the business lunch special (2 courses for $21).  I started with the Signature Salad which was really good.  They don't allow you to stray from the set menu.  We asked if we could get the special they were running for the festival (strawberry salad), but they do not do that.  For the price you are paying, I didn't see what the big deal was.   Not like we were asking for a piece of steak as a substitute.  Salad for a salad.  Star lost for not being accomodating.  Husband ordered the She-Crab bisque and it was one dimensional.  He liked it but all I tasted was cream.  They really skimped on the crab meat.  Lack of quality will be a common theme in this review.  My sister got the Scallops and she actually left hungry.  The scallops were gritty and the dish itself was bland.  They do a great job plating though.  I ordered the petit filet and ordered it Med. rare.  It came out rare.  I ate it anyway since I didn't want to wait any longer for our food.  The server actually did not ask us to cut into our filets to make sure it was cooked properly.  My dish came out messy.  I barely had any onions on my dish while my brother-in-law had a pile of it on his filet.  The meat is not of high quality at all and was just grisly.  I absolutely love the vibrant colors of brussel sprouts and my expectations were disappointed when it came out and looked like limp sauteed bacon and cabbage.  For how long it took to come out, it looked like they literally threw my meat on the grill and took it off right away and threw the bacon and brussel sprouts into a sautee pan and threw it on the plate (5 minutes total of cook time is what I give it).

Thumbs up to the bartender.  We thoroughly enjoyed our Right not Left.  Perfect balance of bitter, sweet, and sour.  The muddled cucumbers and strawberries made the drink so refreshing and how can you go wrong with Patron.  With tip, our lunch for a table of 4 adults and 2 kids came to $200.  On the hefty side but we never have a problem paying this much when we actually get quality food.  Left walking around the festival feeling we would have enjoyed the food at the festival more and paying only a 1/4 of the price.  Save your money until the restaurant actually focuses on the quality.  Tricking people into thinking you are offering quality by charging quality prices is just straight up mean and disappointing.

This Trader Joe's blows.  It has nothing to do with the food, prices or hours.  But the staff has let the lines for the registers turn into a total clusterfuck.  Whenever I go in, the lines wrap around all the aisles and run out the door.  It's a pain in the ass to maneuver around and through the long line to get to any of the food.  People look at their phones, shop for groceries and shout at each other while in line.  This slows everything down even more.  

The staff let their own customers act like stupid assholes for too long.  Now it's near-impossible to fix and it's a shitty experience to shop there.  It's the closest grocery store to me so I deal with it.  But if you have any options, shop somewhere else.

So I've been coming here with the fervor of a religious zealot for 2.5 years now and am sorry to say I suspect there has been a change in ownership. The food is similar but in particular the general tso's recipe is a bit tweaked. Prices are still the same as well. What was more alarming was the change in staff. The last time we came after ordering, eating, and getting the bill we were told by the new waitstaff that they do not accept credit cards. I asked if this was a recent change because in the past credit cards have been accepted. They then stated they did have a machine but it was broken. We were short about $5 plus the tip in cash and I said I could run to an ATM and come back at which point they offered to 'try to get the machine to work'. Well shockingly the machine worked. The whole demeanor of the new staff is kind of sketchy. I personally felt like they were lying about not accepting credit cards and then it not working because they wanted us to pay in cash. The whole lying thing is no chill. Just be aware ownership may have changed -- it's now young man and woman working there.

Happy hour is great however their normal menu is outstanding! Service was great as well. We ordered four rolls, all delicious but the volcano one really stood out to me. I'd definitely recommend this place

This place has some pretty good Mexican food but the servers can be a little better. It is a tight squeeze but the food makes up for it. I have been here by myself in groups and with children and each time has been great

I consider myself a Mexican food junky. So when I heard that my favorite Mexican place (Mexico city grill) closed I was sad..... but we were craving Mexican so we came to Lucianas. We were sat quickly for a Saturday night, but then the wait began. We waited for over 10 minutes for someone to come even get out drink order. (Mind you they weren't that busy) finally we got drinks and ordered.... fast forward.... food came out.... uhh no silverware. So we asked for silverware. The waitress only brought one set  my wife and I just looked at each other like umm do we have to share? ‍ 
I ordered arroz con pollo it was delicious! The wife ordered nachos and they were super soggy. And they didn't put half the toppings on them. Needless to say we probably won't be back any time soon. 
Oh and PS their salsa is suppose to be "mild" and it definitely was not. Not for this baby  at least!!
Hip atmosphere, great servers and very good food.  Really enjoyed. 4 star means to me very good.

I went in for a last-minute eyebrow wax because I was getting my senior yearbook pictures taken. The whole process took about 15 minutes, and at first they looked great! But after a day, I realized that oh my god, she took off a chunk of skin from my eyelid. I've never had this problem before and I'm certainly not on any acne medication. Considering both Benefit Brow Bar and B's Boutique eyebrow waxes cost the same ($20, which is why I usually wax my own eyebrows), Benefit is the way to go for your emergency waxing needs.

Matt is a rockstar!!! He has worked on me for years through soccer injuries, general health issues, and many more. His vast knowledge of the space and general interest in my overall health has been incredible. Highly recommend working with him as he is not only extremely talented in this field but a awesome individual.

Great place. Lovely cocktail list with lots of bubbly and rose. The cheese boards are out of this world and the appetizers deserve to be meals. The mushroom burger and the steamed mussels were heaven and we can't wait to go back for more frites...and dessert!

Ate here with family tonight and everything was perfection, from the bang bang shrimp, to the wedge salad, to the fish & chips and blackened fish tacos. The service was wonderful as well. We will be back again and again.

Really enjoy this being open in the neighborhood.  I've been twice now and both jars have been delicious- I definitely recommend the chocolate bread pudding!  My only wish is that it was open a little longer- it would be a great place to stop for dessert after dinner!
Last meal before heading home. The best tamales ever great flavor very authentic washed down with a Heineken.  Pretty cool they have store attached as well as bar area

I love, love, love zoup! I've been to both the one in Glen Mills as well as Collegeville. I work in the area and eat here at least once a week. Some people classify it as "expensive" - it's comparable to any lunch I've gotten anywhere else. 6 bucks for lunch isn't breaking my bank, if you're that cost conscious stick with McDonalds drive-thru menu - you get what you pay for. 

It's always packed at lunch time - I try to get in there before noon, otherwise you may not get seating.
I don't like the smoke (not a smoker). I love the Leisure Kings. So I will sacrifice and let my coat smell like smoke to see those guys. Otherwise ... meh.

Their cakes are AMAZING! Best in the neighborhood. I've ordered 2 birthday cakes and also stopped in for cookies and other treats. Everything has been delicious and really unique flavors. The shop is also really pretty.

Knowing how much I loved their cakes, my mom emailed to inquire about a cake for an engagement party she was throwing for my fiancé and I. While I'm sure she was not the perfect client/email writer, the correspondence from the shop was absolutely disappointing! When she told me I was shocked so I read the emails myself, the the person she communicated with was down right rude and condescending. She did end up apologizing but I don't get it... not necessary. Please be patient with your customers. Also, the pricing she gave us for a 10 in cake in the end was $367? That seems off...? Disappointing customer service. Sad because we both loved this shop and their cakes, we are left with a bad taste.

Worst Experience I've ever had!!! Workers were making false accusations and when brought up to the manager he stated "it won't matter who you tell, nothings going to happen" on top of that we were being racial profiled got charged double to be refused service and to be harassed by employees. Definitely wound not be back!!!

Poor customer service.  I submitted a request on 7/15 and was told I would get a call within 24 hours.  That never happened and I have called every day since several times a day with not even a live person answering the phone.  Today I finally get through and the girl tells me they are booked out and cant help me.   I wish they would of gotten back to me sooner as I would of looked somewhere else.  

I could never do business with a company who does not answer the phone.  Never.

Love this staple of Fountain Square. Just got back for the first time in maybe a year and eager to come back again. Any time I've been for lunch, it's been speedy which is great. The Siam Ginger and red curry are my favorites, but everything I've tried here has been great. You can make any dish hot or Thai hot which I appreciate as a fan of spicy food. The old building and colorful decor are also a good part of the experience.

We came here to have a family outing as my daughter and her husband were in town.  We invited more family and friends to enjoy a Sunday afternoon with us.  We ended up with enough people to take up 3 lanes.  Glad we did it on a Sunday as there is only 12 lanes in the venue.  The waitress came by and took our food, drink, and shoe sizes.  She returned shortly with the drinks and a basket of shoes.  The food came a little later.  The waitress came by regularly to check to make sure we had everything we needed.  The staff was very accommodating as not all our guests showed up on time, but straggled on in.  Can't say enough how friendly staff is.

With all the socializing, we were able to finish 2 games with 6 bowlers on a lane in the 2 hours we bought.  The extra minutes at the end of the second game were given to my grandson and his friend to play some bumper bowl.  The men appreciated that there was a TV screen between scoring screens that was turned to a sports channel.

There was enough of us that we ordered quite a few of the items offered.  The food consists of small appetizer portions.  We had the wings, all 3 types of sliders (my husband really liked the pork belly slider with the apple cabbage slaw dressing), chicken & mushroom meat pies, the fries and waffle chips (which were a hit with the children), and a platter of bacon praline bites and fresh cookies.  Great finger food to nibble on while waiting for your next turn to bowl.  

Bottom line, the family and friends all had a great time.

I stopped by on a Saturday while in The Loop and was surprised how friendly the staff was, from the minute I walked in I was greeted with a friendly smile without being pressured. The store is small however that isn't a problem. Overall the concept is simple, they sell unique t-shirts and also have graphic designers available to help make a custom shirt should you not be able to find exactly what you are looking for. The styles range from local to pop culture, and are reasonably priced.

I did like that they had their own variation of the I  St.Louis shirt which instead of the , features a Cardinal. I believe that Urban Outfitters used to sell that shirt but I cannot find it anywhere anymore so I might have to have Baked T's help print one up for me! Much like GoodWorks is a stop whenever I am in the Loop I need to add Baked T's to my list so I can see what creative ideas they have come up with since my last visit.

1818 Chophouse is a true Gem!! Not only is the food fantastic, they come up with amazing new fresh ideas regularly! But the best part is the staff! Hands down the best people from upper management to the hostesses and bussers! They always display an attitude of whatever we can do to make your meal and dining experience better, they will do it! I honestly believe that the great attitude of the staff helps lift the attitudes of the customers! It can be packed and people are stress free enjoying a fantastic, friendly dining experience! Keep up the wonderful work!!

This place appears to be doing well as the lines are consistently long.  The kids who work there are hard working and friendly, but something seems off with the staff, like there was a guy with a gun hiding under the ice cream counter.  Anyway, after dinner in town, I stopped in on a hot night with my 2 daughters and let them order first.  After perusing the selection of unique flavors (flavors I've never heard of before) I asked the kid for a sample.  He said "sorry but we don't give samples."  For an ice cream shop with such unusual flavors, giving a sample or two should be a requirement! I asked "who made up that rule?"....  and there it was.  The reason for all the bad juju in this place.  The kid motioned towards who must be the owner.  So I asked them 'why - with so many flavors unique to your store do you not give samples?'  They blamed it first on Covid (while literally no one in the store was wearing a mask, including the staff or the owner)... and then proceeded to blame it on people leaving their 'sample spoons' all over the place.  Anyway, I can't tell you how the ice cream is because I didn't order any...sorry, not willing to pay $10 for a flavor I've never had before and can't sample beforehand because some other people left their used sample-spoons somewhere you didn't like.  This place isn't cheap, and there are too many other ice cream places nearby that want my business...

Outstanding French bistro. My wife thoroughly enjoyed her veal piccata and I as well the duck breast special. Both were served very warm with a delightful mix of vegetables. The oysters rockefeller and pate were superb appetizers and the deserts were outstandingly varied and delicious.The cafe is a real find in Tucson.
Horrible service, food was raw, (buffalo chicken melt) blackened wings were plain with no seasoning, fries were cold! TVS are outdated

No one is in the restaurant and they denied me service because I was one person. It shouldn't matter if I'm 1 or 10. You should accept anyone who wants to even come in. And the place is empty. Seriously??? Avoid

After years of La Reforma inundating me with cute branding and mouth-watering food photos, I finally got around to trying this place. I had high expectations and was ultimately disappointed.

If I'm being honest, this place is gentrified Mexican food, but not even cooked well. I had the sweet potato taquitos, roasted corn salad, mole duck confit, and tres leches. I will admit, the sweet potato taquitos were bomb and honestly tasted like cheese instead because of how sweet and creamy they were; however the rest of the food items made me sad and I don't like being sad after eating dinner.

The roasted corn salad had a dressing that tasted like watery ketchup with maybe a dozen pieces of actual roasted corn. The mole duck confit barely had any mole on it, and whatever spoonful of mole was on there it tasted burnt and bitter. The duck itself was dry. The tres leches cake was legitimately corn bread. It tasted like good corn bread, but not tres leches cake. There was no cream for it to soak in, and it came with some weird vanilla bean sorbet that tasted kind of sour.

Our food also took way too long to come out, especially the dessert. It came out a good twenty minutes after we had finished our meal which is odd because room temperature corn bread and ice cream don't take time to prep.

Sorry ya'll, but I'm not impressed. If you want some "edgy" spin on Mexican food hit up Rollies on the south side.

Small Hole in the Wall.  But the Chicken was as good as it was hyped.  I find the Nashville Chicken Sandwich better than Chick Fil A and Popeye's spicy chicken sandwich as they are freshly made and very juicy.  The wait was so so, there wasnt much space, but the food was good.

Please note the hours; they are open from 11am-9pm only on Friday through Sunday. A family run Pakistani Kabob place; really interesting find; We were driving around Manchester Road on Friday and were looking for something to eat and decided to try this place. What a pleasant surprise. We tried chicken boti and chicken karhai with Naan. We liked it so much that we decided to come back on Saturday and tried bbq platter. We have not found anything we didn't like.

Great breakfast tacos!!!!! I would get em every morning if I could! Place is quite "hipster" but who cares it's tasty!! It gets crowded and u have to wait in a decent line for donuts but it goes quickly! Great customer service every time I've been! The donuts are so fancy that it makes me feel less bad about my non existent workout when I eat them! :P definitely try this place out! :)

Since I have been in town this week, I have visited this location a couple times using their drive thru. They run a fairly efficient operation. The lines have been at least six cars deep each visit and they process the customers relatively quickly. I was impressed both times with the friendly staff.

This is, hands down, the best Gyro on the North side, and you get way more than you pay for. Seriously, it's enough meat for 2-3 gyros. I take the remainder home and throw it in with some pasta or some such the next day.
Disappointed! The person wasn't keen on doing proper haircut. Kept uneven sideburns. Surprisingly he didn't even noticed until I said. Too pricey for mediocre haircut.

It has been about one year since I have been to this location and it probably will be a very long time till I do again. It was terrible. Soup came out cold when it finally did come out our main meal came out with it. Two of the four meals were totally wrong. The Pasta Milano had not sun dried tomatoes in the sauce and I asked for extra. So the waitress brought me a bowl to mix into it but I sent it back because it was cold anyway. The sausage rigatoni with bolonegese sauce was actually pasta Milano with sausage instead of chicken. So that went back also. 
At this point we asked to speak with the manager and we were told she was too busy to come to our table. Can you imagine?  Never again.

No free parking but that's not the problem, the food is. Yuck!! Not good at all. Very disappointed in this place!!! Please don't waste your money!!!!!!!!!!! Found a hair in my sushi as well as bland food, rubbery veggies, hard rice, and the meat was not good... not a very picky person at all but this place is a forever no go!!!!!

I will start this review by saying I am not a barbecue fan at all BUT I absolutely love this place and every single thing I have ever ordered here!  Their ribs are absolutely amazing and fall right off the bone.  Then when you think it can't possibly get any better you taste their parsley potatoes and think you've died and gone to heaven!  I have been coming to Kojaks for over 10 years and making the drive of 40 minutes each time because it is SO worth it!  You should try it too!  Beware though once you try it nothing else will compare!

I stayed here for a Brentwood/Franklin business trip last month. The best part about this hotel is the location. The hotel is situated just off Carothers Pkwy. and International Drive which offers easy access to I-65 and the Cool Springs galleria. There's so many restaurant choices, and the hotel is about 10 miles south of downtown Nashville. The rooms were spacious and pet friendly. However, if you are allergic to pets, I recommend another Hilton property. I did not read the website, so 2 rounds of Benadryl later, I was ok! I did experience a minor issue that management fixed (hence the 4 stars in lieu of 3). The bathroom was not cleaned to the best ability and the guest next to my room was coughing so loudly I could not imagine getting a decent nights rest. Not only did they move me to a new room down the hall, but they also gifted me complimentary Hilton Honors points. The beds are super comfortable and there's plenty of complimentary parking. The breakfast was also good and equipped with standard Hilton property offerings. The only other downside is the technical issue with the TV. The front desk associate gave me a work around to fix this known issue, and all was well. Overall, if you're looking for a pet friendly, spacious, accessible hotel with large bedrooms just south of downtown Nashville, this is your spot!

We frequent this restaurant due to the wonderful staff. Ichiban is the best chef and his assistant So-So was amazing. I ordered the Chicken teriyaki and had so much food. I will definitely be back again.

Had not dined here in quite a while, but had lunch today for a birthday celebration. It was outstanding! I had blackened fish tacos with mango salsa, my husband had coconut shrimp. Both meals were very good. The highlight of our luncheon was the simply amazing lava carrot cake with vanilla ice cream. Decadent does not describe it. It was pure heaven in a dish. The service and atmosphere were outstanding. We enjoyed it immensely and plan to return soon.

I have rented about 100 cars this year so far but only 3 show up on points.  Why? Because enterprises software does not automatically include your membership number.  It has every thing else, like address and DL number.  Good luck submitting 100 Plus rentals for points.

First off French toast, 4 slices of bacon and 2 eggs and a glass of orange juice should not cost $24.  The wait was 45 Minutes because they only have about 7 or 8 tables.  The hostess should be real about the wait times.  10 minutes three times in a row is not acceptable!  Ice was at a premium, a glass of orange juice was 6 dollars, two slices of very thin bacon were 3 extra dollars.  The food took forever to come out.  I ordered over medium eggs and they might as well have been hard boiled.  My server avoided my table so that I went most of my meal with hot water and OJ.  When the server finally arrived and I asked for ice the server had to make it all difficult. When she brought the bill she was prompt in returning so that she could turn the table, get paid and move to the next victim!  The food was good but she was in hiding while the food was on the table I never got to ask her for extra syrup because my French toast had it sparingly.  I seriously think this would have been a much better restaurant if the server were better!  Here is the kicker, my wife and kids went several hours later for lunch while I was at the casino and had the exact same thing to say about this place.  My family read my review while at the table and said they would try the place anyway because of the yelp reviews thinking I was just having a bad morning.  They read my review but yet it is missing today.  So I'm writing one again.  Because they deserve the review they got.  If you bring it good I give it good, if you bring poor service and value you get what I got!

Food and friends is a great place to pick up beers togo while in the Rittenhouse area. Apparently you're not allowed to drink the beer on premise though. 

The selection of beer they have is as extensive as you can get with out going over the line into exclusivity. The prices are normal Philly prices and the staff have always been kind and helpful.

Quick little vacation.....Ca Dario was epic!!!  We got the garlic mussels, buffalo mozzarella, calamari.....great choices. 

Wait staff was excellent, very satisfied.  Location is in a shopping center next to a target, but who cares.  

The food is the show......enough said!

Great spot

Loved this place. Loved everything about it. It is relatively loud and the tables are close together, it also has the old school slightly-cheezy ambiance but the food is amazing and super reasonably priced. We didn't have a single bite of food we didn't enjoy.

Very disappointed with my PODS experience and it's not over yet! Moving from Longmont, CO to The Dalles, OR.  First, I was told one week before my container drop off date that PODS does not service the area I was moving to because it is 50 miles away from their main service yard in Portland, OR-even though I was initially told this was not the case!  I tried to find a moving company that could help in that short amount of time but it was not an option.  Second, I called last Saturday to ok the payment for the container to be shipped ($1869.00). Their customer service assured me delivery in Portland on the 23rd.  Since PODS doesn't service the area I am moving to I called movers who requested the weight of my container in order to quote a price.  I called PODS back and found that they could take my container weight for $40 the day after it arrives.  During this conversation I found out that "there was an error in shipping" and that my container was not yet marked to be shipped and would now have to be shipped guaranteed to arrive on the 25th-glad I called otherwise the container would have likely sat there.  Even though there was an error with shipping there was no error in billing me $1869 for the container shipment.  Third, while on the phone with customer service the woman decided to "do me favor" and see if they could drop the container any closer to my desired location.
 She found a yard in Clackamas, OR that is about 10 miles closer to me in The Dalles and asked if I wanted it dropped there instead.  I agreed only if it would not incur an additional charge.  She verbally confirmed that it would not and made the change.  This morning I wake to find an additional
charge if $207.74 to my card on file and they still have not shipped the container!!!!   Go with anybody else that you can for your move people.

All said and done, PODS looked cheaper on the front end but for where Im at now I would have saved money, time and physical energy going with Allied or another moving company.

OMG, this place is the BEST!!!  I don't use dry cleaners much anymore, as I seem to be living in T-Shirts and jeans...but I sing with the Indy Symphonic Choir and had an "emergency with a hem" situation.  As i'm new to the neighborhood, I'd called a few other places I knew about---all of whom were uniformly rude, or unhelpful, or just...basically, when they learned that all i needed was a hem, they quickly lost interest.  Unbelievable.

I noticed a distinct difference as soon as I called Curley's.  The man who answered the phone was almost shockingly upbeat and friendly, which is always nice...when I inquired as to whether they "did" hems, he crowed, "Of course we do!!"  Wow.  SO...I drove over there - the place was very big, by the way! - and the seamstress and her assistant were waiting for me.  We did the fitting right then and there; they were extremely helpful and sweet to boot.  Dropped the dress off on a Tuesday afternoon and requested it be ready by Friday, to which they responded "No problem!" and then volunteered that I could actually have it on Thursday.  Yikes!

This was all especially nice to hear, particularly after I called another establishment up on 86th St. - a joint that gets FIVE STARS on Yelp, by the way (a crime!!). The man who answered THAT phone was a major jacka**.  I asked if they did hems; he responded "Depends".  I almost laughed and said "On what?"  He said "I'd have to see it."  I said "Can you give me an estimate as to cost?"  He said "No."  I said "Are you kidding?  Can you at least tell me if it will be, say, $10 or $75?"  At this point he actually yelled at me!!  He said "HOW WOULD I KNOW WHETHER IT WOULD BE $10 OR $75 IF I HAVEN'T SEEN IT!!!"  at which point I hung up.  Ugh.  He's been in business "25 years" and this is how he behaves.  No, thanks!  Curley's all the way!!!

unreal! my wife and i ordered a pizza and it took 2 hours to receive it! and guess what? when we finally got it, the driver mumbled some incoherent nonsense and gave us our COLD and shitty ass pizza! what the hell is going on at this location? this has been the worst experience we have ever had with any pizza place, EVER. 

if you are craving pizza, you're better off eating a lunchable or putting cheese and sauce on a slice of bread than ordering from this "business." save your time, money and frustration. we will never order from any Papa John's ever again. whoever the regional or district manager is for this particular store needs to get their shit together and figure out how to solve this disaster of an establishment.

This is the absolute worst service you have ever seen in a restaurant! Servers do not write down what you order, bring the wrong food, after waiting A super long time! There is one book and one waffle iron for the entire restaurant so when our party ordered five waffles it took forever to arrive. In addition we can another day just two of us with a simple order and the wrong food was brought the first time after waiting more than 45 minutes

Stopped in for a soft, hot strawberry lavender donut while staying at the Canopy by Hilton. This location is basically in the hotel lobby but has a street entrance as well. Donut was absolutely perfect. The next morning we couldn't resist stopping in again for some fancy and classic donuts, and they did not disappoint. Chocolate cherry was probably my favorite.

The family that owns this restaurant also own the equally delightful Cross Culture in Princeton, and the food overall is excellent. Perhaps the portions in the Lambertville location are slightly smaller, but otherwise this is top notch Indian fare, prepared with ingredients you can really taste, and just the right amount of seasoning & heat. My personal fav is the Chicken Biryani, but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. It's all delicious, and the service is friendly & efficient. This is one of the quieter restaurant choices in Lambertville, tucked away on Kine Court, so you may not run into as many tourists as with other choices in town along Bridge St. But you will experience well prepared Indian cuisine, by owners who know what they are doing.
I love their iced mocha! Such a cute coffee shop and I love their mission to help those in need.
Surprisingly delicious Chicago-style deep dish pizza!  One pie was enough for us 3, might have to order a second if you are a party of 4.
I go to Milanos all the time - their pizza and burgers are wonderful - and service is fast and pleasant!  Prices are quite cheap, and they bring the food to your table!

...This place is okay. 

It's in need of renovating for sure. The dance floor setup has kind of an old "Dinner Hall" feel and out of the 3 times I've been, it's never been crowded/packed. Not the best djs...but I did see a pretty good dubstep artist one night. Pricing and bathroom conditions were fair. No issues with security. 

Not high on my list of places to go. Unsure if I may return.

The view 40 stories up is truly beautiful but the restaurant doesn't match up to it. Its attempt to keep the charm from its golden days comes across as stubbornly stuck in the past. Everything is dripping in burgundy except its "grandma's china" place settings. I don't mind that type of old world charm but it's not being portrayed correctly. It's a very odd mix of things that do not say fine dining. The old saying is "you can put lipstick on a pig, but that doesn't make it a beauty queen" well, Kemoll's can have a waiter serve cheesy bread in a tuxedo, but it doesn't make it fine dining.

The portions of food are large but the quality is poor. The prices are way too high for what they are serving. Mussels came to the table uncleaned and with broken shells mixed into the seafood risotto; the risotto itself was over cooked. When we brought up the issue of the mussels we got a brush off from the girl that picked up the plate and a "oh, sorry" from our waiter. Nothing else was said.  The manicotti was nothing spectacular at all. If you put it next to a dish from Olive Garden, I wouldn't be able to tell the difference. I make all of my own pasta at home and may have high expectations for true Italian dishes but it's unfortunate to pay so much money for lackluster dishes. However, the fried artichoke appetizer was unique and delicious but still not fine dining.

Our waiter, Billy's, positive and friendly attitude made up for the piss poor "I could care less about this stupid job" attitude the table clearring blonde woman was sporting. I looked at the dessert menu but passed; nothing really jumped out at me. After Billy overheard it was my birthday, he slipped a piece of chocolate cake with a candle in a to-go bag saying "you have to have cake on your birthday!". He was a very sweet and knowledgeable man.

Overall, Kemoll's is stuck in the past of a fine dining restaurant that they no longer are.  If they update and revamp some decor, lower the portions, and greatly increase their food quality, they can rereach that fine dining standard again. For now, I won't be back and would not recommend.

I wasn't going to write a review, and was just going to chalk it up as bad experience because they were short staffed. I gave them a pass for that because things happen and they just didn't have the staffing, but when there is a lack of effort given with the staff that's there then that's an issue. 

The place was fairly busy so we decided to sit at the bar. The food experience wasn't great, my steak was cold and they forgot to bring out my side items. I didn't have a problem with that, I understand things happen. They made me a another steak and brought my sides. The problem I have is that I left my jacket with a valuable in it on the back of the chair I sat at. I called and spoke to the manager, described my jacket and told him I left at the bar on the back of the chair. He said he looked and didn't see it. Mind you it was 15 minutes before closing, so the place was practically empty. I drove back up there and saw my jacket sitting right there on the back of the chair. It was pure lack of effort on the manager's part to not look, that's unacceptable. That's the only thing that bothered me. I was understanding on the short staff but the lack of effort is unacceptable.

Aside from that, the bartender was nice. She put in maximum effort considering it was short staffed.

This is a nice gym that is reasonably priced. I love that it is 24 hours and even at 3 AM there has always been someone else there. Around midnight, 20 or so people are, on the mean, there working out. I gave it four stars instead of five because their water fountain in the front has insufficient water pressure. Also, they don't have enough of the flat pull down bars for the huge 16 person machine. It's the machine that you see when you walk in. If you want to work on your triceps or biceps on that machine, there is only one or two short and straight bars that you can use on the machine's 8 different locations that don't have a chair or a bench

I love this place for its grungy diviness, its $2.50 miller high life ponies w/ a kamikazee shot specials, and the ecclectic mix of clientele.  I also like the fact that they let you bring in your own food, ie. a large pizza.

What I don't like about this place is the drunkard 40+ year old, saggy boobed, aloof, bitch-faced bartender.  When I went on  a Friday night, she was so drunk she almost fell over.  When I ordered a Miller High Life pony special, she sneered,  'do you want a Miller High Life pony?"  Um...yes, I replied.  She then slammed it down and said "the proper way to order this is to say I want a Miller High Life pony special."  Umm...bitch, that's what I said.  Then she had trouble adding together 3 specials and  gave me 10 extra dollars back (I didn't say anything).  She is also inept at pouring beers on tap...she wastes about 5 beers when pouring one, but don't get the beers on tap anyway...they all taste pretty flat. 

I will definitely still return back to this place...it's still a fun bar with great specials, despite the attitude.

Coolest bar in Nashville. Very chill house party vibe with a great large outdoor patio area. Super rad decor. Probably my favorite detail of the decor is the gorgeous stained glass windows and maybe the wall paper in the bathrooms, believe it or not. They often have a dj playing music, which adds to the house party feel. Music usually isn't too loud, so you can still talk without having to yell. Always a chance the night will end in an impromptu dance party. Good food and drinks all reasonably priced, especially for Nashville these days. Kinda hard to find at first, which I guess is the point. Kinda like a speakeasy I suppose. Feels like a house party, cause it is in an old house, but there is no sign, so you might walk right passed it a couple times.

OMG!! Where do I start? From beginning to end, this was a fantastic experience. Everything about this place was absolutely fantastic. I really liked the art on the walls! I wish they had this place in Flagstaff. They would be the best Mexican style cuisine restaurant in the entire city. There wouldn't be a single empty seat. After a very disappointing Thai food experience the night before, we wanted some really good food. The day had been great so far, and seeing how we were leaving that night we wanted to end on a great note. We couldn't decide what to eat then we remembered that Flagstaff doesn't really have any good Mexican food. BOOM! And the hunt was on. We walked so far considering that Flagstaff is only a fraction the size of Tucson hahaha. But not without enjoying the amazing stores, creative street art, and murals around 4th Ave. We finally asked someone where we could get some great Mexican food. She went to the back and asked a coworker who was Mexican. She recommended LA Indita. Turns out it wasn't that far at all. She said, "the service is a little slow but the food is amazing." In my experience those are the places with the best food! I would rather wait a few extra minutes and have amazing food. In this case, the service was prompt, friendly, attentive but not invasive. Absolutely perfect. The moment we walked in the cutest little girl came to our table and pursued to take our drink orders.  It was the cutest touch to a business I had ever seen. From there we ordered our food. I have eaten at so many Mexican restaurants that I am not easily impressed by them. First thing that stood out to me was, the chips and salsa that was served. I have never been to a Mexican Restaurant where they serve the chips warm. I'm pretty sure they make their own chips. They are very consistant in size and texture. The salsa they serve them with is so good. Not that stuff out of a container. So far I'm already loving this place. Me and my friend order the Thursday special, and the lady ordered the bean and rice burrito. Okay, I have had so many burritos in my life I don't even think of judging one. A burrito is a burrito, but I don't know what they put in their beans that make them so darn good, but Daaamn they are good. And the tortilla has actual flavor. Not just a hot tortilla. The lady was just saying over and over how amazing it was. I'm pretty sure she said it was the best burrito she has ever had... twice hahaha.  Me and my friends meal was just as good! The beans, the rice, the enchilada, but that green sauce tho! That sauce was something else. I would slap the Pope for some of that sauce right now. LOL!! Meanwhile that little girl is greeting all new tables that walk in and is just the most precious thing. She didn't even have a note pad. She was doing it all on memory. Just the fact that they are instilling her with a sense of work ethic was awesome to see. You don't get this kind of food and experience at a corporate, dresscode enforced, there way is the only way, 8 minute ticket times kind of restaurant.   It isn't some cookie cutter, chain quality food. This is from scratch, passion in every bite quality type of food. Honestly, if I would have had to wait I still would have given them 5. The food quality and the service style is just amazing. I think they ruined other Mexican food for me haha. Everyone else will be compared to LA Indita. THANKYOU for the phenomenal experience!

In trolling for a place for dinner while in Philadelphia for business, I came across this place.  What drew me in was the availability of poutine.  Not something I see everyday down here in the Carolinas.  

Service was good -- the waitress took excellent care of me.  The availability of beers was decent, with a couple of local offerings among the mix of domestics and imports.  As for the poutine (I ordered the bacon poutine), it was just okay.  It didn't really wow me, and it would have been nice if there would have been more cheese in it.  

Price point was about what I expected.  Overall, it wasn't terrible, but it wasn't awesome.

Stopped by last night and had carnitas, rice,  beans, chips, salsa,  pico and guacamole. 
Also ordered shrimp enchiladas with green sauce.

They have an extensive menu,  including sopes.  I hope to get back,  soon....

When I took a one-night trip to Philadelphia (early August 2006), I stayed in this hotel.  I found this hotel a good fit for me for that night.  I wanted to tour the city and I was a good walking distance away from the city.  beds were clean and clear when I arrived, and even when that wasn't taken into precaution, I was able to see the sun set and rise that night and next morning.  I could even see the Ride the Ducks operation boat enter the Delaware River from nearby.

It's a bit hard to find at first, but when you do try to find it, it's fairly easy to spot.  It's quite a distance from the nearest Interstate exit that links to this major Philadelphia route(I-95) but when you see the bridge nearby that goes over the Delaware River that is also I-95 that goes into NJ and you see Campbell Field from your room, it's quite impressive to look at.

The only problem was I had a top-level of the hotel- room(nosebleed section)-but, if you compared that to my booking options saying that my room had to have the slightly more costly River-View, I got what I paid for.  I didn't even expect that they would have a room for me, just a month before my trip-then when I get there having to use this particular room-after forgetting to mention my preferences over room placement?

If you're hoping to use their WiFi, make sure to pick up a single sheet for their secure wireless code that you'll need to login to their network-from their front desk.  I don't know much, but I think it's a one-day one night, single use code.

The staff was kind, gentle and nice.  Their complimentary breakfast was good, well stocked, and just overly great.  I had no other trouble with the A/C, but be weary that the parking is not free at this hotel.  Either way, being able to walk to all the major attractions in the historic district, was definitely a plus. 

The bad thing is, some of the major attractions that I was hoping to see nearby did not include the Stadiums of Philadelphia-Citizens Bank Ballpark, Wachovia Arena, Wachovia Center, Lincoln Financial Field, the former site of Veterans field, etc.(I did spot them later on my trip back on I-95, but that's beyond the point.

I had one problem with Philadelphia itself, but it's nothing that my hotel could have helped me find or organize-the ticket purchase place and boarding place(two different places) for the Ride the Ducks tour that I had so wanted to take that year was hard to organize and I didn't even ride it due to this issue.

RUDE RUDE RUDE wow I've never met such nasty management. My family and I went on a Friday night at 8:54 when they close at 10. The manager was annoyed at the time we came and was absolutely awful to my family and told us he didn't care about our business because "he's doing so well" - psssht! We left and went to Monster Golf where my boys had a blast! Stay far, far away from Golf Land!!

If they show up, they are fine. They recently increased their rates from $10 to $12 and didn't realize it. They frequently show up 30-45 minutes late so make sure you keep that in mind. They keep saying 5 mins, 5 mins and then show up very late.

The perfect place to be at the end of a full-day of wine tasting in the SB Funk Zone. With a wide menu of burgers, sandwiches, fish, salads, and beer and wine, it's always a comfy spot to hang with friends, or meet the neighbors. Also a good place to watch any of the hottest sports, or laugh along during any of their Stand-up Comedy Nights.

This is a little oasis for us.  My good friend and Yelp giant,  Michele R,  gave me the assignment to take my husband here. Aye, aye,  Captain!

The food is great, the service was excellent and both of these attributes are well documented by all the reviews.  Frankly,  I do not think you can pick anything but winners on their menu.  The complimentary popcorn is a thoughtful offering for munching on while you wait, but not me because I was all over the restaurant enjoying their artwork.

The big surprise (I knew Michele R knows good eats)  and the pleasure for me was the humorous and serious artwork on the walls. I absolutely loved the collection. 

Thank you Michele R.  You have earned that black badge + !

After walking by the Cafe Du Monde in the French Quarter I didn't think that I would get the chance to try a beignet. Although I was mistaken, this location was right by where I was staying and did not disappoint. I ordered a cafe au lait and a small order of beignets and instantly felt like I was in France. Luckily there was no wait for my order and the food was delicious !

This place is so tiny you almost need to squeeze yourself in with a shoe horn. Don't bother go for the cheap "cap prices" on the signs outside. The $3.99 is for one egg, potato and toast. Adding extra adds up immensely.

It needs a face lift, but the staff is nice and so is the breakfast! They did everything they could to fit us 7 as fast as possible.

We had the egg dishes on toast and burritos and it was a different breakfast experience. And good.

The place has a stressful feeling to it, being tiny and crowded and people waiting outside all the time. It gives you the feeling that you need to hurry and not occupying a table unnecessary long. Maybe not the best start for the day.

They accept AMEX.
What a fun event. Upstairs of the bar the host a cocktail/bartender class. Highly recommended. Fun event with an interesting spin on the history of booze in New Orleans

If you care about your animal, do not let them stay here.  My dog was injured here and the staff did not attempt to contact me when it happened, nor did let me know when I came to pick him up and pay for his stay.  When I got back into my vehicle I noticed he had a tear in his skin adjacent to his eye! His eye was droopy and red. Upon this discovery I went back into the facility to a red-faced staff member who admitted she neglected to tell me what happened.  This facility is understaffed and over-crowded with dogs.  

Admittedly I should have seen the warning signs of their neglect as a pet care provider as my dog picked up giardiasis (intestinal parasite due to lack of cleanliness) from this facility which took months and multiple veterinary visits to remove from his intestine.   STAY AWAY from this place.

Best Pho & Vietnamese cuisine in Reno, without question. Amazing food in a warm, inviting and well decorated atmosphere, with a friendly staff that cares and keeps the place clean. The Summer Rolls appetizer with BBQ pork is a must, and the Pho Tai (#2 Rare Steak Pho) is my go-to. No trip to Reno feels right without a meal here. So grateful to the owners Sang and Fiona for the care they put in to SF Kitchen!!!

Service was great tonight and our food was prepared extremely well, to our exact specifications. The night fell off a bit when we noticed the fruit fly infestation.  A couple more glasses of wine later it fell into a carnival game between my wife and I (very competitive) to see who could clap the most fruit flies.  I (husband) won but sad that we play this game at a nice steakhouse.  Also there is no hot water in the men's room, at best it gets to warm.  Hopefully there is hot water available for service.

LHD rocks!! Our dog Jimmy Dean absolutely loves it! They take excellent care of the dogs doing everything that they need (not like PetSmart and other big box type places). Nails clipped, hair groomed, gland cleaning/squeezing, hair clearance for defecation, etc. He gets to visit and socialize with the other dogs that are also allowed to walk around the back portion of the shop (secure location). He comes home with a bandanna on and a treat. He gets very excited about going! It's his day at the spa!

Do you like beer?  If your answer is no, then get away from me, weirdo.  If your answer is yes, then come give me a hug, you beautiful bastard!  Also, you will love Black Acre because they make damn good beer in a state where the bar is pretty high.  I have had my favorite stout ever here (Chai Guy), and numerous delicious IPAs.  They offer a small but tasty menu of a few appetizers and panini style sandwiches, as well as a different brunch option every Sunday.  You can also feast upon a sampler of some of the finest meats and cheeses in the land in the form of a meat plate, cheese plate, or a meat AND cheese plate.  I also have to commend the servers and bartenders because no matter how small or large the crowd, the service here has always been great.

Beer.  Meat.  Cheese.  Yessss!

Ordered delivery from here last week and it was pretty good. I really wanted Han dynasty but the delivery wait time was over an hour and we didn't want to wait. It turned into a good opportunity to try this place which is located a mile from my job. Delivery was fast and the food was piping hot. The shrimp fried was reallllyyyy good my only complaint is they didn't put any soy sauce in the bag and that's an absolute need for fried rice so I waited til I got home to eat it. We compared this meal heavily to Han Dynasty which we love and it's all legit expect the Dan Dan, the type of noddles used were skinny and flat and slightly overcooked. Other than that it was a solid experience and you can taste how fresh everything is, I'd certainly eat here again.

This joint has seen a much needed menu upgrade recently and it has paid in spades. Revisited the wing selection on a whim and found a drastic improvement from a year ago. Both the Mango Jamaican jerk and XXX Hot were incredible and cooked flawlessly. The jerk wings were bursting with flavor and the XXX were the perfect blend of fire, spice and sweetness. What a delight to find great wings much closer to home than the Railroad. 

It also doesn't hurt they feature local Stickman Brews on tap - not a bum beer in their stable. 

My only gripe - bring back the Frank Rizzo! Mmmmm.

I went for my birthday.  Steak was tender and cooked correct.  The sides were lacking in taste.  Creamed Spinach was bland.  The potatoes were just cut in to small squares and cooked they lacked taste and were disappointing.

In the spring my husband and I went here for pho and it was AMAZING-- the service was too. We do not live near by so we just recently went back for a second time. It was actually our anniversary so we were really looking forward to a special night with some delicious food. When we got there everything was off to a slow start. There were only a few customers there but we would wait and wait for server to come take our orders. When he finally came around he acted extremely annoyed when he had to do his job. We were so excited when our food finally came out. To our disappointment the pho was downright bland. The highlight of the experience and reason for the second star in my review was the drinks. My husband got a Vietnamese coffee and I had a Thai bubble tea and both were heavenly! I believe there still may be hope for this place but I certainly can't recommend anyone go out of their way for it.

A great late-night pizza spot.  We stopped in for a pie around 9pm-ish on a Saturday night and had no wait.  It was excellent!  Also pro: got a parking space right up front and there is my metered parking after a certain time in Indy so late-night dinners are great for us!  I'm a fan, but I'm also used to Chicago pizza so I'm biased.  It's def not Chicago style, although they have a ton of options to choose from and the service was fast and friendly.  

They allowed us to order 1/2 and 1/2 specialty kinds on the 16" pizzas so we took advantage of that.  As a bonus, leftovers! Our favorite was the Cajun chicken pizza, it was creamy and in my opinion that makes the pizza!

This is a good, basic neighborhood place for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  The service is always friendly and fast.  My kids love the pizzas and turkey avocado panini.  We get eggs and pancakes here on the weekends.  It's not a destination restaurant, but a wonderful little spot for the neighborhood.
Some of the best ice cream I've ever had. Waffle cones are delicious, very buttery. Unique flavors are all pulled off very well.

The food was pretty good.  Setup is like Moe's or Chipotle.  Line staff were friendly and happy to explain the process, your options and make recommendations.  Wound up sitting upstairs due to size of building.  Halfway through our meal we were asked to relocate to make room for open mike night.  The way it was handled was disappointing.  The staff member who asked us to move made no effort to help us relocate at all.  We had to carry our food and look for another table we could sit at.
Terrible French gel manicure. Looks like the first time ever attempted, went there at the last minute as my nail salon was booked.

My daughter and I have been wanting to check this place out for a while, so we finally stopped in for lunch one day.  The atmosphere is cheap-Italian; my 19-year old daughter thought it was nice, I thought it was a bit tacky.  The service was great.  The garlic bread was dry; we normally kill bread and ask for seconds, but we each ate one piece and called it quits.  The food was OK; nothing to write home about, but nothing to complain about, either.  She had spaghetti marinara and I had baked ziti.

I know peopole really love this place and it's a cardinal sin to NOT like Ted Drewes...however, I've had custard before and this is not custard.  Real custard is smooth, silky, rich, delicious....fake custard is milky and not anything special. I mean, don't get me wrong,  I had the oreo/heath mixture and I still ate it, but it just wasn't custard.  Wisconsin has real custard, Missouri does not.

We went to Rosita's for a Dine to Donate for a local club. [let me first say how much I love when local restaurants do this!]

Our server was attentive and knowledgeable of the menu. We quickly got our chips and salsa and our drinks. I had the arroz con pollo and it was delicious! Came out nice and hot and without cheese, as I requested. 

The guacamole was so good, too.  Nice and fresh. 

Our family enjoyed the atmosphere, the food, and the prices were very good reasonable. Thank you, Rosita's for a great experience!
Loved the food. You get large portions and it all tasted so good. A great place to celebrate those special moments.  The staff is top notch, very nice and very helpful. A great restaurant!

I liked this place when it first opened but it is truly just awful now. I've come in multiple times with my family and friends (because one of them wants it) and we always have terrible service with mediocre food - if that. If you're in the area, do yourself a favor and go anywhere else.

It looks like ice cream, and it SELLS ice cream!! How cool is that??  And it's goood ice cream. But its pricey ice cream-- and the teeny-boppers that staff it don't deliver on what the menu promises. Cherries, wet nuts, whipped topping-  all things promised via menu on our one or more of our sundaes, yet sadly missing when we ate them. 
The sundaes we had were quite yummy, with quality toppings- but when you pay 7 buck+ for a sundae, you want all that's promised!
Docked 2 stars for that.

I feel really torn writing this review. I started coming to Diamond Nails at the beginning of this summer and had nothing but awesome experiences! The staff were always friendly, they had a great color selection, and I always felt like the finished product looked great. Because of my good experiences, I decided to make reservations for a bridal party to all come together to get their nails done at the end of August (I am the maid of honor in the wedding). I called two weeks in advanced and made the appointments--five manicures and five pedicures beginning at 4:30 on a Friday afternoon. I made sure they knew that we were a bridal party and they said it would be no problem.

Well, it was a huge problem.

We showed up Friday for our appointments to find that the salon only had four technicians (not a big problem, though our confirmation said we'd have 5). However, all four techs were either at the beginning or in the middle of doing someone's nails. I get that Friday afternoon is a busy time of day for salons, but THAT'S WHY I MADE APPOINTMENTS! One of the technicians got me seating at a pedicure station where I sat for FORTY MINUTES before they actually began my pedicure. AND I WAS THE FIRST ONE THEY STARTED! Some of my fellow bridesmaids waited well over an hour for their service to begin and spent the bulk to that time with their feet soaking in cold water. It was incredibly frustrating. Instead of having a fun, relaxing afternoon like we'd planned, it became really stressful as we watched the minutes tick by knowing that we had somewhere to be at 7:30 and we were not going to done. 

I raised the point that we had reservations and needed to leave by no later than 6:45. The technicians assured us that they could finish all of our pedicures and manicures, which was a total lie. In the end, three of us didn't get our manicures because there was no time. One of us who did get her manicure didn't finish until 7:10. In the end, the work they did was sloppy because they were rushing to try and not lose our business, which really wouldn't have been a problem had they started when our appointment was originally scheduled instead of 40-60 minutes later.

I know this is long and it's the first negative review this place has received. If you go by yourself and have unlimited time, this place is great. HOWEVER, if you make a reservation, do not be surprised if you show up and they don't honor it, especially if it's at a busy time of day. I know that, despite my good experiences in the past, I definitely won't be back. They acted so unprofessionally. If you take appointments as a business, you better make sure you can honor them, especially if you take them for a large group. Clearly, Diamond Nails does not understand that basic tenet of the salon business, so I won't be back and neither will any of my friends.

We eat dinner at San Jose' at least once a week. The food and service have always been excellent. There are a lot of entree choices on the menu, so there is something for everyone. It is so nice to finally have a great Mexican Restaurant in the Land O Lakes/Connerton area. 

We especially enjoy the chicken fajitas and the taco salad. The tacos are also very good. The mariachi band on Thursdays is quite enjoyable as well. Anyone in the area should definitely stop in and try this place out.

We were so excited to experience it as a family. Way too crowded, for the $88 as a family of four its not worth it. Couldn't really take one good picture, people standing everywhere, Tropicana Field was selling beer inside...they had a market, food court if that's what you looking for. Ice skating is $5 for kids, $10 for adults. After 20 min in line for getting skates they decided to resurface the ice-everybody off...waited another 30 min. Looks great but couldn't enjoy it. They should do some crowd control, at least on the Ice rink. 3/4 of the crowd did not know how to ice skate / first time on ice!!! Not planning to return.

It's was great food as always. They did not receive a 5 star rating is because although people enjoy a nice long dinner with no rush sometimes not everyone has 2 hours to spare. We had tickets to a game which was in 2 hours and I barely made it to the game. Definitely not somewhere to go if you have any type of time constraint.
Food was on point. So good I went back 3 days in a row for breakfast. The staff was friends, and the customer service was exceptional. A must eat at spot when you're in Reno

Service is good. The food came out super fast. My tamales/beans/rice were barely warm. The rice and beans tasted okay. But the tamales reminded me of Costco's tamales. Which means they were pretty dry and bland. Also the salsa for the chips were not good ;-(

Last night, Christmas, my co-workers and I booked a reservation for 8 O'clock.  
We are a flight crew and after a long day of holiday traveling/WORK (being away from our families, just like those working in the restaurant) we were really looking forward to a warm comforting Italian dinner with exceptional service (which usually what you expect from a place like Buca di Beppo aka a place that thrives on being open during the holidays).
We showed up right on time and with no surprise they said they were running behind on reservations which we were totally understanding of.  
It was Christmas...we assumed they were short staffed & it was late, we get it BUT our understanding began to fade as we stood there waiting and continued to hear countless employees pass by us cursing and complaining about "STILL" being there.  
Our tiny bit of Christmas cheer after OUR long day of working on the holiday quickly faded and we soon began to question if we should even stick around.  
30 minutes past our reservation a host finally tried to seat us but as we approached a two top table (for 3 people) in a giant room full of tables covered in empty dirty dishes we each cringed... I'm not sure if it was because of the size of the table, the filth surrounding us or the fact that we felt even more away from home and alone standing in that a room but when she asked "is this ok" we all 3 very sadly replied no.
Another 10 minutes went by and we stood there continuing to hear servers complain... an exact quote from a server after she asked the male host if there were anymore reservations for the night and he said no was "Thank Fucking God".
We then were seated and by the saving grace of GOD the only server and person in that entire restaurant that we had seen for the past 45 minutes with a smile and that looked like she knew what she was doing approached our table.  We were quickly relieved.
