Her name was LIV and she was a doll.  She turned our entire experience around and allowed us to feel as close to home with friendly conversation and passionate concern that we were having a wonderful Christmas dinner, we could not thank her enough.
My only hope in writing this review is not to nag on those who were clearly upset about working on Christmas (don't worry I was upset I had to work too) but my wish in this post is that those people who were so miserable can learn from this and take after Liv's positive attitude and realize that their behavior can make or break someones experience and that they aren't the only ones making a sacrifice during the holidays.

Delicious!!!  Went there twice and is in love with the food especially the beef kababs, fetteh, and fresh warm pitas!  Food the second time was a bit dry, but the flavor and spices still tasted the same.  Love how they take late reservations up until 11:30pm!  Can't wait to try breakfast where many are raving about the rose pistachio cruellers.  Will definitely eat back!

I like Eureka. They have amazing burgers. 
I was happy the time I saw burger with fried egg because I remember my country, it's very common to have burgers with fried egg. Therefore, I enjoy that here. 
There are many things are hood for appetizer. You can get mouthwatering wings especially with buffalo sauce, and you can get mac n cheese, when you'll eat it, you'll say wow delicious. 
I like to eat tortilla burger without bacon, and with fried egg, or sometimes, I like to eat jalapeño egg burger. 
Tortilla burger is burger, jalapeño, bacon, kinda of cheese or sauce. 
My friend usually like to get cowboy burger. It delicious but I cannot eat it coz I'll get messy with it, but she work with it so fine. 
You can have fries ( good ), onion rings ( kinda big ), and other staff, but I like these two for the side. 
I don't drink, but my friends told me their beer is very good, and if you beer drinker, you'll like their beer.
I'm sure you'll like the place because it's very good place to hang out with your friends, and you'll be happy to give the waiters their tips because they are very very friendly and they'll be happy to serve you.

Wonderful fusion food. My family all got the three tacos and a drink with both chicken and beef. Garnish bar is incredible! Everyone was very satisfied with the food. Completely unexpected from the look on the outside and we'll be sure to return.

So much cute stuff! The front of the store is mostly clothing and the back half is books, household items etc. I would have bought more but I was only in New Orleans for a trip and didn't have room in my suitcase. I like that by buying here I was supporting a cause and would definitely shop here again. On another note the bags were really cute. They had little black paw prints on them!

As a self-proclaimed tea addict, I'm always looking for somewhere to get my fix and this place definitely fits the bill. The set up is relaxing, the tea choices are endless, and it's a perfect place to relax and enjoy a cup.

They have a good selection of board games and books if you want to be alone or have fun with friends, and I believe they have a quiet area for those looking to study or unwind. The service was outstanding. The woman who worked there came from behind the counter and explained all of their teas and gave me recommendations as well. I thought it was great that she was so willing to help given that I accidentally came in about 30 minutes before close. 

They have a kitchen for some random Asian inspired bites to eat and desserts for a sweet tooth, making it an all around one stop shop for students as well as working adults just looking for lunch or a morning break. The kitchen closed by the time I got there but the teas I got were REALLY GOOD. 

I ordered the Thai Tea and the Strawberry Matcha Latte and both were huge sizes, pleasing to the eye and delicious. I highly recommend anyone stop by!

I totally forgot to yelp this place. I came here for 2 bridesmaids dresses. The dresses were pretty but the customer service was awful. The first time my bridesmaid and I went it didn't take us long to find the dress. I mean it was the 3rd dress she tried on so we were in there maybe a half hour. Pretty easy right? So we order the dress and I take my other bridesmaid in weeks later so she can get fitted for her dress. We walk in, I grab the dress without any help (didnt need it, i knee what to get) and went up to the front to give them my name for our appointment. The sales associate looked us up and down and treated us terribly. Maybe it was my cat sweater or my cousins hand tattoo, I don't know but she was short with us, did not offer to help in any way except wait directly outside the dressing area and ask if we were done. I asked her for a clamp to tighten the dress and her reply was "are you buying it?" I felt absolutely terrible as this was my younger cousin's first bridesmaid experience and it was supposed to be fun. This lady has a job to do and I thought I made it easy by showing up on time with the dress picked out. There was no sales on her part. I was married back in May and everything was so great. You always have the negative but this kinda stayed in my back pocket. It was therapy to write this review. I only write positive reviews but this broad really upset me. I'm glad I got my wedding dress somewhere else.

Weak drinks and terrible attitudes from the staff. We had arrived early to New Orleans and could not check in until an hour after we had breakfast at Mothers (which was delicious and service was AMAZING!) so we decided to stop by here since it was close to where we were staying. Nice girl sat us at the bar. Bartender took both our drink orders (no smile or hello of course). It got ugly when she came back for our food order and we politely told her we were just having drinks. She gives us a disgusted look - immediately turns to the girl that sat us and says, "I want another table because they're ONLY ordering drinks."  

I bartended and worked in the restaurant business for 11 years before the career I am now. She could have been friendly and we would have stayed and had more drinks that would have resulted in a much bigger tab than a couple sandwiches could have been. Instead we finished our drinks as she shot us dirty looks and left. Strangely, I still tipped her well - seemed like she needed it more than I did. Lol

The perch is my new favorite eating spot in green hills. I love how I can walk in at 3:30pm and order an omelette and waffles. The ambiance was very relaxing and quiet. The omelette that I ate was to die for and the fruit salad that I ordered was fresh fruit. I highly recommend stopping by and eating at The perch.
At the time of this review, the venue was closed due to renovation.  We drove 2 hrs to find it closed, website seemed to be behind the times.  Will try again, soon.

Sadly, this place is usually great, but today, Friday, May 1, 2020, things were bad. I went to pick up a three item combo for my family with the same expectation of great seafood at a reasonable price, but when I returned home, I noticed something was wrong with the fish. They smelled like fecal matter and ammonia. Those smells are normally associated with unclean and rotten fish. I grew up on the bayou, so I know this smell. Someone on the team cooked and served rotten fish.

I'd never experienced that from this place before, and I thought to alert the store immediately of the problem, so no one could get sick from Ciguatera or Scombroid, because when I first purchased food there based on a friend sharing their meal, one of the employees prided themselves on having a great establishment and hoping to be able to keep up with the new customer demand. I didn't want to see their business go down, let alone have anyone get sick, especially with Covid-19 going on, so I tried called the store.

Unfortunately, each time I called, I was sent to voicemail, and as I began to leave a message, the phone was hung up. I tried three (3) times calling the number ending in 1206, until I went back to the website and tried calling the number ending in 1207. When I tried the secondary number, I encountered the same problem.

I'm not sure if it was the staff from the 10:30am to 8pm shift that worked today, but I feel really sorry to have to write this review. I just don't want anyone to get poisoned, and sadly, answering the phone just once would've helped with this situation, instead of making it this public. I hope the staff that did not cause this dilemma understand. No one deserves to be sent to the ER, because someone was completely irresponsible or just didn't care enough for their customers.

I'm providing a link to Poison Control relating to food poisoning from fish. Hopefully, this will help some who received food from there between those hours. I'm not sure what happened, but I hope it can be resolved and no customers get hurt from the employees ignoring my phone calls.

https://www.poison.org/articles/2009-jun/what-you-cant-smell-can-hurt

Great spot.  Clean look, great food.  I took my son and daughter and they both ate the wings.  I had the sausage and it did not disappoint.  I plan to go back and try some pulled pork and brisket.  Very friendly.  Simply put,  a great place to go for BBQ.
I've bee here before he put me in the worst situation , match my sideburns to my beard now, I'm bald with a crooked porn stash ? Any thought it was funny

This place is...AWESOME!!! I haven't been here in a few months, but I used to frequent this place on a regular basis when I worked on 202. All of their food is great, the atmosphere is great, the owner is great (and is always there)...I'd eat here every day if my wife would let me!

PS: They have Coke in glass bottles...epic!

I liked the variety of coffee and tea.  The french press for the coffee is nice as well, and I liked that it was a stronger flavored coffee.  Though I didn't like that the tea was labeled as loose leaf tea, but came in tea bags, a minor gripe... but a gripe.

I ordered the Big Easy Benedict.  It came with fried onions, avocado, chorizo and  cajun hollandaise.  It was very good, but the egg was a little over cooked for my liking.  The dish was otherwise well thought out, the flavors went well together, and I like that it comes with a fruit cup (all the fruit was juicy).  The potatoes were a little soft for my taste, but my romantic associate likes them like that.  She ordered one of the skillets, which I was less impressed with than my Benedict.  It just seemed sort of plan in comparison.  The pesto infused skillet looked interesting, I'd like to see some of that pesto make it's way onto some of the other dishes.

The server forgot our order, so it look us a little while to get our food.  They compensated us with some chips and salsa, maybe something else as well.  

No alcohol at this brunch place, not really sure if it is a BYOB either.  Someone call and check.  I'm not going to.

I travel from Houma just for their Boudian and Boudian balls. I am a cajun and because of that i am very picky about my cajun food. This guy is from my home city which i didn't find out till we stated talking about were he gets his Boudain from. The prices are not over priced and so far this is the only place i have found Boudian in N.O., and this is as much a staple for us locals as crawfish and gumbo. The staff is very friendly and you feel like you just walked into Cheers, they make you feel as if they known you forever. And as a local thw main questions we ask each other are how's your momma and how's your daddy. So to have this feeling in the "BIG CITY" is very nice. Love going here and can't wait to come back again.

Now I know what it's like to work out in a prison. First of all I had to pay to valet park my car. Second, the layout of the place is a nightmare.What were they thinking? The equipment is junk, the place is dark and depressing and the weights are everywhere. A group of punks hung out at the one adjustable cable crossover for over an hour like a pack of wolves guarding a carcass.  Do yourself a favor, Stay the F away from this Shithole.

Let me start by stating that I'm nowhere near a connoisseur of fish. They all taste the same to me. So take my review with that in mind.

I really didn't know what to expect upon coming here except exceptional tasting fish, as majority of these reviews say. It's a cute little cabin-looking place, which makes it feel less like a restaurant. I'm not sure why, but I was expecting more on their menu than what was there. But hey, stick to what you're good at: smoked fish. The dinner platter fish choices are salmon, mackerel, mahi-mahi, and mullet. Like I said, I don't know anything about fish, so it's not like I can tell you the difference among these. So, I let my dinner partner choose the salmon for us.

The platter is big enough for two to share. It comes with coleslaw, potato salad, onion, tomato, and two sauces. It's an additional $2 if you want an extra plate when sharing. (Seems a bit pricey for a plate, silverware, onion, tomato, and 2 small sauces.) The fish itself was NOT hot, as I expected like other restaurants, but I let it go. The taste itself was pretty good. You can really taste the smoked-ness of it. The waitress didn't really explain what the sauces were, just that they were both varieties of horse radish, one spicy and the other not. I liked the not spicy one. I think I read on some reviews that the German potato salad was supposed to be warm? Ours wasn't, but still good enough, I suppose. 

NOT convenient is that they take cash only! For a business that's been around for 50+ years, I couldn't think of a reason they wouldn't take card. It's small, yes, but seems popular enough among locals and tourists. 

So, really, I'm glad I finally got to taste the fish the town's been talking about, but I probably wouldn't go out of my way again to eat there.

Went here for breakfast. The place was packed so there was a 45 minute wait. I had the Chicken Biscuit with a sunny side Egg and gravy, with a side of Home fries. Breakfast was great. The biscuits were fresh and fluffy and the chicken was flavorful. The Gravy add a delish mess to the biscuit. Was everything I was looking for a breakfast. Will def visit again when I come back to Nashville.

We visited the gold and diamond source and were pleasantly surprised and pleased to have met the owners but also to have met some wonderful people. They treated us professionally and the owners were relatable. We walk away with a beautiful setting for a beautiful diamond we had, and even bought our 10 year old son his first gold bracelet. I can not tell everyone how happy we were and are. They have made us their lifetime customers!!! Exceptional service and varied selection of jewelery.

I hate to do this, I know folks will hate me for it, but I was simply underwhelmed here. I was so looking forward to my visit here, but alas it will probably be my only visit. 
The best thing here are the shrimp Rangoon... they are absolutely delicious, light crispy, tasty, by far the best thing tonight. Some of my friends also enjoyed the egg roll. I did not get a chance to personally taste it, so I'm taking their word for it. 
I had the fried rice and found the whole thing to be heavy on the salt, yet still somehow lacking in taste. It wasn't the worst thing I ever ate, but nothing to write home about either. 
The bone broth was weak and bland... nice presentation and such, but the taste didn't keep up.
Several folks ordered the green beans and the common consensus was that the beans were overcooked and just nothing special. 
The little rice cakes, while nice to look at, were like chewing on some kind of rubber creation with very little taste. 
The drinks were pretty good. I liked the different creations here. 
I found the interior quite appealing. Nicely done. Romantic dinners here with the dim lighting... unfortunately so dim, we couldn't see what we were eating, the details hidden in the dark. Some of us actually pulled up the flashlight function on our phones just to see what we were ingesting. 
Service was good and efficient. So kudos for that.

Their animals are well taken care of, and some of the staff are great !
Prices are fair and you leave with ample information about your new pet.

i have been coming to the taste of india buffet for a decade.i have rarely ever been disappointed.the food quality is always consistent,the service is good and the kheer and chutneys are to  die for.i have introduced many people to this hidden gem.

Decided to check this place out and I was really impressed! The owners were more than kind, they went above and beyond to help me pick the perfect plants. I was looking for something to hang my plants with and again the owner went out of his way to find me the perfect device! On the inside there are locally grown fruits and vegetables and the outside has a large selection of plants and trees. If you live in East Nashville or are passing by, check this place out!!

I've been going to Mayers for years, since Kevin ran the place. Back then I never seemed to have an issue. I tried to pass along the loyalty. In recent years I've had to take cars back over things that should've been taken care of the first time. I realize that these things can happen with cars but, when I bring in a car that's leaking and get it back (-$600) later that day still leaking, someone is not very thorough. Prior to that I brought a van back 3 times to repair the AC, I was charged every time and it was still room temp in my van. Part of me wants to go back regarding the recent leak and have them repair it but, I see it somehow costing me more money, just like the AC incident. I shouldn't have gotten a car back leaking power steering fluid and they should be thorough when evaluating these things. Fix it right the first time!

I just ate the most amazing burger from this place. You can just walk in and order and they will cook it right up. Only takes about 10-15 min. The roll was fresh, cheese melted to perfection, the fries were pipping hot. And the prices are very reasonable. The staff is super friendly, and know a lot of people by name.

Today I hit the jackpot!    I found Honey Bakery!
I have been told by many that I would NOT find
A good Dim Sum Restaurant in all of Reno  for the past 3 years.     Well that may be so BUT I have found a Bakery with Chinese baked goods AND
A GREAT VARIETY OF  Dim Sum.     First of all there's  plenty of parking.     The place doesn't 
open at the crack of dawn.   It opens at 9:30am.
They have a busy time usually lunch time.     The baked buns are fresh with a big variety.    Sweet and savory meats.     The Dim Sum can e fresh sealed OR you can take it home and steam it to your time of need.     Pretty traditional.     I was told you can also order some delicacy's .     I'm in such a happy place today that I'm still smiling!  I will be back!!!!!    BY THE WAY,  don't go in looking for doughnuts!

Was there last week had the best time ever never imagined a place like this existed in New Orleans. One off my best friends out of Nola told me about this place so I decided to check it out for my self. The atmosphere is killer the Asian themed tapas are top notch so bad that I'm craving the black cod all ready. (Tip of the day : at this place / BLACK COD)

If your into scenes and crowds this is the place to go really I've met some of the coolest people ever here. 

Just check it out for your self if I was a local this would be my place.

I have heard about these cookies from my husband who plays ultimate frisbee with Jake. Of course, he has never brought home any cookies for me to enjoy so I had to wait until the storefront was open!! These cookies are excellent!!!! 
I'm usually very picky about cookies, especially chocolate chip since I love to make them at home, myself. Jake's chocolate chip cookies may have mine beat! They were sweet without being overly sweet. They had the perfect texture and shape. I could easily eat far too many of them!!! 
I also had the chocolate, chocolate chip cookie, which are usually too sweet for me, but Jake's were perfect! Great texture, great flavor, great size, great everything! haha!! 
I'm pretty thankful I don't live close enough to get these everyday!!! I would end up gaining so much weight! haha!!

We recently had a 6am flight home from Saint Louis, so decided to stay at the Hilton St. Louis Airport.   

Pros - super close to the airport (5 minutes - only because I hit a red light), comfortable beds, and good service.

Cons - run down, broken, and even gross rooms.   I'm a loyal Hilton member, and choose them due to the generally consistent standards that I've come to appreciate and enjoy over the years. 

The staff was a pleasure to work with, and when I truthfully responded to my how my stay was, they generally seemed sorry for the disappointment, and offered to remove my parking charges and provide me a large amount of HHonors points.   Of course, this was after they mistakenly added almost $40 in internet charges. 

I doubt we'll be back, but if you just need a place to crash briefly overnight that's quick to the airport.... I guess it's okay.
I have been a fan of Trader Joe's since I lived in Arizona.  I was thrilled when they came to Florida.  One of my favorite grocery stores!
Good eats no matter what time of day! Waitstaff is ostkly Alabanian and all are good..! A place to relax, eat & enjoy the day no matter whyat time you are there!

I have been playing here for many years. The course is very nicely laid out for all levels of player, and the staff is generally friendly, helpful, and welcoming (well, there is one miserable woman who is periodically at the counter who doesn't seem to understand the concept of being pleasant to those who are patronizing a business, and is quick to make you feel small and uncomfortable just for being there.  Thankfully for the course, she's not always at the counter! Rumor has it she's related in some way to a former owner...entitlement is no excuse however).

This course provides a great bang for your buck, as the fees are comparably reasonable, especially since the course is in good shape and well maintained.  I took a star off because the cart paths could really use some TLC.  You bounce around quite a bit when traveling on them with a cart.  Also, a drawback is that they have banned carts from entering their parking lots.  That's very inconvenient after a round.  I, for one, don't feel like schlepping my bag back to my car. I want to drive to the car with the cart, unload, and return the cart.  Every other course allows it, why not Westwood?

The restaurant has been good every time I've eaten there.  The facilities, locker rooms, and bathrooms are always clean. 

Please consider patronizing this local business if you're near Gloucester County.
Every time I walk into this Starbucks it's so busy! But I noticed they still manage to get so many drinks out! Great job Jackson!!

Great food.  Good vibe. 
Nice restaurant with good prices and is pretty quick if you need that. Mix what you want for your own creation or order from the suggested combinations. Have been here a few times and the food always tastes great. A few tables outside for both indoor and outdoor seating options.

Excellent!!! I am a single female and moved a one bedroom from one apartment to another on May 18 - Cash and I can't remember the other guy's name did such an INCREDIBLE job. They were ten minutes early, called me Ms. Katie, laid down floor protectors, put everything where I wanted it, and worked quickly! They also bill quarter hours so I didn't have to pay for time I didn't use. Seriously thank you!!! Even referred them to a friend!

A hidden gem. We loved this place. Food was terrific, but the service was top notch. The beef pavilion style was sooooo good and the chicken spring rolls. Next visit to SB this place is definitely in our comeback list. Highly recommended.

We stopped by this bar during our visit to Nashville because the crowd looked super leveled and yes everyone was just having a good time. The crowd was older because it was around 2-4pm on a Friday. But it s great, no crazy stuff. First floor seatings are first come first serve. You have to do a RSVP for 2nd floor seatings but you can do it on the spot. When we were there it was about 15 mins. Drinks are alright but their Southern Poutine is SO GOOD. The combination of the pulled pork, tatter tots, and the cheese curd just hit the spot! Definitely order that to share!!! Toilet was clean. I would certainly recommend this place for small bites and to warm up before you enjoy the crazier part of the Honky Tonk!
The food was pretty well portioned and tasteful. I highly recommend this place for a try.

If you care for your personal property, please stay away from Titan Moving Group. They moved my belongings from Miami to Los Angeles, and just about every piece of furniture was damaged as it was transported without any protection whatsoever. They basically just put all my furniture unpacked and without any paddings at all inside a truck. Even the guy who helped unload everything said he had never seen such a thing. All my things were damaged and some were even never delivered! And the worst part, I was offered $175 as a settlement amount after a 4 month ordeal of just trying to have someone respond to my messages. SCAM is the only word that comes to my mind. These people just partner with low quality movers like David and Golliath and they just wipe their hands clean when things go wrong.

Just checked this place out for the first time. Love the vibe. It's hip. It's urban. It's everything a new downtown restaurant should be. On mondays and thursdays apparently they do a few of the cheaper rolls for half price, so we definitely took advantage of that. We also indulged in the crab-asiago w/ Naan appetizer which was good. I give it 3 stars mainly because the normal prices are pretty high for a sushi place, and the service was fine but not great. I'd give it a half star bump if I could. Aw screw it I'll give it 4 for trying.

Our spontaneous trip tonight to see the Circle of Lights did not disappoint. I highly suggest going on a weeknight before the schools go on holiday. Much fewer crowds and easier parking. Plus when you visit South Bend Chocolate Café (a holiday must) you won't have to wait in line for forever! 

Fun fact: Back in the 80's they used to ice over the water in the monument and open to the public for ice skating! Wish they still did that!

I was super excited to try this restaurant out. So me and my family came here for my mother in law's birthday and we had an amazing server. Her name was Francésca (Frankie) and she was an absolutely amazing server. Her service was impeccable and her mannerisms were absolutely amazing. The food on the other hand I wasn't satisfied with. My son and husband both had either over cooked or under cooked steaks which were immediately rectified by the way but that wasn't a great first impression. Other than that we had great food and a great time

Omg the service here is wonderful... I travelled here to New Orleans from NJ and cracked my screen.... The service here was speedy and they even fixed and additional repair understanding my circumstance which saved me a lot.  So friendly and soothing environment with great light music while I waited.... This is the place to fix your phone... Save your money from those phone companies

This is a gentlemen's club that pretends to be a sports bar.

There are other PT's and the other reveiwer is talking about the PT's Brooklyn location and this is Sauget.  This is the "sports bar" themed gentlemen's club.  I have not complained when I was told I was going here even when sober and someone else is willing to pay entry fee.

This place is expensive, but the entertainers are beautiful and wearing usually just wearing just thongs (with $$$$...)  More of a sport bar hangout, but some beautful girls (even waitresses).

I do have friends who wife's take them here for birthdays.  Usually followed by the statement "I love my wife!"

Bring lots of cold hard cash or pay ATM fees.

I am thrilled that Hop House is offering vegan jackfruit Tuesday tacos! They are delicious and I'm so thankful that I get to enjoy BBQ again. 

Now to add a daily jackfruit BBQ san

I travel to TPA occasionally and stay downtown, it was great to see another sign of normal life:

Buddy Brew Park Tower is OPEN again! 

They are gaging demand and trying to figure out what hours will work.

In the meanwhile, this great coffee shop is serving up what you need. Me? Today?

Giant oat milk latte
Avo toast
(Some socks as a gift for a friend with feet)

The coffee and toast were excellent and the staff was friendly, skilled, professional. The vibe is fun and chill.

Did I mention the dog on their logo looks just like ours? Five stars just for that. JK. Love this spot. So happy it's back.

As an Italian girl from New York I  always a bit skeptical In regards to eating Italian outside the home.   This place is phenomenal from the bakery to the expresso martini and chicken parm.  Great job amd.thank you for a wonderful meal

I had a very pleasant experience with these folks.  I called to get a quote, found the price to be good, and within 15 minutes they were at my house.  They also caught a smaller, previously repaired chip that was coming undone and they repaired that for free.  All very professional and nice!  Would highly recommend them to anyone.
Best tacos, best margaritas, free shots for cinco de Mayo and if anyone says otherwise they are lying. NAME ANOTHER PLACE IN NOLA YOU CAN GET FREE CHIPS AND SALSA. You can't? Yeah. Exactly.

This place was terrible! The food was bad, the service was bad. It was empty when we got there so that should've been a sign. The drinks tasted bad. The servers were fighting, and the managers were incompetent. Our food was cold and the waitress threw it out without telling the cook to make more then just walked out and left. Just don't eat here.

Full disclosure: I've only eaten here during the weekend buffet that they do (I think that this is actually Friday-Sunday, either out of a misunderstanding of the concept of a weekend or as part of a conscious effort to defy it) because home is the southerly parts of Pinellas and, given the existence of thirty-some miles of miscellaneous urban nonsense between where I am and where they are (I need to take three interstates to get here, each more stultifying than the last), it might as well be in one of the Dakotas, or else some forbidding slope in Kamchatka, where the wolves howl and the night does not end. Thus, I've never been here for a normal meal and ordered a normal item off the menu like a normal person. But I've been to the buffet many times, since the place is right across the street (or *almost* just across the street) from Lettuce Lake Park, a lovely place to wander and gawp at the alligators and weird birds for the princely sum of $2.

Utterly full disclosure: If I have any tiny trace of blood from the Indian subcontinent, it's been so diluted and diffused by generation upon generation of angry people who make angry-looking buildings that it probably now couldn't fill a grasshopper's coffee mug, and I'm pretty sure that I've never been within three thousand miles of Delhi. So I have no claim to judge what constitutes authentic Indian food of any stripe, and anyone who does should feel free to snort contemptuously and consign this review to whatever part of their brain they use to store voicemails about extending their car warranty or the phone books that regularly land in their yards and absorb rain and reclaimed water until they're a soupy mess.

But, even given the above caveats, this very well might be the best Indian restaurant I've ever visited. I've had a long and checkered career of visiting Indian restaurants, from the dismal downtown buffet where you eat too much chicken tikka for no discernible reason (it does not spark joy or create satisfaction, but still you keep eating it) and enter a state of such profound drowsiness that you immediately understand that you will never get anything important done for the rest of the day, to the smalltown restaurant putting on airs with white tablecloths and silver where the most complex item on the menu is saag paneer, to the grotesque and misbegotten Midwestern late-Fifties steadily-collapsing concrete-and-sheet-metal monstrosity where beef vindaloo (???) is on the menu and the servers mispronounce the names of dishes with the insouciant confidence of the utterly damned. So, whatever mitigating factors might be in place, I stand by my pronouncement.

The buffet, and the menu in general (which, again, I haven't sampled at length, but have browsed) seem to make reluctant concessions to American taste, offering some of the usual suspects (butter chicken, tikka masala, whatever vindaloo), but seem to be mostly interested in going beyond that. The weekend buffet reliably has goat curry, which is wonderful (and spicy!) and not something that is regularly included in the genre, and the chili chicken (which is usually interpreted as some soupy, sticky variant on Chinese food, as per its origins) is a sort of dry, fried, spice-encrusted dish, gloriously addictive. And many dishes whose names are unfamiliar to me--a sort of rice pudding, but not the kheer that is easily found at every five-and-dime buffet across the nation, instead a complex, spicy concoction with caraway and green chile, or a set of fritters (labeled "baby corn," though I'm not at all sure that's what they were) that become transcendent when dipped in one of the array of lovely sauces that they provide. And it's actually spicy, or, rather, many dishes are (the butter chicken is still, predictably, bland and inoffensive), which is damn near impossible to find in an Indian restaurant around these parts--even some of the buffet items have a decent bite. And the little (free!) cups of chai that they provide--strong, but not too sweet, not like the milky sugared-up lattes that you get at Starbucks. And this, and that, and more. Yes, it's slightly spendy (currently around $15 for the buffet), but you don't eat here every day and, perhaps, like me, you've driven for a while to be here, in a weird abandoned parking lot adjacent to a Holiday Inn Express adjacent to a huge tech park... so it's probably worth it.

But if you've just skipped to the end, here, in hopes of discovering whether this restaurant is good and whether you should eat here, the answer is, definitely, yes and yes. If you are even remotely intrigued by Indian food, and if you do not shrink from the notion of capsaicin-laced food as if it were the machinations of the devil himself, you owe it to yourself to visit this place. Yes, it's in the parking lot of a hotel, and it's tiny, and you don't know where you are or what's what (welcome to Florida). Just go in and eat the goat curry, you weirdo.

We used to love this place. Always looked forward to eating here when we visited Tampa. We recently visited and noticed a significant decline in the food and customer service. The food was so bland. The Summer Rolls, Tom Kha Soup, Red Curry and Noodle dishes were tasteless. The smaller male working in the front was incredibly rude. The place was empty at the time and he kept rushing me while placing my order. I first asked for soup...that's all!!...thats all!!...was his response every time I added an item. I knew exactly what I wanted and he kept cutting me off with...that's all!! We ordered exactly $99 worth of food. He made us feel like he was doing us a favor by ordering food from this restaurant. I'm not sure if there was a change in ownership or new chefs but we will never be eating here again.
The service is amazing, Mike B. gave wonderful recommendations and he was so spot on in recommending the best beignets in New Orleans!!! Must get! Also everything on the menu is delicious!!
Fast Eddie is the man! Everything was so good I don't think I can describe it in words!

So disappointed.  I used to order from Schiano's every week because I love their pizza so much.  Lately the service has been sub-par (though I must say I think the food is still really good) so I don't order as often.  So today, I used their online app to pre-order a pizza for 5 pm.  They made a mistake and delivered it immediately after ordering (around 2 pm).  So no big deal....I just told them of their mistake and they took back the pizza.  They delivered it again around 5, and when I say again, I mean the same pizza from 2 pm.  The bottom crust was burnt because they clearly threw it back in the oven for a few minutes to heat it up.  It was stiff as a board and barely warmer than room temperature.  Even if it were my mistake that caused the 2 pm delivery, which it wasn't, this still would have been really poor customer service.

I had their enchiladas, which was very tasty. I love extra beans, and you can even ask for extra sour cream and the gravy. I would come here again, the service and workers there are great and respectful. Food is amazing!

After having to cancel my annual skin cancer screening appointment, I receive a 50 dollar bill as a no show SIX months later. Now I am searching through email and phone records to prove that I did in fact cancel before the 24 hour time period OR they are threatening to send this to collections. I was a loyal client for years and referred many. Something is very very wrong in this office with the cut throat way they do business. They must really need 50 dollars.

Worst pedicure I've ever received. 
The technician spent about 5 minutes on my feet, I only got one coat of paint and it's all over my skin. I won't be returning.

I haven't visited this Olive Garden in a very long time-like years..so this was my second visit ever and first visit in a long time. 

My son wanted to come here because we had just left his dentist appointmentand we were hungry. We visited this location yesterday-May 14 2019-we entered at 2:15p and left at 3:52pm. We were immediately sat by the hostess whom was very friendly and told us about the unlimited games for $1.99 that we had the option to play.

Our waitress/server name was Alesha, she greeted us and took down our order. We received our soups and no breadsticks, Alesha said that there was going to be a wait on the bread sticks, so I started eating my soup but couldn't finish it because I like to dip my breadsticks inside my soup, so I waited a few more minutes and still NO breadsticks. I went to the bathroom and came back and there were no breadsticks still! My drink of a watermelon margarita did come tho' and my drink gave me an instant headache because it tasted as if the bartender had originally made my drink with a salt rim and then noticed that I said no rim and just poured my drink into a different glass-which is why my drink looked the way it did (which was cloudy) and tasted the way it did(which was salty). I didn't want to complain about the drink but I felt as though I needed to tell Alesha because the drink gave me an immediate headache and that's not how that drink is suppose to taste. I was just at the city Ave -Olive Garden and my drink was perfect, clearly something wasNOT  right here. Alesha apologized about the error and brought me a new watermelon margarita drink which was now made to perfection! Thank you Alesha/Alicia for great service!

Our food was good, although my son's fries looked well over cooked, but both of our portions were correct. My son was disappointed with the fact that they didn't have any ketchup for his chicken fingers sadly. 

If there wasn't such a long wait time on the bread sticks and if my original drink didn't give me a headache and if the bathrooms were clean this would of been a 5 star experience because our waitress Alesha was pretty polite and nice to us and even wished me a happy belated Mother's Day.

Something that also made my son and I and another table of guests shake our heads was the fact that we were waiting for our checks and we heard a different waitress (NOT Alesha) saying to her customers that " she doesn't eat here, she doesn't bring her family here, and that olive garden's food is not good and she's just being honest that she would rather eat Italian food at a small restaurant that has 3 tables in it because the food here just isn't good to her and that she only works there and repeated that she doesn't eat there". I understand if you don't like the food where you work at that's fine, but why did the waitress feel the need to advertise that she doesn't like olive garden's food to Olive garden's customers? Even the waitress's guest were like wow you are super honest---honestly it made me feel like ummmm I don't even want my left overs anymore because even the employees here are saying that they don't eat olive garden's food. 

So all in all I had to take away a star for our wait time for bread sticks, bathrooms weren't stocked and were not swept and the fact that I had to hear the other waitress (not my waitress) complaining about how nasty olive gardens food is. I truly wanted my experience at this location to be a "wow " experience because of my past experiences at the city Ave location....but the only great things here was my waitress Alesha whom was very inviting and made my son and I feel like family and the hostess who was nice and I did enjoy my food up until I heard the other waitress expressing that she disliked olive garden's food. So my experience at this location was a 3 star experience but my service from my server Alesha was a 5 star! Thanks again Alesha you were great.

I come here at random times with different people, and every time I step foot into this little restaurant that appalls you with jumping frogs,  I am never disappointed. The frogs are delicious by the way. Those little slimey sons of guns. The owner of the place is very attentive and nice. All of the waiters/waitresses are fast and listen to what you want. Their pina coladas are to DIE for and everything else they offer is good. Fresh food all the time. This Is A must  when you are in Chinatown. DON'T MISS IT!! GO GO GO

Close to Philadelphia only 20 minutes from the Tacony Bridge.
This place is listed twice. Actual name is Johnson's Corner Farm so both names apply to the same place (also listed as Johnson's Farm). My family and I really enjoyed Johnson's. It is well maintained, clean, lots of parking. If you want to have a nice day out with your children please try them out. One thing I really liked is that there is lots of tree shaded area to hide from the sun if you want. Five of us did the hayride and barn for $31.
One strange bit of advice is that they give you feed corn that you are supposed to break off the kernels and feed them a few at a time. I seen people not knowing and giving the entire cob to the animals (you only get one per child I believe). The cashier didn't inform us amateurs how to use the corn (we figured it out) but the staff was polite and courteous.
Will definitely go again.

My daughter and I decided to try Tony's after a bit of shopping. We are from out of town and were a bit nervous to try a place that was unknown. After checking reviews, we decided to go. We were very pleased with the service and our pedi. Although they were busy, they got us right in and seated us next to each other. Everyone was friendly and pleasant. Our pedis were actually one of the best we have gotten anywhere. Great pedi and wonderful and friendly service!

We've been long time customers and always considered Long's the best yeast donut anywhere. Recently the quality has changed and not so good. They either have new bakers at Southport or using different products. Advice to management - time for quality check.

I have had dental and orthodontic care in many states and have experienced irresponsible and unethical care from several practices. My experience here was very timely and professional. My hygienist had an excellent chairside manner and continually checked to see if I was doing well during my deep cleaning for all four quadrants in one visit. Normally this would take a couple visits due to the bleeding and soreness in the gums and pain. I appreciate the treatment I received at bright now dental and will be returning to this practice for my future dental care.

Hello the to best Mac & Cheese, Goodbye Imitators! 

I visit Noodles and Company when I am stuck in a rut and not sure what to eat. The menu appeals to both our meat eating friends and vegetarians. Even those pickiest eaters (alas myself) can find comfort in their menu. 

The staff is super friendly and can thoroughly explain all the options on the menu.  Whether you are dining in (and the establishment is very clean) or getting your meal to go the manager inspects everything that goes out of the kitchen to make sure everything is correct. 

Oh and if you have room after your meal, don't forget to pick up one of their tasty treats. The rice krispy treats are the best!

Twin Rivers Tree Service crew is the best.  They cut down a 30 foot tree with no trouble. It was watching artist at work. 
They listened to my concerns and handled everything well. 
I highly recommend Twin Rivers Tree Service.

We came here last Sunday, Mothers Day (of all days). The parking lot was full, walked through the door and were seated immediately (no waiting, right on!). I ordered their red chile chimichanga enchilada style and my partner ordered a carne asada combination plate. He wanted a small sample of their menudo and our waitress Lisa brought him a small bowl with lots of menudo (totally surprised by their generosity). He loved their menudo and thoroughly enjoyed his whole meal which he could not finish....leftovers. My chimi was huge, I could only eat half of it (took the other half home) and as always their chips and salsa were off the chain.....so good.
I have upgraded my star rating from three to five!
Great pour over coffees and friendly staff. The interior is really nice, clean and spacious. The bakery items are large and have great flavor combinations.

I must say this place has a great atmosphere, even better staff,  and their food is just devine.  The buffet is a must! The korma is the absolute best anywhere around. Very highly recommended. Thank you for the continued great experience and full belly.
Great staff, awesome work. Thx guys. Did tint complete detail and put wheels and tires on to get me looking good.  Prices were great. Wholesale prices on wheels
Really stunning.  Have been here at least a half dozen times, but never made it to the Mission before.  This time, we did the Trolley Tour, and it was one of the stops on the tour. Really beautiful.
A fantastic menu with a lot to choose from. There is something for everyone here. The bar area is a good setup where you can just be social and enjoy good dinners and food.
Excellent arugula beet salad and raw apple pie. Amazing. Really friendly people too! The menu is full of delicious vegetarian items.

This restaurant has some of the most authentic Mexican food I've had in a long time.  Very very fresh ingredients, comes to the table nice and hot, and the taste is delicious! The horchata is to die for, I had a child rellano, the best I think I've ever had! Chimichanga was my husband's choice and he loved it. Excellent restaurant, great prices, nice atmosphere.

This is a great little basement shop that has odds and ends from the days of old. They pretty much have something for everyone, if you like items that were around before 1980. I've bought a number of things here and the staff is always pleasant. Good prices too. I don't remember having my jaw drop at something being over priced too.

Beautiful hotel. I may be bias because it was Papa Noel and the hotel was decorated as festive as can be with Christmas decorations. The courtyard is great and the staff is so pleasant and friendly. I look forward to staying here again in the future

Incredibly disappointed and grossed out doesn't begin to cover it. We went to Helm last week and the meal started off fantastic - service was great and the food was incredible.... but I'm writing this review about what we witnessed from the kitchen throughout the meal but mainly as our desserts were being made. Helm has an open kitchen so you can see the chefs cooking the food. When they weren't cooking we saw them standing around on their phones, and they did not wash their hands in between being on their phones and handling food.  Then when they were preparing our desserts, we watched a chef dip a spoon into the whipped cream tub, lick the spoon, dip it back into the tub, put the whipped cream on one of our desserts, then put the spoon back in his mouth. Needless to say I was unable to eat the dessert and passed it off as being full, but wish I had said something about what we witnessed. We did not observe anything like this the rest of the meal, but maybe we weren't paying as close of attention. Not that this should happen in any kitchen, but you have an open kitchen concept restaurant, you should absolutely not being practicing hygiene practices like this for your guests to see.

This was my first time here. I recently moved to Saint Louis and I've been trying to find a nail salon to regularly go to. I'm a nail and cuticle picker so getting my nails done help keep me from destroying my fingers.  The general atmosphere was calm and relaxing with lots of space between other patrons. There was no chemical smell that is typical of a nail salon. I had a gel removal and manicure with Deme. She took amazing care of my nails and was incredibly pleasant. I'm excited to go back and get a pedicure with my next mani!

Tried this place out for dessert since my hubby is on a no sugar diet. He only eating natural sugars. We got two fruit bowls. He really enjoyed his. He got apples & strawberries, wildflower honey, and granola. Mines was the apple/ pear streusel with plain yogurt. I personally thought the yogurt tasted expired. It was sour and not good at all. The cooked apples and pears became pretty disappointing after a few bites. Overall, I was not impressed, and I would not choose to get this ever again. I'd be interested in trying their lunch bowls though in the future.
Sad to see that this place is closed down. In my opinion they had the best Mexican food in the area.

The server was wonderful but there were other lacking areas. I was given a VERY dirty salsa bowl to start. Then, my knife had leftover lettuce all over it. Finally, my food was actually very cold. All that being said, my fiancé had a very hot meal that he thoroughly enjoyed. Beautiful atmosphere! Oh, and the salsa is fantastic!

I've been a patient here for 5 years. If you have an urgent concern, they can get you in same day. 

Be prepared to wait. The waiting room is often full. The care received here is worth the wait. 

Cosmetic services are reasonably priced as well. Yeah, you can find less expensive elsewhere. But other than stand alone laser shops, the prices are industry competitive.

I found a ton of excuses for visiting Iron Barley when I lived in St. Louis - family in town, double dates, tomato festival, lost a bet, etc.  The specialty is oak-smoked meats: pork, prime rib, etc.  Amazing stuff.  Lots of other enticing options: sammiches, mussels, salads.  I'm honestly not a great fan of the barley preparation that comes with most of their dishes, but I can't really complain since I rarely have room for more than a bite.  The staff here is great - you tend to see the same people every time - and many of the customers are neighborhood regulars.  There is a bar if you get stuck waiting for a table, and when watermelons are in season they pour a great watermelon margarita.  Often a guy with a guitar is sitting there playing blues or bawdy folk songs for tips.  Don't leave without trying one of their blaster pies with strawberry habenero sauce and bourbon whipped cream.  Iron Barley is truly a great place to eat, and one of the most delicious and unique in St. Louis.

Great service, the people who helped yesterday serve the party of 11 did a great job.   The food was delicious and the best part was we didn't have to wait a half hour for the food to be ready. The fajitas took a little longer but  it was worth the wait the tortillas were fresh and food was amazing.   Over priced but worth it.

We had a great stay! The front desk was very informative about the city and the must see places. The room was beautiful and I adore everything being black and white. Walking distance to all the local hot spots and yet quiet after 10pm. It was a great stay

EDIT: SELLS BEER AGAIN - WILL ADD A REVIEW LATER

DOES NOT SELL BEER. Apparently they lost their license to sell beer. Now it's just another "corner store" type location. It's a shame because the people who work here are very nice and would always have a good selection of craft beer.

My entire family loves Nami! This was one of our go-to places, when we lived in St. Louis. Pork belly bun and Chasu Ramen are my favorites. My kids loved their fried rice. Can't wait to go back, when we visit the area.

My husband took my phone to We Fix Phones N More to get the charging port replaced the other day.  Unknowingly, while being replaced, something happened to my microphone in the process and when he brought the phone back home, the charging port was great but I tried to make a call later in the day, and it was a no-go.  Unfortunately, that happened on a Saturday and they do not have hours on Sunday.  First thing Monday morning, I took the phone back to them and explained the issue, thinking that some type of dirt or dust had blocked the microphone during the charging port replacement.  The representative was attentive and took my phone immediately.  He said it would be approximately 35-40 minutes, so I told him I would come back to pick it up.  When I returned later, the phone was done and they had had to change the charging port again due to the microphone issue.  They did not charge me for it and were very apologetic.  My husband has been using this place for several years now, and this was my first experience.  I will definitely return!  The customer service was above all else and the place was super welcoming and clean inside.  You will not be disappointed!  This is a great spot for your phone/tablet fixes!

This was the second time my wife and I went to Luciano's and it bums me to say that it was an all around disappointment. My first trip the service was great the food was great so coming tonight I was looking forward to a nice evening. We were seated in a decent time but waited for close to 10 min for our waitress to appear. I ordered the item I loved the first time the arrabiata?? If I spelled that correctly. It was over salty and so was the bread loaded with salt.  The atmosphere was nice and some of the wait staff also. When our dinner was brought the young lady did not clear the table of dishes. I would say 2.5. Over all bummed I wasted my night to pick where we go to dinner here.

This has become a terrible place to shop. They don't have the staff needed to run a store like this, so the lines are always huge. I waited 45 minutes to pay last time and now I'm standing in another huge line as I write this. The dressing rooms have been closed every time I've come in. The signs say it is for Heath reasons, but the staff told me it is because they don't have people to work them. So it means everyone has to stand in line to buy and then stand in line again to return. The time wasted has become greater than the money saved.

One of my new favorite places to eat. The platters are great and are really a good bang for your buck. The shawarma platter has been my favorite so far. Make sure to get the fries, they're fantastic. Contrary to other reviews, I thought the hummus was good. It wasn't the best hummus I've ever had, but I would definitely say it was good. 

It's a little small but you can sit outside if you'd like, which I think is nice. This is definitely a place I'd go back to for a nice, filling lunch.

Looking at the menu and the prices that accompanied them, I was expecting a lot more.

We ordered regular breakfast fare.  Meals came with homestyle potatoes. We asked if we could substitute the home style with hashbrowns. "You are in luck, all we have is hashed" ..... huh? A potato is a potato. How could you be out of one and not the other.......FROZEN!

Ugh, I could do frozen at home for a lot cheaper! Food took about 5 minutes to come out.  Plate was extremely hot. DAMN! Another sign of heated frozen microwave food. 

Potatoes turned out to be scalloped potatoes.  Wth?!? 
I didnt even want to bother to complain.  

Shame because I would rather visit a local family owned and operated breakfast joint around here.

This was a very nice exhibit.  You can easily spend an hour or more here. Lots to see.    The only reason I didn't rate 5 stars is because I had an issue breathing here.  The building is really old and it is very musty.  I'm usually not sensitive to allergens which Is why I would like to make those who are aware of this.    My respiration literally was affected for days after.

We went here for our anniversary and it was fantastic! I had the salmon and my husband had the filet mignon. We had the bacon wrapped scallops for an appetizer. Magnificent! The salmon was served over some delicious risotto, and my husband's  filet was perfectly cooked! The service was over the top! We were the last patrons there since we were waiting for our UBER driver. We went outside to wait for our ride. It was something like 20 degrees and snowing. The wait staff pulled up and even offered us a ride home! Our cab pulled up at the same time, so we took it but we couldn't have been more pleased that they wanted to make sure we got home okay. Talk about an amazing staff and great place to eat! Check it out!

I had such a great experience here. I was referred to Dr Sievert by a family member who is a Dental Hygienist (that should already tell you, you're in good hands if your own family sends you their way). I had great interaction with Emily and Sydney, they were both so helpful and really cared for me. Dr Sievert was a saint! He is easy to talk to, very calming and I only got the best vibes from him. Not to mention that the work he did was quality 100%. Thank you so much everyone!
First visit, food was excellent along with the appetizer. Well worth a return visit when I return to Tucson. Best Chinese food i've eaten in Tucson.

I've only ordered from there a few times but I gotta say, the buffalo chicken pizza was incredible.  A good amount of cheese, chunked chicken, the perfect amount of buffalo sauce (which is very good) and blue cheese (also very good).  And the pizza dough is the thicker, greasy, delicious kind :)  They were also open on Christmas Day this past year, which is what my brother and I ended up eating for dinner since the rest of our family went to Florida :-D

We almost missed the restaurant, as there was only an "S" led logo & a small little "Stock" decal on the door. Good thing for GPS. Came here for a quick bite & got literally what the name states. The broth is just Vietnamese stock soup (probably powder) that they boiled and then threw in some pho noodles for what they call "pho". Completely not authentic Vietnamese cuisine, but what did I expect right? The chicken pho wasn't hot enough either. Service was great though, food came out quickly and our server checked in with us throughout the meal. Probably wouldn't come back just because I could get authentic pho somewhere else within a 2 mile radius, for cheaper.
A bit pricey for just a simple dumplings n malatang ( the spicy soup) ... But it taste good... Just not worthy to go back again.

Used to be really good. Past three years it's gone down. I come for lunch regularly and can tell you this: Shrimp are always overcooked, Scallops are usually overcooked. But I come back because it's close to work and I can get in and out quickly. But they've got a great waiter.

Update: Well I went in for lunch last week and the dining room was empty. I sat down and placed the same order I always do. I got my drink after about 5 minutes, but no salad. They always bring the salad right out. Fast forward another 15 minutes. No salad, and I haven't even seen the waitress. Meanwhile I watch the bartender ignore people because she's fiddling with napkins or something. I got up and walked out after 20 minutes of waiting. I'm done with this place.

Stopped in for lunch, will definitely be back.  We both had a small pizza, one hand tossed and one thin crust, both were great.  The toppings were good quality and abundant.  Caesar salad was good, but a little hard to eat because the bowl was so small.  Service wasn't great, which was surprising as we were the only customers at the time, but the food was good enough to warrant another visit.

Summary: Terrible service and food for both times I have been here.  We came here for the buffet which was quite disappointing.  The steak (limited to 2 requests) was a cheap cut and chewy.  The ribs were pre-cooked and seemed previously frozen.  The pork belly was paper thin and unflavored.  The servers forgot to provide bowls and spoons for the soup.

I have been taking my Golden Retriever to Barker's Barber for a few years.   He is a big baby and they treat him well.   They are always on time and call as soon as they are through so that I can come get him.   The services are reasonably priced too.    I have several friends that use Barker's Barber and they all have nice things to say about the care for their pets.

I enjoyed Brophy's Bros. It was my first night in Santa Barbara and this was a great first choice. It was not a complete touristy spot, but it had a welcoming feel (it is right off the water). The wait was long but the food made it very worth it. I ordered the seafood pasta and it was delicious. The kitchen had 10 or so specials to choose from which shows how fresh there food is.  

My only complaint would be a lack of beer selection but I got over it. Nonetheless, 5 stars.

Good food, a little steep in price, but that's not unusual for decent sushi.  I had a combination dinner, and some rolls.  The only reason I'm not giving this pace five stars us because the service wasn't great.  The waiter was friendly, but we had to check out at the host stand which was lame, and we also waited a while to get our drinks.

Yes, please!  A group of my girlfriends and I enjoyed a delicious dinner at Luke's while visiting.  

First of all, do not skip the fries.  They were cooked to perfection and highly addictive. 

The pate board was a large portion and quite tasty. 

I ordered the ribeye and split it with my friend since we planned on having more bites after dinner.  They were gracious enough to pre split the meal.  The steak was prepared very well. 

Of course, you can't forget the oysters.  If you love oysters as much as I do, you'll appreciate the selection.  Honestly, you should have the Louisiana oysters along with the others simply because they are delicious and you can't pass on price compared to the other oysters. 

The only downfall was that we were seated in the back room which seemed to be with out heat.  It just so happened we were there during one of the coldest days of the year in NOLA.  We were all freezing, but the good food helped to over come the cold room temp!

Had spaghetti and meatballs. Meatballs had a lot of gristle. The gravy was good, the pasta was fresh, but stuck together and in pieces like a baby would eat. Waitress was nice. Food time was short. I'd probably try something other than pasta next time.
The best steaks I've had. If you're in the area you should definitely come check this place out.

Friendly staff. Many smoothie & juice shot options. Great area to walk around and shop. Clean! (No spot to eat but it looks like during the summer they might have outdoor tables and chairs) Great on-the-go spot!

Ya gotta check this place out!!!
Awesome service and great food. Started with Arancini that was fabolous and moved on to the steak burger. I shall be back....

Love the ambiance of this place - very unique. The food is good, but a little on the pricey-side. Plenty of seating inside and out. Great for business meetings. Can TEND to be a little loud due to the natural acoustics (was an old church building), and the schedule of when they are open can be hit-and-miss due to them using the building for private events occasionally.

Honestly, the food is good, but, in my opinion, overrated. Although different, Commander's Palace and Bayona are much better, and so is the service. We ordered the paneed rabbit and smothered chicken. As noted, both were good, but not great. We waited over an hour to be seated. I also felt the staff was somewhat lackadaisical as to my nut allergy. I enjoyed my meal, and so did my date, but I wouldn't rush back.

I remember eating Erio's as a kid and loving it.  I completely forgot there was one off Woodson, and have been frequenting the one near 94 (which is a phenomenal place).  So I was stoked to go to a location closer to where I live.  The area is a little sketchy, but hey what do you expect near an airport?  I called in a pickup order and for the short period of time there the service seemed friendly, but the atmosphere was dated and stuffy.  

Brought home a salad and a hamburger pizza.  The salad was watery and salty.  The pizza was bland and very disappointing.  I kept waiting for it taste delicious but it never happened (actually tasted better reheated the next day).  I feel like the quality of ingredients are significantly different between the 2 locations.

If you want Erio's check out the location near 94.  That's the right location to go to.  Never disappointed with that location.

I love Thai food and everywhere I go I get the yellow curry and theirs did not disappoint. They have great tasting low price dishes with filling portions. My boyfriend got the spicy red curry which was also very good. This is going to be our new go to Thai spot.

I've recently started coming here for my groceries, I was a fan of the Market Street location but this one is definitely closer to my home.  I'm always amazed at how much money I save here compared to the competitors in Center City.

Recently, I have been trying out various grocery stores because I live in Center City and I am conveniently located to Trader Joe's, Rittenhouse Market, DiBruno's and multiple smaller grocery markets.  I have tried them out because of my concerns of the social distancing precautions with COVID 19.  I am pleased to say that I feel that Trader Joe's is the clear winner of all of them with Social Distancing precautions because they make people wait outside and limit the number of shoppers in the store at once, they spray hand sanitizer on every shopper's hands upon entering, they wipe down carts and the checkout line is controlled, not amassed.  I have felt more safe shopping here than anywhere else for that reason.  In case you're wondering, DiBruno's came in 2nd tied with VIP Market and well, we can guess who came in last because of not practicing social distancing.  There are many other ways to compare these markets, but my analysis is based on my experience with Social Distancing precautions.

They have lots of fresh produce, a nice plant selection, great prepared meals, snacks, a nice selection of frozen foods and it's at a fraction of the price of the other markets.  

The store is clean, the employees are very helpful and friendly!  I have been very impressed with both this store and at the Market Street store how easy returns are.  I didn't have my item, I took a photo of it, I described what needing refunding or replacing and they have taken it off of my next order or put it back onto my debit card.  Great customer service!
Hands down the best cheesesteak in the area. This delectable sandwich is overloaded with meat and a healthy combination of cheese.

This was my first time here and I have to say the food definitely lives up to the hype. Everything was very tasty and you get really nice portions. My fiancee and I had the Bootlegger Fries to start. They had a perfect amount of cheese and the seasoning was really tasty. I then had the 1919 burger which was nice and juicy and cooked perfectly. I substituted the onion tanglers, seeing as how we had some fries already and they were nice and crispy and were a generous amount. I'm not a huge fan of the big onion rings where the onion just slides out and your left with coating. These were spot on. My fiancee had the Virgil Stackwell chicken sandwich and she loved it. It was a really nice size, so much so that she couldn't finish the bun but wanted to make sure she finished the chicken. I tried it and it was crispy and juicy, no dry chicken here. The sauce was pretty great as well. We were both really full after eating our meals so we actually go dessert to go. We got the Ricotta Cheesecake and the Bourbon Pound cake. When we at them later that evening they both were so damn good. I love my desserts and these rank up there with some of the best I've had. The Speakeasy decor is great and the atmosphere is awesome. I loved the music too, it was contemporary songs but done in swing style or big band, loved it. Unfortunately we were only visiting the area for the weekend and didn't get a chance to experience the screening room and the signature popcorns. Next time I'm back down that way I will be stopping back in to try more of the menu as it all looks and sounds great. And I have to say the staff was really pleasant and very sociable. If you want a nice spot in Safety Harbor you won't go wrong hitting this up.
Great local flair- and tacos to die for!  A perfect lunch and the owners were a delight!

It's weird to leave a five star review of something like this, but from crying through my phone call with Alex on Friday to the really comforting compassion and kindness of Dr. Brad putting our beloved Geege down in the comfort of his own home on Sunday, Lap of Love made this excruciating event as bearable as possible. If you have to do this for your dog - and most of us will - these are the people to call. I cannot thank them enough for making the hardest thing even the smallest bit easier. Truly good, kind, and gentle people who understand how painful this is to do.

So far I love this little salad bar that opened up on 103 and Jasper.

Today I tried the metaboost salad (field greens and spinach, kale, mangos, carrots, edamame, almonds, goat cheese, balsamic vinaigrette) it was amazingly delicious and soooo healthy.
They also offer, wraps, burritos and build you own salad, as well as froyo and fresh squeezed juices.

My only complaint - my salad was a tad on the small side and their dishes are fairly high priced
Also their to-go bowls are paper and I prefer plastic bowls because I can wash and reuse them rather than just having to throw them out

We were decieved by this hotel.  We booked a stay in Sept. 2018 for a stay in middle of Oct.  When we arrived we were disappointed by the place immediately.  The pictures looked so much better.  The pool area looked distressed and was closed.  There was no one at the outdoor pool bar but the bartender.   We had to go up an outdoor elevator which was very hot inside to get to the reception area.  I asked about the pool and they said it was closed for rennovation and that they were "sorry". 
  I became very upset because we had a small child and there was no pool and they knew this as this rennovation was scheduled.  They offered us a few drink tickets to compensate - big deal!  I told them my grandaughter doesn't drink.  I talked to them two times before making a reservation and no one mentioned the pool rennovation.   The room was very far away from the hot elevator.  So although the view of the Gulf was nice it was a quite a hike to get to it from our room. You could tell there were efforts to update the older building but it just quite did not meet my expectations of what I thought an hotel being connected to the Don CeSar hotel would be like.   The couch had some light stains on it and gave me the creeps.  The other two pieces off furniture were dated rattan furniture.  The one chair pad had a light round stain on it like it had been peed on.  I asked calmly to talk to the manager and of course he was "not available".    So I called him and left a message and Rick never returned my call.   So for that I write this not so great review.
Get the Poke Bowl.  And the oysters.  Great happy hour margarita.  Love this place.    This place also had great service and Chef Scott has the right idea.  Can't wait to go back

I went for lunch on yesterday and it was my first time there. It was not crowded but it had a nice lunch crowd. The restaurant is so spacious there's plenty space available to be comfortable and still be able to talk at a normal level at your table. Our server was really friendly and attentive. The margaritas were very very tasty. I had the Fajitas Texanas which is chicken, shrimp, and steak. I was STUFFED!!!! The food was so freaking delicious. I am anticipating my next visit to this great establishment. I was beyond pleased.

Our waitress Caitlin was great! She easily handled our table of 7 women. She got all of our orders (drinks & food) correct and even helped my friend with food allergies find the best meal for her! 

I got there just in time for happy hour and buoyed the food & drinks I ordered!
Wow...wow and wow! This is the best Mexican Food that I've had in a very long time. Coming from LA, I consider myself a Mexican Food snob and they did not disappoint! The tacos are Awesome!
Best beers on tap. Great Happy hour! Sports fans can watch the games on the many TV's. Family friendly too! We bring the kids all the time for some food and fun!

Just found a fingernail in my food . This was utterly disgusting . Went in to get my food and the place was filthy . I should've known . I couldn't chew my sweet and sour chicken and thought I heard. Crunch, yep a fingernail !!!! Ughh appetite done !!! $22.00 down the drain ! Don't go here !!!!

One of the best BBQ places in St. Louis. Prices are reasonable, food is fantastic. They are always crowded.  Expect to wait awhile, during lunch we waited about 45min to an hour but it was worth it if you have the time! There is plenty of parking in the back and alongside the street. Menu is simple, but with a lot to choose from.  They're located close to St. Louis University.  A must try for sure.

Can't say enough good things about this studio! The teachers are phenomenal, and they offer a lot of different types of classes with different instructors at different times, so you can always find something that works with your schedule. And the workshops are great. They offer one workshop per month. This month is a class with Rebecca for Mala making and meditation. Can't wait!

We had to grab something quick and easy at the Village so we picked this place.  It's nicely located by the fountain.  Staff members are very friendly, but we are disappointed with the food.

The price is alright.  Mall price.  I am not going to complain.  We ordered the small Benito teriyaki chicken and Karen BBQ beef.  Perhaps it's the healthy chicken, so it's dry.  Lots of pepper seasoning and sauce (supposed to be teriyaki sauce but tasted like overly sweeten soy sauce). Beef was tough but the sauce is NOT Korean BBQ sauce I expected or we usually would have.  It tasted more like Chinese or Korean bean paste sauce which we use for noodles (or I call it Chinese Spaghetti).  Anyways, not what we expected.

I probably will not try this place again.

I purchased a diamond ring from Shane Co., Duluth. Thanks to Joe Gipe, I had a great experience. He was very professional and helpful. You can't ask for a better sales person. Thank you Joe for helping me find the right ring! I would definitely come back for future purchases.

I have to pay for wifi? Why should I do that? This place is a cute place to hang out, and they have little trinkets and art on the wall, but I had the worst latté that I have ever sipped here. Come here if you hate Starbucks or PJ's, which are right by. They have a drive-thru too, which is nice.

TL:DR - It's a good ramen bar... for Edmonton.

I was craving a noodle soup of some sort after a long day at work, you know like a warm pho or ramen of some variety to hit the spot on a cold April day (too cold for April really). In any event, after consulting with my wife we decided to take a stroll over to Nudoru Ramen, a place we've seen on many an outing but often passed by for one reason or another. We were seated quickly and the waitress was very pleasant, although mildly flustered by how busy things were. There were just two servers the aforementioned waitress and another waiter, of the two of them the waitress seemed to do most of the work of serving people. 

The menus were simple, a few tapas items, some soups, specialty ramen, and a "make-your-own" ramen menu. We both went with a the meat based broth with a shoyu style flavour. I topped mine with pork belly, 1/2 a soft boiled egg, menma bamboo shoots, and sweet corn. The orders came out quickly, and promptly. The broth was still very hot, all the flavours were present. 

I'll preface the rest of my review with this statement, for Edmonton this is a solid Ramen bar (not a jab at Edmonton by any means). The reason I say this is because I've been spoiled by ramen restaurants where there is more variety and competition to push restaurants to try to achieve more to stand out from the crowd. 

As far as the taste of my ramen was, it had a strong shoyu (soy sauce based) taste. The noodles were a bit chewy for my liking, and the soft boiled egg had a distinct salty taste that over powered everything in that bite. The bamboo shoots weren't as firm as I had expected but they were fine given the rest of the dish. The pork belly was the saving grace of this ramen dish, as it was flavourful with good texture and softness that it melted in my mouth. 

After we were finished with our meal it took a while for us to get the bill and pay. 

Would I go back? Probably, if I were craving ramen. Would it be my first choice? It's still up in the air for me (my wife said she wouldn't come back anytime soon). So take this review for what it may be. As far as ramen restaurants in Edmonton goes, it's a place you should at very least visit to see for yourself. If you have had ramen in any part of Asia or more specifically Japan, you will probably be let down. Happy eating!

Gin and tonic with no bubbles.  Cesar salad tastes like fish.  Hamburger overdone, not worth the trouble. Tried to eat but couldn't finish the dish.  Chips and salsa were a o k.  But not enough to save the day.

We hired Walden Floral for our wedding and Courtney far exceeded our expectations. We had to postpone our wedding twice due to COVID, and each time Courtney was quick to accommodate seasonal changes and so many various requests that came up along the way. She really listened to our "boho tropical" vision (even though it was pretty vague and honestly, sometimes we were contradicting ourselves!) and was hyper focused on making everything perfect.
