She also acted with a lot of integrity towards us and our vision even if it meant suggesting buying fewer, or less expensive flowers to best complete the look - for example, instead of suggesting massive centerpieces for our tables, she recommended going with simpler bud vases that were completely perfect, and even suggested that we re-use our aisle arrangements for the sweetheart table instead of creating multiple pieces with only one purpose.

Throughout the entire process, Courtney was extremely collaborative, attentive, detail oriented all around just fun to work with. And on the wedding day itself, every touch she added blew us away. She delivered on exactly what we discussed and was promised, with some incredible touches that set it all over the top and blew away our expectations.
Hands down, my favorite soup! This spot is one of a kind and the hand drawn noodles and home made wantons are out of this world. Perfectly spicy and delicious. I would recommend this spot to anyone!

Our Waiter today was very unfriendly. We were sitting at the Bar and it was fairly busy. She didn't ask us if we want anything else to drink, she didn't give us Silverware for our food we ordered and had to wait for it. She wasn't bothered giving us service at all. I do not recommend this with this poor service. Not to mention that she plays with her hair while serving food and drinks!!!! No thanks!!!

This car wash is awesome! A brand new location added to the other 5 they have. They were running a free car wash for the week so I thought I would give it a try. My car came out amazingly clean and the whole process was pretty quick. At the end you can vacuum the interior, clean with towels, and they even have a compressed air hose to blow out any leaves or dirt in hard to reach places. Most car washes in the area are old so it's nice to see a new place with modern technology. Deluxe Wash is $9 (basic clean which includes foam bath, clear coat, high pressure, spot free rinse, and heat wave), Protection Wash is $12 (includes basic + triple foam, wheel cleaning, tire shine, and underbody), and Ultimate Wash is $16 (includes protection + citrus foam, buff/shine, and hot wax). Definitely will visit again!

This is for one drink: the Ramos Gin Fizz. You will rarely find a Ramos outside of New Orleans. This bar has the best one in New Orleans, for a specific reason. A Ramos is an egg white drink, shaken as long as possible to mix the white and sugar into a near-meringue home. The O has a specific shaking machine to give it a full six minutes shake, producing a beautiful thick puck of foam that rises inches above the rim of the glass. 

Their other beverages are none too bad either, though perhaps a bit above the prevailing rate. You're paying French Quarter premium. It is a quiet refuge from the loud drunken, though.

Oh this breakfast spot is awesome.  Great ambiance, perfect location, food is awesome and the service was great.  Had a great time with my friends Marcia and her beau Mike.  It's just an overall great spot to meet up with friends and eat and enjoy without all the noise and rush.

3.5/5 Ambiance. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. I sat outdoors and they were playing some nice jazz music to set the vibe! Our seat did have the AC dripping on the side but it wasn't too bad. You see the sunset and it gives kind of like a beach vibe, with this restaurant at the corner of a neighborhood.

4.5/5 Service. Our waitress was nice and knew the specials of the day really well. Everyone was so kind.

4/5 Food. The bread basket here is AMAZING! My friend and I ate 4 baskets and craved for more the next morning . The bread is lightly toasted and has soft, chewy insides. We had the lobster ravioli for appetizer, which tasted so good. It is creamy but the lobster stuffing inside has a kick of spiciness, which balances it really well. You get 3 raviolis, which was perfect for an appetizer. The portion sizes for the pastas are really big, and I was so full when it was time for the entree (probably because of all the bread...) But overall, everything tasted pretty good!

Definitely not what it use to be!  This place was sooo good a few years ago. I'm not sure what happened but we ordered the roast beef po boy and mac and cheese and neither had any seasoning. None at all. I'm not sure what kind of cheese was used on the mac but it didn't taste like anything at all much less cheese.  No flavor at all with the roast beef and almost no gravy. My first bite had me wishing I had gone to Parkway for a roast beef debris.  I gave it 2 stars because they have Barq's in the bottle and it was cold.  If you want a real roast beef and gravy (debris) do yourself a favor and go to Parkway.

We were passing though town on our way home to Oakland, California following a trip to Colorado, and stopped in for a beer. The IPA was very good, but the highlight for us was taking home a loaf of their Icky Bread. It was really great. I don know why more brewpubs don't make their own bread. The bread was moist and sweet (though not sugary sweet). Kinda wish we were a lot closer to Reno, so we could get the bread more often....like, all the the time!
Service is crappy, the food was OK but over priced for the amount and quality of it. And the women's bathroom was disgusting to put it nicely. We will never go back there.

I know it's a popular place, it's been open forever, but in my 4 visits since I've moved back here to Tucson, I have not been very excited. Food is kinda sloppish. Simple and not very good actually. Don't think I'll rush to get back there. :-/

Very consistent for Mexican in Philadelphia. I find it to be very good for large groups and enjoy the brunch. I have been to El Vez many times and have not been disappointed. Good food and a fun energetic vibe.

I've waited a long time to write this review... and I'm glad I did. Wisshickon Brewing Company opened on April Fool's Day 2017, and I was there, a little apprehensive that it was an elaborate ruse. Instead, I grew steadily more in love as continual improvements occurred, and JJ and I discovered our favorite neighborhood watering hole... which eventually became the site of our wedding about a year and a half later.

The taproom has a homey tavern feel, with plenty of seating for you, your kids, and your dog (yes, you read that correctly). At any given time, a few super-friendly bartenders are hawking the 10 beers or so are on tap and will assure you that you can't go wrong with any of them, whether it's a Devil's Pool double IPA, a Wigwam pale ale, a Kelpius Cave Belgian, or a Raven Hill porter. The dork in me goes gaga for the clever brew names, which all tie back to the Wissahickon Creek/Park area.

If you need some food to wash down your drink, WBCO maintains a relationship with a rotating cadre of food trucks to satisfy any craving.

WBCO also opens the brew room for customers to enjoy every sporting event on a big projector (ESPECIALLY the Eagles and the Nittany Lions), yoga, Quizzo, cornhole, and private events (read: our wedding). The beer garden/deck is also a cool place to enjoy a pint and watch the weekly cornhole tournament, weather-permitting.

TL;DR: come and drink here. Everyone will greet you as a friend, you'll drink delicious beer/cider/kombucha (or wine!), and you'll leave feeling like you're part of a family.

We had 8:30 reservations for four on a Saturday night - none of us had been, but the reviews looked good and the online menu looked fantastic. We arrived about 5 minutes early and were told it would be just a minute, the guests at our table were just finishing up. We decided to sit down and open our beverages while we waited. And waited. And waited. Afore mentioned guests had polished off their meals and dessert, but were lingering WAY too long. The PYT at the front didn't want to say anything, but after 30 minutes, my husband politely pointed out to the ladies that we were waiting for the table and we had 8:30 reservations. Thankfully, they left. I tell this little bit only to illustrate just HOW FABULOUS the food is - we were a little annoyed at the wait, but once the food started coming out, oh my! High marks for the gazpacho . . . the short ribs . . . the lobster pot pie. And do not miss the "chocolate decadence." We started to just order one to share between all of us, but decided on two. That was a stroke of genius, as after one bite, we would have been fighting over it. Add to it that I got to drink my own favorite beer that's usually not served in restaurants, and it was a meal to remember!  Our waiter, Jason, was great, too. It's a little oasis in all the boisterousness of NL . . . check it out.

By far the worst salon experience I have had. The attendant kept yanking my hair and when I complained said something along the lines of, "no pain gain". The precautions they were taking for Covid were awful and the place was filthy. The attendant had a mask on but it didn't cover nose. I would rarely wish this on a business but I hope they go out of business.

So glad that Yogurtland opened in Goleta! My kids love this place downtown, but it wasn't so convenient until now. Uh-oh! Hope it's not too convenient. Must remember to try to limit the portion size to just three ounces so I end up with six! You try it...that's tricky to do!

Really a great dining experience, especially considering they've barely been open a week.
Unique/diverse menu options, pleasant atmosphere and quick service

Quaint, casual space. Really good soul food. Decent prices. Awesome service! 

When I walked in, the waitress immediately greeted me and asked if it was my first time visiting them. When I said yes, she prepared samples of three sides for me to taste, and offered to allow me to sample any other side on the menu. 

I intended to go to another soul food spot for takeout tonight, but it was closed. I actually had no idea this place what here! What a fortunate turn of events!
Trustworthy. Fast. Cheapest wash is enough for someone who usually keeps their car clean and cared for. Enjoy bringing my car here!!

Very unsatisfied. We got here at 7:30 and didn't get our food until 9:30pm. I asked for an amaretto sour and they brought me a white wine. We waited for so long for everything. This was such a disappointment; on a Sunday night i don't think it was that busy for us to have waiting for 2 hours. the waiter also kept taking our plates when we weren't finished, we asked for our checks when the food came out at 9:30 and at 10pm we still did not have our checks. The manager came and offered ONE person of our group a discount meanwhile we all waited. The checks weren't correct either. I am VERY disappointed, the waitress we had kept making rude comments when we would ask if they could check where our food was. we told the waiter it was someone's birthday, no one sang or even offered a dessert or anything.

The Eagle is definitely one of those places to take an out of town visitor. I've heard they have the best chicken wings in the city but I do love their fries and their mules! They serve them up in giant mugs and are definitely worth the price since they aren't shy on the liquor. I also love their outdoor patio in the summer time, they are right at the beginning of Mass Ave so it's a great place to be in the city! It is usually pretty busy and hard to find a seat but a great place to start a night out or celebrate.

Awful wraps and the rolls were hard as rocks. We got a large catering order for our lacrosse team and the rolls could have been used as lacrosse balls because they were so hard. Others said their salads were good, so I guess just avoid the wrap and rolls. Make sure you have a dentist on hand in case you decide to try the rolls.

They've continue to raise the price and I've tried to cancel my account by phone, writing and email.  I get a different Customer Care Member (that's a joke) each time.  I had the subscription on automatic credit card so I disputed with the credit card company and now they send me a bill. I've called to speak with their accounting department and they continue to say I have to deal CCM, in the meanwhile the CCM will contact the accounting department and I'll have to wait for a reply.  I now have charge they refuse to credit. They are a bad company to deal with.

Grate burger pick your own toppings they had a little spice to them loved it. I got 3 maple bacon mushroom melts all 3 my favorite ingredients. My husband was full off one witch barely happens the thick burger helps. My daughter eat most of her burger but a little to spicy for her, but she scarfed down the fries thanks to the New York fries addition to this burger joint. Definitely going back its just down the street grate for a lazy day when mom don't want to cook.

Not your typical grease tacos I was expecting. They were pretty good and  they had great customer service!! They were so helpful with telling us what's good on the menu aswell as letting us try all their sauces.

Even tho it's getting a 3 star review for my first visit, I'm hopeful it can eventually get 4 stars from me. 

This place is clean, cute, offers fun pizza options, a sald & pasta bar. 
VERY affordable week-day lunch! 

The pizza was just ok (fresher pieces were better, obviously) but I did enjoy their crust & my tummy was totally cool after my over-indulgent lunch, which is impressive.  

Their marinara sauce is some of the best I've ever had in a restaurant (no joke) & the pasta bar is great- as long as the guy serving you isn't who I dealt with today.... either he was just having a really bad day, hates his job, or is just a RUDE person. The back of his shirt said "I built this company"- I thought that was strange & am hoping he's not an owner or GM because that makes this all worse. 
Something about me- if a server, bartender, or restaurant employee is not super busy I really like asking what they recommend; it's their place of work & they should know & typically I get a genuine response, but not today. 
I'm new to this pasta bar experience so, naturally, I walk up with a plate- the pasta station employee pulls it out of my hand & asked what pasta- I mentioned I have never been so didnt know how it all works (says nothing) & when asking what pasta he suggested the guy just flat out picked one that was right in front of him & then interrupted me as I said I would like to try two & I ended up stuck with wayyy too much angel-hair pasta. I didn't get to try the others because I refused to go back up there. 
This guy made zero eye-contact with me & showed zero customer service skills. 
I'm not high-maintenance when going out, especially at a place like this, however I do expect a small level of customer service from those in charge of interacting with customers.
Other employees walking around didn't seem very friendly besides one- a very nice blonde girl who complemented my pizza shirt, she was nice & poor thing- I can't imagine working with that other guy! 

I forgot to try the dessert pizza! 

We will give this place another try down the road, in hopes of a little better pasta bar experience since, in my opinion, it's kind of the high- light in this restaurant!

I decided to visit this lovely establishment on a Tuesday afternoon. The place was completely empty. When we got seated, we were met by delicious chips and salsa. The salsa was very flavorful. Fast forward after two baskets of chips and salsa, we ordered our food. My boyfriend ordered a burger with fries. I ordered jerk chicken taco, surf and turf taco with rice and beans. My boyfriends burger was huge however he said it lacked flavor. My food wasn't great. The jerk chicken taco was okay. Nothing special. The surf and turf had very too much haystacks onions. There was hardly any meat and shrimp. I would have enjoyed it a lot more with steak and shrimp. Overall I don't think I'll visit this place ago.

My sister asked me to go to Black Cat Cafe this weekend. My family often went to tea at the tea room that occupied the building before Black Cat Cafe opened, so I was interested to see what replaced it. Black Cat Cafe is operated by a non-profit organization that supports pet rescue and is run by volunteers- and all meals are tax-free. We made reservations for 12:30 on a Saturday. During our meal, there were only about 4 tables occupied, and a few empty- it would be safe to stop in here on Saturdays without a reservation. The decor was cute and they had tons of pictures of cats and dogs around the cafe.

We were seated right away, but weren't given menus and our table wasn't set. The couple next to us handed us their menus and said, "here- we don't need these anymore". (Their food came in the next 5-10 minutes, so I think the waitress forgot to pick the menus up from their table). The good surprise: they were serving breakfast, and they had some great vegetarian and vegan options as well. Eventually a waitress came by and asked us what drinks we wanted- we all ordered iced teas, which were really good. When she brought them a bit later, she forgot to give us straws or spoons- I had to ask. Eventually she took our food order. Then we waited. And waited. And waited. It took about an hour from the time we sat down until our food arrived. (Except for soup- one of the 3 of us ordered soup, and that came out about 20 minutes before the rest of our food). However, once the food came out, it was pretty tasty. We had to be somewhat aggressive to get things we needed- more iced tea, ketchup, etc. However, in the end, everything tasted good, and everything was quite cheap ($27 for 3 people). 

I'd come back again for the food, and if the service improved a bit, this would easily be a 5-star place. On the way out, we quickly browsed their shop area- they had some items you could buy to support the SPCA (t-shirts, mugs, keychains, etc.) and some yummy looking scones and brownies. Apparently when it is nicer out, they also have adoption days where they bring dogs and cats out to the site for you to spend time with before or after your meal (and consider adopting, of course!).

Pros: supports a great non-profit, tax-free dining, cheap tasty food, cute cafe, not overly crowded, vegan/vegetarian options
Cons: slow, spotty service
This is my favorite spot in & around upper darby! I never get the same thing! Every time I order, i'm never disappointed

Been eating here since 2014 and this is 100% the best sushi restaurant you will ever find. They always have your food out quickly and it is always very tasty and consistent. There kabuki special roll is to die for and you're missing out if you don't try their yummy chicken. Easily my favorite restaurant.

I have read the reviews and the ones with low scores may also equal a low food IQ. Our food was perfectly prepared.  The service was fantastic... Not something I say very often anymore.  Yes, the prices are not cheap; if you want cheap order Pizza Hut or Dominos; you get what you pay for!  Looking for a good, authentic, casually romantic place to eat?  This is it... Recommended to anyone who can appreciate good food and atmosphere!  Side note:  love the accordion player'. Nice wine selection too.

I go here maybe once every 2 week for lunch and they never dissapoint.  There rolls are always fresh because you get to create your own roll.  BBQ pork is by far my favorite. Top it off with some fresh cucumber, mango and jalapeño with some peanut.  And I'm a happy man lol. You can add up to 4 topping of different vegetables and fruits.

Drive thru person was just nasty he obviously didn't want to be working drive thru which came across loud and clear. At the least food cane out quickly this time but the customer service is terrible. This is not the first time I've been their but it will absolutely be the last. Dude at the window if you don't want to be in retail find another job.
So sad that they closed!! Their tofu taco was the best I've ever had... Please come back Memas'!!! PLEASE!!!

Christopher was great! I had rubber sole protectors put on my new leather-soled dress shoes. He was able to do them within an hour. The craftsmanship was excellent. He is super friendly and said that he's been a cobbler for almost forty years. Great job!

i actually don't like raw oysters, but this place has many other great options. poboys are all pretty good, as is the jambalaya and gumbo. the atmosphere's also pretty cool, with red-checkered table-cloths and such. we had to wait a while the last time we went, but, on a weekend, that's to be expected. 
overall, a fun experience and yummy food.
I ordered a smoothie here and it was really good. The person working helped me pick it out based on the fruit I was wanting!

Love this place! I've been to several Phoenix Pita Jungles and this one is amazing too. The interior is modern yet the ambiance is laid back and casual. Vegetarians have lots of options here! My boyfriend loves the shwarma and always orders it. I love the chicken Lavosh pizza! I ordered the Lavosh shwarma this time and it was good but make sure to order some tzaziki on the side since it's kinda dry by itself. For an app, we had the tri-hummus with sirloin. Basically it was a sampler of all 3 of their hummus and sirloin on top served with pita bread. Delicious! Pricing is reasonable and they also have beer. Great casual date place. They also offer to-go ordering.

I rented at the apartment complex on Tanque Verde Estancia. The worst freaking apartment complex I've lived in my life. The b**** Kelly moved me into a downstairs apartment with a freaking one-year-old above me can you imagine they're up all hours of the friggin night kids running around like it's a playground on my ceiling. A couple above me were fat and weighted a ton when they walked it felt like the ceiling was going to cave in.The couple above me were having sex while they're f****** kid was running around like it is a friggin playground on my ceiling at 3 in the morning. I was woken from the thumping on the my ceiling. Who has sex while they're freaking kid is running around watching them. That's just disgusting. No wonder kids today are f****** retarded. I guess when you have f****** retarded parents you come out retarded. 7102 do not rent unless you want to deal with the shit I had to deal with. My advice is to never rent there at all don't say I didn't warn you.

Got the chicken fingers, hot. Breading was light, which was nice, and the hot was hotter than Hattie B's, in my opinion, but the chicken itself wasn't that good - dry, a little tough, and just not not that great. Maybe it's because I got the chicken fingers and not "real" chicken (breast, thigh, wing, etc) but I've got to give this a 3 because of that.

Solid. 

We went here to try out the pizza and overall it was really positive. 

Two of shared the OG pizza-basically a meat lovers, salad, and garlic knots. 

If you like garlic, you have to try the garlic knots. They were really good and the best bang for our buck. 

The pizza was really good. We will be more adventurous next time and try the brisket pizza or the pineapple pizza. 

When we go back, we would just get the garlic knots and a pizza to share. 

We would love to see fountain soda added. 

The salad was okay but the pizza and knots are the stars here. 

Most importantly everyone was so friendly and welcoming.

Went to hometown cafe on a whim and were so glad! We were seated right away without wait (not to say it wasn't busy!). 

We got a nice booth for 4. Our waitress was super nice and straight to the point which was great since we were starving and needed to eat. I got the eggs Benedict. I don't eat ham and our waitress switched it out for tomato and avocado which was great! I got them with home fries and they were delicious

My fiancé got the smothered breakfast burrito and it was really good, and way too much food! The portions are huge and the prices are low, what a steal!

Our friends got the blueberry pancakes and the chicken fried steak and everyone was very pleased with their meals.

I went here to get my eyebrows permanent makeup touched up after the woman who originally did them retired.  When I went in for a consultation Virginia told me the shape could be improved and drew on what she thought would be more flattering.  I went with her suggestion and was amazed at how much better they look with just a little bit of tweaking.  Virginia herself is an absolutely lovely woman.  She really knows her stuff!
Extremely happy with my hair. This is such a relaxing place, I highly recommend it. Very talented staff. I really appreciate how clean and organized everything is. Love the artwork as well

I really like RC Willey, they sell good quality items at a reasonable price, and they often have lots of sales/deals going on.  I recently purchased a queen serta mattress set from them on a really good sale.  They were able to deliver my mattress only a few days later for $59 which also included the removal of my old mattress (I believe you only have to pay the delivery rate once every 12 months).  I also like that they call to give you an estimated delivery time, and then call again when they are on their way over.  I also purchased a vanity from them years ago and it is still holding up nice.

Delicious, great service, and overall enjoyable experience! If you're looking for a chic, unique dinner, look no further. Though we got there about about an hour before closing, LT was still bustling with groups large and small all deeply engaged in conversation in the packed but intimate space. 
Per Yelp reviews and a pep talk by our sweet server Austin, we ordered the bone marrow appetizer. Austin described it as "meat butter" and turns out there is not a more accurate descriptor than that. A unique, smokey buttery flavor served in alarmingly large femur bones, the marrow was more of a special delicacy, but certainly worth the experience.
My dining partner hit it out of the park with an order of gnocchi, creamy and well seasoned. The portion was small, but as someone who rarely orders non-meat entrees, he was floored by the flavor of this dish. 
I ordered the peach and ham pizza, which was quite good, though paled in comparison to the gnocchi. The pricing was very disproportionate to the amount of food, though quite in line with quality since my pizza was at least 2 meals but not quite on par for deliciousness with the gnocchi.
Drinks were also impressive once we got past the overwhelming array of nuanced cocktails (good, just a bit confusing at first glance). I went with a beehive, refreshing and tasty!
Finally, the cookie skillet....I mean, just wow! A warm chocolate chip cookie with vanilla gelato. It was cruel to squeeze it in on top of all the other delicious foods, but OH so worth it! Don't miss LT or their dessert!

Food was delicious!!! Bacon Bloody Mary's were awesome. We did the online waitlist thru Yelp and showed up checked in w host stand and only had to wait about 15 minutes. Can't wait to come back and try again!
Best place in the spongedocks hands down! The hush puppies are to die for! Great food, great seafood and good atmosphere. I love sitting outside and looking at the water.

Total dive bt theres nothing wrong with that. it was a great stop new years day 2008 to warm up (and the bartender with the hair decoractions made me love the place!) and this years for a quick pony beer to add to our bar crawl made sure we made it to another beer with out getting sick. The bartender was a sweet heart and even put up with us being wasted and asking her to take pictures.

This is for an unpleasant experience that happened to me!

I happened to be staying their one night in the height of summer, I had payed WELL over the top for my room around $800 a night....JOKE. The place is obviously really nice, but it's not $800 a night nice. The hotel is more like a camp ground setting with all the rooms in different buildings with gardens around, quite tranquille.  I decided to walk and find the swimming pool in my robe....I ended up having to cross the main road to get there, a bit embarrassing for cars driving past.

Everything was really over priced there. I made the mistake of thinking I could walk into Santa Barbara...which you can't. It's a 15 min taxi away which was a bit annoying.

ANYWAY...to the point..a celebrity was staying there who I randomly ran into during my self tour of the complex.....as I was just looking at what was going on, I was ushered out of the grounds by staff! When I told the staff I was staying there they didn't believe me and then followed me around! It was SO RUDE. Once they realized I did have a room there I was followed back to my room. I felt like I was under ROOM ARREST as they waited outside, what did they think I was going to do? Do you realize how much I have spent there! Now I didn't say anything to the celeb or do anything to them or even take any pictures, I just simply watched what was going on inside the hotel that I had paid to stay in.

I get it you are an OVER PRICED HOTEL for people with 'more money than sense'  Does this mean my stay is worth less than someone else's? DISGUSTED

I didn't like any of the stuck up staff, I didn't feel relaxed which was my entire purpose for going there in the first place and I have told so many people about that incident! I had a beer on the veranda but felt like I was being watched so just left to go into town (15 minutes away) I had planned on staying 3 nights....and ended up checking out after 1 as I was so mad!

Get a grip! The room was half decent and what you would expect for $100 a night (which it wasn't)

NEVER going back.
Oh my goodness. The wings had me wanting seconds and even craving wings the next day! Best wings I've had out in years.

This was my first visit to a Legends Galaxy Theatre. I'm very impressed. I actually haven't been to any movie theatre for several years so when we showed up 5 minutes early for a 1:50 matinee on a Saturday, and were told the only seats left were front row my immediate response was a silent but mental HUH??? Verbally I actually asked "do you assign seats"?  The look I got was priceless. Yes. I had no idea how much theaters had changed. 

Front row scared me. I bought tickets for the following day and chose a back row seat. I walked away on Saturday armed with the website, www.galaxytheatres.com, where I will be able to locate my local Legends theatre and buy tickets in the future. 

NOTE that there is a $1.50 surcharge to buy tickets online. Bumps the matinee (& evening Senior) price from $8.50 to $10. But hey...ELECTRIC RECLINING SEATS and swing away tray tables...Plenty of space to walk down each isle with all the seats reclined!  And an excellent well designed wheelchair row with companion seating. And good safety lighting along the stairs. 

The next time we go...and we WILL be back...I will check out the view from that front row just in case we don't want to plan far ahead to see a movie!

And a note to management...I agree this is a luxury theatre  but if Galaxy ever wants to take luxury to the ultimate level, CONSIDER OFFERING ORGANIC POPCORN or at the very least NON GMO popcorn!  I would buy THAT popcorn!  And it would say a lot for a Theatre to take an interest in its customers health!  

Other reviews have mentioned that IMAX does NOT have reclining seats. If that's a deal breaker be sure to ask before you go!  I have never been to the Imax.

I highly recommend this company. I have chosen it based on Yelp's reviews. My a/c broke Friday night. I called Saturday morning at 8. Jerard was able to come over at 10:30ish. The motor and fan were broken. He fixed the motor but had to get the fan on Monday. He was able to find a used fan so I can have a/c until a new fan is replaced on Monday. Jerard is flexible and good to work with. It's about trust. He sent me the bill a week later to make sure the a/c is working properly before I pay him.

I have sampled boba before and didn't see the appeal, but I was convinced to give this one a try and oh my goodness I am hooked! First off,  I am picky about my iced Thai tea and they nailed the authentic flavor here. I added the brown honey boba and loved both the texture and the flavor it added to the tea. I also sampled the strawberry boba,  which tasted like mouthwatering gummy bears. 

The only downside is that I may never try anything else on their extensive menu because I will forever be craving that Thai tea... I will definitely be making this shop a part of my State St. routine!

It's honestly a meh place, I go there at least once or twice a month but I try not to write a review if it's not insanely good or bad but my last few experiences were bad which comes from the fact that they've switched to cheaper meats for almost all of their dishes
BlueDot Donuts rocks.  My wife goes maple bacon.  I do blueberry cake.  Good coffee.

Ate at Andys for the first and last time today. The server might have been on drugs or some sort of zombie, every single thing we ordered tasted like crap,and my husband and I are sick. Luckily enough my kids refused to eat there burned rubbery hot dogs so they are faring a little bit better. My Greek pannini was tasteless and not fresh, my husbands meatball sandwhich had no flavor and all of the French fries were under cooked. Not happy at all.

Bibi Jib is hands down the best Indian food I've had in California. I'm a transplant from the U.K living in SoCal and Indian food is in our DNA. I have always lamented the dearth of great Indian in California - until now. You will not be disappointed. Amazing food, great friendly staff and incredible wine list....
Delicious food, great service, and perfect location.  Going back next time I'm in Santa Barbara. Would definitely recommend!

I have shopped and donated here for MANY years.  Overall the items are much better organized than they used to be.  But OMG, the PRICES!  The pricing is absolutely ridiculous!  I just came home from the shops and I am still aghast.  Who is setting the prices on these items?  Everything is top dollar, and in some cases MORE expensive than similar NEW items.  If you are looking to save money, then this is not the place to shop.  You can do better at Home Goods, Ross, Marshall's, etc for better quality NEW items.  Until they get their act together and fix the pricing, I recommend skipping the shops.

This is a B&B that really knows how to do it right!

It's absolutely beautiful. Each room has it's own theme. Their chef comes in each morning and makes the most luscious breakfast!  They go out of their way to make you feel at home. The decor is tastefully lodge themed without going overboard. The beds are super comfortable. The staff is so friendly and helpful and will do anything within reason to make your stay perfect. 
There a some rooms that have balcony access, and some even have jacuzzi tubs! It located further from downtown which makes you feel like you truly are getting away from it all. However, it's also close enough to go do whatever sightseeing you'd like in town or out!
If/when we ever go back to St. Louis were staying there again.

This was a great experience as a mother with a toddler. After 3 times at union hospital in elkton and being told my kid was just hungry I came here. they took us serious immediately and found a possible cause within hours. It was so serious he had to be ambulance transported to Dupont childrens hospital. This was the first place that took my child being sick as a serious issue. I am very grateful to have found a hospital that cares about children.

My husband and I had the honor of having Matt and Katie DJ our wedding this past September, and they captured the style and ambiance of our special day flawlessly. They were able to take a small list of music suggestions from us and then take care of the rest on their own. Not only are these two amazing people, they will completely take care of you on your special day and will make sure the flow of your event goes smoothly.  I highly recommend Do Well Events for your wedding or special event!

Was here years ago with a friend from DC on recommendation from a friend in NJ. It's a nice place. But, the dishes that stand out to me were the calamari appetizers and the dessert chimichanga.

The calamari was excellently fried - crispy and right tenderness. Came in a cone presentation with pieces of jalapeno peppers. Very nice, tasty, not too spicy.

The chimichanga was tasty. It was sweet - and I guess I didn't really expect it like that. While tasty, I can' t say I enjoyed it or thought it was memorable.

I may need to experience Bridget Foy one more time but my first time was probably average - not too hot, not too cold. I, however, might be more adventurous or desire more adventure with my food than Bridget Foy caters too.

Parking is Philadelphia parking - so be careful, make sure you feed the meter.

Avoid this place at all cost they are the worst!!! I go in on a Friday afternoon around noon. I pick up some spray paint, tack cloth, and need one 2x4 cut into 1 foot lengths. The guy cutting wood can get the guy in front of me wood cut straight. The worker never asked what I needed, or anything. I stand there with this 2x4 for 15 min and when he's done another customer walks up and is told that the saw is out of order! I will never set foot in another Lowe's again!

Mardi Gras is a state of mind. And Caluda's can help you keep that state of mind all year long with their outstanding King Cake. I first found out about King Cake at a Baton Rouge Yelp event on Zoom . It was supposed to be a bake-along event but I didn't bake; I watched and took notes from the chat, including a most important note about ordering King Cakes online from Caluda's. 

Which is exactly what I did. 

My King Cake was supposed to arrive a week before it did but in these crazy times in which we live, not only did we endure a pandemic but a massive ice storm in Texas shut down shipping impacting the whole country. I called Caluda's to see what was up and heard an outgoing message saying, basically, chill. Your cake will get there when it gets there and it will be fresh. 

Which it did and it was. 

Caluda's King Cake is yeasty, moist and flavorful. The icing is the perfect sugary compliment to the dough. And of course it's sprinkled with sugars  (purple for justice, green for faith, and gold for power.) It arrived on my doorstep with a Mardi Gras cup and three strings of Mardi Gras beads. Talk about putting me in the Mardi Gras spirit. Just what the doctor ordered as we come up on one year of pandemics, lockdowns and quarantines.

TOURIST TRAP.

That's all this is!

I tell people all the time that if you want a actual, authentic cheese steak I always tell people Carmen's in the Terminal Market or Jim's on South Street!

I continually try and give this place chances since it's location is convenient, but they continue to provide mediocre service, and this time I got to leave with a scratch on leather in my new car. This will be the last time. 
Left with crumbs still on carpets, water dripping down from mirrors and all around trunk, windows and windshield not cleaned right, Inside sprayed but half-wiped, Tires sprayed but not wiped at all and a new scratch! 
The funniest part is you can see them "cleaning" your car and as I watched you can see the minimal to 0 effort put in as someone sprays the window then slowly drags a rag across the center then moving on to the next. 
I will be contacting the BBB.

They made me feel like I went to my grandparents for ice cream. Immediately, you'll feel welcomed here. They had a great assortment of waffle cones, bowls, splits, dips, classic candy, and, most importantly, ice cream. 

When not busy the owners will chat with customers and make sure everything is just right. No tips accepted, only donations to their gransdaughter's college funding (really).   

Definitely will come back again!

I have fond memories of dinners at Effies during college, but a visit back with a large party last Friday night left a bit to be desired.

Effies has a fabulous atmosphere. Located in an old house with mantles and family photos on the walls, it definitely has a simple, homey feel. It's a family business Greek cooks, servers, etc. On previous visits, I've enjoyed dinner in a private covered dining room on the back patio and live music.

On this visit, we were seated upstairs. They have lots of long tables for large groups upstairs, but it was also pretty stuffy, which improved when I opened all the windows. I was unimpressed pretty quickly when I noticed lipstick on one of the wineglasses on our table. 

Unfortunately, part of our party had an unexpected issue and arrived very late. Although we ordered plenty of appetizers and the restaurant was fairly empty, our waiter made it clear that he was unhappy about the delay and actually gave us a deadline to place an order by! We also ended up being there quite a long time catching up, and were rushed and told it was time to leave by the staff, putting another damper on the evening.

That said, the food is actually very good. We loved the Thessaloniki platter (lots of fresh, delicious pita and dips), the stuffed peppers, and the Effie's chicken. Also very reasonably priced.

Overall, good food, reasonably priced, cute byob for large groups. However, a little more attention to cleanliness and service would have made this a better experience for our group. Don't forget it's cash only!
Gorgeous bar, stunning cocktails and in a great location. Has a speak easy vibe. Highly recommend.

I have been going to smile line for years since they were in conshohocken. Dr. Jeong is always nice and professional and I have been completely satisfied with his work. He even fit me in for an emergency appt the same day I had an issue. I have never had any pain after procedures and have had all my procedures done in house. He seems to really enjoy dentistry and it shows in his work.

I was never able to hit up their original spot, but this newer place is set up nicely.  The strip mall they are located in needed a shot in the arm.  I was impressed with the inside, chairs set up around a electric fireplace, booths, table seating in the back, lots of coffee themed decor along with coffee bean sacks from around the world and plenty of room for seating.  That will come in handy during and God willing after we get through this terrible COVID lifestyle.  Was sad to see a little playroom area roped off and closed due to COVID, but that is unfortunately where we are these days.

They have a warmer for some sandwiches to go, private label coffee, daily specials on a chalkboard, nice clear views of their different bagel offerings, but lacking descriptors on each type of bagel, but the staff was nice enough to point them out.  Their coffee setup is self serve.

Eats wise I decided to go with a sausage, egg and cheese on a cheddar jalapeno bagel.  They told me 5-10 mins which seems long since I was the only customer inside.  My sandwich came out just before 5 minutes and was packaged nicely.  It was $5 and change.  My first impression was that the sandwich was small, the bagel looked great, was fresh, doughy and on the smaller size.  You aren't going to get a belly busting breakfast sandwich here, but it was fresh, and neatly made.  The egg and sausage were fresh and decent.  

Bensalem is lucky to have several small business bagel/coffee shops in town.  I expected more of a portion size for the price, but the bagel itself was good.  The location is nice and clean.   I hope for nothing but the best for these guys!

I recently moved into a rental home. I expected to find the home in a very clean condition when I moved in, but that was not the case. The hardwood floors were not clean, showing shoe prints and residue from whatever was used on them last. The inside of my oven was covered in black residue, and other appliances were barely wiped down, with multiple details overlooked. A friend recommended Bill and his crew at The Cleaning Authority (Fishers) to provide their signature deep clean. They arrived on time and listened attentively to my primary areas of concern. The two employees were polite and organized, and I felt comfortable leaving the house to head to work. That evening, when I returned home, I was literally amazed at the difference. The hardwood floors looked polished. The floorboards were wiped down. Bathroom and kitchen counters were shiny. Sinks were clean and shiny. The kitchen looked amazing. My oven was CLEAN (and I mean CLEAN)! The stainless steel refrigerator even looked better, and I had already cleaned the front several times in an attempt to rid it of a weird residue. They wiped down the inside of my refrigerator, too. My entire home smelled fresh! There was no skimping on service from this team and I am extremely pleased with the outcome. I will recommend The Cleaning Authority to anyone I hear is in need of cleaning services, without hesitation.

It was a Sunday when I learn the sad truth that House of Bread does not do donuts.  

What they do do is -
Bread 
Danish 
Cookies 

My favs- 
Zucchini & Pumpkin Loafs - the zucchini loaf is light. A perfect midday snack.  Personally, I think it begs for chocolate chips.   I made the request at the counter. They smiled and we chatted about our favorite loaf recipes.   I don't think they'll make the addition of chips but a girl can dream. 

Tea Cakes - Light cake stuffed with berries (not too sweet).  They come in trays of 8. You can get single serving at Swill Coffee.  

This is a great spot to grab breakfast when the farmer's market is open in the summer.   

I've see the House of Bread trucks around town so I've gotta assume I've eaten there bread and pastries in coffee shops and restaurants around town.

Comfortable bed, clean room, phenomenal staff. Came here for a work trip, stayed in a room and our team also used the conference room here. The staff was incredibly polite and accommodating, even when I inadvertently left my key cards in my room and locked myself out at midnight.  

There is a restaurant/bar in the same parking lot which is convenient, nice amenities (gym/pool/hot tub), breakfast/dinner and small bar in the hotel. Only downside is my room didn't have a tub (I love bubble baths, haha), but the shower was great so I can't complain.
The fried chicken here is amazing. Get a half fried chicken sweet and spicy, order a few banchan and thank me later.

Laid back. Delicious comfort food. How can you go wrong?

This place was delicious. We had thanksgiving dinner balls- which were actually turkey, mashed potatoes, stuffing, and gravy all fried together. 

NOT TO MENTION- they had my most favorite beer on tap- Yards Love Stout. One of the best low key places in Philly I have been to that hasn't had a total foodie vibe. I felt comfortable and the food was great.
I have been to this bakery with my family and friends a few times. I have had nothing but superb service and fresh baked goods. I love that they are open later then most bakeries.

Decided to try something new and I'm SO happy i did. Interestingly enough, i was browsing yelp looking for a good bratwurst but somehow ended up at Vina. I was sold by looking at the pictures and just had to try the lemon grass chicken sandwich.  

So delicious!!! The flavors are so floral and crisp. For such a large sandwich, i was quite honestly surprised at how light it all was. I didn't feel overwhelmed or needed a nap, even if i did only eat half. The ingredients compliment one another and the flavors are still distinguished without being bogged down by a ton of sauce. 

I can't wait to return

This was a darn good cheesesteak.  Very nice seeded roll.  Good amount of tender tasty meat.  Good cheese and cheese melt.  The fried onions may have been the weak link.  They were there and added a little flavor.  I saw a lot of sandwich trays going out to businesses while I waited for my cheesesteak.  Two Good Guys running the place.  Very good Cheesesteak experience.

I only go in this bar once a year and since what when down last year will not be going back! I go to the annual Saint Patties day breakfast every year I can make it! 
I went and waited in a big line as usual to get in the place. I thought all was well and was having a great time socializing and drinking with the people. When I got ready to leave the rest room the guard / owner of the place pulled me aside and Said "I don't know how to put this but people have been complaining about you running into them." I said no I didn't notice I did not do anything and said excuse me if I ran into anyone. Then he told me you have to leave, but you can come back anytime but on this day! So if you are young and like a big place and not visually impaired like me then enjoy on Saint Patties day which you will not find me there ever again!

I've been to the one on Rte 3 twice before and was happy to see this one open close to where I live.  Went last night with a party of 4, had to wait about 15 min for a table (booth), which was fine.  We ordered appetizers, 2 bang bang shrimp, potstickers & crab cakes to share.....they were very good and the dishes were left empty.  I had the lobster tails and they were cooked perfectly.  Two others had the Kobe beef burgers and there were no complaints and one ordered a steak w/mushroom sauce and he was pleased as well.  Overall the service was great, food was great...my only complaint would be that it was very loud in the dining room.  Will definitely go back!!

What an epic BBQ experience. You're immediately greeted by the pit/preparation area as you enter the premises. You can smell the flavor of the food outside the building! My mouth was watering before I came through the door. I went with my wife who had been here before and recommended I try it. Spoiler alert! This place is hands-down some of the best BBQ I've ever had. 

It was a Sunday night, so it wasn't too crowded. Though the upstairs section had a lot of people sitting there. Due to COVID we decided to sit in the less populated section inside, but downstairs. There is also seating outside, both upstairs and downstairs. We were greeted by our server, and handed a carafe of water and two glasses. I ordered a Pepsi, and looked at the menu. 

I was glad to see that they had just about every BBQ aficionado's pick of meats. There's pulled-pork, ribs, brisket, beef-rib, and the list goes on. I was a little disappointed in the Pepsi/Coke choice, but that's a personal preference, and not a point off for the restaurant. If Dr. BBQ is paying homage to Texas, then he would get an extra point for staying true to Dr. Pepper in fact. I ended up ordering the Texas Two-Step which offers two half portions of meats, and two sides for $18. 

The food came on a sheet pan with parchment paper on top, which was a nice touch. The sides I ordered, the cowboy caviar, and fries, came in their own respective dishes. Presentation was good, and I enthusiastically started to eat. The burnt ends! Oh, they were perfect. Just the right amount of softness to crunchiness ratio if that is even a thing. The ends of the ends were slightly burnt, and the crunchy part of the ends was my favorite part. There was so much flavor in the meat (angus beef) that I didn't even need one of their three BBQ sauces to go with it. I can't rave enough about the burnt ends; just get them. Secondly, I bit into the brisket, first without sauce, and then I proceeded to try all three sauces. The brisket was cooked perfectly, and was soft and tender. The first sauce, the sweet sauce, was a little too sweet for my taste. The other two sauces, the Smokey, and the Spicy sauces were delicious. The spicy sauce ended up being my favorite. It had just the right amount of heat, and flavor, that it paired with the brisket perfectly. 

Now for the sides. The Cowboy Caviar was a little disappointing. It was bland with no seasonings, and there was no heat to it. I would suggest adding some kind of salt-based seasoning, and a few jalapeños to kick it up a few levels. I almost took a star off for this side, but it is nothing that can't be easily remedied, and the other two sides I tasted, the BBQ beans, and self-cut fries, more than made up for it. Side-note, I did end up finishing the Cowboy Caviar as it was still a good side. The fries were seemingly done in house. I've never seen fires cut in these shapes, and they tasted fresh, not frozen. The fries are also super thin, so they are almost like potato chips, but not quite. The BBQ beans were awesome! Full of flavor, and just the right amount of sweetness. It even had pieces of meat in there for added flavor. 

Service was good. I did have to wait a few minutes for a refill on my Pepsi, but that could've been specific to my server. She may have been very busy upstairs, as the downstairs indoors wasn't very busy. I ended up eating everything but the toast, and two burnt ends, and that's saying something because they were so good I wanted to eat them. I then decided to see what they had for dessert. I ordered the Banana Pudding. The pudding was so good that I had to finish it. There were little cookies throughout the pudding, and it was topped with whip cream, and a slice of banana. 

Overall, Dr. BBQ is a MUST to visit if you come to the Tampa Bay region. I live 40 minutes away, and would come here every week if I could afford to both physically and monetarily.

The burger (just a regular cheeseburger) was very good. It was nice and pink.

But oh the garlic fries. They were disgusting. The first couple of bites seemed great. Then my mouth actually started to hurt from the heavy doses of garlic, and my fingers stung from the garlic. 24 hours later, all I can taste is garlic. My car absolutely reeks from the 10 minutes I had the terrible fries in my car. I love garlic and use it liberally when I cook, and I can't handle the garlic fries.
Amazing service! Kara was attentive and made sure I got a delicious Latte! She was helping in making my selection, and served us quickly! Wonderful morning pick me up!

Went for an anniversary dinner and decided to splurge - we split a pitcher of sangria ($31) and both got the chef's tasting menu ($75). I usually feel guilty spending that much for a meal but for a special occasion it was 100% worth it.

The menu was super unique - lots of great Spanish dishes that I would never have thought to order or would have NO idea how to make at home. Especially loved the octopus, was a great serving size and pretty thick tentacle (weird description but other places that have octopus usually serve these squirrelly little pieces). The basil ice cream was fantastic too!

Overall - a little pricey but I think for special occasions it's a great experience and a delightful atmosphere.

I recently ordered from To-Kai for the first time as a departure from my normal sushi place. While the experience was alright, I wasn't too impressed with the food. However, they were very polite and informative on the phone and my food was delivered very quickly.

I ordered their steak and shrimp hibachi dinner. The price for the meal, while quite a bit higher than I generally pay, wasn't a deterrent. INITIALLY.
When I opened the order, the small amount of food I saw made me feel as though I had been ripped off. The shrimp were small. The steak was tough, though seasoned well and the rice was incredibly hard for some reason. In retrospect, I'm quite glad they didn't give me more rice.

Their gyoza was perfect though. However, considering the price of the meal - I should have enjoyed more than the gyoza.

I was having scheduling issues w/ my usual groomer and came across a Groupon for this company. There doggy mobile was cute so I decided to give it a try. I schedule appointment 10 days later (1st available). I was scheduled w/ Marielsa. As previously stated on other reviews no surprise she was running 15 min late. She met my dog and seemed appropriate and caring. She "assessed" him and stated he was really " matted" and that he would require a short cut. She took him into the doggy mobile and 2 hrs later,  I was immediately stunned to see my dog completely shaven down to the skin, leaving minimal patch of hair on ears and tail. My dog had been converted into a Chinese Crested or a hairless cat. I was so upset that she had done this to my dog. Then to top it off she asked to sign a consent for shaving the dog as if at this point I had a choice. I immediately complained to the company and received a callback only to be offered a bath for my dog in 3-4 wks. My dog has been insecure, cold and has not slept for days since this traumatic experience. I caution everyone who uses this company regarding this " dematting" it seems unnecessary. My dog is well cared for and brushed frequently.  I think it's quicker to do than style them for breed appropriate groom. I will not use them again.

Ordered the Jamaican shrimp, and it arrived as mostly chicken (which was an option...that I didn't order) and lukewarm after a 20 min wait, which feels like a long time. Didn't alert the waiter, since we needed to get on with our day.

I miss the 775 Gastropub that previously occupied this  location!
Nice place, good food and friendly staff , can get a little busy at times, they have a fantastic breakfast special , a nice bakery is attached , all in all worth a visit from breakfast thru dinner.
Amazing amazing amazing service. We've been back every day bc Sasha and Holly are so great! Fun music by Kyle! Check this place out. Best bar on Bourbon...warning...the Resurrection is dangerous!

They get 3  for great food but terrible service.  Their potato salad is really good and their Gyro was huge.  

If you order the Greek salad you better be hungry because it's huge too!  

There was only 1 table when I went there, it took me 20 minutes to get my food.  When my friend arrived it took him awhile to order and a long time for his Salad.  ( about 15 min). 

I'll go back because the food was great and I hope the service is better so I can give them 4 stars.

We met Scott through an open house. Shortly after we met, we sat down with him and went through our criteria. Over the next few months, as our criteria continuously  changed, Scott patiently kept showing us home after home. We were trying to by our first home and we are so grateful that we had Scott on our side. He always provided us with an honest opinion, was always a quick message away and ensured we got the best deal. He found ways to save us money and negotiated so incredibly hard for us. We are so happy with our new home and had the most wonderful experience buying our first home because of Scott. We've gained a friend through the whole experience and would happily recommend him to everyone!
Great spot. Pizza is consistently good and the service is quick. Not to mention how nice the staff is -- I highly recommend this place.

Sensual, elegant, soul-affirming and absolutely perfect.

(And that was just our waiter, a Nordic deity named Franz) 

I work just a few blocks away from this place, and had been there for the incredible lunches during the day (at "Steam"). I simply could not ignore the relentless 5-star reviews any longer. Turns out, this place earns every pixel of the full five stars, and even makes me dream of a mythical sixth star. Places like this simply do not exist on the beach.

The exterior is very unassuming, which helps keep this place off the radar of a lot of folks. The interior is lush with dark woods and perfect attention to design, with the chef's station right out there with the customers. I felt a little underdressed actually, in my t-shirt and shorts (though in no way unwelcome). A woman played live jazz on a small stage in the corner.

The only slight hiccup in an otherwise perfect experience was the host. When he seated us, he immediately said "our mineral water choices are ____ and ____, do you have any preference" as he was walking to grab them for us. An obviously pushy tactic to upsell some drinks right off the bat. We had the tap with lemon (I am not a fan of mineral water). 

The food (tapas, but in larger portions than what I have had before) was a new level of supreme goodness:

House (Red) Sangria, 6 dollars - 5 stars

Spaghetti Squash Coconut Curry Bisque, 7 dollars - 5 stars (the best bisque I have had in 44 years of consciousness. 7 bucks is a tad much for a cup of soup, but one spoonful validates the expense)

Roasted Spaghetti squash with veggies, 8 dollars - 5 stars (the flavors just cannot be described) - and the price is so right!

Seafood Curry over rice, 11 dollars - 5 stars (lush spices, but not very "spicy" - amazing)

Red, a dessert, 7 dollars - 4 stars (see photo I uploaded with the full description of this dessert - it's basically a red velvet cake + cocoa bread pudding)

My girlfriend and I luxuriated over each dish, sharing each one together. It was one of the nicest, most intimate meals that we have had together in a restaurant. The chef, Jackie, adds a full star by her presence alone. She made sure we were pleased with each dish, told stories from her life as a chef, and really added to the experience. She cooks everything right there, out in the open, a few feet away - giving you the feeling of eating in her own kitchen.

It is rare when I feel that 5 stars is "undercutting" a restaurant. The fact that this place exists at all on the beach is an anomaly. None of the clotted grease, deep-fried goods, or oversized drinks in giant plastic souvenir glasses here! This is what a "dining experience" was meant to be. As someone who both lives and works in the beach zone - I am supremely thankful to have this oasis of beauty and bliss mere minutes from my home.

Apparently I can't give 0 stars so I had to give a 1 star. Poor customer service. I enrolled into their monthly program but when I cancelled it all my sessions were also cancelled. They still charged me for 2 months. So I paid for 2 months and did not have any massage sessions.

Excellent excellent food! We went on a Friday night and tried the curry sausage, schnitzel and the Nutella knodle...all excellent. You absolutely must try the knodle, the owner claims to be the only one in the state serving it and it is like nothing we've ever had. 

The schnitzel was fried perfectly and the homemade sausage truly great. It was served with a curry sauce but they have 5-6 other sausage dishes to try if curry isn't your thing. It's a limited menu but I like that personally...they focus on what they are good at, but the owner said as they go along they will add more German dishes to the menu. 

The artwork in the restaurant is very neat as well and has a story behind it - ask the owner, he will be happy to explain it to you! Very nice guy - give them a try!

Four of us stopped in and were happy to get one of the last two tables available. The food was delicious, the server rather ditzy (affectionately stated) and the kitchen was backed up. And we all enjoyed ourselves! 

I had ahi tuna served with Wasabi and sliced tomatoes which was delightful (no chopsticks). $7.95 

Other orders:
Six wings with celery, carrots and choice of blue cheese or ranch dressing. Sauces: mild, hot, blackened, grab your kilt!, garlic parmesan, BBQ, honey BBQ,haberno BBQ, Teriyaki. Our order was for naked wings and a side of garlic parm $5.95 

Rueben Rolls - homemade eggs rolls stuffed with corn beef, cabbage & Swiss cheese. Thousand Island on the side $7.95 yummy 

Colcannon - potatoes mashed with cabbage, onions and topped with Cheddar cheese $5.50 this rocked 

The Fiver French onion soup with leeks, shallots, red, white & green onion in a hearty broth topped with melted Swiss and provolone $5.95 best I've tasted 

Corned beef rueben with Swiss,  sauerkraut and thousand island dressing on rye $9.25 keeper 

So many menu items that it was hard to choose. Pricing is reasonable and affordable which makes Finley's a place to go back to again and again. Oh, the beers were fresh and cold.  Free parking 

Finley's Irish Pub & Eatery has great food, drinks, music and atmosphere.  There are 18 big screen TVs with a vast array of sporting events including the NFL and MLB package.  Also offered is a full complement of Irish whiskeys, full liquor bar as well as domestic and imported beers (22 on tap)

So much for first impressions. My first visit to this so called cup cake heaven ended before it began. I was greeted by a sign on the door, "Out of cupcakes". I will try to be understanding to the fact they are a new business. However, a little customer service could have gone a long way to curbing a negative first experience. Visit number two did not go much better. I was delighted to find they were open this time, but they only had a selection of two different types of cupcakes. I did not care to purchase either of the two choices. I was not crazy enough to go back for a third visit. However, I was brought a red velvet cupcake.  The entire edge of the cupcake was hard, and last time I checked cupcakes are supposed to be moist. The inside of the cupcake was dry, and no amount of frosting could save this cupcake from its desert wasteland. Sprinkles cupcakes and many others have nothing to worry about. This business is going to need to put in some serious work to stick around.
This was our second visit to Woody's. The service is wonderful and all the workers are super friendly and make sure you have a great time. Go early and get a discount.

The Toastery is my new favorite brunch place! I love the warm corn bread with apple butter that welcomes you when you arrive! My pancakes were equally delicious, as they were served with crispy bacon and topped with powdered sugar! Another great brunch spot!
Chicken fried chicken, sweet mashed potatoes, and bacon mac n cheese. Wow!  All of it was amazing. And live music too!

Because El Vez was too crowded and *someone* forgot to make a reserveration, we yondered across the way to Zavino.  What a nice find!  

I opted for something simple -- just a plain old margherita pizza.  Simple.  Fresh.  Delicious.  I don't know as much about wine as I might indicate, so I opted for a glass of merlot.  On point.  

The service was on par for what I'd expect from a place like this -- friendly but not obnoxious, attentive but not smothering.  

Definitely worth a trip across the bridge to explore more of the menu ...

About the nicest thing about this spot is the ease of finding it. The freeway exit drops you right there. The prime rib was pretty good for the price. The gambling was pretty terrible. The view is of a train yard, which I actually liked. Maybe not for everyone. The neighborhood is mostly warehouses otherwise. Check-in could have been better. And the $18 "resort fee" is plain highway robbery. Unfortunately, that has become the norm in Nevada.

Had a great time here!  Went on a Thursday night for a beer-tasting lesson group sponsored by Budweiser.  Probably half the reason why I loved it so much was because we got free food/beer with the lesson.. but still.. it was great.  The crab fries and wings were outstanding -- best wings that the bf and I have had in Phila.  We also noticed these things that people were ordering called "towers of beer" -- where it's literally a huge tube of beer that they put on your table and there's several pitchers worth in each one.  We already made plans to go back for the bf's birthday because of the great time we had!

Love this place.  The wild boar tacos and tomato lager soup are probably one of the best lunch combinations in the city.  However they do not always serve bowls of tomato lager soup (they convert it to soup and grilled cheese) and when they do that I stop going for lunch.

Got the East Nasty, such a good meal. So filling! I really like the atmosphere. Don't really like finding a place to park in the Gulch cause you have to pay ,but if you go on a weekday you should be able to get by using 1 hour free parking.

This place has a wide variety of options for all! I especially love their vegan comfort bowl. It's delicious and the portion size is great plus a little bit more. It's near the university so parking is their downfall. You will find parking 1 out of -2 times but the ambience and food are great, just park elsewhere! The services is always good and noon is usually their busy time.

It took a week to get a response to my initial phone call, and another week for them to send someone just to get an estimate. The employee promised an estimate the next day. A week later, no estimate has been received. I tried to reach out to the employee who reviewed the work, and he didn't respond. When I called the main number to inquire about the estimate, they didn't know where it was. I'll be moving on to other options.

I hate to write this, as we have had good luck here before. The free chips and salsa aren't free. The two mamacitas who were running things did not communicate with each other, and one thought it would be ok to make comments about customers. Some of us do in fact speak Spanish.

As Bane from Batman would say, "Mexican food for the uninitiated." 

I didn't hate the food at Cinco. In fact we will probably be back because of how close it is to our house, but the flavor on this trip just want there. We also ordered it to go, which may have affected the flavor? 

I ordered the Chile relleno/Enchilada meal and a taco on side and my wife got the Pollo Fundido? 
Something I've never seen on any Mexican restaurant menu or taco shop menu. It's basically Grilled chicken breast with grilled onions, peppers and tomatoes on a bed of rice and covered with cheese sauce. Yes, I tried it and yes, it was the best thing we ordered! 

The chili relleno/enchiladas meal was ok, but really lacked flavor. Specifically salt and a little heat. The enchilada was my favorite of the two and next time I'll probably just get a enchilada and add hot sauce!

The taco, again lacked flavor. Honestly, just a little salt and or heat and this would have been a solid beef taco. The sides outshined the meal which means, I'm all in on a bean and cheese burrito during my next visit.

Adiós, mi amigos!

Yes, Sam's Morning Glory Diner was great. We squeezed in sometime during the 2 o'clock hour on Sunday afternoon for a late brunch. After a relatively short wait, we were seated inside. The diner itself is clean and quick. The server was nice and efficient and although disappointing that I couldn't sub in tomato for asparagus, I can't really argue with the no-subs-on-the-weekends rule. 

I had the smoked salmon, asparagus, & goat cheese fritattaa and my boyfriend had the Neighborhood Fritatta. Both were tasty and plentiful. Mine was a little dry and lacked a little in the cheese department, but keep in mind, foods are rarely cheesy enough for me. I enjoyed the warm apple tastiness, even though I could only wedge in one bite. The rye toast was grill-marked and crisp and I sampled part of a biscuit and enjoyed that as well. I'm also a potato fanatic and the taters were okay. The home-made ketchup was different and A-OK, but personally, I prefer the regular stuff.

While I enjoyed the meal and have no real complaints, on my watch, it isn't on the same five-star level as my other favorite brunch spots. I'd give it a 3.5 star rating if I could, but I'm going to air on the 3-star side.

Found this place walking around. So happy we stopped in. Very friendly and accommodating wait staff. Very professional and helpful. Had shrimp and pulpo ceviches. Also had grilled sardines. They were prepared fantastic. Paired them with Pinot Grigio and a white sangria. Spend the extra bucks for the Spanish brandy. Do worth it. Had a lot of fun here. Will be back for dinner for sure.
I love this chain! It's clean, quick, & inexpensive. Their special wax is way better than the regular kind. Highly recommend it.

Dining mecca or tourist trap? Ummm... five stars for both! My friend and I came here on a quest for a hangover cure... as we walked in, we were instantly floored by the sweet aroma of freshly baked cinnamon buns and made a mental note to return after we ate substantial food. Only moments later, we found ourselves reaching for a fresh pretzel... unreal! A few free samples later, and we decided that nothing cures a hangover like Thai food. For $5.50 each, we got a generous helping of spicy shrimp curry (amazingly flavorful and spicy!) and veggie pad thai (honestly, the veggie pad thai didn't do it for me - not moist enough). For another $2, we were gulping the very best shrimp tom yum soup. It was partly sticker shock from non-NYC prices and partly the outrageously flavorful food... but I'm hooked on Reading Terminal Market! On the way out, we picked up a whoopie pie and a cinnamon bun from the Amish bakery... both very good, but not quite as surprising as the pretzel. If I lived next door to this place, I'd be a very happy (and fat!) girl. You need a few hours to wander around... and several meals to appreciate the wonders!

Gave this place another try last night but definitely won't be back. I want to like it, as we used to frequent half moon. Service was good but that is all. Burnt sweet potato fries, mediocre food. Too many great places in the Kennett area. Supposedly they just changed the menu...definitely for the worse. Wings were not good either. Hopefully they improve and are successful. Place was almost empty, which tells you something....

This restaurant terrible i like Italian food but I don't recommend because this restaurant messed up with menu it only as pasta and they seem to not offer pizza in their fine dining they should because they keep saying they consideration but they never listens to guest inquires and they aren't listening to guest and they won't offer pizza because even know they have a wood fried oven and they won't offer it in fine dining only other joint the reason I give this a one star Italian restaurant is that they ruined this restaurant and they ruined Italian food and the manger is very ruined and said they won't offer pizza and they should offer pizza because a lot of people would like pizza on the menu because people get tried of eating pasta  all the time and i love Italian restaurant but not this one because they don't serve pizza  and they should Understand that fish is not a Italian cuisine.
