It's clear to me that they don't pay the employees very well and the chef so they decided to save money and the only way they had to do this is to not offer pizza in the menu because it would make the pizza expensive on the menu and it would give Much money to the employees and not to the restaurant what heard when you sign  the check it doesn't go to the employees it goes to the restaurant and that is  ridiculous behavior that this hotel have someone needs to have a serious talk with owners and fix this hotel entirely. So who's with me on this?.

Service is exceptional here. I absolutely loved the staff and the band that was playing. 

Food was delicious. Most amazing remoulade salad. Portions are small. Order up if you're hungry.

Jose was amazing. Very kind listened and definitely went above and beyond! The part ordered, twice, was not correct. This was not Jose's fault but he took on the job with no hesitation to get it correct. I will definitely be calling on him again!!

Although they have good food and drink, the place is over running with hipsters, both as customers and employees. It's chaotic and poorly managed. No ryme or reason to seating. Needs drastic change over.

I've been a regular customer of Shoot Straight for years. Purchased many guns, ammo, and supplies from them. Brought my wife and 10 year old daughter neither of whom have ever held or shot a handgun before. I informed the guy at the desk I wasn't there to shoot but teach my wife and daughter how to safely handle and shoot a handgun. He asked me if I was an instructor (not sure of the relevance). I told him no. For the record I have over 40 years of weapons experience as well as a substantial amount of advanced weapons training. I was only charged for my wife and daughter. We went in and set up on the lane and I instructed my daughter on how to handle the weapon and site the target. She was obviously nervous because this was her first time shooting. She asked me to fire the weapon so she could see what to expect. I fired ONE round downrange to show her what to expect and set the weapon down and was getting ready for her to step up and begin. Less than a minute went by when a range officer tapped me on the shoulder and told me I needed to step out and pay a range fee because I'd fired the weapon. I asked the range officer if I could clear the weapon because he was so insistent that I needed to pay. He said ok. I had to leave my wife and daughter on the range to go pay. We had a civil exchange at the counter where I explained why I had fired ONE round. He had no interest in what I had to say. I asked to speak to a supervisor whose position was the same. I then asked to speak to the store manager with the same result. None of the three gentlemen I spoke with had any interest in what I had to say. They simply wanted to collect their range fee. The second gentleman I spoke to interjected that they made an exception even allowing me onto the range without paying. Something I find odd as I've trained others there before. They lost a valued customer and will lose my brother in law as well over a $16 range fee. Shame on them. I'm not saying rules are made to broken, because they are not, however, charging someone for firing one round to show a 10 year old what to expect is truly ridiculous.
It said Sunday close ar 10pm our uber arrived at 758pm and its pitch dark, disapointing
I thought this place was okay did not live up to the hype the smoked chicken was really good brisket was okay turkey was good the sides we're just okay worth a visit but not worth the long line

Altough our tour boat captain was a good fellow, it is pretty reprehensible they dont inform you that there arent alligators to be seen in January. Tickets are still sold as though you are going to be amazed. Pretty much a let down to hold a baby gator with its mouth taped at the end of the ride. Additionally a connection could be made between our visit to this tour and within 5 hours, our credit card was cloned and used at a nearby walmart store as the start of a 5 day credit card spree. Oh yeah, lots of fun.
Thanks
Weak drinks, dirty utensils, not-so-fresh salad, very bland spaghetti bolognese, and what looked like a bug in my cocktail. We'll  pass on this establishment in the future.

I've been getting my hair colored for probably 20 years and do my research when relocating, as it is important to me.  After researching, and reading reviews on Yelp, I selected Studio S and Selena. The salon is a cute salon in a convenient location and Selena is beyond great!  She listens to you and knows what she is doing.  Go there today!!

Spent about $70 there over a 3 hour period on a Thursday. It was dead but still had fun with group I came in (2 guys friends and a chick). Decent tunes were played, as well. I just was kind of annoyed by the pretentious, smug-ass hipsters bartending at times. My one friend was cuttin on them so bad. XD It's overall definitely my kind of atmosphere, though. I don't dig fancy. Oh and there's free parking. :D
If severely limited tv channels, warped carpet, worn carpet, nice but clueless staff are your thing, stay here. Otherwise go to motel 6 as this Marriott property is in that class.
Charbroiled oysters definitely lived up to their reputation, and the grilled shrimp pasta was a nice choice.  Service was excellent... highly recommend.

Out of all the haircut places I've been to in the area, this is the only place that does a phenomenal job, and well worth the $16 charge. 

Ask for Elysia/Leesh, she knows her stuff and doesn't just take an electric razor to your muffin top, she actually spends time cutting your hair and is very sociable.

Years ago I heard it said that there's 2 kinds of stores - ones of necessity and ones of neurosis.  Less profit in necessity stores/shops/restaurants/establishments and they're even hard to find.  But this is not that type of place.  One more reason I left glorified, special S.B. to never to return to live.  No more such places for me, no more Boulder, Encinitas, no more U.S.A. before long.  :)

First post-Covid visit here was a delight! Came for happy hour and stayed long after. Martinis were great, a little on the small side, but not as small as some happy hour martinis. Limited HH food menu was good- the fried chickpeas had a good flavor and are perfect for sharing. The pretzel with beer cheese was AMAZING. The beer cheese was so delicious that we scooped out what was left in the ramekin with a knife and ate it. Suggestion for the "pretzel" - it was essentially a roll. If they were nuggets, it would be easier to share. The poke tacos were fresh and tasty. The squid ink gnocchi was probably my least favorite, but it was beautifully plated. 
The outdoor tables appear to fill up quickly, so we were relegated to indoors, but the space is so aesthetically stunning, we didn't mind. Everyone following safety protocols. Can't wait to return!

Had cocktails and appetizers the harvest mule is awesome! It's the drink of the month s must try!
The calamari was tasty and cooked to perfection!

This place is always busy, so we don't go often. The couple times we did we thoroughly enjoyed it. Shark bites are greasy & the quantity is very small, but I can't complain, they are still sooo good & it's not like you can get them easily. Food times are efficient & the staff is wonderful.

Oh thank goodness I found this place!Everyone is kind, compassionate, and so invested in what they do. They took the time to explain every step, every procedure, and every part of the bill to me. My little dog and I couldn't be happier! I couldn't recommend Parker's Paws enough!
Excellent and informative staff. Don't usually write reviews, but this place is a step above any dealer in the area!
The best local breakfast on Clearwater Beach. They've been in business for years, I've been coming here for 15 years and have no complaints. Food is great!

Very clean, good prices, Plenty of good choices. Server was very friendly, the food was very good and quick to the table. Abel the owner came over to say hello. Someone asked for something at they did not have (cinnamon coffee) they were told they would make it. Not a fan of the Spanish music otherwise we'll worth giving the place a try.

I was surprised to see the changes at this place having been to this location when it was a different name under different ownership.

This place looks very upscale and the new renovations are beautiful.  The pedicure area in the back is so relaxing with low lighting and spa music playing. 

I was pleased with the technician that did my pedicure and manicure. She was friendly and did a great job. They have a huge selection of polish colors. I will definitely return!

I was in Nashville for a convention and walked down to this place and enjoyed the music and atmosphere. 

My wife had a pulled pork sandwich and I had a pulled pork plate. The beans were great and the BBQ sauce was great also

Don't let the dive looking exterior scare you.  This is a mellow place, vibe is always good.  Relaxed hippie vibe, especially Thursday night for the house grateful dead tribute band, Uncle John's Band.  Friendly service, good food.  Great outdoor patio for live music.  Draft beer selection is weak, no Cigar City on draft?!

Love love love this place.  We had been to the other Surrey's and decided to see if this place is the same.  I love the inside! It's roomier.  We sat at the breakfast bar! 

I had banana fosters french toast! Delicious! I always get my sauces on the side so I don't eat soggy bread! They use the french bread to make the french toast and inside the french toast has banana puree!  It was delicious indeed.  I also tried their homemade juices, apple juice with ginger juice added.  Talk about sweet and spicy.  I wanted something with low acidity b/c my tummy had to recover from issues during the week.  Ginger helps sooth my tummy! My apple juice was just as delicious with or with ginger added.  I got my ice cup on the side to add my juice to it. 

Hubby tried the smoked turkey and avocado sandwich! it was yummy.  The wheat bread was toasted...not too  much mayo on the sandwich but best part is the avocado. The potato salad was more mayo based but did have a cajun kick to it.   I also had an order of home fries which was delicious with my ketchup! 

Overall, I would definitely come back!  maybe earlier during the morning before the crown and tourist arrives or during the week when there may be a smaller crowd!

I love this place. I come here for brunch every time I visit New Orleans. Everything I've tried has been amazing. The croque monsieur, croque madam, sliders... all of it amazing. The burger slider is my favorite so far. Prices are reasonable and the service and environment are fantastic. I can't wait to come back and try something new.

Tonights meal was absolutely superb! The attention to detail & presentation was phenomenal! The taste awakened our senses. We ordered the chicken gyro & the skewered chicken. Even the rice was amazing tasting which was very moist & flavorful! The service fantastic the chef even went over the whole menu with us. Ambiance was perfect. Looking forward to eating here again. Hats off to the Chef!

Been here on several occasions for both breakfast and lunch.  The service has always been great!  The food has been fantastic.  I really appreciate the fact they make everything from scratch here and the love for food shows. Give it a try you won't be disappointed...a truly great local gem!!

I was in Nashville in mid August that to give Redlands Grill a try again. I'd gone a few months ago and was disappointed. This time they were on their A game. The food was delicious and the service was terrific. Also, management is attentive and wants you to have a great experience. I'll be back !!!!!

My favorite food spot in St. Louis! Wow! Unbelievably delicious and creative menu. The ingredients are local and the ware is green. Also, and importantly, the service is friendlier than the smiling postman from a 1950s sitcom.

The food is just as stellar at P&K as it was when I was the first to review the joint back when it first opened.  The spicy, lip-tingling pulled pork is my go-to, but my friends enjoyed their crabcake sandwiches and coconut-whispered mussels. The burger's lights have not dimmed over the past two years, either. 

What sets P&K apart these days is how absolutely refined the service has become.  Our server, Beth, wound off the specials of the evening with such love and knowledge I was tempted to order all of them, especially the organic, juicy meatloaf sandwich on brioche toast with grilled onions.  Not only was she superbly versed in the menu, Beth was quick, efficient and funny.  She is an obvious professional who enhanced our experience exponentially. 

Lastly, the decor here has always been great, but the additions of the flower planters outside and ringing the fairy-light wrapped trees has transported the outdoor dining section.  It's just gorgeous, and makes dining outside on a cool spring evening a joy.

Great customer service and fast service. Only problem is the location. There's a signal when you leave so when a lot of people are there you are stuck for very long periods of time just waiting for the light to turn green on the busy street.
Still so many pizzas I'd love to try here.  Huge fan of the R&B, Destroyer, and all of the salads! Great fries as well.

Okay, after a long while not visiting, all seems well now. Though the pricing is higher, the change is dispensed with integrity and previous issues seem to be resolved regardless of who is on register. I do recommend.

My wife and I were craving sushi and decided to get the bento takeout from Yokozuna, the server in the phone offered "uni" to my wife and said if was a special. My wife and I normally love uni so we decided to order some. But the uni they served to us were definitely dead or gone bad because I can still taste the foulness of it. I normally don't mind yokozunas sushi but this uni has definitely left a horrible taste in my mouth. Any sushi restaurants that doesn't serve fresh sea food and proactively offers it to their customers are bad sushi restaurants. I can still taste the nasty taste of spoiled uni in my mouth.

Thanks to Patrick, we had the most amazing wedding last night!!! He was great, everyone was on the dance floor the entire night. We have had numerous guests text us today saying he was the best dj they have heard at a wedding! So professional, and was great with my crazy wedding party :) I would recommend him to everyone!!!!

My wife & I went to the Thai L'Elephant for the first time for dinner before a show at the Colonial Theater (which is only a half block away). The menu is terrific and the food was phenomenal. We had the Thai Treasure for starters and I had the Evil Jungle Princess for the entrée. The food was prepared & seasoned perfectly. The service was spot on; attentive but not over-bearing. The ambience is great for a romantic dinner or an evening  with friends. The byob is a plus. We love this place and will be back often.

Very professional. Replied within 10 minutes of requesting service. Setup an appointment for the next day between 2 & 4.  Called at 1:30 to say they would be there in 45 minutes. At 2:15 they arrived, diagnosed the problem and within the hour the dryer was working like new. I would definitely use them if I had an issue with any other appliance. Serg seems to know exactly what the issue is and how to address it.

Our waiter was excellent. The food was average and not worth the price. There are too many great steak houses in the area that are better quality and cost less. I had the French onion soup, brussel sprouts and  porterhouse steak. The filet portion tasted buttery but the quality of the steak and the taste was ok. The ambiance was chain-like and the walk into the place was depressing as you had to pass through the slot machine crowd with heavy smoke in the air.

We stayed in the Casino tower rooms.  These rooms have not been recently renovated and it shows.  Out of their control but the freeway traffic was loud. We were on the 17 floor and you could hear it all night.
Carpet needs shampooing, large amounts of dust bunnies along the edges. Both beds had little hairs st the top of the sheet (almost like dog hair). The dresser and night stand very dusty.  Not sure what was going on with the TV but the picture quality was very "snowy".
The shower looked clean but had mold on the accent tiles. The toilet was either dirty or heavily stained.  I'm sure the Resort tower rooms are in better shape as it states they were recently renovated.

This is only place I will go for skincare. I go to Fani and she is hands down amazing. I always leave with my skin feeling hydrated and glowing!! 

If you haven't experienced the spa here yet it is a must go! And Fani is a must see!

I love their appetizers and the deck is set up well for outdoor dining, even as the weather getting chilly, with space heaters, etc. I have consistently found the entrees to NOT be up to the same level as their appetizers. I go back often, but go elsewhere for better entrees at the same price point.

Blue Cross is the only insurance I have ever had.
They paid practically every bill for major surgery 10 years ago

1 & 1/2 years ago, I broke my entire foot, 'cept for my toes..horrible accident.
I was in Bethlehem Pa where the hospital there was not qualified to put my foot back to normal. .  had to be taken to Presby Hosp. in Phila.

Bill for ambulance $746.  Medicare just paid $187.  Usually Blue Cross
picks up something...been to BC 4 times w/forms filled out & more forms.....have to wait up to 30 days to see if any portion is covered.

Been w/BC more than 50 years & this is the first time ever..had forms to fill out.  Get a runaround & they are knit picking...why?  This never happened ever.

Pay a fortune for BC & am really disappointed on  major surgery on my foot  
BC is  dragging their feet.

Ms. C. Wilson
Phila Pa.

The food is delicious and the location is so perfect you couldn't ask for better. The one thing I've noticed on the 3 or 4 time I've gone is the hostesses always overtime your wait time almost to try discouraging you to stay. On Mother's Day I went here, and def expected to wait a long time. Was quoted over an hour way and thought ok no problem. Looked around and noticed maybe one other party waiting but the place was packed but still counted maybe 5 empty tables. Figured it was for reservations so that's fine. Went and ordered drinks at the bar and literally got our drinks and then got buzzed to be sat. How can they justify telling me id wait well over an hour and seat me 10 minutes later. Owners please take note! This isn't good business when the first people they see tell them this. BUT- I continue to return because this place is wonderful. Mojitos are a must, I always get at least two ha! Everything from the ahi tuna to the seafood pasta and the banana fosters desert. Everything taste fantastic.
Had a great experience here, staff was kind and joked around with us, food was fast, cheap and delicious. my new favorite pizza place in all of boise.

First time I went here, I was over hyped on the experience and I wasn't excited. 2nd time, very excited! Great food, great bread & butter, awesome wine selection. Only negative was the first time we went, the waiter told me the pasta wasn't made fresh in house. For a top notch restaurant, I want in house fresh pasta, but maybe that's me being overly picky. You go here for the seafood, and the seafood is above reproach! So go for the seafood, be friendly to the wait staff & you just may get a free dessert! I sure did! but I normally get something free everywhere I go!

One word: Bulldogs. Another: Margarita. And another: Sangria.

Julio's is not authentic mexican, obviously. It's good for appetizers like flautas, nachos and such, but I don't think their big meals would have satisfied me. The atmosphere is very laidback and sometimes partyish. 

The music is too loud though (OH MY GOSH I AM OLD!)..

Drinks: GOOD.

What a great experience! This was one of the best experiences with a car rental.  Had a nice clean dependable car at a great rate Was going to return a day early because we thought we could not return it to Tampa airport .Shout out to Chad Gessner! He let us keep it and return it at the airport for only a few dollars more !   Chad Gessner a very professional kind person, I am looking forward to getting my next rental from you on Feb 16th Thank You Enterprise!

This place was astonishingly amazing!  I came here with three friends for a wind down on a Thursday night.  Our waitress (whose name was also Kate, or something very similar) walked us through the menu, didn't groan when we tried to order things which weren't on tap at the moment (things cycle through based on availability, but there is a board in the back which lists everything they have at the moment, and they're described super helpfully in the menu).  She managed to lead us all down our own beer path successfully finding something for everyone.  Also, she seemed to have had everything on the menu and stopped us from making some questionable decisions from a place of overwhelmed confusion.

In short, our waitress/bartender made the night, but the nice, warm, welcoming atmosphere didn't hurt.  I have definite plans to come back here, it's just the right feel for a calm night where I just want to drink some good beer and chat with some friends.

Wow! The bar is the PLACE to be my friends  Little Rickie (aka Rob), Rick and David are phenomenal! The service, craft cocktails and eats are top notch too! Feels like we have known these fellas forever! Thank you! Cheers to Sand Key!

I would sit here and write a review about my meal, but all 5 people who I ate with, all ordered different food. Every, single, one, was impeccable. Along with excellent service and endless mimosas. I'd come back every time I come to NOLA.

I ate some crab it was good, they do have inside seating which is nice. The crab is expensive but it is worth it by far it is a good place to eat before fishing on the pier it full you up, but the seating is limited but that is only inside. The outside is packed with people so reserve a seat before you come. I got some good instructions on how to eat it, would come again anytime.

Great new BYO sushi spot in the heart of Berwyn!

My first time at Otoro was their opening night - but you wouldn't have known it! The service was fabulous, food was fresh, atmosphere was pleasant.

Since my first visit at the beginning of the summer when the restaurant opened, I've ordered takeout and dined in again. Every time the food has been fresh and delicious. Looking forward to returning!

PS - This restaurant is not affiliated with the old Otoro sushi restaurant that was connected to Landmark Americana in Strafford at the corner of Lancaster Ave & Old Eagle School Rd (I'm noting this because I, including many others, have asked!)

This restaurant has not been open for long, but it has already became a favorite of mine to take friends to when they are visiting. The variety of food is great and I love to see the fusion of different South American foods. The prices are great. I love the burrito! Two thumbs up from this Peruvian eater.

Os preços são melhores que os do outlet da philadhelfia ,muitas roupas de grife porém da trabalho e tem que ter paciência pra procurar e achar peças ,malas com bom preço ! É preciso perder tempo
Pra achar Voss mercadorias

Such a fan of this place!  So sad its closing :-(

Ordered 3 pies from them this Christmas because its their last one.  They always please the crowd I serve them to!  Gonna miss these guys!

Chocolate chocolate chocolate is so decadent! One of my favorite chocolate ice creams ever. They have great nondairy options too like eureka lemon (also one of my top favorites). You can definitely taste the quality here.

I have been going to Juicy's for 12 years and I don't know why I have never written a review about them.  They are, hands down, the best burger place I have ever eaten at.  I am a burger guy so much that I look up the best rated burger places in places I visit just to try them out.

Their buns are fresh.  The tomatoes and lettuce are generous.  The onion is just right.  Their french fries are crispy on the outside and wonderful on the inside.  Finally, the burger patty is perfectly cooked every time.

When my brother in law and sister in law come to town they stop here for a burger before coming to our place and we live five minutes walking distance away from here!

Best burgers's in town.  I get the grilled chicken sandwich. The owner is great, he always remembers us each time we are in.  Oh did I mention this is in a gas station.
Still the best!

Food is good, but not worth it anymore when they mess up the order EVERY time we've been. Onions on the gyros when we asked for none, no tzatziki on the gyros when we specifically asked to have it, etc. Especially disappointed when I heard they have new management, but the same mistakes keep happening. I don't know that we'll give it another try in the future

I love these guys! Really great company and so reliable, experienced, with great work too. I started out having them mount my TV on our wall above our fireplace, then they came back to install a ceiling fan/light in our dining room, and now I have them booked to come back a third time for a bigger job in our living room installing recessed lighting. The money, time, and everything is worth it. They do good work and it's clear they know what they are doing. Highly recommend this company! I also love that the owner is a local to the area with a family. I love supporting local businesses that are actually good and I can develop a relationship with long-term. :-)

Finally starting to use  three brothers pizza on Tampa road. Food is outstanding staff is so polite and patient and delivery is so prompt I encourage everyone to try the store they have meals on the menu you will not find anywhere else. A great addition to our area.

If you want to constantly deal with substitutions.Due to them being out of 80% of your order!!.And unprofessional shoppers,who complete your order before your set time.And send you a completed text,with the audacity of requesting a review/tip for the shopper.Without even informing you of unavailable items!!..Then look no further,this is the store for you!!..I dealt with the constant substitutions,I REFUSE to deal with ignorance/disrespect!!.

It is craft pizza.   No little Caesar's here.   The toppings were fresh and the cheese bread was good.   I do wish there was more cheese on the pizza.  I will just order xtra cheese next time.    The soft drinks are pretty limited.    I wish they had a option for coke drinkers especially since they sell cans as well as fountain.

Never go to Visionworks if you need an eye exam!!! 

My vision has not changed in years but my lenses were scratched, since prescriptions expire after a year I made an appointment at Visionworks to get an updated prescription.  To their doctor, that must have translated into me saying my vision changed and I need a whole new prescription.   His chair-side manner was terrible, he doesn't speak much to his patients, nor does he listen.  As a result he informed me that one of my eyes had gotten better, and wrote me a new prescription.

Since Visionworks, like most other places like it charge a fortune for lenses, I went to get my glasses made at a different store, Lecso (whom I very highly recommend).  When I put them on I suddenly had double vision, a headache, pressure on my eye and I couldn't see or even read anything. 

I then returned to Visionworks demanding they fix this prescription right away.  The same doctor did a 2 second exam and then told me that he "GUESSED" that my vision had gotten better than it really had, and so he wrote another prescription.

I now had to pay for another pair of glasses to be made because apparently guessing is now part of optometry.  Despite my experience so far I was confident it would be right this time.  I was wrong.  I tried to wear this pair for a few days in an attempt to get used to them, and as a result I had horrible headaches every single day I had them on.  One day my headache was so intense I had to miss work.  

So I called Visionworks to explain to them what I had been through, and demand to see a different doctor.  After being placed on hold for about 10 minutes I finally got an appointment with someone else.  When that day came (my 10:45 appointment was actually 11:00 apparently), I got to see a far more competent doctor, who actually listened.  He started my exam with my existing lenses and from there tried to see if my vision could get better.  It didn't, because as I initially suspected, my vision has not changed!!!  

This was not the first time that the same doctor that I saw twice at the beginning of this ordeal has messed up my prescription.  A few years ago, when he released my prescription for contact lenses, he wrote the magnification as 180, when it was actually supposed to be 80.  That was a $300 mistake that I had to pay for.  I had enough and complained to the store manager, who then thought it was acceptable to tell me that all of this was MY FAULT!!!

I will never go to Visionworks again, and I strongly recommend nobody else does either.  I plan to go to a real optometrist who has his own practice, not a store in the local shopping mall.  

Lesson Learned!
Just left, 4 of us sat at the bar for over 10 minutes and didn't get served. Thirsty Marlin is packed and waited on us right away. Great band here!

Unreal, maybe 12 people inside saw and made eye contact with at least 3 employees. Not one said a single word, we sat down and nobody came gave us a menu, water, said a single word to us. Rather disappointing. Walked out because nobody said anything to us for over 10 minutes. We're going to eat and drink, clearly they make a lot of money cause we were going to spend at least $100 from everyone in our party

I stopped by for some 6pm breakfast food. It was perfectly acceptable, and cost very little. The service was nice, and some of the employees were eating food cooked there, which is always a good sign. I see no reason not to come back.

If you are an Vandy undergrad or grad student, this is the place to go to get your fitness on. You already pay for the facility with your fees so you may as well use it and get fit. 

The rec center offers several classes. All the yoga I have been to is SUPER gentle, so I only go when I need a relaxation yoga class. They also have spinning, boot camp, Zumba, and some butt toning class. I have only done the yoga. 

I mainly use the weight and cardio room. It is well equipped, though it can get very busy at peak hours. I find going either mid-morning or around 6:30-8 is pretty good. It feels cramped, so if you are used to large spacious gyms, you will have to adjust. 

I am quite the fan. I am glad that i dont have to pay for a gym membership at the YMCA where they are crazy religious and stuff (though they do have much better classes). Hopefully the addition they are adding will increase the weight room space and they can spread things out a bit.

Baby's is probably one of my favorite burger places in Indy. They offer a build your own burger option and have tons of great, different kinds of toppings most places don't normally have and let you pick how many patties you want (up to 3 I believe). 

For me, I went with their Strut Burger and a chocolate shake with peanut butter whisky and wow was I happy with my choice. Sides can definitely be sharable, so my friends and I split fries and onion rings. If you're like us and couldn't decide, get both - I promise you won't be upset.

I love the modern diner look this place has and they have a pretty big patio that's also got heaters, so you can even eat outside in the cooler weather. They also have a parking lot and tons of free street parking so there's never a problem finding somewhere to park.
Very fun & informative ride! Only thing I would change would be to let people get off & take pics in front certain spots. But, overall, very nice experience!

It was ok. I just know for my own personal preference next 5ime to ask 4 the mixed crab not whole. And not marinated cucumber strings... I ordered a California roll on soy paper with cream cheese. I don't think that they r experienced much with soy paper because both my rolls were split open. Plus the soy paper sticks to thier wrapping paper. I would suggest asking them not to wrap it on paper at all or just use foil.

I had an excellent experience at this clinic.   My cat was in extreme pain and straining to go to the bathroom (number 2) but all that was coming out was mucus and a clear like gel.  Friday morning I brought him in at 6am, and one of the doctors was immediately able to see us.  He was hospitalized for 24 hours, had numerous tests done and the cause they believed was colitis.  So they started treating him for that.  On day two he still was pooping mucus and hadn't eaten yet so Ahmed and I decided it would be best to release him to come home to see if he would eat.  Sunday morning he still hadn't eaten and looked to be in a good amount of pain.  I called the clinic and spoke to one of the lovely girls at the front desk and she asked if they would prescribe an appetite stimulant.  After talking to the doctor she said it would be best if I brought him in for another examination.  I was upset at first I had to bring him in again as he is always more comfortable at home, but I did.  Then Mohamed and I decided that the best thing to do would be a ultrasound to get a better look of the inside and to see if he was going to be going into hepatic lipidosis.  About 6 hours later they called me to pick him up, reviewed the ultrasound with me and explained that 1/3 of his colon was inflamed.  He is now doing better and eating well.  Hopefully on the road to recovery.  Everyone at this clinic was great and I would recommend them.
Best Mexican food in the area. Also...best takeout experience by far since being locked up. Food is always so fresh and great.

This is a simple, family owned restaurant that serves great food.   

The family that owns the place is extremely friendly.  The chef will frequently deliver the dish themselves and check in to see how you enjoyed the meal - a nice touch! 

The hummus is the best that I've tried and i've had many.  I'd go just for the hummus appetizer - delicious!  The lamb kabobs are fantastic - nice char, cooked to your desired temperature and well seasoned.  Most dishes come with rice and grilled peppers and onions and a side of some type of middle eastern salsa which is excellent.

Only gripe i have:  we've hit this spot numerous times over the years and to be honest, in the past the service could tend to be a bit slow/lacking at times, but, it's always friendly and they'll accomadate most requests.  So you may end up waiting long, but it pays off with excellent food.  And it seems they've recently they've made some changes and our last few experiences have been very good in terms of service.  

I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for solid food, served without flourish or frills and at a reasonable cost.

Have been back several times since my previous review. Had dinner there on Saturday night, first time for my husband to go there. We had dinner entrees, and they were more satisfying that what I had ordered in the past. He got the Bayou Shrimp, with 5 large shrimp and a very thin crawfish etouffe sauce, and a hunk of savory bread pudding, over spinich. Beautifully presented. I had the chicken coatted and rolled with polenta and served with a porcini mushroom gravy, over cubed potatoes, with roasted asparagus. Also beautifully presented.

Husband loved the shrimp, which was very spicy (maybe too spicy for me). He also liked the spinach and the bread pudding. I did not care for the taste of the polenta as a crust, however, and it was also rolled inside it, I think mixed with the mushrooms there. But that may have been my own taste buds, or maybe it was not a good creation. The chicken was moist and tender, and the potatoes were satisfying. Too much dinner for me to finish. 

Nonetheless, we ordered dessert. I couldn't resist the sound of the ho-made ice cream--banana, walnut, chocolate hunk. Very delicious. My husband got the apple strudel with ice cream, and he enjoyed it as well.

By the way, our bread was very fresh and delicious. I saw women dining (without men), and they seemed to be having a very good time, so may "Nicholas" (see patt C. 5/7/2013) was working that night. All the staff were so very nice, they had been trained to smile and be polite as is allowable by the law to the guests.

I will say, Jimmy's was NOT doing a full business--the Oyster Bar and something else up the street seemed to be overflowing. Next time, I am going to be asked to be seated in the dining room, not the bistro (bar area). I also did not like our teeny tiny table for two, which was too crowded, and we had to have the waitress take stuff away and stash some on the table next to us.

We will be returning there for my birthday celebration next month.

I'll be fair. This review is from 2018. It's very possible they have changed. But possible they have not. So take the review with that context. But Yelp keeps asking me to review them, so here goes: 

I hired them to help me clean for an apartment move out. Three women came over and I showed them the house. My cat is a jerk and was angry about moving chaos so he pooped outside the litter box and I didn't realize it until they were there.

I went upstairs. I didn't hear any cleaning. I look out the window and the three women are outside, one is on her phone. I'm confused. Then they get in the car and drive away. What the hell?! I call and apparently they didn't want to clean up cat poop so they quit. Ummm...I did not ask them to do that, and obviously didn't expect it. It was so unprofessional to enter someone's home, judge them, and leave without saying anything (especially because when they left my front door was of course unlocked because I didn't know they were leaving). Becht said they would reimburse me. I imagine they did - moving was so chaotic I didn't check my bank statement that month and forgot to follow up. But they really screwed me over, since then I had to call off work to get the deep cleaning done myself last minute just a few days before move out. 

Because of this, I will never ever ever hire Becht again, honestly even if they fired everyone since then, because just thinking about them makes me mad.

I'm sad to say, my last few visits here have been disappointing. Bad service, cold fries, long waits with lots of open tables, barely-blended lumpy milkshakes, and "This isn't what I ordered." Just re-fill my water already please. You don't have to read the specials on the chalkboard for me, I'm sitting right next to it. And did that waitress just sit her butt on that empty table while taking that other person's order?

It's Nutts, Get your old staff back.

I am hard-pressed to give it more than three stars. Need more flava in it's food. The flavor is bland and like I said you need more of that in their sandwiches. Only eeason I gave it 3 stars was because of the freshness of the ingredients. 

Although I must say I wish the sandwiches bread  was softer. 

Will try again and see if it goes any further

The bar was located in our hotel. We stopped by after an early dinner on a Friday night to get some cocktails after a long day visiting Philly. Service was great, we even got some free popcorn ! I enjoyed it all the more that the Yankees won their game that day. Don't hesite to stop by. Tips : if you stay several nights at the Kimpton and decide to skip on the room cleaning service the hotel will give you a $10 coupon to redeem at Square 1682.

Went here for the first time with my girlfriend and also work in the restaurant industry so I know what is a good place and the food was pretty good a bit bland but add a bit of what seems like house made hot sauce and it really set it off. The reason for my review isn't for the food but the service. .....I paid 42 bucks for what I thought was 2 platters and a side of nachos n guacamole and 2 jarritos but only got the 2 platters and drinks by no means am I complaining that I want my money but that the lady just seem like she didn't care and was taking it for herself....pretty sad to me and made me kinda not Wana come back....

As badly as I want to write "HOLY SHIT THIS PLACE RULES IGNORE THE REVIEWS JUST CHECK IT OUT" and leave it at that, I feel compelled to do my favorite restaurant in Philly more justice than that. This review is for Restaurant Week, Fall 2012...and Restaurant Week, Winter 2011, and dinner, and lunch, and every time in between that I visited the 'buzzo.

Barbuzzo simply does not mess up, ever. Let's get right to why: my Restaurant Week meal began with two crispy, thin two-bite flatbreads: one with salted radish and another with tomato, basil, olive oil, and balsamic. Both were perfection; the tomato bread in particular hit a perfect balance between the sweet/savory notes of the tomato, the body of the olive oil, and the texture/saltiness of the edible accomplices. 

From there, I progressed to the sheep's milk ricotta. I'm not *dons internet flame body armor* a huge fan of cheese *takes armor off*, but this stuff is the truth. The ricotta is light, creamy, and subtly sweet without any of the typical "this tastes like bad breath smells" vibes that most cheeses communicate to my tongue. As others have said, however, the bread and the sherry figs do the real damage here, with the latter enhancing the aforementioned subtle sweetness of the cheese and the former being an crispy, oil-infused, appetizer-worthy force in and of itself. The smokiness of the bread takes the dish in a much more daring direction than less talented chefs would ever attempt. Subtle but significant touches like plus flawless execution that are what make Barbuzzo clinch that fifth star.

Next up was the Paccheri, which is similar to the Calabrese on the ordinary menu. Both are pork ragu rigatoni dishes that are heavy on the basil and show just how devastating a perfectly-honed simplicity can be. Unlike most 'buzzo fans, I think the Budino is merely good as opposed to THE HARDEST OUT, so I went for the Tiramisu instead. I'm really not a dessert person, but I was able to kill this one without much of a problem, which is saying a lot. 

Normally, I'd end the review right there, but I really need to stress to the casuals that you're missing out if you only try the Restaurant Week menu. There are at least five other pitch-perfect dishes on the menu here (the stuffed meatballs and the uovo pizza being the very best of them) with a balanced drink selection to match, if that's your thing. I really don't have a witty, jokey, negative, or cynical thing to say about this place - oh yes I do, actually. It's a claustrophobe's nightmare, both due to the crowdedness and the narrowness of the space. You'll totally suffocate and die and go to Awesome Food Hell before you finish your meal. You might be even forced to, I don't know, rub elbows with and interact with strangers! The horror! So yeah, terrible job, Barbuzzo. I hereby revoke my five stars. Except I don't.

Little Anthony's has always been one of our favorite pizza places in Delaware County.  The crust is thin and crispy, the sauce is excellent and they put just the perfect amount of cheese.  We used to love going there, getting a plain Neapolitan pie and then some specialty slices but the parking can be very challenging during Friday nights.  Much to my elation, and with help from Yelp, I recently learned that they will deliver to our house in Aston. I have had their Sicilian crust also and really like it; it reminds me of my Grand Mom's home made pizza.  Unfortunately I am the only one I my house that likes Sicilian and you can't eat a whole one so I grab a slice  when I see it behind the counter.  Their tomato pie is also very good as is their stuffed pizza.  I particularly enjoy the one stuffed with steak meat & cheese (comes with Marinara sauce for dipping) which I have gotten from behind the counter but it apparently is not on the menu.

I am in NOLA for spring break and today I finally woke up in time for breakfast. After getting my cash back from Rite Aid I decided to treat myself to some Micky Ds breakfast. I figured a coffee, hash brown and a bacon egg and cheese bagel would help the hangover that was slowly taking over my body.

I got in the crazy long line that snaked around the store, confused as to why a "fast" food joint would have such a long line. Well after about 10 minutes the line hadn't moved because out of the two cashiers one  was standing at the register glaring at the customers and the other was playing with her hair. A little angry I asked if there was a problem with the register since neither of them seemed to know how to do their jobs - surprise, no response. After another 10 minutes it was almost my turn with only one order ahead of me. Two middle school kids were in line before me and the cashier refused to take their order and instead told them "go back to school and take your exams". I was shocked. I have never seen anyone refuse an order before. Little did the ignorant cashier know that they were also here on vacation and were sent in by their parents who were waiting in the car. Apparently the drive through line was longer and more stagnant than the one inside - hard to believe. They walked out empty handed. 

When it was finally my turn to order the cashier didn't say a thing and just stared at me. I said hello and she responded with a blank stare. Tired of waiting I told her my order. She wasn't listening and made me repeat it. I tried to order one of their breakfast meals without the coffee. She didn't seem to grasp that concept and gave me the coffee anyway. Instead of trying to correct my order I gave it to one of the homeless men who was waiting outside. 

I have never seen such poor customer service before. If you are in need of a fast food fix avoid the Canal Street Mc Donald's! Go to Rally's around the corner on Broad Street instead.
Not from around this area.  The food is always delicious whenever we make the trip to Idaho.  We always make sure this is a stop when we are here.  Pulled pork is awesome.  Good beer selection too.

We went July 3rd for breakfast, arrived around 9:45am. From the time that we ordered our food to the time that it was served it was a little over 40 minutes. The only time we got an update on our food was when we asked about it. I am aware that it was the day before a holiday but bringing in more staff next time. And after having people weight so long for their food at least give the courtesy of a % off the bill, it's called customer service.
We had the strawberry French toast and the Nova LoxBenedict, learn how to make home fries! The food was good (minus the home fries ) but the service was something I would rather forget!

We came on a Sunday at 5pm - right when they opened. We were sat immediately as the gate opened - down the stairs and into the dim, low lit space with dark wood and leather and candles everywhere. 

The music was hip hop, which off set the old time decor. 

The server was well dressed, well spoken and supremely knowledgeable about the cocktails. 

We tried two tasting menus between two of us - totaling 8 small cocktails. Suffice it to say they know what they're doing when it comes to mixing drinks. I especially loved the Gobstopper drink (a hot buttered rum drink fat washed with duck prosciutto on the Willy Wonka inspired menu) and what was called a "juicy Manhattan" - one of the last drinks on the classic tasting menu. 

The service was impeccable and we were very well taken care of - down to the tiny crackers and cheese spread and refilled waters. Would come back - and Sunday at 5pm was a perfect time to be there.

Andrew, the technician from clog kings was prompt, efficient and very professional. He took care of our situation in a speedy manner and did not exceed estimate he gave us. I would highly recommend them to anyone else who needs an honest reliable plumber.

Well first time at this location....and won't be coming back.

I ordered from the vegetarian menu and from the dessert menu too. 

Drove home about 5 miles away.

Both full of meat. They are labeled correctly but the wrong empanadas. I assume the arroz con leche is not supposed to be chicken and potatoes WITH POWDERED SUGAR ON TOP yuck!!

Needles to say I won't be going back. If you don't eat meat I'd recommend breaking the empanada open first before taking a giant bite of it.

My wife and I decided to go to this neighborhood gem since Les Marchands (which is otherwise a great spot) didn't have ramen anymore. We never even got to the ramen because we got preoccupied with the drink selection and other funky Asian fusion food! The potato croquettes and the bass were fantastic. It's not too pricey, the atmosphere is nice and the staff are fun to converse with. We'll definitely be going back soon!

Forgive me, but I couldn't help but think of the "Queen of Pop" as I entered Mad Donna's with my friend.  Were this at night for drinks with music I would've said, "Hey, Mr. DJ, put a record on" and "expressed [my]self" in dance.  BUT, we went for lunch and the other patrons probably wouldn't have appreciated it.  keke :)  Anyhoo, I will find another day to "strike a pose" cause it'll definitely take longer than "4 minutes!"

The Madonna montage finished playing out in my head as I contemplated what to order.  I had their Original Donna Mac and Cheese which was rich and creamy with good flavor.  Since I also had a coupon from the Nashville City Saver 2011 I was able to order a second entree for free (up to a $13 dollar value).  So, I took their Mardi Gras Mac and Cheese dish home to my hubsters.  Also delicious and full of flavor, BUT I don't recommend eating these dishes as left overs unless you want to see how much oil is used to cook it!  My advice, eat it all up at the restaurant and don't think about the calories! ;)

I also enjoyed their loaded taters skins which were regular fare, and their sweet potato fries with the sweet chili sauce.  I must say that their sweet potato fries were mouth-watering-ly seasoned; I think I even tasted some cinnamon on them.  They were some of the best sweet potato fries I've ever had and paired very well with the sweet chili sauce. Mmm-mmm good which earned them their fourth star in my books!! =D

The ambiance is eclectically casual and friendly with the food coming to us in good timing.  I felt comfortable there, free to eat and chat for as long as we wanted; granted they weren't extremely busy on this Friday lunch hour.  Nonetheless, I enjoyed the food and will be back to this local "neighborhood restaurant" that IS "as unique as East Nashville!" (the tagline from their website: http://www.maddonnas.com/)

We stopped in late to try this gem out before Devour was over- it went above and beyond our expectations! It was such a fun date night. The food was amazing, our hostess, Brittany, was super nice and made sure we always had what we needed, and it has convenient parking. We had the Blackberry Bees Knees and the Prickly Pear Marg and they were nice and boozy and full of flavor. The Bees Knees was surprisingly tart! The loaded BBQ pulled pork nachos were perfection and the butter cake was TO DIE FOR. We will definitely be back!
